description:
Why has it taken me so long to get over here? No idea. Sunday early afternoon (National Dog Day!) and we found a spot in the lot, no problem. Because it's primarily used for people with their dogs, I don't think people park it here for the day like they may in other locations. And it was beautiful - full blue sky and 65+ degrees. That's heaven in SF. 

The steps down and back up are a little steep, but just take your time. Once on the beach, the free-range running and opportunity for doggie playmates abounds. Plus there's the water. Honestly our 4-year-old mix (mix of what? who knows?) had not really run out into the ocean...only small riverbeds.  But she took to it like a fish. Plus, when she made friends with another dog whose owner was throwing a stick in the water, she happily followed him out into swim territory (just barely - don't freak - not near the waves or anything). 

The only thing that was strange was so many jellyfish washed up (I think they were jellyfish??) and several dead birds (a couple of whole, and several entire wing-spans). No idea how they happened. Oh, and the horses that came along and pooped on the beach. I believe I'm the only person bothered by the fact that horse owners don't have to pick up the poop (and on trails, as well) because everyone says "oh - it's natural." Sure, but I still don't want my dog eating horse poop (which she did) and I don't want to step in it either.

I digress. The wind was perfect to watch the hang-gliders and it wasn't crowded AT ALL. Tip for wash-off post-beach: take a large water bottle to fill a couple of times, as they have a bottle fill as part of the drinking fountain in the parking lot. Pour it over your dog with fresh water to get the sand off their face and paws for the ride home.

Love love love this place and will return often!
author: Laurie H.

description:
Love coming here with my German Shepherd. Soooooo many other doggos! It's off leash which is one of the reasons why I love it so much. 

So many friendly faces!!!! 

Only bad thing about this gem is the weather :( 
Super windy/cold at times so make sure you check weather ahead of time or just bring a jacket just in case!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Well isn't this just a living example of All Dogs Go to Heaven! 

My friend and I decided to spend our Friday afternoon on the beach and she knew this spot specifically would put a smile on my face. I wasn't sure what to expect but I was totally down for exploring. We took an uber to the parking lot and walked through the sand and dunes to a point where you could take a small hike down to the shore. This is when I started to notice some doggies playing and walking with their people families. Once we got down to the shore I noticed even more pups and that's when my friend let me know that this beach is known as being a dog beach! I saw so many cute dogs living their best life. This was the best surprise!

Being an early Friday afternoon, it wasn't too packed and we were able to lay out, relax, and have some awesome one on one girl time. I enjoyed walking along and discovering graffiti art and the ocean views were awesome.
author: Jayme H.

description:
If there was such a place like a doggie heaven on earth, this would come close to it. 

As we strolled down memory lane yesterday reminiscing about the many days we spent here with Maxie, it was both difficult and therapeutic at the same time. It feels different walking here without you. With watery eyes and a heavy heart, we followed our steps we took a thousand times and felt your presence beside us.

I remember the first time we were here like it was just yesterday. You were just a rambunctious puppy getting into mischief, getting chased by the older dogs, getting bullied, digging into the sand, sniffing everything in site and trying to put everything in your mouth. But eventually you learned how to play and behave like the other dogs and pretty soon, you were the big dog teaching the other pups how to behave. 

We didn't have a ball then, but we played fetch with those branches that were even longer than you without a care in the world. You enjoyed every moment and showed me how to enjoy it, too. But then when we eventually got you a ball, we probably lost a dozen of them swallowed up by the park. Yup, this was our Bermuda Triangle of balls that kept disappearing. 

You jumped into the wave head on and probably shocked the heck out of you. But you're a water dog, so you got the hang of it real quick. Running at full sprint at the beach made me grin from ear to ear knowing full well you loved to show off. Sure you weren't the fastest, but in my eyes you were the supersonic dog going full blast on the sand as the grains shifts under your paws as they get lifted in the air like slow motion. 

Your stunning gait and weird, sideway dash made you look like you were going to tip over when you ran at full speed, which was both a mystery and a joy to watch. You also broke your paw here as we had to put you in a cast, in which you kept chewing and gnawing off. Such a silly and stubborn girl you always were. 

As we covered every inch of the path we took so many times, I can see you on every bend in every stage of your life. I see snapshots of wonderful moments we experienced that I would give a million bucks to relieve over and over again. 

This was more than a park as we spent countless of hours here on my weekends and days off. These were some of the best times I spent, and it didn't cost me a darn thing. Well, maybe a dozen or so balls, but who's counting. 

As we ended our trip and gazed at the view of your favorite spot, this will always be a part of you and expect me to take you on our next stroll like we did a thousand times over. 

I love you, Maxie. 

February 16, 2006 - August 4, 2018

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=7nIgf_uU1CU
author: John G.

description:
If you have a dog, you need to come here immediately. Fort Funston is DOG HEAVEN! Everyone here had a dog (or several). I was impressed at how well-behaved the dogs were and my pup made a few friends. 

First, what to expect / what to wear - it's a beach, but it's more like a hike, so dress appropriately! Athleisure is perfect, and comfortable sneakers. Also, make sure to bundle up, because even in the summer it's cold and WINDY. Sunglasses are a must to protect your eyes from the sand and wind. 

Now, getting there / parking - just put Fort Funston in your GPS or google maps and you'll find it easily. Arrived at 11:30 am on a Saturday morning and discovered that parking surprisingly isn't an issue because there's a huge parking lot. Even when we left an hour later there were still a lot of spots available.

Bathrooms - the only bathrooms I saw were porta potties at the large parking lot, so plan accordingly to avoid having to use these. 

The main trail is paved and easy to navigate. There's lots of side trails too if you want to explore, and a steep slope down to a beach as well. Plenty of water fountains and bowls for your pup, but we brought our own too. Lots of dogs off-leash, but kept mine on a leash because he's an escape artist, and he still had a great time.

If you're hungry after, west lake center has some dog-friendly eating options like blue line pizza, and is only 5 minutes away. Can't wait to come back here!
author: Josephine M.

description: Usually I love Fort Funston, but today, October 8, 2018, my Three Legged black lab got bitten by a white pitbull named Roxie. The owner, a Vietnamese man in his 50s, refused to exchange contact information. Posting this year as a PSA to beware of this dog (and owner).
author: M. L.

description: If you love dogs and walking for miles of coastline...this is the place. So many, MANY dogs. Oh yes...owners too. Truly delightful. Made me miss my girl back home
author: Laura P.

description:
This is my second time visiting Fort Funston - something in the name of "FUN"!!! Best dog beach!  I'm a dog lover so it is the perfect place to visit if you want peace, tranquility, refreshing scenery and most important play with the most beautiful dogs! The pet owners are very friendly and don't mind if you spend a little time with their pets.  It is just something about the calming waters and the sound of the ocean that puts everyone at ease! Whenever I visit my daughter in San Francisco I'll make it a point to visit the best dog beach at Fort Funston and it's all FREE...lol And you get a great workout when you leave as you have to walk up a hill of sand.  You might have to stop a few times to catch your breath but it's totally worth it in order to experience this Beach! And the views of the ocean prior to descending to the beach is just priceless! 
Happy Yelping!
author: Sheryl T.

description:
Dog owners & dog lovers gather around!!! I do not and have never owned a dog myself but if you love dogs or own one this place is for you! All the dogs were super friendly and it was fairly clean (I was worried about stepping in some sh*t). My boyfriend told me as I was falling asleep last night "we're going here tomorrow" and me being so tired mumbled "ok" without doing my usual research. So, here's a few tips about coming here:

-bring proper shoes! This place is a HIKE. Not a stroll on the beach as I expected. I wore flip flops and I was worried about trekking up and down a sandy hill. Not ideal. We didn't get end up going down to the beach. Too steep for flip flops.

-super windy here so dress accordingly. Came in booty shorts and almost froze my a** off because it was cold. Not fun for me but maybe perfect for the people hang gliding off the cliffs!

Other than that I thought the view was gorgeous! Way better than what you see in Santa Cruz. Didn't see a place to pay for parking so we didn't pay and it was fine... We explored the WWII bunkers and checked on the hang glider zone and walked along the trail before deciding we weren't prepared enough and left. Will be coming back for suren
author: Celine L.

description:
DOG PARADISE! Best dog beach I have ever been to. No other dog friendly beach/park is better than Fort Funston. 

I brought my dog hear for the first time and she absolutely loved it. It was my first time letting Luna off leash and ever since then I've been comfortable letting her roam around on her own. Every time I bring here, she gets sooo dirty! but makes me happy that she's happy. I love walking around barefoot, but it freaks me out thinking about stepping in dog poo so PLEASE pick up after your dog.. I would really appreciate it (: 

Brutal walk up the steps towards the beach and brutal walk up the sand hill when leaving the beach.. I hate the walk and wish there was another way. haha
author: Molly M.

description:
My favorite hike near the Pacific Ocean. This was my 2nd time at this location and I absolutely love it. I decided to have a late lunch at the beach and listen to the waves. I hiked down to the beach. Walked the beach from one end to the other and hiked back up. I did about a 2.5 mile at Fort Funston. The beach was active with folks, their families, friends, and dogs! 

Beautiful day. Check out my photos!
author: Anita T.

description:
I have come here more times than I can remember. The views are amazing and trails are great for getting some exercise amor walking your four legged friend.

The only issue I have with this place is the San Francisco crowd has gotten more and more disrespectful and irresponsible with their dogs over the years. So much so that I don't always feel comfortable bringing my dogs here. 

Overall, this is still a great spot but if I do come here, I try to come during a time that is not crowded.
author: Sean S.

description: Beautiful ocean view with lots of cute dogs of all sizes running around and a few hang gliders roaming the skies! I enjoyed seeing the dogs frolic around freely and smelling each other's butts. This popular place makes for a fun weekend outing. It's great that the parking lot is free. I saw two lots, but one is further away from the main area. Although parking can get crowded, lots of people go in and out of the park, so you should have no trouble finding a spot.
author: Donna M.

description:
l love coming here with my puppers so he can go and meet other puppers and its a puppy playland so i am overwhelmed with joy!! 

Walkies to the beach are enjoyable especially when its during sunset. there are times when you come here one hour before the sun sets the colors are out of this world. i would get lost here and just soak up all the amazing vibes that this place gives me. whenever you just need a break from the hectic city life and all the noise, this place is your safe haven.
author: Anh T.

description: Fort Funston is a great place for all dogs to come and relax and be a dog, people here are very friendly as are their dogs.. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good time with their pets
author: Ramon N.

description: I have been to this place a few times with our dogs. Lots of cute dogs off leash so come ready to be overdosed with cuteness. People seem to be cognizant of their dogs limitations and some choose to keep their dog on leash. No crazy interactions happened when we were there. On clear days there are a ton of hang gliders which adds to the beauty of the place. Going up the giant sand dunes is really fun. I really wanted to roll down one but didn't get a chance this time. Parking was OK the couple of times we came here although it was on the weekend.
author: Rou M.

description: Who would have known that this is a paradise for both humans and puppies! With a not-so-secret beach down the trail, everything is perfect. The hike was not bad at all.
author: Yuan Z.

description:
Dilemma: I love petting pups but don't have one of my own! Solution: Fort Funston to the rescue!

Although a ways away from downtown, it's absolutely worth the ride over. I came a bit before sunset and was greeted by dogs roaming about, off leash. Dogs on leashes in the city generally look curious enough, but all the dogs here looked ecstatic! They were all too busy sniffing things and playing chase with one another to really even give any hoomans much heed. 

There's about a 20 minute walk that leads down to the beach. The path itself is clean and well kept-- surprising given the density of dogs here. Then there's an extremely steep downhill walk to the beach (bring your sturdy walking shoes, the walk back up is pretty strenuous). The sandstone cliffs are majestic and beautiful. The beach itself is not one for sitting given the sand fleas, but it's great for watching pups frolick in the ocean.

A corgi I met pulled a bait and switch on me by coming up all friendly, wiping its nose, then running away! There were also some huskies I saw having a grand ol' time chasing one another, and a more elderly dog trying to pretend it didn't hear its owner. The pups really come into their own here.
author: Nicole H.

description: What a beautiful beach, and SO many happy doggies and owners. From where we parked it was a 0.7 mile trail to the beach. The end part is a little steep, so may not be possible for everyone. My dog and I both loved this beach and could have stayed all day if a certain pesky husband hadn't insisted that there is more to see in San Francisco than the beach.
author: Melanie I.

description:
A real treat for our dogs since we live nearly an hour away, but nothing quite like it. 

It's one of the few remaining places for off leash dog action in the Bay Area that NPS hasn't cracked down on. There's some paved trails in the midst of sand dunes (so watch out, doggie will come home sandy), cliffs with ocean views, eucalyptus groves, and military structures. It's not a particularly long walk There are water fountains for the dogs in case you forgot your water, and a few picnic tables for resting. For the most part, everyone's dog is off leash here so expect socializing and playful romps. Between the great views, sprawling space and doggie friends, it's a wonderful place to get your dogs some fresh air. 

Relatively clean for a place mostly for dogs. People are pretty respectful about picking up and keeping the place poop-free. BYO bags since it doesn't look like there are bag dispensers anywhere in the park.   

The park has two places to park -- a small strip (few spots) along the highway and a main lot. Parking hasn't been a problem even on the weekends. 

Main gripe is the lack of fencing around it so I guess in theory your dog could run off here if not under tight voice control / has bad recall skills. We didn't let our dog run around off leash here until I established recall skills in a fenced in dog park. Some trails run close to the parking lot so you might want to leash up before your dog gets too close to car traffic. Also, the place can get hella cold even in the summer (paragliding happens nearby to give you an idea of how windy it can get, even in July). Check the weather and make sure the sun's out or it can be almost unpleasant.
author: Anita T.

description: Absolutely brilliant dog beach! Because there's no fence, a certain level of training is demanded, lest one might lose their dog. This weeds out a lot of the bad canine citizens you would see at a normal dog park. I was pleasantly surprised that all the dogs we encountered were appropriately behaved. Our boys had a wonderful time! The watering station is pretty far from the actual. Beach so I'd recommend toting a jug down to keep your pup hydrated.
author: Amanda P.

description: Why does this place get so many 5 star reviews? Just took our dog this past weekend there and as we were just getting out of the car this dog came out of nowhere and tried to attack my dog. My husband got out and was trying to get the other dog off our dog and the owner started to scream at my husband calling him all these foul names. Finally after all that was over I looked around and everyone  had their dogs off their leash. Why? Put your dogs on a leash. I put my dog on a leash. We went down the street where all the dogs were on a leash. Much better. It was a nice place but no way is my dog going to get bullied by some random dog and I don't want my husband being yelled at by some crazy owner who doesn't care that his dog acts like him. No more going backey for moi!
author: Jenny C.

description:
This is my favorite park in SF. Always clean, beauty. I loooove this area. 
Me and my friends do enjoy!!!!!!!!
author: Lubov D.

description:
Beautiful!!! Extremely underrated!! Free to visit! And many good looking................dogs!!!!!! I can't think of any reason why anyone would say no to this place!

We decided to make a quick stop here after a delicious, big lunch, to do some sightseeing and walk off part of our lunch. We got more than what we expected.

I'm a huge sucker for dogs. If anyone ever wanted to kidnap me, just use a big, fluffy dog, and you could probably lure me away. I could see myself come here on a regular basis just to stare at all the cute dogs! Big dogs, small dogs, hairy dogs, hairless dogs, all different kind of dogs you can think of! It's not labeled as a dog park, but it is your unofficial dog lovers' heaven!

Have I mentioned you can also do hang gliders here? (for a fee) We were so tempted, but didn't have enough time to sign up for the class. It would for sure be an awesome experience. Even more reason to come back to SF :)

The parking lot is located way above the beach. It's a fun way down, but a lil pain in the butt to get back up. Be careful when you stand too close to the cliff, it could be a good 100ft drop to the beach. It'd be a quick way down, but you wont look so pretty landing :P

The only down side about this park is there's no public indoor restroom. The ladies who work at the nursery attached to the park rangers were nice enough to let me use the park rangers restroom. So just make sure you come here with an empty bladder if you're planning on staying for a few hours.
author: Ai Vy N.

description: We took our dog to Fort Funston.   When we got there in the morning (10 am), there were a lot of cars in the parking lot already.   And there were a lot of dogs.  A whole lot.  Although there were a lot of dogs, the park is huge and you don't ever feel crowded.  Anyway, we took our dog down to the beach.   Unleashed.  There are lots of dogs at the beach or in the water.  We really like this beach.   However, we were not able to find any shower facility for human or for the dog. However, there were multiple water fountains available in different locations.
author: Mike Y.

description: A long walk along the beach, where your dog can gallop free, with dozens and dozens of others, sheltered on one side by tall cliffs and on the other side by the Pacific Ocean. If this doesn't sound to you like one of the happiest places on earth, I don't know what to say to you. It's only because of the embarrassment of natural beauty in the Bay Area that I didn't come here all the time.
author: William B.

description:
This may be the diclofenac talking, but going out for a medium length jaunt at Fort Funston is downright okay.   You just go out of your house, get in the car, an hey like 10 minutes later you're in this windy dog bullshit place with old cannons and cliffs and all these dog hustlers.  Who have like 25 dogs each.

My dad is always telling me what a great gig it is to be a dog walker.  You get a van, make a couple stops, and then go to Fort Funston or whatever.  Who gives a fuck.  Next thing you know, you've got all these FB and GOOGL and TWTR aholes paying you $25 a head to corral their retarded dogs around for an hour.  Digital economy * side hustle *gig  * diy * fucking boom boom boom.  You know what I'm talking about.  Yada yada yada, it's raining macchiatos at Peet's cofffee next to the Lucky's on Sloat Blvd and honey badger don't care.

Yep, that's the life.  Fckin bullshit walking dogs and coffee and whatever.
author: Asper K.

description:
I love the dunes, hot sand deliciously hugging my flat feet, aerobic workout with up and downs. Don't fall over the many cliffs.

Easy to find a private spot and behold all the majesty of the ocean.

Fun place for a visit. Clearly, all the canines were in the know much earlier than I.
author: Jana C.

description:
Took my dog here for the first time on Sunday & it was what they call it "Fort Heaven". If you love taking your dog out or your fur child has way too much energy to be cooped up at home, this is the place to go. 

The trail to the beach is a little stinky (as expected) but you won't really mind it because you will gasped by the nice view and all the cute friendly pups! There are pretty much 2 ways to get down to the beach. We went through the steep Sandy hill going down to the beach and it was such a workout. (Precaution) you need to wear shoes you don't care about or workout shoes. I even saw a lady wear rain boots which is such a smart idea because you WILL get sand and water in your shoes. 

I recommend going in the morning around 10:30/11:00am before it starts getting too hot for the dogs. My Pomeranian LOVED it! He was even strong enough to get back up on his own to climb up that steep Sandy hill to get back up to the trail. He was knocked out when we got in the car and didn't even care about the car ride because he usually gets car sick. 


The downside of this area is just finding parking. Took us about maybe 15 minutes. I'm for sure taking my dog again here though! Great exercise for both my Pom and I!
author: Danielle L.

description:
How have I never been to this dog beach in my lifetime?!  I have read reviews and reviews and finally went yesterday to do a 5.5 mile walk/hike around the dunes and down the beach.

Free parking, tons of dogs frolicking all over, this looks like what doggie heaven must look like! :)

It is a clean, beautiful beach with a very long strand you can take your pups down and also they can run off leash everywhere.  

Can't wait to come back in the Spring and Summer!
author: Dana A.

description:
A peaceful and cool place for George our vista and ocean air.

LOTS of dogs here but mostly friendly and fun. I was surprised the place is kept clean and I didn't step on dog poop despite the large number of dogs.

Wonderful location for pictures too.
author: Rob G.

description:
Still as good as ever if you have a four legged pal who loves playing with other dogs and ocean water.

For quicker access to the beach, I suggest you park along Skyline near the stoplight north of the main entrance. Parking in the main lot will add about 12 minutes to your walk, so if you're in a hurry, exercise this pro tip.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
What a fun dog park! There are so many trails in this park so you and your doggies can explore. There's a variety of cement, dirt, and sand trails. You can even go down to the beach! My favorite part about this park is that dogs can be off leash. It's lots of fun to watch your pup frolic anywhere she/he pleases!

I also love how large this place is! My bf and I have been coming here for a while with our dog and we still find new trails to do.
author: Tara A.

description: Babysitting our granddaughter and needed a place to take their German Shorthair Pointer to run! Parking both times was full, so we drove around the parking lot three times until a car left. They have port-a-potties in the parking lot which is great. The trails are pretty nice and full of dogs!  You can walk down to the beach though realize it's a steep sandy cliff.  There is a sign posted saying the cliff is steep. We had our granddaughter in an Osprey backpack or else she would not be able to walk it. At the ocean, there were tons of dogs, children playing in the water and sand and people on the ledges of the cliffs sitting and enjoying the ocean. We loved it so much, we went two days in a row. The views are spectacular.
author: Terese C.

description:
Great location for off leash play and exploring! So much fun, but word of warning... ignorant dog owners/ dog walkers. 
Was out there today with my dog and there were two ladies , about 20-30 years old, that were walking a pack of probably 20 dogs they obviously didn't have control over. As I walked my dog by most of them started lunging at us (to the point I feared for me and my 150lb dog). They had several ridgebacks with them and small dogs. If anybody know who these people are I'd be interested in knowing.
author: Kelley K.

description:
Dogs rule at this beach ! The adeptly named Fort Funston is a whole lot of FUN for humans and pups alike .  Majority of the people we saw had their dogs with them. Dogs are allowed to roam free on the walking trails leading down to the beach . When you get to the beachy area , it's dogs gone wild ! So many happy pups chasing balls, jumping in the surf,  and sniffing the ocean air ! The beach is clean, with amazing views. The sand is smooth and sprinkled with some pretty colored pebbles, rocks, sand dollars,  and crab shells. Not a lot of seaweed like we see at some beaches, so it looks much "neater."

It's a large park/beach area that is well marked and easy to find . They have a pretty decent size parking lot, water fountains, a few porta-potties. Apparently fort funston is also a spot for paragliding. We saw a handful of people prepping for flight and a few in the air . 

We are most certainly making fort funston a regular destination for some fun in the sun with our pup. Can't wait to visit again soon :)
author: Brenda B.

description:
Oh, the famous Fort Funston. We got our puppy in April 2017 and that's all we've been hearing about. "Go to Fort Funston! Have you been to Fort Funston yet?" Since my boyfriend and I live near the San Francisco Caltrain station without a car, you can imagine the difficulty of covering the back seat of a Lyft ride and praying that we make it to the beach without getting kicked out. But alas, we made it.

Oz (our Siberian Husky puppy) gets excited at the beach. All he wants to do is dig in the sand and chase down other dogs. Because of that, I would recommend that your dog has decent recall before bringing him here and letting him off leash. There are some owners who get nutty about random dogs approaching theirs... even though it's an off leash public area. Ugh.

We brought Oz to an area of Fort Funston where he wouldn't be able to run up any cliffs and away from us. Great place to play fetch, though unfortunately Oz doesn't like fetch. He just likes to make friends and splash around in the water. He always has a great time in the cold, while my boyfriend and I are freezing our butts off, so don't forget to bring an extra layer while you're waiting for your furry companion to get tired out.

We'll definitely come to Fort Funston every once in awhile, especially for doggie Meetups, though there are a few other dog parks we'd like to visit in the meantime. It's not my favorite place to go, especially because I'm generally not a huge fan of the beach, but on a beautiful and sunny San Francisco day, it's hard to resist the idea of hitting the sand and watching your happy dog run around for a few hours.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Fort Funston, as is evident from the high reviews here, is the most awesome off-leash dog park in the SF vicinity. This is a great place for taking a walk with or without a dog. You can spend the entire day here (or at least a few hours). 

There's a parking lot, which is nice. But I normally park on the side of the road off of HWY 35. 

There's an upper paved area where you can walk in a big circle, then there's a huge beach area underneath. Tons of dogs and people everywhere, but it never feels crowded here because this place is so huge. 

My two favorite things about this place: 1) This place is open and vast so dogs don't tend to fight each other, as there's no pent-up energy in a small confined space, unlike a typical dog park. 2) I love walking along the ocean! It is so beautiful here. You can really walk a very long distance along the beach. I've never been able to "finish" it. 

Of course if your dog doesn't have good recall, you'll probably have to use a long leash. It probably also takes some getting used to for the dog. I first took my puppy here when he was 5 months old and he was scared and overwhelmed, even on a leash, because it could be quite a far distance to walk with the noisy ocean and there are so many other dogs running around. But now he loves it! It's a great place to use the chuck-it stick. 

Also, the ascend and descent to the beach from the upper paved part can be quite steep and strenuous for some. It also gets cold and windy, so always wear a jacket.
author: Jennifer W.

description: This is a hidden gem of hikes in San Francisco! It somewhat has the worlds of a hike and unique in its own way. This place is great for dogs and you'll see them running around. A nice view of the city and you turn around you see a nice view of the ocean. This hike isn't difficult either!
author: Alliver V.

description: Come here sometimes with father for a walk. There is nice scenery of the Pacific Ocean and it is clean. People walk their dog here. It's a calm place. It's good to bring out of town people here to check out the view. Parking is easy.
author: Denise C.

description:
Honestly, do they need another review? Probably not but I love this place so much they're getting one anyway. 

Fort Funston is every dog owner's nirvana. My boyfriend (who's from Seattle) has noted it seems like you can't take your dog anywhere in the Bay Area, and he's especially right considering all the new regulations being proposed for off-leash dog spaces in San Francisco. So now more than ever, Fort Funston is the best place to hang out with your dog and let them enjoy some off-leash time outdoors.

TONS of grassy and sandy space so it's easy on your pup's feet and joints. Even if I wasn't a dog owner I'd still come to 1) PLAY WITH ALL THE DOGS 2) enjoy the scenery! It's right by the beach and when the sun's out it's absolutely gorgeous. You'll see hang gliders at the end of the beach by the parking lot, and there's tons of space to sit down and hang out on the sand. You can walk down the hill to get to the ocean, and the walk back up is a considerable workout. 

Bonus points for the huge parking lot too!
author: Angela L.

description:
Dog park. Dog park. Dog park.  If you're open to dogs off leash and probably going to run up to you, then this is the place for you.  Fort Funston is an alternative for people who want to take a stroll along the Cali coast with their dogs, without being too close to the water (though you can still access the beach a couple miles in).  Fort Funston is a very scenic park with a marked path and has a lot of sand paths so be prepared!  

I usually run the sand hills for a great challenging workout. Instead of using the wooden man-made steps on the sand incline, try running on the sides and getting a good pump in.  I love that Fort Funston is super versatile where you'll occasionally see hang gliders preparing for take off at the edge of the cliff, runners, families, dog owners, and casual walkers/hikers.  There is also a huge parking lot for visitors! Definitely visit if you need a breath of fresh air or want to see all the cute friendly dogs running around.
author: Tiffany Z.

description: Awesome place to go for a walk with your dog, its only a .3mile walk to the beach and plenty of space for your dog to run around. Parking might be a little difficult on nice days, but worth the view
author: Melanie T.

description:
Scenery and views are incredible on a sunny day.  Blue skies and ocean views, beautiful cliffs and hills...you feel like you've been transported to another country.  We're so spoiled living in SF :)

Place is a Pup paradise! Tons and tons of dogs wandering around the beach and trails.  My puppy loved running up and down the hills, digging in the sand(..trying to eat the sand), splashing in the ocean, and meeting tons of other doggies and humans.  He's currently passed out on the floor in a deep slumber.

A word of caution, probably not the best place if your dog gets nervous around other dogs or is not well-socialized as there will be plenty of random dogs running up to you.

I'm a fan of letting your dogs be off-leash but dog owners, seriously can you at least stay near your dog and don't let them wander out of your sight??  My puppy is very friendly but still learning how to socialize so I keep him on leash for this reason. Most of the dogs we met were very friendly but I still get nervous when several dogs start sprinting towards my puppy at full speed without any owners in sight.  One dog owner reassured me that his dog was friendly when the dog ran up but the dog started barking and snapping at my puppy, causing me to have to yank back my dog forcefully. Not cool dude. Another dog followed us on the trail for a good 20-30 minutes and we had no clue where his owner was. We were starting to wonder if we were going to have to take him home(just kidding) but luckily we were able to find his owner.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Oh hello hidden gem! Filled with a ton of sand dunes and an amazing trail. If you're anything like me and love running around in sand dunes this is your jam it had the best sand you can just melt in and the perfect scenery such a great place to reflect. & the scenery will literally just have you in your feelings. 

Proposal spot worthy.

Oh also you can most definitely take your pups here seems like a lot of folks do. Will definitely take mine next time.
author: Genevieve M.

description: This beach was relaxing. It's definitely the "unofficial" dog beach. For us, being a non dog family, we were still able to enjoy ourself and watching the dogs and their owners have a blast. The kids loved finding sand dollars and they were able to roam around without the crowd of people.
author: Bianca R.

description:
The name is not deceiving. Just south of Ocean Beach, Fort Funston is F U N! It's a beach, an amazing series of path and off-path hiking trails, a dog park, and an interesting place to explore. There's plenty to do and see here at this abandoned military base. 

If you like dogs, or perhaps can't have one at the moment because your feisty feline is a self-proclaimed only child, then this, my friend, is the place for you! Dogs, dogs, as far as the eye can see, and most leashed properly, excepting on the beach where they can play in the surf. Big dogs, little dogs, medium dogs, fuzzy dogs, skinny dogs all running around enjoying themselves, playing in the waves, fetching things, rolling in various dead items, and enjoying FREEDOM. I was in heaven. 

The path down to the beach is steep and quite a workout to hike back up, just to warn you. The one we found was one of two *recommended* ways to get down to the waves. Although there are many off path places to explore, I would advise using caution around the cliffs. They are steep and unstable, according to terrifying signage placed for the stupid that surround us. 

Other than copious canine interactions, my other favorite part of visiting this place was the history. Fort Funston still has plenty of now defunct military installations ripe for exploring, or climbing and tagging, for some... Mortar Batteries still line the trails. You can read about it here:
http://www.militarymuseum.org/FtFunston.html

I found it very depressing that the dunes were once covered in wildflowers and abundant wildlife, which was steamrolled to build the base, but WWII was no easy time to live through. It seems they're working hard to bring back the ecosystem that once thrived here, and that was wonderful to read about on various informational postings. 

Did I mention that parking is free, and that there are plenty of water fountains and Port o Squats available? There's no reason not to visit!
author: Jenny P.

description: One of the best dog hiking trails you will find in the Bay Area. It is not too long, not too short either. It has great view with dog friendly beach. You will be surrounded by hundreds of sweet dogs running freely on the trail.
author: Niki Y.

description:
They call it doggie Disneyland, and it's the truth. It's times when I'm at Fort Funston that I wish I had a dog. But luckily, the park itself is also a haven for those who seek peace, quiet, and a hike with views.

They say the experience starts at the parking lot. And your trip starts off great with free parking (rarely is it full). And you know you're at Fort Funston with as soon as you leave your car (or bike or whatever transportation), and you hear a mix of barks from dogs of all sizes and types. Energetic barks fill the air with happiness--it sure is palpable and you're excited.

What I love most about Fort Funston is that you feel like you're away from the hectic city life. Peer out into the horizon across the Pacific ocean, and you might spot the end of the Earth. Pop down by the succulents, read a book, and enjoy life with a view. If you feeling like you need to move, hike alongside the cliff (it's safe) or head down towards the beach. 

My only hope is that this place continues to be a bit out of the way for most and doesn't too crowded...for the sake of all the dogs...
author: David W.

description: Wow!  This place is breathtaking!  We brought our pup here yesterday and he had the time of his life. We took the steep path, near the hang gliders take off area, down to the beach. So many happy dogs and people all the way down. Walking back up was arduous, but I'm not in very good shape. The trails up above the beach were great too. I would recommend getting there fairly early to find parking. Also check the tide charts to make sure the beach is doable.
author: Jill L.

description:
One of the best places to go to in SF if you're a dog owner/lover.  Awesome views of the beach and coast with plenty of happy dogs roaming around.  It doesn't get much better than that.  

There are also a ton of different trails.  There are paved ones if you don't want your dog to get dirty as well as less crowded trails that extend into the sand and cliffs.  

I've only been here twice with my dog so there's plenty of more for us to explore, but its already a favorite of mine.
author: David C.

description: Love it here. It's relaxing for me and my dog. It's endless digging and frisbee for my little pooch! The hang gliders are also very cool to watch. The drawback is hiking back up can be a pain especially in the summer. So wear comfortable shoes and douse yourself with sunscreen.
author: Rosalynn R.

description:
BEACH is a cold one so bundle up and prepare for some gusty winds. Don't wear a hat that's loose because you will lose it. Sunglasses too please because the wind blows sand in your face. Trails to the left and trails to the right. Follow the cones for the trail to the left that goes directly to the water and beach down below. I like that it's not a horrible incline going down nor up. 

DOGS are allowed! I see quite a few off leash so beware. We usually come here for husky huddle malamute mingle meetups. 

PARKING is a huge vast parking lot and we haven't had trouble finding a spot close to the front walking area. Seems there are always people coming and going at different times.  

OVERALL I am a fan of this beach and like how dog friendly it is.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Fort Funston is exactly what I would imagine a doggie/dog lover heaven would look like. It basically consists of a nature-y walk and a beach. Most dogs are off leash, running around, and having fun. The views are BEAUTIFUL, and the friend I was with commented that it reminded him of South Africa with the ocean combined with the hilly backdrop. I can't believe it took me three years in SF to finally visit this place!

The parking lot is spacious - I went on a really nice day so it was filled up, but large enough that people were coming and going. You can also park along HWY 35. I did get pretty muddy and sandy on the beach so bring towels and stuff to clean off before you get back into your car.
author: Connie Q.

description: Amazing dog park. The views are spectacular, and somehow there are countless dogs here that all get along and enjoy all the space to run. The owners are always very respectful and everyone helps keep the park beautiful and clean.
author: Russ S.

description:
I stopped out there today with my wife, brothers, sister and nephew today for about 3 hours.  It's a great spot along the ocean with a beautiful scenic view from the bluffs looking down on the ocean.  Driving up we saw a guy on a hang glider as we approached.  After parking we realized that there were at least 1/2 dozen people assembling their hang gliders getting ready to launch.  It was pretty amazing watching people soaring, gliding and hovering in the wind currents several hundred feet in air above the ocean below.  It was amazing to see the hang gliders riding the wind currents.  

In addition it's a well known dog park.  I love dogs so it was cool to see packs of dogs running freely on the beach and in the park having a great time. We saw dozens of dog walkers with their packs along with individuals walking there dogs along the beautiful ocean front view.  There is also a trail along the bluff overlooking the oceans.  It's just a great way to spend the day in a beautiful scenic location.  Tons a fun, but a little chilly and windy.
author: Phil S.

description: Took my little boy to Fort Funston today aka Doggy Heaven and it did not disappoint! He absolutely loved it! He decided he was a mountain climber and went for his first mini swim and played with all sorts of dogs and got SO dirty that we both needed a bath and a 4 hour nap when we came home but it was worth it. Can't wait to take him back!
author: Christie H.

description:
Great park for hiking/walking in San Francisco with large and free parking lot and though highly trafficked, the trails are wide and accommodating, and the views and all the happy dogs definitely make it a unique hiking/walking experience. 

Most of the trails are paved until you start descending to one of the several beaches. Rain boots are a smart choice, if you have them. (I went with regular hiking shoes and a wave came in closer than I expected. My shoes dried pretty quickly but my socks remained wet.)
author: Yvonne K.

description: First of all, let me say that this is a great park if you are a dog lover and/or owner.  With that being said, I still feel like the dogs should be on leashes since there are a lot of kids around.  The scenery is fantastic since it is along the cliffside. It's also cool to see that this is where the paragliders take off when weather conditions are right.  The park is large, but most of it is sand trails, so it is difficult to walk around. There are only a few portable bathrooms and they are really gross. Super crowded on the weekends.
author: John L.

description:
Great beach to run around with the dogs. The only "bad" thing about this place is the long steep walkway to the beach.

Other than that, I try to come here as much as I can!
author: Jonathon L.

description:
Most favorite off leash dog  park.  

It's funny to watch  people bring food here for some kind of picnic where ALL the dogs are trampling over the food and picnickers!    Hahahaha!  It's a dog park!!!

Oh, yeah, that being said you can imagine how gross it is to see people barefoot and kids/babies touching the ground and sand.

Dog park FOR dogs.  Not a playground or picnic area.  So leave the food  and crying  kids at home !
author: Charlie B.

description: Beautiful park to take your dog, but man did the steep walkway kick my ass LOL. But the view, the blooming flowers, and salty air more than make up for it. Be aware of homeless people, I had this meth head guy approach me and my dog, and he was hiding in this alcove. Don't go alone, or make sure you bring pepper spray with you.
author: Raquel A.

description:
Plenty of parking and a ton of happy, friendly dogs and their owners. The beach in certain sections can be a little dirty due to ash mixture from bonfires but the off-leash allowance is fantastic. This is one of our very fave dog spots in the Bay Area. 

Thanks, yelpers!
author: Susie O.

description: This is the place to be for all dog lovers! Its a nice walk along the coast but watch out for the cliffs. Dogs are off leash everywhere!
author: Eric M.

description:
My boyfriend and I have found our favorite get away for our two boys Kain D (German Shepard) and Rowdy Boy (Boxer) I brought these 3 here for their first time and we loved it. 

We started off down the hill more from the entrance and parked there on the side of the freeway. We walked up the hill (opposite ofFort Funston) to where there's open fields were Kain and Rowdy met many other playful dogs and laid back owners. We went passed everyone up a few of the cliffs and came across one of the forts as well as the end of the cliffs which showcased the beautiful beach below as well as some forts. 

We then walked back to the car and drove into the Fort Funston parking and made our way down to the beach. There are different ways down and of course we took the complicated way (near the smaller parking section from the main one you will see on your right when you pull in) which was more exciting for me and the boys. The beach had many other dogs there to play with and all the owners are super friendly towards everyone and their dogs. Kain and Rowdy couldn't even stay within reach because they loved how much open space there was and how playful all the other dogs are.

Going up, we took the stairs. This place is literally a dog heaven on earth. I would rather bring these two here than to a dog park!
author: Joyce D.

description:
A beautiful place that is a dog lovers dream! The beach is an incline down from where parking is and you just follow a some sandy steps and happy dogs down to the beach.

There you will find beautiful coastline and a beach where dogs roam off leash. We loved walking along it and so did our dog.
One thing we didn't like was that horses were also down there and caused a stir within the dogs. I guess it's an animal friendly beach!
author: Ami T.

description: How did I wait so long to bring my dog here?!?! It's a great place for dogs to run off leash and explore the "forest" and the beach. The dogs here are all really nice and friendly and my dog just lights up when we pull into the parking lot. The parking lot is big and we've never had trouble finding a spot. There are poop bags, trash cans, and water stations around the park as well as benches for sitting.
author: Jessica C.

description:
For over three years, we have been coming to Fort Funston!  This is a dog heaven place, and I hope it will continue to be an off leash dog beach because our dogs, truly enjoy running freely and jumping into the water, over and over again.  They also love meeting all the nice dogs and owners alike, who too, enjoys the serene and peaceful view of the ocean.

I take advantage of coming here to exercise not just my dogs, but to shed a few "Pillsbury" belly fat off my waist, and challenge myself every time to run up the sandy hill.  What's really cool about Fort Funston, there are always people around even on foggy days.  But on a clear and warm afternoon, you will find many hand gliders up above, dog walkers and even tourists simply enjoying what San Francisco Beach has to offer.  Fort Funston truly is a magical place both for the humans and their dogs too.

Until then, Cheers! ~ :p
author: Edwin R.

description:
Best Best dog park!! off leash is ok here. big, friendly, clean and nice view here. 
People here loves dogs. The view is awesome and the trail is not hard. 
My dogs have a very good time and exercise today. Definitely, will visit again in the future
author: Tina H.

description:
This is our go to place every weekend!  We drive from the east bay to enjoy the scenery, hike, and to let our dogs bask in the glory of the ocean  and sand! We haven't met a mean person, just a few ass hole Russians saying our dog is a killer because she is a shepherd, but when finland hands you your ass on a platter with the backing of Germany, I would be scared too ;p 

There are designated spots for dogs and fishing. You can park on the road, or in a lot. The lot does have port o potties, just don't fall off the cliff like the signs say!
author: M O.

description: Great area off leash for dogs to play! One thing is to be careful about are the cliffs and parking lot area. Other than that you can pick walking trail area or by the water front :) will come back
author: Susan L.

description: The heaven for both dog and human!! We often come with our friends and pets on Sats. We spent three hours each time running and walking on the beach. This place is clean and has various types of landscape , such as desert, forest, beach, and park!!! A lot of activities!! The best is go unleashed!!!!
author: Kevin W.

description: First time to this dog friendly beach.  Short 45 minute drive from San Jose.  Easy to get to and a ton of free parking.  Tons of dogs both on leash and off.  Everyone seemed to do well.  Beautiful paved trails as well as sand trails.
author: LeTia T.

description:
Thank you to all the amazing yelp reviews!

Came here yesterday with my bf and yorkie for lunch/beach day.

Parking at the top and bottom and a little trek to the beach. I love off the leash dog beaches and I'm so happy Fort Funston exist. I just moved to the bay and I've been looking for dog friendly places and Fort Funston makes it to the top of my list.

If you're a dog owner it's def worth a trip and make it part of your free day. I'll be back for more doggy beach days with our little Ebi.
author: Jewelyn T.

description: Had alot of fun with my family and dogs. Wish I lived closer to this beach I would probably come out daily with my doggies. It is one of the best dog beaches I have ever been to. Will be coming back soon. I highly recommend bringing your dogs here they will love it.
author: Vick D.

description: This is a great dog park/hike! I love seeing all the doggies! Also the beach is beautiful, and there's some wildlife if your lucky. Plenty of sand dollars to look at and pretty stones and sea glass. There are stairs near the parking lot and stairs near Lake Merced area, a good way to get those steps in! Such a gem!
author: Myra H.

description:
Omhhhgggggg!! This is one of the happiest loveliest most fantastic places in the Bay Area! Can't believe it took me so long to get here with my pooches!

The scenery is gorgeous, the dogs are happy little kiddos, and everything is right in the world.

That's my happy recommendation haha!
author: Sarah M.

description: Great area for dogs.  The beach the dunes and trails are all open and off-leash.   Lots of professional dog walkers with 5 or 6 dogs which sort of bugs me.  It's fine if everyone gets along.
author: Andy P.

description:
Dog owners beware!! OUR DOG GOT BIT HERE TODAY 09/26 around 4:30pm by a larger black poodle type of dog that was off leash and NOT TRAINED. 

Fort Funston is a very beautiful place with a wonderful view, so many dogs get walked here and you would not expect something like this to happen at all. However many dogs go off leash here which is fine IF your dog is TRAINED and well behaved but this dog obviously was NOT TRAINED and AGGRESSIVE! it caught us totally off guard and I really wish we knew it broke through the skin at the time, or how to deal with situations like these.

The owner was Caucasian with long red hair, she had at least 2-3 large black poodle type of dogs and it was the younger one that quickly got aggressive with our 11 pound Pomeranian. When the owner tried to pull her dog back my dog even lifted up in his or her mouth! I grabbed onto her and screamed for the owner to get her dog off of ours before the owner was finally able to get the dog to stop.

I thought I had checked her thoroughly at the time but the blood did not show up yet, I looked through her fur many times and felt around and she did not whimper or cry but she is so fluffy that we did not see where it broke through the skin and the owner just kept apologizing saying her dog was still a puppy and did not realize its strength .. if only I knew it broke through the skin we could have at least gotten their information down and checked if their dog had all the shots!! Or they could have been responsible owners and do more than just apologize, like go with us to the Vet to make sure nothing was wrong! 

My toddler was freaked out and kept asking what was wrong with our dog Poppy, I was so upset but did not want to show more than I already did which would scare my daughter more than she was already. We were just SO grateful that it did not seem like she was hurt but we should have done more. Now we have to contact the Vet tomorrow and we have no information we can give them about the other dog's vaccinations or any medical concerns that might be transferable, and take time off to get her checked etc.


If anyone knows this owner please forward this along to her, they need to know that it was not just puppy play, it was real aggression that led to another dog's injuries. Please keep your untrained dogs leashed! It could have been much much worse. I just hope everything is fine at the vet and there's no more injuries that we can not see.  

If this happens again to anyone else please get the other persons information down or go to the vet with them right away. I wish we knew more about the other dog's medical history.
author: Helen H.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing! Doggy Disneyland at its finest. My Otis had a blast here since the whole park is off leash. The trails and small hills are scenic and safe for all dogs since not being near any major traffic and the beach view is beautiful. 

We seemed to go on a day where the weather was warm and expected a lot of people and dogs to be out. Although the park was busy, parking was super easy and free. I highly recommend this place for anyone with a furry loved one. It's a guaranteed blast!
author: Cynthia N.

description: Oh how I love this place. We have two big dogs and by far this is their favorite place to go. Great exercise for both dogs and owners. You won't be sorry you went.
author: Christine H.
Mike J.

description:
I love this place because it's the only place I know in the bay area that allows dogs on the beach. A beach destination for your fur friends. If I was a dog, I'd love this place too! I mean who doesn't love being on the beach??

It didn't take us long to get to the beach also from the parking lot. I liked that. Alot! There's a few different pathways you could take to get down to the beach.

I saw so many dogs here and if I was a dog, I'd think this place was heaven. We came when the weather was perfect, not too cold and not too hot, just right. 

While our fur friends were running around with other dogs, we walked along the beach collecting rocks and sand dollars. We found so much!! And I didn't know that their  natural color was purple! I guess once it dies, it turned white. Be careful with these too! Broken sand dollars could be hiding under sand!

I don't like that we live far away but I love coming here so it's worth the drive. I get to be around dogs!
author: Elena K.

description: Best scenic hike/view with SO MANY dogs....I cannot believe how many dogs I saw. And all of them were extremely well behaved, even dogs with no leash were friendly and civil. This is great for families, young people, couples, modeling/photography, dog friendly people, and more. Lot's of space to stretch out and have a hike-splash in the water- followed by picnic on the beach.
author: Esca N.

description: Beautiful and fun spot for dogs and families alike. Our son, almost 2, had a blast running around and seeing all the pups play. Our dog, Boxer, had the best time running around and splashing at the  beach!
author: Melisa K.

description: So cute and cool if you wanna go on short hikes and see cute little dogs!!! Highly recommend for a morning hike or bringing your dog here.
author: Dhia X.

description: Such a great place to take your furry little friends.  My dog loved the place and the hike was great for humans too!  Nice views and lovely place to walk your dog along the beach.  Parking is free too!  Try to go on a clear day!
author: Nyla K.

description:
I wouldn't call this spot a hike but it's more of a nice, sandy dog park. You park at the top and walk down these steps that are mostly covered with sand. As you descend the stairs, it's a bit of a stop and wait while others ahead of you try to navigate down. I wore sneakers and really should've worn sandals since with every step, your foot gets lost in a pile of sand. Meanwhile the dogs are having a grand time running down trying to quickly make it to the beach. 

At the bottom of the hill is doggie paradise! Dogs of all sizes are running freely, catching balls and rushing straight into the oncoming waves. Bring a sweater since it can get quite chilly and windy. A nice outdoor adventure for your four-legged friends.
author: Ruby C.

description: Great park for dog lovers. Dog haters, beware, you won't be comfortable. Gets pretty windy by the beach so make sure to bring a jacket
author: Derek Y.

description:
We didn't spend much time here but there were some nice photo ops on the cliffs looking down toward the beaches below. Also the trails on the upper portion of this area is nice as well.

Our very short time exploring put us over by some government buildings which looked kind of ominous along with signs warning trespassers to stay out. I could only imagine what the government may be hiding in those buildings. Of course I had to throw some jokes out there too in my true jovial fashion.

Had we gone down the hefty vertical paths to the beach I am sure the dogs would've love it but time was waning and we had to get back to the east bay. I'd like to go back for more exploratory purposes someday though.
author: Steven G.

description: We are here almost every day, my dog loves it. It's a great place to train as well. The views are gorgeous, dogs everywhere just roaming around off leash and on leash. Everyone we interact with are super friendly and knowledgeable in training dogs. We are always looking for tips to help us train our pup. If you go there and your dog happens to jump on someone and give sweet slobbery kisses they are always happy to receive them and understand. There are two drink fountains for both humans and dogs, there's also a ton of water bowls that can be filled. There trash cans near the fountains, a few benches and tables. The pathway leads to a few spots and also leads to very sandy down hill path to the beach.
author: Cassandra G.

description:
Of all the dog parks/dog beaches I've been to, Fort Funston definitely ranks among the top 3! 
Lots of parking, plenty of poop bags along the way, water station for your pup, lovely views to be seen, but most importantly for me are the dog owners. Everyone is on the same level about cleanliness and picking up after their dog! I did not see any surprises left behind! All very well behaved doggies too! My dog had the most wonderful time and I felt very safe with him there being off leash. Will definitely return!
author: Molly M.

description:
If you're not a dog person, then this will probably not be the best spot for you. This place is swarming in off leash pups who are having the time of their lives! 

Parking is pretty easy and there are a few trails you can take. Walk left from the parking lot and you'll hit the steep stairs and reach beach access. Walk right from the parking lot and you'll go on a trail that will lead you down to the beach. Don't be like me and decide to walk UP the stairs... Walk down and along the beach and come up an easier hill trail! 

Come prepared - dress in layers, bring water, bring doggy bags, and keep an eye on your pup in the water.
author: Shelley K.

description: Amazing view !!! Nice place for spending your free time. I like to spend a lot of time in this area with my dog. Also you can find a lot of interesting people and their pets.
author: Jake D.

description: Fort FUNston is where you take your dog to have FUN - lots of dogs there! There's a big lot for parking and a trail with a nice view of the ocean down to the beach. Kobe had a blast playing on the sand and dipping in the water. We stayed until sunset and it was beautiful. Favorite beach trail to take my dog!
author: Christine C.

description:
This place is dog heaven. So many pretty huskies here.

Walk about 5- 10 minutes down the sand stairs to get to the beach. Walk along the Pacific Ocean and see the tide bring in crabs! Get a good workout returning back up those stairs.

There's a lookout point by the parking lot. And another walking trail that heads toward Ocean Beach.
author: Joanna L.

description:
This dog park. Is. Awesome. Its like doggie heaven! Tons of trails, huge, varied terrain area to explore and beach access! My dog had a blast when we visited. Even though there were a TON of dogs there, we had no issues with fighting or aggressiveness. I probably got to the park around 9:30 on a Sunday and was able to easily find parking. When I left around 12:30, the parking lot was closed as it was totally full. So definitely get there early!

There are two ways down to the beach, one is a "staircase", the other is just a steep hill. If you're in moderate shape, access won't be an issue. When I was there the tide was high so I wasn't able to walk the whole beach and got to experience going up and down both ways. Next time I will definitely choose the staircase-I prefer walking uphill on wooden slats buried in the ground versus just trudging up a hill with deep sand. 

The water fountains are also only close to the parking area, so you may want to bring your own water if you plan on being closer to the beach part of the park. Same goes with the doggie bags. 

Just wish I lived closer to this place, I would be going every weekend!
author: Katie S.

description:
If I had a dog, I would come here more often.
If I had kids, I would come here more often.
If I lived walking distance, I would come here more often.
When I'm old and my only friend is my shadow, I will come here.

Some areas were more secluded than others.  We came here to run up and down sand dunes trying to get our work out on.  

Nice, clean area with a great view of the beach.
author: Linda N.

description: Nice location packed with people and pups even on a Tuesday morning. I enjoyed the views while my pup enjoyed all the company. Definitely a great place to hang out with your dog!
author: Shaun M.

description: Dog heaven. Whenever I petsit, this is one of my favorite places to go because the highly energized crazy Cali dog can run off leash and romp around with her people until she's slightly tired. I get to take in the beautiful scenery and we both leave satisfied and smiling. Just be careful to keep your dogs on leash near the cliff area.
author: Jenna M.

description:
This place is wonderful if you want something more outdoorsy than just the beach. Overall, it was beautiful and a fun afternoon.

My dog loved it, but there are a couple of problems with this place that prevent it from being a 5.

- Really steep to get to the beach. I'm young-ish, and I can't imagine someone older, overweight, with joint pain, or anyone out of shape getting down and up to the beach. Going down was easier but not totally for the faint of heart, but going up was a cardiovascular challenge.

- No clear directions posted. There are multiple parking lots, multiples trails, and within the trails, there are multiple forks in the road. It's not obvious how to get to the beach. 

- Dogs galloping. People come here for the off leash nature. I have a Samoyed though so she can't be off leash until she gets to the beach. So it's a bit annoying to have dogs galloping towards you at breakneck speed

Come here if you have ample time on your hands and don't mind an adventure. If you just want a dog beach though, go to Pacifica or Half Moon Bay
author: Lilly D.

description: Our first time here today and we LOVED it! Nice weather, open area for our puppy to run around in visible sight, and nice dog owners. The only negative thing about this beach is the stairs of hell you have to climb back up when you're all done!
author: Shellie C.

description: A must visit beach for dog owners. Dogs can run offleash here, and obviously most people who come here love dogs and so friendly. Plenty of parking.
author: Wenny T.

description:
I regrettably don't come out to Fort Funston too often anymore, with the passing of my beloved 15-year old Labrador (Lira) last July. However, I have some wonderful memories of Fort Funston, from both my childhood and dog-hood days.

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ Large, open space with a good number of trails to explore 
+ No leashes required (although I'd be careful around the cliff trail with your pup, as there have been some tragic deaths for both humans and animals there)
+ Strong community of dog walkers (and you eventually get to know quite a few pups/humans through your walks here)
+ There's a water fountain near the middle-ish of the main trail, and many local dog walkers have donated bowls to keep every pup well hydrated
+ Absolutely gorgeous views, with beach access via either a loooooong wooden-slatted stairway, or a steep sandy slope (dogs have been known to ditch their owners and run to the ocean here, with no intention of turning back, usually!)
- There are some cat tails scattered around this place, which can be deadly to your dog if inhaled through the nose. Be informed and cautious.

Fort Funston has a special place in my heart, and I wish every other dog owner happy memories here, as well.
author: Claire S.

description: I usually go here when I have days off and when its a nice sunny day out. Not too cold because my dogs shivers aha. Anyways! Very nice people. And cute doggies everywhere! It's good to let your dogs exercise and run around. The place is very big. Always the place for my doggies to have fun and socialize!
author: April M.

description:
I totally loved it! It's just too bad that I live in San Jose and can't go up here as much as I would want to... 

I went here on a cloudy, and a bit of a foggy day but even so.. I was so amazed on how cool and beautiful this place was! It was so green. I felt as if I was in a different world when I stepped outta the car haha. It definitely is a doggie heaven where all the dogs just run freely, interact and play with each other. There are many paths to explore! The cliffs can be dangerously exhilarating. The beach is walking distance (Which was unfortunately closed that day due to the weather. ):  But it's okay because I still really enjoyed the view.) The sand provides a good workout too! They also have historical stuff from the war which I thought was really cool and interesting. 

Definitely coming back!
author: Betty P.

description: such a beautiful park!! The best part is parking is free! the only con about this beach is the steep walkway, other than that its a great place to bring your dog and family. Maybe next time i come i will take plenty of pictures. pretty clean for it to be a dog beach. Just be sure to keep an eye out on your dog one owner didn't notice the dog pooped in the water. X( either way amazing place to hang out and catch some rays!
author: Karla C.

description:
Fort Funston is as fun and beautiful as you would expect from the best dog park in the world.

My dogs and I entered the park through the Lake Merced parking lot and hiked down the path towards  San Francisco. Along the way, we saw tons of well behaved dogs and children, friendly people, and some of the most beautiful sights I've seen in the Bay so far.

Fort Funston does provide a water fountain for people and pets near the Lake Merced entrance and some of the paths are paved, but I did find it difficult to find a path that led to the actual beach due to a lack of signage and me not thinking to bring a map of the place. I also recommend bringing plenty of dog waste bags as well as a vessel to carry used bags in, as I didn't see any trash cans along the trails.

Also as a heads up, the beach access trail near the Lake Merced entrance is actually closed for the winter season, and so to access the beach you should head to the trail closest to Fort Funston's official parking lot.

Overall, this is a fantastic place and I'm going to try to take my little buddies here as often as I can!
author: Tracy K.

description: Sandy trails and Amazing views :D went there with my 5 year old daughter and dog , both of them had a lovely time enjoying the ocean and the view :)
author: Neena S.

description:
This is the perfect place to take your dog! Off-leash and a beach nearby.

My friend took me here with his dog and found a weird parking at the bottom near an intersection. It looked like an unfinished road so only about 4 cars could park there. We walked up the hill and found ourselves at the top of Fort Funston.

Very beautiful. Highly recommended. Bring your camera, perfect place to take pictures as well!
author: Aj C.

description: 5 stars for Doggy Disneyland, a magical place where you and your pup can enjoy the beach, hang gliders overhead, and the occasional whale sighting.
author: Heather H.

description: Dogs loved it!!!!  Easy parking, short walk to the beach, friendly folks and dogs enjoyed meeting new friends.
author: Tom B.

description:
Loved this place.

Wish I lived closer....

I had seen a few of my fellow Yelpers check in here, sparked my curiosity and decided I had to go on my next day off....would have brought my dog but wanted to see how it was first....my doggie is a little "special" 

As soon as I drove up I was in love....

So peaceful and sceren....... Just thinking about it relaxes me .

So all trail failed me and I did not even know where to get started. So I winged it..... Ummmm it was good and bad lol  I got lost a few times and had to slide down the hill.... "Fun" thank God im not afraid of heights 

So as Im going up the sandy hills I'm thinking "are you sure you want to do this?" Im not a huge fan of hills lol.... Love running down them HATE going up. Love the views .... Well as I go up I realize that not only is going up a sandy hill harder than a normal hill it also requires an enormous amount of leg strength. 

Oh well I didnt drive an hour and a half to stand around....... So worth it .... Something so rewarding about making it up and then making it back.  I'm sure there are easy routes...like I said I got lost and made up one lol.... Well if you want to relax , listen to the waves , breath some freah air this is a good place to go.


All dogs where well behaved.... Not sure how my dog would have done...maybe ill take him next time...
author: Genesis A.

description: This place is the best!! So windy and kinda cold, but who doesn't love the beach. The kids and dogs always asking me to come back! Bring a jacket and make sure you like to walk because this place is one of a kind. Hang gliders and dogs, but it never feels crowded. Also lots of parking. So many beautiful views, two! Thanks Fort Funston!!!
author: Mark Z.

description:
Sooooo mmmmaaannnyyyy dooooogs! OMG we found doggy playground heaven. Those stairs though.. man I was not ready for that. There are a lot to get down to the beach, so be prepared. Is this where the dog walkers take the pups? If not, they should. If anyone owns a dog, they MUST bring them here. 

Just at the border of San Francisco and Daly City, Fort Funston offers at least 5 different hiking trails for both humans and dogs. The crowning feature though to this National park is... the Beach! Duh. Bring the dogs, take the leash off and let them run, bark, frolic, sniff, dig, smell and swim to their hearts delight. They will have the best nights sleep and you a quiet house. If you prefer not to make the trek down the stairs to the water, there is a nice overlook that is just as appealing. The native shrubs and grass nearby will keep fido entertained just the same. 

Take heed and mind the decaying animals on the sand such as birds, crabs and fish. Lest fido cover his own coat with that of the water road-kill - your car will smell the same.  Otherwise it's a great day out with the dogs!
author: Jaylena P.

description:
The best dog park evvvaaa! Rather than write a review.. here is a video of our trip. 

DOG HEAVEN at Fort Funston: http://youtu.be/OQ3xmhqkP7E
author: Leber C.

description:
This is like doggy disneyworld, amazing -- my pup got to meet so many other dogs and run in such a wide open space off leash!! 

Getting down to the beach is pretty manageable, you can walk on a paved path until you get there and it was pretty flat too. The pups can wander around while you mosey on down.

The beach is pretty clean and most the pups are friendly, this adventure really tired my pup out - yay! (he has a lot of energy). 

Lots of wind when I went, but the experience was amazing for my pup! Parking was pretty easy, and I would definitely come back!!
author: Kristie C.

description:
Great place to take an easy hike and take in some fresh air.

We were looking for an easy hike and this place came up. The name of the park sounds exciting enough - Fort and Fun-ston. 

Just 10+mins away from Daly City. They have a decent sized parking lot with easy access to the trail heads. 

All trails are easy with minimal incline. A highly popular dog park, where dogs have plenty of space to run and many are off leash. If you are afraid of dogs, this is definitely not a park for you. Most of the dogs we come across are very friendly.

The whole trail is very beautiful. One of my favorite trails though a tad too short. 

Highly recommended park. just make sure you watch where you step - dog poo everywhere.
author: Cindee T.

description:
two words: DOG HEAVEN. 
Simply amazing, right at the edge of sf, by Daly City. It's free, beautiful, clean, what more can you ask! It's a freaking beach that all these dogs roam around off-leash so happily. I like to park near the water fountain, then take the paved path, make a right, then walk down to the beach and walk along the shore til I see the stairs which leads right back to the parking lot! A  perfect little loop for you and your pal.
author: Tiffany C.

description: We traveled 2.5 hours to visit because the reviews saying best dog beach and they were right! Our dog and kid had a wonderful time running on the trails and playing in the beach. It's one of our best beach days ever! The parking lot was very crowded, but once we were on the beach it didn't feel crowded at all. We had plenty of room for our family and dog to be away from others.
author: Caroline H.

description:
Dog people are the best people.  And the best dog people seem to all be at this dog heaven beach.

Lola, my 60 lb athletic and playful GS, hurt her shoulder there in a freak accident yesterday, and as I was panicking and she was in excruciating pain, people just stopped their activities and came to our aid. 

Someone helped call my wife and tell her where to bring the car, ..someone brought their blanket and made it into a stretcher, ... someone carried my stuff, ...  people grabbed a corner and walked the long distance to the stairs, and then all the way up the stairs, with reinforcements to take turn carrying her, while I was trying to keep her calm. Someone told me about the vet emergency hospitals nearby, then called and made sure to find one open (Nor Cal Veterinary Emergency and Specialty) told them we were coming ...

Lola is better now, no broken bones as far as the vet could see with exams and x-rays, ... she has most likely has soft tissue damage which should heal with time. 

Thank you all so much, .. who helped us and who wished us well. You make all the difference in this beautiful place. I am amazed and truly humbled by the humanity ... We will come back to this heaven soon.
author: Ali S.

description:
Fort Funston is now in my top 3 off-leash dog beaches in California - along with Del Mar Dog Beach and Morro Strand (between Morro Bay and Cayucos).  This area is beautiful.  Lots of trails to walk, dogs walking freely, no poop to be seen.  Not at all crowded this Saturday mid-morning and plenty of parking.

This former Nike missle site was inactivated in 1963 but remnants of the former purpose are visible.  The parking area sits at the missle launch site and down at the water level is more structural evidence that are now a canvas for creative artwork (tagging).

The clips are jagged - follow the trails to lets down to the waters beach and there are, supposedly, two sand ladders (pseudo stairs) available and are a good workout heading back up.  At the water, the sand is clean; I hear it's magnetic.

It's more than drive up, park, and hit the beach.  There's trails and paths and this area is easy to get to (just south of the Zoo).
author: John H.

description:
I LOVE DOG WATCHING HERE. My corgi is unfortunately living across the country with my parents at the moment. My favorite thing to do is to come here and watch all the dogs come and be happy and run around off leash. Everyone is happy and there are regulars. Some of the doggie day cares even take field trips here. 

The handicap trail I believe is the longest beach handicap trail in the country. There is a steep sand hill that allows beach access for you and your dog. That is about 1/2 the park.
