The other half is above with lots of running puppy room. There are a few handicap portapotties in the parking lot. They've always been clean for me! The deck above the parking lot is also used for hang gliders! (It's super windy here, be ready!) that's fun to watch as well! 

This is also a national park site, a true fort! So its open container .
author: Ciara F.

description:
We have very fond memories coming here in the past enjoying the views of the ocean and watching the hang gliders soar.

It's been at least ten years since our previous visit. No real reason for not returning.


I think we caught Fort Funston on a bad day.  It was very windy so the main trail was closed.  There were also dozens of dogs; half of which were pooping up a storm without their owners cleaning up after them.....wth?

Mr Rinky braved the winds and walked down one of the open trail.
I stayed in the car and read since I wasn't dressed for the cold.
author: Rinky N.

description: The water on this beach (Fort Funston Beach/beach right below Battery Davis) comes right up to the rocks. Very refreshing. A couple on their first date relaxed on elevated logs, surrounded by dogs enjoying the cool temperatures and foamy waters. Unfortunately, in trying to protect her phone from the advancing waters, my mom placed her iPhone six plus (the big one) on a higher cliff face only to discover that someone had stolen it within 20 minutes. The phone was taken on Wednesday, June 21, sometime between 7:30 and 8 p.m and powered off shortly thereafter. Phones are expensive and my mom still hasn't been able to replace hers, so if anyone saw anything pleaseeee PM me.
author: Sarah W.

description: This is an awesome place for dogs! Me and my girl brought our puppy and he loved it! There are so many dogs here leash and mostly off leash. My pup is not too good off leash but it will take time to get there i know it lol. Overall... I recommend to all dog owners, to bring your dog here!!!
author: Joseph F.

description: While this was great for a walk on the beach with the dogs, the rest of it was not so great.  The bathrooms were horrible. The place was crowded.  Between the bathroom smell and garbage cans full of dog poo, the smell was over whelming.  The place is in serious need of periodic maintenace.
author: Karen D.

description: Nice place where your pets can express their freedom from leash. Our dogs gone crazy, running and playing in the sand.
author: Inaro V.

description:
Doggie oasis within city limits...need I say more? This is an AWESOME place to bring your dog to socialize or just for a scenic little hike/walk along the beach. So many awesome dogs and places for dogs to sniff. My little ones love going here and romping around for hours. There are a couple water spouts for parched pooches, in addition to trash receptacles for waste products. 

Highly recommend wearing comfortable shoes with a bit of a grip, especially if you plan on trekking down to the beach. Be forewarned: there's a crazy incline to climb from the beach, so be ready to engage those glutes and hamstring muscles!!
author: Tracy T.

description:
DO YOU LOVE DOGS?! RAISE YOUR HAND IF YOU LOVE DOGS!

Or...alternatively, take a walk through Fort Funston if you really love dogs because they are everywhere here!

I don't have a dog. In fact, I'm more of a cat person. But I've since been to Fort Funston two times now and I'm a little jealous that you're able to take a walk with a dog and bring it to the beach and cats just like to hang out on your windowsill and hiss at you when it's hungry.

For Funsten is like a getaway from the city. It's a bit hard to get to for a downtown dweller like me, I took the M to Stonestown and then the 18 will drop you off right by.
I took a little hike and found myself in this beautiful scenic environment.

Sand. Sand everywhere. In your hair, eyes, lips, purse, and tiny crevice and crack to be seen. It gets windy here! The sand ca sting sometimes so wear leayers and bring a towel or something.

The wind is also unusual because it is the cause behind the changing landscape every week. I was sitting down on this sloping hill the first time I was here. The 2nd time? That beautiful slope was gone and is now this terrifying cliff drop. Whoa.

Once you hike down to the edge of the water, the wind dies a little bit and it's nice to walk. The sand isn't very clean and there's a lot of washed up sea creatures and the shells of old crabs and such. Not very pleasant, but hey it's the ocean.

You'll notice the abandoned remains of bunkers from time past. Bunkers where they use to camp out and watch for intruders in the sky. Pointing their guns into the air just waiting for days on end for something to happen, but hoping nothing does. Now the large concrete bases have fallen from the cliffs onto the sand below into their final resting place-until the waves will eventually wash them out into the ocean forever.

Historical, windy, hilly, isolated, and full of puppies. Yeah, that's Fort Funsten!
author: Lanie L.

description: Our first time at Fort Funston was a blast! For all three of us, the doggy, kid, and myself. Will definitely be visiting again before our trip home! And every time we come back! It's a great place for everyone in the family especially the little woofers!
author: Shannon C.

description:
This PLACE! I wish my dog could write a review because she would be raving. We came here after missing the exit for the golden gate dog park. Our sheepdog mix, loved the park. There is tons of beach area to explore and if you are agile you can jump down the small sand cliff to the beach area which is mostly empty. I am excited to go back and explore this dog beach more. 

A bit of advice to dog owners- to dogs, a tennis ball is a communal good. If you come to a dog park with any toy, prepare to leave with no toy.
author: Jenna E.

description: I love taking my dog here. He gets to run around and play with other dogs. It's a great exercise and the views are so beautiful. Go down to the beach -- why not?!
author: Steph L.

description:
Great spot for a walk or small hike whether you have a dog or not. I've gone here several times with friends but I went there one time walking my cat. 

My cat wasn't really made for this park, he was too scared of all the dogs. Maybe cats who are more used to dogs and the outdoors would be okay. 

Loved the views and enjoyed the hike and quick trek to the beach. Only downside is that having to use the restroom sucks! They have a concentration of porta-potties in one part of the area but if you're not close to it you're screwed. I had to jog there hahah. 

Tons of mosquitoes at night but that's natural I guess.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Never thought I would see so many dogs at one place, all prancing around off leash. It honestly was like a dream come true for me! We went to Fort Funston with some friends and their adorable puppy and looooved the place. 

It is a short hike to the beach and there are enough water bowls along the way for the doggies. You can see almost every breed of dog and they all look so happy as they greet each other. :) 

Even if you don't have a dog but love dogs, visit Fort Funston. It is a doggy lovers paradise!
author: Shriya P.

description:
Benji gives Fort Funston four paws up. He loves to play with other friendly pup buddies and to run in the ocean. 

The beach is long and there's enough space for everyone to spread out to explore. Almost everyone there has a dog so you should bring one too unless you want to look like a dog-napper. Benji had a wonderful time sniffing other doggies' butts and putting random things in his mouth. I had the pleasure of carrying Benji's many bags of poop during our outing. Happy dog = happy doggy parent.
author: Yi Z.

description: The best beach + hike in the Bay Area. Not many people visit Funston. The views are gorgeous (understatement) and the beach is endless, there are old military style bunkers. Be sure to grab something warm otherwise the winds may wear you down. Probably one of the worlds top places to catch a sunset on the Pacific.
author: Shaunak K.

description: The best place to let your dogs live free!  It can be a little breezy, but the dogs don't seem to mind.  There can be a lot of people on weekends, but there is always parking. If you have guests visiting from out of town, they will be blown away by how lucky the dogs are in this town!
author: Sophia G.

description: This is my favorite place. It's easy to get to, is pretty rain or shine, is visited by cool dogs and humans, and looks different every time. That's not a hyperbole. It really looks different every time for me because how the weather is and how high or low the tide is affects how cloud-like the sea foam is, whether or not you can get to the other side of the ruins without getting wet, whether or not some of the ruins are deep in sand or if you can see all the graffiti. It's a magical place!
author: Carmela G.

description:
Don't have a dog :(.... Yet! 

But used to come here often with my aunt and cousin to take their dogs out! :) 

And it would be very lovely seeing them make friends and playing with the other pups. 

Not only that, but coming here also equals such a nice scenic walk! From going on different trails and looking at the trees and getting beautiful views of the ocean!! Most pleasing when it's nice out. This is also a place that can be fun for kids! Let them run around together and "explore"! You'll love it... They'll love it. Just as much as the dogs hahah.
author: Farah D.

description:
Views and walk are lovely. My rating is solely for the behavior of dog owners.check out the reviews not put up. A lot of 1 star for same reasons. 

Fucking ridiculous, to the stupid woman who let her 4-6 little snappy annoying aggressive dogs sprint over and bark and attempt to jump on my two year old. Your a disgrace. I had to sweep her up in my arms while your little mutts kept on running at us. A swift kick told you I wasn't messing around your answer"if you had cabin fever you'd act the same" . Listen dopey "dog moms" don't have 5 dogs if you can't put manners on any of them.
Be warned this entire trail is run by dog  moms and dads and the dogs. Dogs are all off leashes and a free for all. Another dog sprinted past my 2 year old knocking her over no apologies nothing. You people are a disgrace, cop on to yourselves. If your dog can't behave keep it on a leash it's a dog not a human let's get that straight. 

Definitely would not recommend this trail area for anyone with kids or without a dog. The possey that "run it" are rude and ignorant. Will not be coming back.
author: obgyn K.

description:
Love this place!

I have only been here twice. Once when I was with college when a guy decided to take me on a date here and didn't tell me so I was wearing unsupportive flats, and another time the other day when a friend suggested with go hiking with our babies in the packs. Easily said the latter was the more fun of the two and because of this I know I will be back here soon.

It is a free range dog park so several dog walkers come here and let the dogs run loose. At one point I would said we easily had 25 dogs running happily all around us. It was great! 

There are a set of stairs you can go up and down to get a workout. Two days later my legs are still sore. Other than the stairs all of the incline and decline are very gradual so this is just an all around great place to go if you want an effective and easier workout. 

The views are great. On one side you can see the Pacific Ocean and the other side you can see Golden Gate Park and all the way to the Golden Gate Bridge.

The only bummer that happened while here was that since there were so many dogs, my daughter did the deed and picked up some dog poop. Gross... But with that being out of anyone's control I can't wait to come back for some more scenic exercise goodness.
author: Andy S.

description:
If you're into biking, from the middle of SF through the panhandle, GG Park, and down the Great Hwy is a great 20-mile roundtrip.

This is a very dog-friendly park, and all the visitors definitely take advantage of that!

I went on a short hike down to the beach (the trail had wooden logs as steps, but they were on a trail of loose wood chips and sand. You'll definitely get crap in your shoes). The view of the ocean is quite amazing from the top, and once you're on the beach, the ocean stretching as far as you can see on either side framed by the high cliff is quite majestic. Plus, it was actually HOT in January! I guess going just a little bit south from the city will greatly improve the weather conditions.

View from the top of that trail: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fort-funston-national-park-san-francisco?select=F2F5cwr2ZyFwQ63jQl4nYA#F2F5cwr2ZyFwQ63jQl4nYA

If you're not in for a hike, just take the trail that goes directly west from the parking lot. Just 100 yards or so and you'll get to a really nice viewing point with a great view!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I don't think I've ever seen a higher rated place on Yelp. At this writing, 5 stars on 760 reviews! Well let me add to the trend.

I don't know if I can any thing different to what has been listed already.
- Beautiful views of the cliffs from the top to the bottom
- Great for dogs and owners to roam free
- Great for hiking and walking trails
- Great for romance or for fun

Parking wasn't a problem for us, and we came on a beautiful Sunday around 4pm. I recommend a good pair of shoes for walking in sand, and definitely bring a jacket just in case the wind gets up there.

One cool fact : As long as it's a clear day, you can see the tops of the Golden Gate Bridge from here!

This is a must see spot, and I know this because all the locals come here! I would come here often too, if I lived here.
author: Brian F.

description: The best dog park ever. Even if you don't have a dog, it's the perfect morning or after breakfast stroll. Great spot for some cardio if you fancy a jog on or off the path. It's a good workout trying to run up the sand hills from the beach. It can get windy so be prepared with a light jacket. Lots of parking.
author: Daisy D.

description:
Do you have a dog? Do you have free time on a Sunday Morning? Get the %$*! out of the bed and take your playful pet out for a long walk through a beautiful little adventure at Fort Funston. 

Good:
1. Amazing landscapes
2. All kind of terrains to explore (Grass, Sand, Ground, Water, Cement)
3. There are many routes available to take inside the reserve.
4. Forgot to bring water bottle? There are couple water fountains for you and your pet.
5. Good place to meet new people and new dogs (because your dog needs friends too)

Not so good:
...
author: H C.

description:
Love to come here with dogs!!! Great place for dogs to socialize. On a nice day, this place can be very packed and hard to find parking.  You can come here for picnic or just hang out. If you have a dog/dogs, do make sure to bring your pet here. You get to meet ppl and your pets get to mingle! 

Ps: Ppl come here for gliding too lol I wanted to try but it looks pretty dangerous lol
author: Alanda B.

description:
I love this plaace!!!! 
brought my dog here and it was amazing 
it was such a cool breeze and the people are friendly 
there was so many friendly dogs 
i would love to live by here
author: Marissa M.

description: Cool spot since i live close by. Very dog friendly trail and nice ocean views. Also good parking
author: Mason L.

description: Doggie heaven indeed! Great atmosphere for people and dogs. Pack a light lunch and dog treats and be ready to hit the trails and beach.
author: Ramsey S.

description:
Don't know if I can add to all the same happy comments as other yelpers - but really the best place to bring your dog for beach, trails and socialization. 

On the trails, they even have water stops! Everyone has a chuck-it so your dog can happily try to chase someone else's ball. Poop bags at the front. Parking really easy to find.
author: Kelly G.

description:
This place to dogs would be what the city is to me. Huge, foggy, and plenty of room to get in trouble. I take my dog here occasionally to let him rip through the sand and concrete trails unleashed. He loves it so much here, and I think it's much safer here than at Bernal Heights Park. 

We walk down the Thornton beach where Bailey has no clue how to deal with the water, but enjoys the nice breeze and sand in his paws. For any dog lover that has a social dog, take them here. They'll love it.
author: Eric A.

description:
I LOVE this place.  This is perhaps the best place in the city to take your dog.  It is part of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area so a good part of it is off leash (voice control).  Plenty of dogs around for your pup to play with and most of the owners are responsible and aware of their four legged friends.  There are plenty of paths to explore and a beach for your pup to enjoy.  The tide can affect your experience as it can come up pretty high and could prevent you from walking from one end to the other.  The paths up/down to the beach is a good workout for most and made more challenging because they are covered in sand.  Plenty of free parking - I never had any problems on the weekend.  Water fountains and trash bins are by the main parking lot - bring your own poop bags.

Be careful of the cliffs though as the drop off can be steep and there are reports of erosion.  This area can also be pretty windy so a jacket may be needed.
author: Roy L.

description: We've been here on a Friday, not so crowded. The weather is good, enough sunshine but not so hot. This place is absolutely worth the one-hour drive, the scene become breathtaking when we approach the shoreline. Our fur baby was with us, and she found a lot of her friends along the way. If you are a dog person, you won't regret it coming to Fort Funston, where like a dog heaven. Dogs are off leash on the trail. Our four-legged friend is not good at recall, so we put her a leash. She is the happiest one during this trip.
author: Kary H.

description: It couldn't be a more perfect day to take my little double doodle to fort funston for the first time. The weather was absolutely perfect, warm, sunny, and not windy, this is Disneyland for doggies. Doggies can be off leash on the trails as well as the beach. Plenty of space for them to walk, play, and run. I didn't see any aggressive dogs when u was there and there are dogs of all shapes and sizes. Bring a towel though for the pooch because they can get sandy and wet after playing at the beach! Overall, believe the hype, it really is an amazing place for your best pals.
author: Betty C.

description:
I love this place. My girlfriend loves this place. My dog HELLA loves this place. There's a trail. There's a beach. What's not to love?

My dog is a 6 year old, grumpy ass English bulldog and nothing stokes his inner fire more than running around off leash, chasing a dirty ass ball he found on the beach. Even though he frowns 99% of the time, I know he loves it and gets a raging dog boner when he realized we're here.
author: Vernon L.

description: Wow! Who remembers 11 Nike missile bases around the San Francisco Area! Well they were there from 1954 through 1974. Incredible - Fort Funston is one of the remnants of that cold war area. That is surely some food for thought. Today Fort Funston is a wonderful park on the cliffs overlooking the incredible Pacific Ocean. It is a favorite spot for hang gliders, dogs, and of course people! Expect wind, the hang gliders depend on it and it is quite a show. I love to be on the cliffs overlooking the ocean with a vista down the coastline, it is a heavenly spot! Bring the coat / windbreaker,. bring binoculars, bring lunch, bring drinks, and enjoy another section of paradise on the California Coast
author: Charley C.

description:
Would rate a 3.5

+ Loved how it wasn't windy
- Didn't like how gross the sand looked
+ Liked how it was a dog beach (from what we saw)
- Was bummed by not having service
+ Liked how there was plenty of parking
+ Also liked how there wasn't hella people
* Not the beach's fault, but wish we could've known it was cloudy before we went (my and my boyfriend's weather app wouldn't let us choose this location :/).
But I should've been a responsible bay area beach go-er and brought clothes for cold-ness, too
author: Denise N.

description: Great place for hiking with friends. The hike is amazing, you see plenty of people and dogs during the day, and there's a relaxing beach as well.
author: Eduardo P.

description: Beautiful work of nature! Best view for your buck!!! Relaxing, quiet and rejuvenating. Highly recommend you to come out and play
author: Ulises R.

description:
Fort Funston is a hop and skip away from our home.  It's a decent beach to visit if you're in the area.  Nice views but expect overcast, windy conditions as a norm.  You can surf here if you're not afraid of the freezing water.  If you're a dog owner, you flock there bc it's the one beach that allows off leash dogs.  The ratio of people to dogs is easily 1:1 at Fort Funston.  Could be a good place to bring the family and dogs.  

However, I feel that those dog owners who do not practice common etiquette diminish the overall experience at Fort Funston.  I'm a dog lover but I do not love irresponsible dog owners.  I always notice that some people do not pick up after their dogs there.  Also, just bc this is an off leash beach, it does not mean you cannot leash your dog (especially those who need to).  Today, there were some little yappy dogs that tried to attack any person that would walk within a 40 ft vicinity of their owner.  Dumb dog owner - please leash your dogs.  I also witnessed a few dogs that got into a fight and the owners were pulling them off of each other.  Somehow one of the owners ended up falling down in the sand dunes.  Again, if you have an aggressive dog, do not let it go unleashed.  

Overall, there are better beaches to visit in SF especially if you want a little more peace and quiet.  If you do go to Fort Funston, be cautious of the unleashed dogs and watch your step.
author: Liv A.

description:
A great place to be if you wanna be with your dog and have a beautiful scene! 

You should definitely check it out when you have a chance! :)
author: Ploy L.

description:
My schnauzer, who is now 5, has been coming here since he was a pup. I come here almost everyday for my run with my dogs & every experience has been as pleasant as the others.  The dog walkers and other park goers are nice & are always ready to give my dogs some lovin'. I really appreciate that there are two water fountains with bowls for your dogs when its time for a water break and bags at every garbage station.  There are multiple trails you can take & 2 ways to go down to the beach (ones a huge set of stairs & other a sand hill).  I would suggest to always park at the main parking lot towards the west side of Ft. Funston by the coastal trail as parking on the lower side against to the road can get a little sketchy sometimes-- there have been multiple breaks in over the years so just a heads up.  I can't rave enough about how much I love this place. Off-leash, big open space, beach view... sigh. If you've never been here as a dog lover or not, you def. have to check it out asap!

Also, Ft. Funston has recently finished up some re-construction with their trails as well. (See my pictures) I like how the walkways are now much larger and I'm sure they'll be finishing up the rest of the trails as some of them really do need some tlc. Till next time.
author: Julie Ann B.

description:
This place is quite amazing mainly for the amazing views you can see here at any time of the day and all the hiking trails that can be found here. Of course since this is a dog park, there are A LOT of dogs around and with that comes a lot of dog poop and dog pee so watch your step! (Hence the 4 stars) but the views here - amazing. 

Even if you don't have a dog, coming here for a photography shoot of sunsets and sunrises are probably the most amazing photos you will get. There is plenty of parking here, even on busy days which is always a good thing. There aren't any actual bathrooms here (portable pottys) which I think should change, this place is nice and with all the people that come here it couldn't hurt to have decent park bathrooms here. 

Other than that, I have heard that it is the most popular dog park in San Francisco. Check it out and bring a jacket just in case as it can get quite windy here.
author: Anne R.

description:
LOOOOOOVVVVEEEE this place and so does lil' Ziggs! As soon as we park she gets so giddy as I'm sure she can small the ocean air and she knows she'll be running leash free through the water and chasing seagulls. Happy dogs running free all over and their humans are really friendly too! Beautiful beach to walk up and down while your pupps go crazy!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fort-funston-national-park-san-francisco?select=SiKPuqtfLry70wpkdvRPpA#KVOAjlHcwVSWSuYDm0kq7w
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fort-funston-national-park-san-francisco?select=SiKPuqtfLry70wpkdvRPpA#hjLr74mTMth1Ud8acvnGDg
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fort-funston-national-park-san-francisco?select=SiKPuqtfLry70wpkdvRPpA#ji7iyz76jaQHtno-iMA88A
author: Vivian A.

description: I imagined dog heaven to be this, i didn't expect it to be so beautiful, vast and clean, No pictures do justice to this place. If you are a dog owner and live anywhere in the bay area, this is the spot to be at.
author: Grace W.

description:
Holy stairs!!!!! No for real, prepare yourself for the hundreds of stairs you have to climb down (more importantly BACK UP).  

That being said, Fort Funston is GORGEOUS!  Such an awesome location and a really great dog-friendly beach.  Almost all of the owners were responsible with their dogs, so it made for a very fun and stress-free morning.  We came at around 11am and there was a lot of parking available.

All in all, a great experience and I will definitely be back!!
author: Alyx F.

description:
Views = epic. 

Scenery = hard to beat.  Every time, it's different.  It's beautiful.  Rain or shine, just go! 

Dogs = having way too much fun.  I brought 4 dogs here, and they had so much fun.  As did I! 

Parking = easy.  Don't be an asshole and take up two spots.  

There's a few benches around, too.  

Water fountains for you and your critters.
author: Fannie S.

description:
What better way to tire out a energetic puppy! I love Fort Funston. Sure getting there is a pain from where I come from, but that doesn't stop me! Well maybe the fog and cold might, but definitely in the summer, there are plenty more sunny warm days than the foggy misty days. (:

What can I say about Fort Funston? It's huge!! Lots of walking paths, sand mounds, water, etc. etc. I especially love the sand mounds because when my dog climbs to the top of it, it's like Lion King! I'm a sucker and then take tons of pictures of my puppy. And then we have the ocean with the waves crashing ashore bringing whatever weird things was in the water ashore too. I say just be careful of what your dog starts sniffing.. gross gross bird feathers. 

I love coming here because everyone here is dog lovers! So no one will walk around your dog or anything. It's nice! I don't have a scary dog, but the social norms of having a german shepherd I guess. Here though, no one cares! 

You meet a lot of dog walkers here. (: They're all really nice and friendly and know a lot about dogs. So it's nice to have people to talk to about your dogs. Though... one time I met a dog walker who was pretty mean and basically told my friend that he's training his dog all wrong. pshhh. 

But just remember to pack a towel in the car and pat your dog down before he or she gets in. My car is still has sand even after a pat down. Haha.  Oh well! A tired dog is a good dog!

Just sucks that places like these can mean your dog can come home with an infected eye... but I still think this place is well worth the time and quality bonding for your dog with other dogs!
author: Joan T.

description:
LOVE!! 

I can't believe I haven't gone to this place any sooner! It's been on my list of places to go for over a year and today we took a spontaneous trip there (don't regret a thing). Everybody here is friendly and you don't have to worry about anybody complaining about dogs being off leash. Depending where you park the less walking you have to do. We parked along Skyline blvd and because we were first timers it took us longer to find the actual beach but when we did it was like a hidden gem. 

Happy dogs, wet tails wagging. What's better than that? Definitely recommend and will be coming back soon :) 

Ohh and if anybody is wondering they have porta potties at the main entrance and fresh water bowls available at each water fountain.
author: Kimmy P.

description:
Dog parks rule for a girl who's closest experience with having a dog was being given a Pug puppy by JoBeth B. and then being told by her parents that she had to give it back, OR ELSE. So sad. Fort Funston is a landmark in SF for off-leash dog walking, which works out perfectly for the people (me) who like to pet dogs a lot. 

Funny coming-of-age story: when I was a kid I was walking with my mom and brother up the Merced side of the beach where little wood steps allow for more traction up the sandy hill. Anyway a teenage girl and her boyfriend were running down and the girl had on a blouse, but no bra (!) and her top flew open while she ran! I was like, oh man! What did I just see?? Boobs, that's what I saw. And being a sheltered, flat-chested pre-teen I was shocked. 

Bright and windy, I recommend wearing layers and shades. The beach is just a hop, skip, and a jump down from the upper level where the former Lake Merced Military Reservation is. You can still walk through the "ruins" and low trees, but beware of homeless squatters!
author: Crystal C.

description:
GREAT place to take your dog, especially if you enjoy off leash walking.

I did come first on a Sunday and it was SUPER windy - so bad that my husband and I finally had to stop and turnaround.  Even though I showered when I got home because of all the sand, I still found sand on me for the next two days.  Crazy.  

The second time I came, I made sure the wind wasn't so insane and I was able to make it down to the beach.  It was my day off from work, but for a Wednesday afternoon at 1pm there were a TON of people here.  My dog and I had a blast and stayed for probably two hours walking around and walking barefoot on the beach.  I wish I had brought a blank to lay out because several other people did and I was jealous.  There are also lots of crab shells and sand dollars you will find   along the black beach sand.  Very pleasant time, and I will be back!
author: Cassandra A.

description:
Don't believe dreams come true? Get that magic back in your heart. Here are a few buzz words regarding why you can do so here:

Breathtaking oceanside cliffs 
Friendly hang gliders that wave hello back
Clean trails
Easy Parking 
DOG PARK

That's right - take it all in. Go for a picnic, stay for the majestic sunset. And, don't be on a time schedule. 

To elaborate on the most dreamlike aspect of this place, let me talk about the dogs. Small, tall, fat and everything in between is what you'll find here. However, none of their 'droppings' were ever seen or stepped in!
author: Sarah M.

description: Best dog park/beach in the city.  The entire park and beach area is all off-leash so there won't be any people complaining about your dog.  Everyone is understanding of the dogs and if you are not, this is not the place for you.  It has great views, long hiking trails, a path to the beach.  My dog loves it here, only wish we lived closer.
author: Justin Y.

description:
Probably the best place, to take your dog off leash.  A great mix of trails and beach access, with so many dogs at all times.

Rocky LOVES coming here and making new friends, big and small.  I still don't get the whole butt sniffing thing, but oh well, they're all having a good time.

Good times indeed!
author: Anthony D.

description: Love the park and the views....Hate the dumbfuck dog owners and walker who let their untrained and aggressive canines off leash....Too many irresponsible dog owners and walkers who just let rambunctious dogs roam free....My keeshond almost got attacked twice lucky I was able to deter the both attacks since I rarely let dogs get near my pup unless they are smaller and a non aggressive breed....Im probably not going to take my dog here any longer...
author: Mozart G.

description: I loveee this place! Amazingly beautiful scenery and perfect place to bring your dog.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Dog lovers galore! 

Fort is both my dogs absolute favorite place to be. Most likely because they get to be free and off leash in a non-contained area. It's also relatively clean  because most owners are responsible and pick up their dog's poop.

I usually start off on the right side of the lot and work my way toward the water fountains and take the left side route. My dogs LOVE running down the paved hill! There's 3 options for us from there. We can take the 1) beach route 2) horse trail 3)sandy hill. I like the beach route the most. I bring them down the steep sandy incline and bring them down to the water. Many folks let their dogs run on the beach and bring them back the same way but I like to walk along the beach back up towards the stairs/parking lot. This tires my dogs out the most and they usually have a blast running in and out of the water. The best part of this route is the stairs... it exhausts them (in a good way!)!!

Don't forget to bring towels to wipe the dogs down! They will get SANDY!!!!!
author: Jessica L.

description:
We haven't been here in over a year. I should have read my previous review before deciding to come here again. 

Two words: Dog walkers!!! Ugh!!!! 

The multitude of clueless, inconsiderate dog walkers completely ruined this place. So sad! It is down right dangerous when they are around and I don't know if the pet owners are aware of the risk they are exposing their pets to by entrusting them in the care of many of these people. Many of them don't have the slightest clue how to handle dogs. 

They should really set up some rules and enforce them to ensure everyone's safety dogs and people alike.
author: Kaya B.

description: The best place to bring your dog, but please make sure your dog is trained with recall. This is an open beach area with loose dogs running around. We brought our dog here for the first time and she loved being free. She doesn't like the water, but likes running around in the sand. We were afraid to bring her here, but we have been practicing recall training and wanted to check if she responded. We are so lucky she has good recall and this place is a blessing. I just wish owners were more responsible in picking up after their dog and that there were trash cans. I understand it's a beach, but leaving your pets poo is not acceptable.
author: Jinnie L.

description:
Perfect place for a quick afternoon hike with friends, family, and better yet -- with your dogs! It's a dog heaven for sure. 

There's a huge parking lot just up skyline blvd. The hike itself is relatively easy. It's about an hour long hike, but there's no time limit because you can always hike farther. The trails can get a bit sandy. 

The best part is the beach that connects below fort funston!
author: Ellen W.

description:
Fort Funston is truly as good as it gets for dogs. It's truly like doggy heaven, just like everyone says. One huge stretch of beach and trails, too, for you and your dog to explore. It's endless fun! 

In that vein, though, if you're not sure how your dog will act around a ton of different dogs of all sizes and personalities...leash them first. There's no shame in doing so! And if your dog isn't ready for off-leash time, people will (and rightfully so) let you know what time it is. 

I've never had a bad experience and almost all of the dog owners are super responsible and their dogs well-behaved. 

The beach itself is huge and you can walk for miles, it seems. It's not the prettiest beach for human swimming or picnicking, but it's great for a romp or a game of frisbee with the pooch. Views from the top looking at the coast are just awesome. Especially when the sun decides to come out. 

Be smart, be responsible and have many epic adventures together! Woof!
author: Kristen S.

description:
Great place for dogs. I try to come here once a week. This place is like Heaven for my dog!  This place has lots of space for your furry friend to run around! You can also walk down to Thornton beach. The steps may look steep but it's pretty easy! Sometimes I'm afraid of slipping but I have to try to catch up to my dog! 

This is a great place to watch the sunset as well!
author: Majileen C.

description:
A wonderful part of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area - great for dog owners, dog lovers, hang gliders, kids, tourists... just about anyone! (The only people who should stay away are people who dislike or are afraid of dogs.  There are off-leash dogs all over Fort Funston)

There is a large parking lot, but it was pretty full when we went today (a Sunday afternoon).

Many soft trails to hike on, pretty cliffs with views of the ocean and the beach below. Succulents all over the place. Some foxtails, especially near the parking lot. Beach access requires a moderately steep descent down a sandy path that thankfully has logs to create some traction - and then an equivalent climb back up to get to the parking area.

It's a good idea to wear layers - it's pretty windy, hence the hang gliders everywhere. Dog owners: Bring your own bags to clean up after your dog, as bags may not be available.
author: Grace C.

description: This place is amazing. Nice trails. Came to watch dogs since I saw reviews that lots of people bring their dogs here and sat on the cliffs and actually saw multiple groups of dolphins migrating. I went on a nice, warm, clear day after work and it made my day.
author: Lelyn C.

description:
This place is a convenient place to go.  It's sad how many locals don't take advantage of this place.  When I encourage my clients to go out and explore, I tell them to come here.  I need to take advantage of this place more.

I have a great memories here.  It's where my now-husband asked me to be his girlfriend.  This place is actually big and you can explore a lot here.  

I know weather isn't always great in this area.  Just come prepared.  Always bring a jacket, unless it's one of those where it's reallllly hot.  You can go down the beach, it can be tiring going up but it's a good workout.  You can always follow the trail that takes you to the beach without the steep area. 

If you're afraid of dogs, allergic to dogs or just not fond of them.  Don't come here.  Because you will encounter them.  But if you have no problems with them, just come here, great weather or not.
author: Claire J.

description:
LOVE this place! I have two boxers and they are more of a hiking trail dogs, rather than a closed dog park dog. They really pay no attention to other dogs, and just run and follow the trails. I have been going here for over 3 years now and I still love it, scenery is beautiful and a nice walk/hike for yourself for exercise.. Can't explain how much i love this place! Lots of friendly friendly dogs, and nice respectable people here also even dog walkers. 

What annoys me the most coming here is when families bring their kids here and get angry that dogs want to come and sniff them, it's like hello you know you've come to a dog park right, if not carry them or keep them in a stroller... It's not a playground for kids!
author: Rachel M.

description: I don't have much experience in searching out dog friendly beaches, but this turned out to be a great place to bring the little guy. With hang gliders soaring overhead, dogs running all around, hills rolling behind you and the pacific ocean stretching out in front of you, this historic beach is a great place to spend the afternoon with your pets. As with any other beach in the area though, the water is extremely cold.
author: Mark O.

description: Heaven on earth for our pup. This place is magical- on the sunniest and warmest of days to the coldest and foggiest- it doesn't matter. Your pups have freedom!! They run and play in the water- explore hills and the beach- they make friends and get so much exercise and play time in. I honestly think this is my favorite place to be in the bay- happiness all around. We have seen whales all over the place as well. Such a highly recommended spot to all dog lovers!
author: Holley S.

description: Should be called fort funs-town! A great place to take the dog to romp in the sand. But be careful of the cliffs.
author: Peter W.

description:
We've only been to Fort Funston to watch the hang gliders & enjoy a picnic above the beach so can't speak to the actual beachy / trails part.....but from all the visits I have made & all the out-of-towners I usually bring here, everyone loves this park

Almost every weekend you can find people hang gliding from the nice windy cliffs - also good to note at this point that windy means cold - bring layers!

Super cool to watch the takeoff, then to see the gliders floating all along the coast then come back to land at the very spot from where they took off

We've also found on random occasions, they even have options for you to do a tandem-glide.....but I'm too chicken ( so far )

There are also picnic tables located a bit inland & while they don't provide a perfect spot from which to see the hang gliders, they do provide the perfect equipment such as tables & benches so that you may place your picnic items above ground

Or we've been known to grab a nice wrap or handheld munchable & sit ourselves down at the overlook / benches to watch the hang gliders & battle the wind as we try to nibble on our sandwiches

Always see loads of cars bringing their doggies & with plenty of parking to be found, this makes Fort Funston all the more tons-of-fun!

Down on the beach or up in the sky, there's something for everyone!
author: Adrienne G.

description: For me , this is home. I feel like this is my backyard just 5-10 minutes away. I used to come here a lot! All the time with friends & family. I used to walk my dogs here and/or would come here to watch sunsets. Hangliders are fun to watch too. You can walk on the trails and walk the path down to the beach.
author: Reese P.

description:
Just got back from spending Labor Day at Fort Funston for the first time! The pups are all tuckered out, curled up in their beds. I'm pretty sure this is the quietest my house has ever been at this hour. This is great! :)

SO worth making the trip up from the South Bay to come here! We spent probably 3 hours walking up and down a portion of the beach, and the dogs were just thrilled the entire time.

No other dog park is even comparable. This place is a paradise for dogs, and scenic and clean for the humans. The sand is super soft, lovely to walk barefoot on. The beach is clean for the most part, no dog poo left anywhere, not much trash or litter around. There's some interesting rocks/caves/ledges around to explore, and hang gliders to watch!

Maybe all the open space makes dogs much more agreeable with each other. My dog only encountered one touchy shiba inu, and that was only because she invited herself to sharing its ball lol. Oops.

---

Tips:

+ Free parking! Woohoo! Gets a bit crowded in the afternoon so you might need to circle around for a bit. Watch out for offleash dogs in the parking lot!

+ Make sure you bring poop bags! You'll also be holding onto the poops for a while since there are no trash cans on the beach.

+ Bring water for your pups! My two dogs got so thirsty right when they got to the beach (probably also from being silly dogs and trying to drink sea water, bleh!) They slurped up half a bottle of water right away.

+ Watch out for horses! (And horse poo, lol, dogs love that stuff.) They get spooked when dogs follow them so make sure you call your dogs off, even if they're just curious about the strange giant beast with a human on top.

+ The path we took today had some pretty steep stairs that made getting down to the beach super easy, but going back up was a different story! I'm sure there's another path for those who aren't looking to do stairmasters up from the beach.

---

Looking forward to checking out more of the trails when we go next time! We walked the up and down a good portion of the beach today, but curious where the other trails take us.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Be warned if you are considering bringing a small dog here, do so at your own risk. Keep small dogs on leash for their protection.  My 17 LB dog was chased and rolled by a dog pack.  Word of mouth is that a small dog is killed here about once a week.  Even my neighbors' high school kid was nipped by a dog while running here. Park & Rec: please add small dog safety warnings at dog parks.   Danger is not obvious to newcomers.  Thanks
author: Catherine A.

description:
Wow - this place is like a big outdoor dog park!

Went here for the first time today and plan to return soon. Good sized parking lot although it was pretty full. Lots of dogs off leash walking alongside their humans and greeting other canines. Haven't found another place in the city quite like it.

The views are splendid - ocean views, rolling sand dunes, hang gliders, and city hills filled with cookie cutter houses. The paths are plenty - paved, sandy, beach access. It makes for a wonderful afternoon stroll or workout. Try trekking off the path into the sand or up a sand dune for an impromptu outdoor stairmaster.

Check it out - and don't forget to bring your dog!
author: Allison R.

description: This is my dog's favorite spot in SF. Fort Funston is full of happy dogs running around having fun. If you are a dog lover in the Bay area, be sure to visit Fort Funston!!!
author: Haein C.

description:
If you hate dogs....DO NOT COME HERE! HAHAHA There are dogs everrrrrrrrrywhere and all are very obedient. Beautiful, trails all over the place. 

I was taken here for as a surprise and it's been months since I've been to the beach. Despite the high traffic of people and dogs, there are many areas to get away from all that and just hang out. We went to the top where there was no one and just hung out and drank from coconuts hahah yes coconuts!  

This place is beautiful and don't let Daly City's fog make you turn around as you're on your way out here. Once you're at the beach there is no more fog on a nice day.
author: Steph S.

description:
Flopsie had her annual vaccination in the mroning. We headed to Fort Funston right after.  Fort Funston is like Disneyland for Dogs. Even though it was a gloomy day, there were still plenty of doggies.

A quick note, the cement path in from of Battery is closed for repairs.
author: Virginia L.

description:
One of my fave dog parks! Great ocean views and trails! My dog loves it... Tons of open space to run around off leash. Even if you're not a dog owner still a good place to visit. Everyone is always super friendly :)

Parking is free but usually pretty full on the weekends. Come prepared for the weather... I usually always need a jacket.
author: Jamie W.

description: Seriously, a must for anyone with a dog. This is one of the few places where your dog can roam free, play in sand, chase some birds around and jump into the pacific. My dog is ecstatic every time we pull up to the parking lot. Out of the car, she's pouncing around like tigger on his birthday (at least that's how I imagine it). Down the trail, you'll find a great hill to descend to get to the water. Descending isn't the hard part, I'm sure you're dog will be running full speed. Just have fun on the way up ;)
author: Leina K.

description: Most of the asphalt is tore up, including some of the one path slipping down the hill. This park is on the verge of being a dump, which is why I gave more than one star. The bonus star is because you can see some cool hang-gliding. Allowing dogs is a great idea except for half the owners are morons. There are tons of dogs that are not trained well enough to be off their lease, but are. They will just stop and get in your way. One lady had 5 dogs of the lease, and the one kept running off. Another guy had 3 dogs and his Rottweiler would listen to him. I heard him yelling for the dog to come for over 10 minutes. The dog was well tempered but if anything happened, people would blame his dog because it's huge.
author: Wang C.

description: I don't hike here; did it once and found it rather bland.  But I do like to visit and sit and watch the hang gliders launch and cruise up and down the coast.  It's a very relaxing way to spend some time contemplating.  Bring a jacket as it's nearly always windy there (hence the hang gliders).
author: Tim L.

description:
This is our number 1 / go to- dog park. It's a HUGE area where you can take your dog off leash without having to deal with the fear of cars, bikes, skateboards, and roller blades. Bubs loathes the sound of skateboards, roller blades, and scooters and will attack them / the rider which scares me b/c I don't want some kid getting hurt by accident. He also runs off the curb (no matter how much we've tried to train him to stick on the sidewalk) even though we can trust he won't run away. 

There is a huge parking lot and then a large sand area, but if you walk in further, there is a place to give your dog water, beach access, a woodland area, an amazing view, and more open softer sandy areas to play.

There are several loops or trails OR you can make your own trail (but be mindful of the indigenous plant life and don't trample on things) to enjoy with your dog. There are a also a bunch of various sized dogs running around which is nice for socialization. 

The people are nice and don't really bother me or Bubs. There was a time when we were walking back to the car and a dog pounced on Bubs but it wasn't in an aggressive way... it was more playful and it was pretty funny. The dog owner had apologized to me but I wasn't mad at all.

One thing to point out though is that in the later evening, it can be a little scary as there are a lot of secluded areas. Near dark, there aren't a lot of people and it could be dangerous.
author: J-nine I.

description:
Fort Funston will forever hold a special place in my heart because it is the one and only place where my mangy looking pound hound got complimented over the shitzu my parents drunkenly purchased at an auction. 

It is a dog lovers paradise with an eccentric collection of San Francisco mutts, mixes, and yes the occasional golden retriever or lab. You have the option of staying dry on the upper trails or getting down and dirty in the waves. Whichever rout you choose, always bring a jacket. The breeze off of the pacific can be quite chilly year round. 

All you need is yourself and your pup. No leashes required and there are two conveniently located hydration stations for both you and your furry friend. 

Warning: this will ruin all other dog parks for you.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
If you are a dog owner and looking for a great off-leash experience for both you and your pooch, look no further!  

They have water bowls at two areas for your dogs so no need to bring a bowl or carry water.  Just remember your poop bags!
author: liesl l.

description:
Dogs, Horses, Birds, Humans! This place is very large with lots of open area for people to walk on trails, enjoy the beach, horseback riding, let your NICE dogs run free. I came here 2 weeks in a row with my dog and she loves it! She is not scared of other dogs and from my observation, most dogs are not on leashes. Pet owners have been very nice in general and picking up after their dogs. 

Not very many place to sit if you get tired and no "real" bathrooms. All I see there are portal potties.  Very gross to my opinion. Would not use it.... 

People also do hang gliding here so that was also fun to watch.
Free parking. Never had trouble finding parking, just can't be picky. Take what's there and everything should be fine.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
WATCH OUT FOR AN ASIAN COUPLE. SHORT MALE AND FEMALE ABOUT 5'3 AROUND THEIR 30'S WITH 2 DOGS; A MEDIUM SIZED DOG (maybe a border collie?) AND VERY SMALL LOOKING DOG (possibly a chihuahua?). THE ASIAN MALE CARRIES AROUND A KNIFE AND IF HE EVEN DARES SEES YOUR DOG CHASING HIS, HE WON'T BE AFRAID TO USE HIS WEAPON!!

I was recently involved in a traumatizing experience, here at Fort Funston.

I brought my pit bulls to the park, just like any other day (Mind you, I am a local and have been coming to Fort Funston for the past 3 1/2 years).

A man's dog kept snapping at my pit bull. My dog has a very good temperament so, while he was being tested he remained calm. The other dog bit at my dogs nose/face area and my dog began to chase after his dog, for what was done. When the owner saw that my dog was going  after his, he held my dog down and began to stab him, about 5 to 6 times with a knife.

At first I thought the owner had been punching my dog, until I came close and saw a massive amount of blood gushing from my dogs shoulder/back area. I yelled to the onlookers to help and desperately pleaded for them to call 911. Once the owner and his girlfriend heard that, they fled.

The police came and I pleaded for them to help. Although they called in for park rangers to come down, they informed me that they couldn't help because Fort Funston is on federal ground - so, I couldn't even file a police report! They also said that they weren't supposed to respond to the call, but because a handful of calls came in about the same incident, they showed up for the circumstance.

The park rangers showed up and called Animal Control to transport my dog to the emergency. My dog was the victim here, and I wasn't shown any sympathy! The officer told me that I should expect what happened, to happen. How dare he? I'm supposed to expect dog owners to pull out weapons on dogs? My dog wears a choke collar; the owner of the other dog could have easily choked my dog, lie him on his side, pin him down, etc. But instead? He stabbed my dog, almost killing him.

My dog underwent surgery yesterday. His wound was 4 inches wide and 4 1/2 inches deep; a half an inch more, and it would have hit his spine, which could have resulted in paralyzing him from the shoulders down, or worst, killed him.

We always hear stories about pit bulls attacking other dogs and the media has done an amazing job exaggerating a bad rep for them. Yet, what about all the stories where wrongness is being done to the amazing breed as the pit bull. 

I was lucky. And I am so grateful to everyone who has supported my dog and I through this experience. But more thankful, to still have my pitty baby still in my life.  Sympathy from the officers of San Francisco was neglected, as well as the Park Rangers. But please believe me when I say, if this incident would have happened to another breed - I guarantee you, other measures would have taken place. I'm not trying to pull the dog breed race card here, but come on, seriously?

Never will I ever go back to Fort Funston! An innocent dog was harmed because of another man's ignorance.

AGAIN: WATCH OUT FOR AN ASIAN COUPLE. SHORT MALE AND FEMALE ABOUT 5'3 AROUND THEIR 30'S WITH 2 DOGS; A MEDIUM SIZED DOG (maybe a border collie?) AND VERY SMALL LOOKING DOG (possibly a chihuahua?). THE ASIAN MALE CARRIES AROUND A KNIFE AND IF HE EVEN DARES SEES YOUR DOG CHASING HIS, HE WON'T BE AFRAID TO USE HIS WEAPON!!
author: Natasha R.

description:
My dog Meebo asked me to write this, so I'm going to share what she has to say about the Fort; it's really more for her than me, although I enjoy the vistas and the crisp breezes and the walking never hurts.

"It's great that the Fort has all kinds of unmistakable landmarks as you ride toward it.  I'm really excited by the time we get there."

"I love all the great smells that greet me as soon as I get out of the parking lot.  This is a happening place!"

"Great social networking possibilities with friends you already know and friends you are just meeting.  One of the best Face-Butt places in the city."

"Good gopherage in a few places when I feel the need to dig.  There's never a line, but sometimes some friends will stop by to check in.  I ate one once, it was a nice place to savor some vermin."

"Best hide-and-seek spots in San Francisco.  Almost tore my eye open once running under low gnarly roots and branches, but let me tell you, it was worth it!"

"Great splashing at the beach, that is, when my lazy monkey bothers to take me down there.  Sigh."

"The walk back to the top would make me sad except for all the friends and the well-located drinking fountain."

"The experience at the Fort ends gently.  I'd like to stay longer, but it's OK.  Monkeys just have different ideas about how to live their lives.  I hope your monkey takes you to the Fort.  If not, it's okay to chew up one of his shoes."

Thanks, Meeb.
author: Bob K.

description: My favorite doggy park ever!!!! A great place to socialize your pup especially on the week days. There are a bunch of dog walkers who brings large packs of dogs who are well behaved. I have not come in contact with any ill mannered dog owners or dogs yet. The beach there is pretty clean as well. Just a heads up, the stairs back up to the parking lot are KILLERRR!!! I also do not recommend coming on windy days because gusts of sand will hit you like bullets!
author: Michelle H.

description:
The dogs are cute. Nice scenery. Crows are funny to watch in the parking lot. One kept on trying to pick up a toothbrush.

Also apparently the plant you see covering most of the dunes was introduced after the military bulldozed the area to make the fort. Then the introduced the African Ice Plant, and its invasive. They're trying to reintroduce native plants.

Cold and windy, bring a jacket.

Easy parking.
author: Audrey L.

description: Beautiful dog park! It's heaven for dogs. The walk down to the beach is easy but the return hike will get your muscles burning. I would definitely make a return visit!
author: Jessica O.

description:
We just got back from Fort Funston as our 44th or 45th dog park.  Had a great time!  It is windy but it was very pleasant (warm that day, no need for extra jackets).   There were lots of people and dogs there on a sunny weekend day.  One person had a dog was acting agressive but it was a fear based dog and did not venture away from its people far (they should have had a hold of such a dog if they were ALL just going to sit on a blanket...but, not everyone uses their heads).

Only bad part?  We parked at the most north area to park (off the highway) and the car next to us got broken into when we were gone.  My husband had a "flash" in his head on the way back of that happening....but our self preservation to have taken all valuables with us and put everything else in the trunk out of sight kept us safe.  

We do not live close to this place.....but it was nice have our 17 lb dog run off leash with the protective HUGE cliffs making it pretty safe for him to run.
author: Lesley R.

description:
This place is awesome for dogs off leash. You have a variety of areas for your dogs to run through.  They are remodeling some walk ways right now. Make sure you walk down the path and head down towards the beach. They have great kodak spots for you to take. 

Although the climb back up from the beach is a bit tough so be prepared. overall, enjoy the weather, hang gliders, and ocean. We even saw a few whales pop up.
author: Thai D.

description: Fair warning -- if you come here, it will ruin your expectations for any other off-leash areas you ever visit again.  Yes, it is that amazing ... and honestly, compared to many places I've been the dogs (and, perhaps more significantly, owners) have been exceptionally well-behaved.  I make it a point to come here at least once whenever I am in the area with my dogs, and it always makes for happy, well-exercised pups.  Bonus for me are the beautiful ocean views and a bit of entertainment watching surfers or hang gliders that also frequent this area.
author: Susan Y.

description: I LOVE this beach! My fiance and I took our frenchie here for his first beach experience and he went nuts! He ran free, met some new friends and had a blast! I got my hiking fix in, while Lando (frenchie) and Max got in their beach fix. This beach is pretty clean, very open and has very friendly and helpful patrons. We came here twice, the second time around, we ran into a Corgi meetup which was adorable! Looking forward to coming here again soon!
author: Christy L.

description:
We just got back from this park and it's totally worth the drive from Santa Clara. It's basically a dog park where the dogs roam off leash because of the sheer size of the park. We walked down the path to the beach and maybe half a mile down the sand by some boulders and back. 

My pup absolutely loved it. My wife kept saying she wanted to come back before we even left and we most likely will. 

I bet it's an even better experience when it's not 55 degrees.  =)
author: Luis N.

description:
One of the best places I've gone with my dog! Took my weim here and had him off leash the whole time. Great place for your dogs to sniff around and explore the environment. Definitely one of the best dog friendly places I've been thus far. 

Pros: 
- huge location
- amazing scenery 
- off leash compatible 
-amazing hiking routes
-water stations for your dog!
author: Ivan C.

description:
This place is amazing!

If I lived closer, I would definitely bring my dog here every week! 

The dog park/trail leads to Funston Beach and if you walk along the side of Funston Beach and keep going to the right, I believe you end up at Ocean Beach. Ocean Beach side tends to have more people so I would recommend just sticking to Funston Beach where there are less people and more animals. Waves are strong, but wouldn't hurt to allow the dogs to play in the water close to shore. 

Great to have your dog off leash. There are also secluded areas if you prefer to not be around so many dogs. However, that means more walking for you!

Another thing that I loved about this place was the fact that it was so clean! Clean enough that I barely saw any dog droppings! However, one thing that I wasn't too happy about was the fact that  down at the beach, there aren't too many trashcans so I was stuck holding my dogs poop for quite a long time. Other than that, twas' an awesome place and would love to take my dog back there sometime soon.
author: Linda C.

description:
Funston is such a great way to spend your afternoon! It's easy to find with plenty of parking. There is an area next to the parking lot where you can easily walk your dogs around a trail, or, if you are looking to enjoy some beach time - head to the left and down the steps/cliff onto the beach, unfortunately, theres no easy way to climb back up. 

Theres lots of dogs, but unfortunately, I have found a lot of dog owners bring their pooches who aren't always the most dog-friendly and let them run around off-leash. I had a scoop up my dog a handful of times from other people's snarling dogs. If your dog isn't great with other dogs - please don't take them to off-leash parks!!!
author: Kate D.

description: We walked down to the beach and it was worth the walk. The trail leading down was well made and easy to go down, not as easy going up if your out of shape!  Flew a kite on the beach and the hang gliders above were well out of the way of my kite. Once decided to buzz my kite about 100 feet from the kite. I think he was jealous that I was doing loops. Love the history behind this spot! So glad it's public space and not full of houses on a cliff.
author: Chris S.

description: Always a good time at fort funston!! Love coming here with my family!! Just be ready to walk, its a lot of cardio!!!  but worth it!!! Also such a fun place to take your dog, meet other dogs and roam around free!!
author: Angelina P.

description: Doggy island ! Live near by and there's a dog community here.  People are usually very friendly . Many different breeds of dogs ! Me and my wife try to come every month with our lovely Darwin ! There's a beach that he loves to swim in it . Recommended for all friendly dogs!
author: d n.

description:
Difficult to find beaches like this in SoCal. Sand dunes everywhere with great cliff views . Some days you'll see people on gliders and across the 35 is lake meritt with the occasional team of speed rowers. Great place for a long run around. 

Dog owners paradise. Beware there are tons of dogs off leash, most of them are well behaved, but you never know...

I usually park on the side of the road past Fort Funston Rd going down the 35.
author: Michael S.

description:
Fort Funston is doggie beach paradise! I don't think I've ever seen our pup happier. Mila has endless amounts of energy and this place is the only place with endless opportunities to burn it all off. She loves exploring the wilderness, rolling around in the sand, chasing the waves, romping around with other pups. I'm always amazed by how well behaved all the dogs are off leash. And while Mila is running around, we humans get to soak in the amazing ocean views, feel the sea breeze on our skin, and walk peacefully along the sandy beach. It really doesn't get better than this!

A few tips for newbies:
-Come early. The parking lot gets pretty full the closer you get to noon so come early to avoid the crowds.
-Picnicking. If you're thinking about picnicking, only do so if its warm and be careful of doggie visitors who'll want a bite of your food.
-Wear layers. It gets foggy & cold in this part of SF so its always a good idea to wear layers to stay warm.
-Bring towels. Your dog will get wet and dirty, towels help minimize how much of it gets in your car.
-Schedule a bath afterwards. Our dog is white, but after Fort Funston she's brown. ;) So we usually go to Fort Funston right before we're supposed to give her a bath anyway.

Have fun! :)
author: Connie C.

description:
We took our frenchie, Ninja, here to have some fun at the beach and that he did!! I felt like he was at Doggy Disney -- the happiest place on earth...for dogs!! Fort Funston was full of dogs and to my surprise, almost all the dogs were off leash and very well behaved. We stayed for a few hours and would gladly come back again for another beach day. The water was pretty cold, but still enjoyable to play and walk around on the shores. The views were beautiful and more than amazing. The weather couldn't be any more perfect for January. It was sunny, 64 degrees with minimal wind. Now I have a tired pup which equals a happy pup. I love California and I love San Francisco!!

I highly recommend bringing your dog(s) as long as they are friendly to both dogs and humans.
author: Cindy T.

description:
Want to see the face of pure joy? Bring your dog here! 

You can smell the sea, watch the sun set and get a good workout from climbing back up the trail that goes to the beach! Not to mention how happy you would make your dog by taking them here. 

Piece of advice; beware of untrained toy/small dogs. People think it's cute when they bark and try to attack other dogs, that's why they rarely correct the behaviour. But when they provoke your 60lbs shepherd, all of a sudden it's your fault for having a big dog that is just trying to protect itself. So please, if your dogs don't know how to play friendly or is just full on picking fights with every other dog in the park, leash him/her for the good of every other dog and their owners. When you come to this park, you can see that the breeds that have the WORST reputation are actually the ones that are most well-behaved. And the walking mop breeds are usually the one with no manners. 

Though I rarely see any of them at the park, I think people who gets mad when a dog tries to interact with them is a little bit mad. It's a dog park, what do you expect?! I'm not talking about a misbehaving dog that jumps on strangers, I'm talking about dogs that just want to say hi and brush by.
author: Muhammad H.

description:
Perfect for any dog lover or dog period! This is what I would call doggy heaven. The  best destination for dogs to run wild and free with other dogs and to watch hang gliders fly overhead. 
Ideal for runners and dog walkers. The water here is warmer than most beaches in NorCal, so feel free to dip your feeties into the water and walk in the soft sand.
author: Danh N.

description:
As I was driving to the park I was starting to think I'd make it a very short visit.  Driving through the gloomiest part of San Francisco ( the avenues) and seeing temperatures drop from 104 in the east bay, to the 70s half way there, to a low of 55 seemed like it was going to be miserable.

To great delight Funston Park / beach was a hidden treasure!  Open sand duns, majestic walking paths, and beaches with responsible dog owners open to play on.

My dog's not great and coming back all the time when I call her.  I was lucky to find a nice cove at the end for us to play off leash and not bother others.  There was only two pair of pit bulls I saw playing a little rough so I stayed clear of them.  Other than that it was a great beach to hang out on.

Definitely will be going back not only to escape the east bay heat, but more importantly to have fun, open, safe play time with our dog.
author: S A.

description:
Live and learn.

Took my pup here for the first time during the weekend and she was attacked. 
Not just rough play, the other dog bit her and tossed her around (my pup is mid size 25lbs). The owner immediately try to make like it was my pup's fault. 

NOTE: my pup has played with many large dogs and played rough with no problem. 
she knows how to submit etc. But this dog bit hard and drew blood (+ the tossing was not a good sign). Based on the owner's behavior - I suspect this is not the first time. [An adult dog knows how to discipline a puppy - but this dog was out to get blood] 

Anyhow, have been told since by many dog owners - avoid the weekends - as there are a few 'well known' irresponsible dogs owners there.

Otherwise, a great place for dogs. As usual, the few spoil it for the rest.
author: Robert Y.

description: Spectacular views and fun place to introduce your feet to the Pacific. Lots of dogs but so much space they don't hassle you. Bring sandals, the walk down and up is basically on sandy hills and shoes make it harder.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I've been here twice, but first time taking our dog. And first time going down the steps and into the beach. WOW. I mean, just WOW. 

This is the reason I moved to San Francisco.. the utter beauty of nature. And my old dog seemed like a puppy again.. she ran and ran and ran.. she really really loved it as well! While we were there, we saw horse riders on the cliff and and on the beach. Very cool imagery. It was a little bit windy, not sure this place is ideal for just laying on the beach. But it is perfect for walking and exploring. It is just beautiful. WOW.
author: Vol T.

description:
Great place to take a long walk and enjoy the awesome view!

And dogs round around freely!  Yay!
author: Pam S.

description:
This place is awesome! I'm only disappointed I just recently discovered it.

In 4+ years of SF living, I'd never bothered to drive 10 min down the Great Highway to Fort Funston - and I was totally missing out! There's a pretty large parking lot (free) at the top of the bluff. From there, you walk down a long stairway to the beach (it's almost more like a sand slide). Once on the beach, it can get crowded where the stairs let out, but walk 10 min in either direction and you might be the only one around! We walked south along the beach for two miles and only passed a few people the entire way - a fisherman, a woman on a horse, and a few surfers. 

For November the beach was warm - although obviously the water is still frigid. I'm not sure, but I think there might be less wind here than at Ocean Beach.

One thing to note is that this place is popular with dogs, so if you have a fear of canines, probably not the spot for you.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Loved bringing my dog here for the afternoon!  For the most part, I felt like most people did a good job of watching their off-leash dogs. My little papillon loved digging up crabs and chasing the water on the beach.  The views were remarkable too!
author: Melly G.

description:
If the marine layer has blanketed Ocean Beach, there's probably a steady onshore breeze for the hang gliders, whom you can see jumping off the cliff here at Fort Funston. 

I've only walked a little of it, but there are hundreds of acres of dog-friendly trails, dunes, cliffs and beach to be explored. Tip: layer up and don't forget the Gore-tex. Seriously, if your hands get cold, there's no shame in bringing a pair of gloves too.
author: John H.

description: YOUR BEST FRIEND WILL LOVE IT HERE. I have been bringing my dogs here, my dogs have the best time here, it is by far THE BEST doggie beach ever, not only is there an amazing beach there also are beautiful trails, water fountains around every corner for the pups. The only thing you need to be aware of is being your own doggie bags because they don't provide any. Excellent place.
author: Anthony R.

description:
This place is dog heaven, and not bad for the owners either. On a clear, nice day it is really beautiful. There are the trails and sand dunes near the parking lot, where you have views of the Ocean, Lake Merced, the SF/Daly City hills and even the Golden Gate in the distance. My dogs usually poop themselves out before we can get down to the beach, but it still makes for a great walk in the park. 

And you can't complain when you have two tired yet happy dogs for the rest of the day either!
author: Elyse N.

description:
I absolutely love this park. Whether or not you have a dog, this place is paradise (especially on a beautiful day!).

I used to come here even when I didn't have a dog and it was just so relaxing walking around the whole park and alongside the ocean. Now that I have a dog, a golden retriever named Pumpkin, I come here whenever there's that rare beautiful sunny day in San Francisco. 

Fort Funston is considered to be a pretty clean and safe dog park. I love that the area is huge and that there are plenty of other dogs so that Pumpkin can get some play time. Most of the time I just stay on the road but sometimes I'll bring Pumpkin down to the beach. So far I haven't seen any dog poop left unattended and there are always garbage cans here and there for you to throw away your dog's business. There are also water bowls for your furry animal to drink from when they get thirsty after all the running around.

Most dogs are off leash but if you're hesitant about how your dog is off leash or how it would interact with other dogs, it's best to keep them close to you just in case. 

I've had an incident where a bigger dog tried to fight with mine once but the owner immediately whistled him away. There's always going to be a risk with animals so just be sure to do all your safety precautions beforehand (recall, shots are updated, insurance, etc). 

Long story short, Fort Funston is not only a beautiful and fun place to bring your dog, but it's also a park where you, yourself, can enjoy.
author: Judith L.

description: Best off leash dog park ANYWHERE.  I love bringing my dogs to Fort Funston because it overlooks the beach below and there is no better place to enjoy the sunset.  Dress warm, though, as it's cold 90% of the time. Being a dog lover is a must here as it IS an off-leash dog park. (I can't stand it when people come here and scowl when a dog sniffs them).  Almost everyone is very responsible and they clean up after their dogs.
author: Alice L.

description:
As we all know "All Dogs Go to Heaven" but before they get there as a responsible pet owner you should take your dog to Fort Funston.  This place is a Heaven on earth for your furry friend.  My Rottweiler Princess Fiona the Ogre was so happy here and yes, she hates water.  Yes we both side stepped the waves as they rolled in but we both RAN full speed up and down the sandy beach.  She nibbled on various seaweed snacks and stole a few balls and Frisbees too.  I am so happy I finally made the trip after hearing all the hype.  The Princess was so pooped after her romp here on the beach she slept all the way home - to the South Bay.  It was worth the 2 hours getting there and the 45 minute drive home. 

I am not giving it 5 stars because I had a helluva time finding this place without a direct address to plug into my GPS.  I ended up stopping and asking a few dog owners I saw walking their dogs in the neighborhood where the doggy beach was and how do I find the "sign" that all Yelpers said is visible.
author: Whinde D.

description:
AWESOME! I took my dogs here today and on a sunny day, this place is just awesome! The beach's black sand and off leash... this makes the park super family and dog friendly.

Come early as parking is usually busy. Layer if it's cloudy.
author: Eva Y.

description: Really beautiful place to take your dog out. My gf and I always take our husky there when we can.
author: Christian S.

description:
Freakin' heaven on Earth for dogs (and their peeps, too)!  I want to be my dog at fabulous Fort Funston. Dogs have voted it their favorite spot 10 years straight in the annual SF Dog Weekly magazine poll.

Basically, I'm a lazy slob so I avoid going down the steep trail to the beach. Id need a sherpa to get there and back. I like to take our dogs on the trails that make a stop at the beverage club to watch them belly up to the dog bar and get dog sloppy drunk. It's like a comedy show out here!
author: Ottis M.

description:
What:
Philip Burton Beach
Hiking Trails
Battery Davis
Scenic lookout of Thornton Beach, Lake Merced
Mussel Rock (point where San Andreas Fault cuts into the Pacific Ocean)
Hang Gliding
Sandy Bluffs
Horseback Riding

More Info:
Free parking and free admission
Bring your dog; it is a very dog-friendly park
Restrooms at trailhead

Sunset Trail - Coastal Trail - Horse Trail

Length: ~2.5 miles; Time: 2 hours; Difficulty: Easy

After an hour's drive from San Jose, we reached Fort Funston National Park and parked the car at the main entrance. The parking lot is huge, so one would almost always immediately find a parking spot.

At one end of the parking lot, there is an observation deck from where we caught a beautiful sight of the Philip Burton beach in front of us, Thornton beach to the left, Mussel Rock to the far left and San Francisco coast to the right stretching as far as the eye could see.

The North American and Pacific plates of the earth's crust collide off the Fort Funston coast forming the San Andreas Fault, which has cleaved mountains and volcanoes. The Mussel Rock to the far left is the place where the San Andreas Fault leaves the land and runs into the ocean.

We started our hike on the Sunset Trail along the coast that took us through the featured sand dunes. Soon we reached Battery Davis that was constructed in 1936 to hold two 16-inch guns to protect the Pacific Coast during wartime.
