As we continued onto the Sunset Trail, we took the detour to the beach access. It was fun watching the dogs having a blast in the wave friendly beach. It did get me into some serious thinking about raising a dog!

The Sunset Trail connected with the Coastal Trail, which soon connected with the Horse Trail running parallel to the Coastal Trail. From the Horse Trail, which looked secluded and well-shaded, one can see the busy Skyline Boulevard and Lake Merced next to it. Soon, the trail took us directly to the main parking lot. The hike did satiate our wish to go on a mild hike to see some beautiful views.
author: Anu M.

description: Took my dog here for a walk the other day. Great place for a hike. Also very historic as you can visit the bunkers and also have great views. You can also watch the hangliders taking off from here
author: Nick M.

description: I absolutely LOVE Fort Funston & my beloved Labrador loves this place too! Like everyone says, this is literally dog heaven as you can let your dog free & run around wherever they desire! Your furry friend can play with other dogs or you can go on adventures with just you & your dog as there is an abundance of space. There are so many things to do with your dog here. You may explore the woods which reminds me of a little forest. You can also run them up & down the high sand hills. You can simply take them on a walk down the trail. OHH & the best part, you can get your doggy all wet in the beach! So fun & the activities are endless! Fort Funston is literally everything you can ask for in a great dog park. The view is stunning & relaxing as well. Fort Funston is definitely the place to treat your best friend to & get them exercised as they have a blast!
author: Jenny P.

description:
We were those creepy girls that came to the park and DIDN'T have dogs, only to creep on and pet other people's dogs. lol. 

There are soo many cute dogs roaming this place! My friends and I came with the intention of hiking but the cute dogs and the beautiful beach were way too distracting. We parked outside along the road, but we recommend instead to park inside the big lot - it's closer to the beach and the trails.

Getting in and out of this place requires climbing up pretty steep and SANDY trails. Super sandy, like by the end I had mounds of sand in my shoes. So just a heads up that it can be a little slippery climbing up/down sand trails. 

The views of Ocean Beach from checking out all the hidden areas of this place are gorgeous! I recommend this place less for hiking, and more so for hanging out, exploring and strolling, enjoying nature, and most importantly, seeing and petting cute dogs!
author: Monica B.

description: This is an absolutely awesome place to take dogs!!!! There are dogs everywhere of every size and shape and they love to romp in the sand dunes and down on the beach in and out of the water. This was our first time there and we will definitely be back!!! Such a great resource for pet parents!
author: Melissa W.

description:
This is my dogs favorite place to go since they have a great place to run around, the beach, sand, and other dogs to interact with!

A lot of cool pet owners to interact with and dogs with personality. I'm sure there are a few people who do not know how to watch over their dogs that make this place uninteresting to others but hey, what place doesn't?

Fort Funston is a community for all. Enjoy the nice views and the fresh air.
author: Cuazzy N.

description:
One of my absolute favorite places in San Francisco. There are two entrances, both with parking. One takes you directly to the top level, the other is from Lake Merced and involves a short, sandy hike up log steps followed by about five to ten minutes of trails (depending on your route) before you reach the top level. There are dogs everywhere, and it's paradise for anyone else who loves them. You will see labradors, beagles, chihuahuas, yorkies, poodles, huge lion-like mutts, everything! 

There are trees everywhere and a good mix of sandy paths and concrete paths that are very comfortable before you reach the top level. At the top level, you'll find sprawling sand dunes stretching out before a beautiful view of endless ocean. On a good day, you'll have warm sun and nice breeze, blooming flowers, and hang gliders swooping and tumbling through the sky. 

After you follow the path along the sand dunes, you'll eventually reach a kind of wooden look out platform. There you can look down on the beach and watch the waves and people with their dogs and families or look up to see the ocean and hang gliders. You can even watch hang gliders launch themselves off the side of the hill into the air. 

For all the history junkies, you can wander around the dunes and explore the old military stations embedded in the cliffside. These landmarks were meant for triangulating incoming enemy ships and have lots of really cool information. You can climb on them and imagine what it was like to live in them. :)

I really recommend coming here to relax and clear your mind and just enjoy everything that's beautiful around you. Remember to slow down though! If you move quickly, there won't seem to be much more than dogs and sand, but if you take your time and just breathe it all in, Fort Funston is really lovely.
author: Grace T.

description:
I'm always amazed when people review beautiful, natural parks and have the audacity to assign anything fewer than 5 stars.

What's to complain about...? The ocean? Perhaps the beautiful stretches of beach, or the flourishing foliage. What, you don't like the hordes of happy dogs? Fort Funston National Park is gorgeous. It's a reminder that SF is right on the ocean, despite the cool, foggy days. The ripples on the sand dunes mimic the ocean, and it's hard not to want to roll down them like a 10 year old (which I actually witnessed in action). Don't come here if you don't want a wayward dog to lick your hand or sniff your... knee. Everyone's really friendly, people and animals alike!

The pathways wend and wind in a big loop with offshoots leading to the beach. Joggers, walkers and runners alike (and the occasional Goth couple in spiked black heels) make good use of the trails. My only warning: beware of windy days, as the sand in your eyes might obstruct your ocean views.
author: Ray J.

description:
FUN FOR DOGS AND HUMANS!

I came here to walk my cousin's dog. There's dogs everywhereeeeeee and I love it! People mostly have their dogs off leash here but there's definitely no problems. If their dogs start harassing you or your dog, then they make them stop, unlike some other places. It's just a nice place for some exercise and scenery.
author: Kathy V.

description: Great mini hike with my dog! He enjoyed being outdoors and seeing so many other dogs. At first he was scared to go near the water, but after we carried him to stand in the water, he realized it was nothing so he loved it. Going up the stairs was easier than coming down for him. Definitely want to return on a nice day! Lots of parking, but it fills up quick.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I feel like maybe if I had a dog or something that it could be a 5 stars.

For some reason, I expected long hiking trails, but there was just a a few short ones that you can walk (unless there was longer ones I didn't know about) but I felt that I pretty much walked through everything. 

What's cool is that you can be in a forest-y area to next to a lake to a top a hill to be right on the beach. It's a very diverse place to walk around. Yes, there a dogs all around and of course they are super cute!

Overall, I think it's a nice place to walk around, but I wasn't super impressed. It gets super windy and sand will blow in your eyes and the beach isn't one that you'd want to swim in. On the plus side, it does have a ton of parking and it's a cute place to doggy-watch.
author: Sophia Y.

description: The view is amazing!  A real playground for dogs.  Becareful pulling into the parking lot dogs may be off leash.
author: Kieu T.

description:
A great place for kids, dogs, walks and views.   The best thing?  You don't need to own a dog since there are some many friendly owners and dogs who are happy to greet and play.  The nice dog owners clean up after their dogs too!

Great for walking in the coastal fog,  Even better since the sun comes out quite often to give you some really great views.

Parting is free in a few  locations in the park and along the Skyline Blvd.

Also a great place to do some gliding or learn from the local instructors teaching the sport.

Overall Fort Funston is a 100% win.
author: Chris R.

description:
Dogs galore! Amazing place to stroll around and hang out with your dog(s) leash-free. I like that all the dogs are very friendly/not aggressive here. Beautiful views, but ugly/icky beach. A little water fountain with dog water bowls (my dog was too much of a princess to drink out of it) Overall, I really enjoyed walking around here and enjoying everything from the forest/tree/nature area to the cliffs overlooking the beach with hang gliders in the sky. Cold and gloomy like typical SF, but a lot of fun. Pretty sure my dog was on a happy high afterwards-- she deserved it.... but it was nice for me and my sisters too.

Fyi- there are only porta potties that smell absolutely disgusting. I would recommend using the restroom before or not drinking so much liquids.
author: Nina K.

description:
The most awesome place in the world!

There are water bowls placed throughout the park for the doggies, some good land hikes, and a sweet beach to play along.

I think that the happiest days of my dog's life have been spent at Fort Funston. 

It makes me all warm inside just writing this and thinking of him running in the sand along the beach =).
author: Jennifer T.

description: "Fort Fun", we call it.  My dog lives for this place.  He has many friends here (more friends than most people have, I'd venture.)  And I've met several wonderful dog owners who share their experiences and insights.  Visiting Fort Fun on a regular basis has immensely enhanced my dog's life, and mine.
author: Ernest F.

description:
Go here NOW! I was there on Saturday and the wildflowers along the coastal bluffs were abundant and beautiful. Then KEEP COMING BACK! There is something to love any time of year at Fort Funston. I've hiked the trails down to the beach, hiked through coastal scrub and walked up top near the Battery and top of bluffs (don't go too close to the edge though.)
In addition to the amazing views of the coast, bluffs and unbeatable city views, watching the hangliders is unbelievably serene and a sight to see. They'll even wave to you, so wave back :)
I've been here in the fog when the cliffs and sand take on an otherwordly look and feel and I've been here in the full sunshine when you can see Sutro Tower, Mt. Davidson, The Outer Sunset and beyond. 
Dogs, dogs, dogs galore-which is fine by me-I don't own one but am a lifelong animal lover. 
Lots to do and see with an overall friendly vibe
Truly an SF Gem for locals and non-city dwellers! Take your out of town visitors here for a different type of city view.
author: Jennifer N.

description: This is the spot where on lookers can mingle with USHGA (United States Hang Gliding Association) pre and post flight while they fuss with stowing their expensive kites. Most are very giving in sharing their sport with onlookers. And below the ridge they so covet is the expanse of beach along the mighty pacific so there is plenty of space to jog in the sand. There are also cool sand formations along the ridge  person may seek shelter from Alous God of wind. The USHGA keeps stickers on the helmets to signify flying compidence and the name of the game here is ridge soaring. The constant, dependable wind flow from the Pacific ocean create near perfect lift pilots all enjoy. We are Blessed to have this event here and equally Blessed by the generosity of Francis Regallo's wife who released her husbands original designs for a space capsule recovery kite that was brilliant but never developed. Good old Nasa,
author: Steve B.

description:
Such a perfect place to let your pup off leash and be free!!!

There are many trails you can take and even a beach the dogs can run up and down on! There is also a beautiful overlook where you can take in views of the beach! If you are a doggie parent, this place is one of the BEST places you can let your dog be a dog!
author: Vanessa P.

description: Perfect place to walk your dog off-leash! I would give it 6 stars if the option was available :) You'll always see a variety of breeds and your dog will have plenty of places to explore and have fun! LOVE this place!
author: Tam A.

description:
I was a bit worried as every time my pug has escaped her leash, it's very difficult to get her back.  Was she going to run away from us?  What if we couldn't find her?  These types of questions raced in our heads.  We came on a Saturday afternoon where it was a bit chilly.  There are portable toilets as you enter into the trail.

After about 100 yards, we let Mushu run free.  And did she have the time of her life!  She ran up to many dogs excited to play and run.  She did come back when called.  During the times she wouldn't follow us, we called her with treats.  We didn't go to the beach as we had our little one with us.  We spent about 2 hours hiking the trails.  All of the other dogs and their owners were friendly and responsible.  There are drinking bowls for the dogs.  

I only wish we lived closer to SF.  It's about an hour drive for us, but we will be back once the weather warms up.  Mushu snored loudly on the way home and was tired for a few days.  Worth every minute!
author: Albert L.

description:
What a perfect lovely place. You simply cannot be in a bad mood at this place. How can you with the endless adorable dogs running up to you?

I had the pleasure of coming here twice during my visit in SF. I went on a Friday morning which was much more casual, and got down to the beach area for a relatively peaceful stroll with the little munchkin. Beautiful calm views! Also came on a Saturday afternoon and it was very busy and saw a lot of daring hand gliders doing their thang! 

The trails are relatively easy, but prepare for a bit of a trek up sand hills when you go up and down to the waters.
author: Rachel T.

description:
If your a dog lover bring your dog here.

Nice trails.
Lots of friendly dogs.
Nice view
High cliffs
You can feel comfortable leaving your dog off leash.
Other people who come here are seem pretty good about keeping an eye on their dog.
author: T C.

description:
FF is like Disneyland for dogs. I love coming here on weekends for some fresh ocean air, rolling hills and sand dunes, and the look of pure unadulterated joy on my dumb dog's face as we approach the parking lot. 

Also, I hate to say this because in general, I really like people, but...SF dog owners can be a little neurotic. My pooch is a goofball and likes to wrestle, but he's not vicious. Nevertheless, I've had people yell at me and cuss my dog out at small parks in the City, because my playful pup wanted to alpha roll their little show dog. This would never happen at Fort Funston. 

People are friendly, chill, and understand that dogs love to romp and play and get dirty and roll around. And if things get overly passionate, we responsibly redirect our dogs, rather than freak out and cause a scene. Fort Funston is my favorite place to take my dog in the entire Bay Area.
author: Laura P.

description:
This place is one of the gems of SF. 

I love how there is a place where my dogs, who are like my children can go and explore and have fun. Most of the people that go to Funston are just like us...we want to have quality family time without the hoop-la of people getting mad at us for having a dog off the leash. 

For the most part, the beach and hiking trails are clean. I think a lot of responsible dog owners understand how precious something like this is in the neighborhood and make a point to clean up after themselves. 

Most of the dogs and people I've ran into have been super sweet and friendly. my dogs always have a blast when we go.
author: Teresa B.

description:
"Off leash walking heaven", "Good two hours walking"

 If you know me personally, and want to go here with your pooch, you MUST contact me. I wanna go with you..

- Sand alert! Bring those sunglasses
- Wind alert! Bring those extra layers. You will miss them
- Portable toilets available, but nowhere to wash yourself.
author: Hyunyoung S.

description:
This place is beautiful with ocean views, clean ocean air and rolling hills, just on the southern edge of San Francisco's coast. I have been coming here for decades, and the parking (free)  has always been a problem, so I wont be harsh about that, and neither should you - just plan a bit of extra time. People and dogs stay an average of 2 hours, so parking turnover is high.  
There is every kind of dog here, and every kind of person. Some (people and dogs) are out for a stroll, want to sit on a bench, just want to watch/walk, some want to run or bike or head to their favorite spot. The dogs all wear big smiles and most of the people too. Bring water for human drinking, the dogs have a multi-dish water gathering spot on the trail. Leash your roaming dogs until you get on the trail, muzzle your biting dogs, put on your tennis shoes and get out there. 
You can also go down to the beach and watch the hang gliders soar from the bluffs. It is magic.  And a request: PLEASE stay OFF the ice plant on the edge of the coast -- it is there to Stop erosion of the cliff edge and path. The sandy soil is loose and slipping away. Let it grow, don't trample it. Stay on the path, and have a GREAT off-leash run or walk.
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
Wow! Why have I only just discovered this place?!?! If you own a dog, you must bring him or her here! I bought my dog here and he had a smile on his face the entire time!

There is a water fountain for drinking, long stretches of beach to run on, and a small hiking trail above the beach. It is magical. My dog got to run around and play with other dogs. 

I especially love that it is an off-leash site so my dog can run back and forth without tangling me up.
author: E C.

description: Such a great place to come on the weekend and bring your fur babies! It was a nice and sunny summer day, not a cloud in the sky. The weather was perfect. There is plenty of parking. We found a parking spot along the side of the road but if you drive a little further down you'll find a huge lot where you can park, I'm not too sure if you have to pay to park there. There are plenty of hills as well as a beach that lets your dogs run around off leash. I would bring water for you and the dogs because I didn't see any water fountains for dogs. You'll definitely get in a good leg workout and some light cardio.
author: Amy Q.

description:
I don't even have a dog but I thought this park was incredible in every possible way. I went along with a friend not so long ago with his pooch Oliver. Boy if I ever get a chance to get canine friend I want him or her to be as awesome as Oliver is. 

Fort Funston is breathtaking and stretches endlessly.  It is pure doggy heaven. Your dog can be off collar and free to roam, climb, and sniff as many other canine behinds as he or she pleases.

I loved the sand in the front of the park. The giant Ravens kind of freaked me out though. It was fun watching this Rottweiler try to attack it though. My favorite part of the park was a secret path my friend showed me, a small climb but it lead to a a view of the beach. Just sitting there and taking in the air and scenery was so serene. 

Although I do not have a dog, I recommend this park to any dog owner. It is a bit of a drive but definitely worth the trip. I am even considering coming back just hike and walk around. The dog owners there are real friendly too!
author: Wen C.

description: Funston beach is an amazing place. I don't even have a dog, but it is a doggie paradise. I went with my 5 year old daughter, and she loved seeing all the dogs running around. When you park, the beach is a 0.7 mile walk according to the signs. It's a paved road or you can go off on the side paths which are sand. We only took the path to the beach but there are other trails as well. The only part that may come as a challenge to some is the steep steps or steep hill down to the beach. My five year old was able to do the steep hill, so it isn't that hard, but it's something to be aware of. It's such a beautiful spot, and I can't wait to go back!
author: Tina A.

description: This place is great. It makes me want to go out and get a dog just to bring it here to have the time if it's life.
author: Mialee I.

description: Its a great beach but godammn~! That climb back up the sand stairs is punishing..better be pretty fit or take lots of breaks...
author: Neoracer X.

description: I had seen a few of my fellow Yelpers check in here, sparked my curiosity and decided I had to go on my next day off....would have brought my dog but wanted to see how it was first....my doggie is a little "special"
author: Prince P.

description:
Compared with Pine Lake Park (in Stern Grove), this is not as easy for a dog to play with other dogs and run around.  

There are 2 levels: cliffs (be careful, easy to slip off when near) and beach.

The Southern (most popular) path to the beach is very steep and sand is blowing everywhere.  Very likely to get sand in eyes -- I couldn't make it all the way down because I wear contacts and the sand was too painful.  My wife has glasses and even got sand in her eyes.

Otherwise, a very beautiful park, with friendly people.  My puppy was however almost attacked by an adult dog, thank goodness we were right there and quickly pulled him back.
author: George K.

description:
Five stars for dog lovers! Ive been looking for a place to take my dog out to play "Off leash" near the city and this is the best so far. Lots of fun trails (Paved and Sand) to play on and the best part of all is the beach that my dog and many other dogs loved to romp around on. Very clean and a handful of watering stations for both humans and dogs. very beautiful views of the coast and if you are lucky you might catch the hang gliders. I will gladly make the drive any day! 

In my eyes this place is a huge dog park and I love it!
author: Veda H.

description:
This is an incredible dog beach.  Tons of dogs for your pup to play with, off leash, clean beach.  Lots of drinking fountains up on the cliff.

This place is full of dog lovers which means everyone here is friendly!

It can be a little intimidating entering the parking lot, there isn't an obvious path to the beach.  If you're standing in the parking lot looking towards the ocean, you can go right or left.  To the left is a staircase going 50 feet down.  To the right is a lengthy path that will get you to the beach.  I like to go right, take the path, walk the beach, then come up those stairs.  The views on the path are of the city, the view from the stairs is of the ocean.

Fort Funston is also a hang gliding spot (not mentioned by 90% of the reviews).  These crazy guys jump off the cliff with their little kites so if you get tired of looking at the beautiful ocean you can look up and watch them.  My dad flies here, he says it's great.
author: Brooke R.

description:
My church. My heaven. My happy place. My two dogs love this spot, so we made it part of our daily routine and, 4 years later for my Labrador and 1 year later for my Doodle, we're still out there every single morning. Big open spaces. Breathtaking views. Soft sand for top speed fetch. We love love love it. I've made so many awesome friends and acquaintances from this place. My dogs have also made many new furry friends who they love to run into. It's a great space and a great community. Many of the morning dog walkers are special, kind people and soooo friendly. There's a lot of dog-talk and I always learn something new at the "water hole" when I run into a new breed or a sweet hearted furry friend. The beach is a great space for running and water frolicking. 

Word to the wise--- I avoid weekends after 9am. It's very busy and many people bring their usually not-off-leash dogs here. It's crazy time and we don't enjoy the madness. I also generally avoid hot afternoons (again, people think it will be nice to take their dog off leash when they don't normally go off leash ever). I stick with super early mornings and it rocks :)
author: AnneMarie H.

description: Forget about the Stairs at Communication Hill, I felt that burn just walking down the sand stairs to the beach. The view is just amazing and you can come with your dog, since it is a unleashed dog beach. One thing I did not like was the fact that the water was so freezing cold that when the water came in and touch my feet...man was it painfully cold. Almost paralyzing cold..but after a while of that pain your feet are just numb but it's pretty cool to just walk on the beach with your dog. So when I was trying to walk back up the sand stairs to the car, man oh man did it burn so bad. I had to stop a few times just to take a breath, it was that tirering.  But that view you get, it's pretty cool. This place is also for hang gliders, you get to see them jump off a cliff and glide through the sky overlooking the beach...must feel amazing up there.
author: An N.

description: We bring our puppy here once every two weeks. It's a great way for her to get some sun and really tire her out for the rest of the day. It's great seeing all the dogs off leash with their owners. Come early on the weekends as parking gets filled quickly. However we have never had trouble finding parking - people always coming and leaving at the same time during peak hours
author: Anita L.

description: It is dog heaven here. Also hanggliding heaven. A nice chill spot. I always come here for a hike. It is very relaxing and less crowded compared to ocean beach. Also cleaner.
author: Pam Y.

description: Disneyland for dogs. My pup gets so excited before we even turn into the parking lot. We come here a few times a week and my pup always leaves exhausted! There are some dog owners who really think they can go there without their dog getting it's butt sniffed and gets upset. But, ignore them and enjoy the beauty!
author: Cidney T.

description: Best place on earth for humans and dogs alike.  Cool, fresh salty air, sand, and beach for our best friend to gallop on.  Can't possibly get better than this!
author: Diana L.

description: Went in the middle of the day, paragliders everywhere, beautiful scene to watch! Ventured around for a hike and to the beach..literally noone everywhere, beautiful sand dollars washed up on the beach.
author: Samantha G.

description: This beach is absolutely breath-taking! This beach welcomes everyone even if you have two legs or four. There is plenty of spaces to park along the parking lot. They also have available plastic bags to pick up your doggy poo. Dog owners here are pretty responsible which is why this beach is so clean! Me and my four legged best friend had a fabulous time here and will be coming back soon.
author: Anne P.

description:
I Hike here on a regular basis to get my dog fix (don't currently have a  dog). It's a special place. Dog Heaven!  
Be sure to check out the antics of the Ravens - Clowns of the sky! Those birds enjoy life and show the hang gliders how to REALLY fly! The Hawks and Snowy Plovers are cool too.
While I would prefer to hear the natural sounds, I often use my Ipod to drown out dog owners and walkers calling their dogs over and over to no avail. 
Hint...if your dog doesn't respond after the second call, it's not listening, and you don't have voice control. Try something else, like dog (owner) training, or a leash!
Other than that, Funston can't be beat!
author: Bill D.

description:
I love, love, loooooooooove Ft Funston.  Of course, my dog loves it - but for me its the perfect way to start the day.

Even when it rains like crazy, I just slip into my super-sexy rain boots and go for a walk.

There is water for the dogs, but they always get thirsty by the farthest bench, so think about bringing some for your dog.

The beach is great, there are at least 2 ways to get down to it, one sand staircase near the hang-gliders and the other near the turn-around in the park.

There is a great website flyfunston.org, that will tell you the up to the minute weather conditions out there.  There is also a hand dandy tide chart so you know whether you need to bring extra towels for your pup.

The only problem is - GGNRA wants to make this all on-leash effectively ending the "recreation" part of the area.  Get informed!  eco-dog.org
author: Heather C.

description:
5 stars park.  Negative stars dipshit dog walkers.

Unless you're a dog owner, you're probably not going to like walking here.  If you have only one small to medium dog that can't defend itself and you, you may really not enjoy it. The place is teeming with large off-leash dogs galloping around, looking like they'd like to sink their teeth into something (like you or Fido!), not to mention overloaded novice dogwalkers trying to  sheepherd mobs of hyper dogs.  Oh, and how about the doo doo from all the walkers who don't bother picking up after their pets...oh so nice!

Such a shame.  In a more civilized era, I suppose people used to take peaceful walks admiring the beauty of the place.  With Thornton Beach trails no longer open, this is the next logical spot for walks and views but unless you have a pit bull or anti-dog device, you're kind of in danger because the owners don't do much to control their dogs - many unattended dogs beelined over to me from nowheres as I tried to walk.  I don't think the self-centered owners are going to be too cut up when their precious take a chomp out of one of the humans or dogs it encounters.  I saw one erstwhile jogger run down a path and into a pack of dogs that jumped on her undeterred by the dogwalker.  Eeks!

I'm thinking the city should charge per dog for the privilege of spoiling a national park.  Raise some money from this lunacy!
author: Femita J.

description: One of the best places my dogs and I have visited. We got there around 11 and I have not seen them this happy in a while, they run down the mountain and started having a blast. The dog owners were super cool about other dogs playing a little rougher with their dogs, no one panicked and everyone got along. I did find a lost dog under my car with no name tag and that was sad, I don't get why people are ok with their dogs getting lost and not having a way to get them back home. We had to leave so we left it with another nice person who was staying longer. Other than that we had a terrific experience!
author: Vania P.

description: Day of fun with my roomies!!!  Super jealous I don't have my ugly puppy Chanel in the bay.  She would've loved doggy disneyland.  It's so fun to hike here!!  the dogs run freely and run right to the water.  They are so happy!!!  The dogs here were so great and so friendly.  I was surprised.  All the dog owners also were so friendly.  Just good vibes all around from everyone.  :)
author: Chrissie O.

description:
I am very picky where my dog goes to play and I hate to walk with extreme caution to avoid "land mines" (aka poop).  I am very impressed with the visitors at Fort Funston National Park and the community who maintains it.  I give a high five to you.  It's extremely clean! I don't know how much emphasis I can say describe clean.  I would roll on the trail and beach, naked. I look forward to future trips with my dog here. 

and as always,
*Review will be updated based on future experiences.
author: Victor W.

description:
Yes, it is gorgeous.  Yes, Pepperoni (my poodle-y pup) flips out when she arrives here.  Yes, it is doggie heaven.

But sadly, its kinda scary for the less large pups.  I feel like Pepperoni could get picked up and eaten at any moment by a leash-less big dog.  

Also, my friend had her car broken into here, so beware!
author: Amy N.

description:
HUGE off leash dog park where you can find many friendly dogs and dog owners. Many paths to take down to the beach and plenty of open space for your pooch to run wild. Do be careful because the upper paths are along the side of a cliff, so as usual, don't let your dogs wander off where you can't see them & definitely make sure they'll respond to voice commands so they stay safe. There are also a lot of hang gliders here, so beware if your dog likes to bark at things flying around in the sky. My dog thought she could chase them down which made for great exercise! Note that dogs aren't supposed to go in the hang gliding launch area which is coned off.

Even on a nice sunny day this park is very very cold, so bundle up & enjoy!
author: Jenn D.

description:
Unfortunately, I do not have a dog but love love love coming here for a short hike, watching the sunset and looking at other people's dogs wishing I had a dog.  

Although, I got to say, I am mighty lucky just to live 5 minutes from this place. To all the dog owners, this is the place to be to let your dog run free and go nuts on the beach for the time being. I hear there is some leash rule? I say no to the leash rule.
author: Jocelyn T.

description: Love this place. Best off leash experience for our doggie so far! Although she did almost ran away with some other jogging hooman with a dog... alas she eventually decided to stop running so I was able to catch up to her. Bonus point for unexpected cardio workout on the beach...  I guess.
author: Angie H.

description:
How have I never written a review about this place?! My bf found this location for us. We have a Mini Schnauzer which we love to walk off leash and he read about this place. We have walked all the trails of this place from our many visits out here. We've even gone down by the beach and found ourselves climbing the sand dunes to get back to our parking lot. The pup loves it here. For a safe and easy walk, take the paved trails and circle back to the parking lot. For a bit of a challenge, take the hike down to the beach and make your way back up. For me, I'm usually huffing and puffing my inhaler, but it's all in good fun! The fellow doggy friends you'll meet here are all well behaved and well mannered, especially those off leash. Bring your furry friend out here and give them the time of their lives with the freedom of walking off leash. It's worth the visit!

#386
author: Marlyn A.

description: Love love loved this place! Came here this morning for the first time after reading the great reviews and they were not wrong. Definite doggie paradise and all off leash! All dogs and people were friendly and well mannered. Will hopefully make this a weekly trip. Maybe it will be sunny next time.
author: Irene R.

description:
This is Doggy Disney - the happiest place on earth for dogs!! The beach area is enclosed between the cliff and ocean, making it a great off-leash area! There is a really long stretch of beach, so its very easy to get away from any dogs that aren't a great fit for your pup. Our girl always leaves Funston happy, sandy and exhausted!

Beware: most days it is incredible overcast and cold - bring a jacket!
author: Danielle D.

description:
Awesome! Darwin has been going here with his dog walker for a while, finally I had the chance to take him here and see the park for myself and wow! 

You get breathtaking views of the city and ocean, plus trails with cool plants and bird wildlife to checkout. For history buffs there are even huge gun installations from WWII to explore.

What an amazing place to let your doggie run down his batteries...
author: Jeremy S.

description:
A fantastic place to take your dog, but PLEASE keep it on-leash until you reach the lower trails. Three times now I've seen emergency rescue squads trying to reach dogs that fell off the cliff near the parking lot area.

I'm taking one star off because the trails are long overdue for some preventive maintenance.
author: John R.

description:
Dog Heaven!

What's funny about that is I don't actually have a dog. My family and I came here, and I swear, we might have been the only people there without a four legged friend. Despite that, we enjoyed walking around the dunes, checking out the beach, and watching the hang gliders. If you are afraid of dogs - I don't think I'd recommend Fort Funston. You can't go 5 feet without running into a dog, all of them off leash. But if you don't mind them, its pretty great. 

Will definitely be back!

PS - Note to Yelp... Fort Funston is not technically its own National Park, as the title suggests. Its actually part of the GGNRA (Golden Gate National Recreation Area).
author: Michelle L.

description:
LOVE it here!  Even if you are not much of a dog person (like moi) you're going to enjoy encountering with all different kinds of breeds here.  Most of the dogs come here without their leash (which I find amazing), so be prepare to really encounter with them (sometimes unexpectantly) and sniffed at.  All of them are so loving and you almost feel like you need to go get one right away because it just feels right to come to places like this with a non-human companion.  

Views are amazing as well.
author: Y K.

description: Awesome dog park. Almost all dogs wel behaved. Watch out during high tide. I keep my dog on leash to train him. Most people are very nice and the park is nicely maintained look out for glass in the sand
author: Scott F.

description:
Fort Funston images:

Hang gliders in flight

Warm flannel blankets to brave cold summer days

Walks with my dad on Sunday mornings

Watching the setting sun on a clear day, rare

The dog whimpering, unaccustomed to the way other dogs say hello

Decades ago as new immigrants, searching the ocean and tracing our way back home
author: Joc V.

description: My girlfriend and I loved Fort Funston and so did our pooch. The weather was a little overcast and blustery on the day we went but other than that the park was great. There were plenty of friendly dogs around to play with and help socialize the pup plus a ton trails and open space to allow us to do our own thing once we wanted to work in some individual training and playtime. There is also beach access, a lot of history behind the area, and an abundance of hang gliders.
author: Sean S.

description: The best beach ever!! Love the fact that it's an off leash dog beach. You may miss it at first, but there were a bunch of cars parked in the side of the road. A little further down there is a sign for Fort Funston, with a lot more parking! There was a little hike (about 10 minutes) from the FREE parking lot to the beach. There's a doggy station for water on the way, so fill up there! So many happy doggies playing with each other/ in the waves/ with their families. Very responsible owners watch their dogs and keep the beach super clean. The sand is smooth and nice to walk on barefooted. The beach is backed by an enormous cliff and goes on for ages. Will definitely be making this location a summertime staple! :)
author: Thi B.

description:
Great for dogs & the entire family!  You can walk, jog or just enjoy its natural wonders.
I love walking with the dogs along the beach most especially
author: Ann E.

description:
Dog owners - the rules may change!!!!!!!!!! They wish to restrict off leash to the sand areas south of the path only. Check out the proposed maps! 

Fort Funston will be RUINED for dogs if this goes thru :(. 

http://parkplanning.nps.gov/commentForm.cfm?parkID=303&projectID=11759&documentID=38106

Here is a link to comment on the proposed changes to the off  leash rules! 

Let the 420 5 star reviews of this place shine thru! It is such a great place for the ENTIRE bay area. I would even pay FEES to continue the place to be off leash!
author: Tina P.

description:
I don't know why I've never been here after living in SF for my entire life! This place is beautiful, I always passed by and thought nothing of it. 

Came here on a sunny Sunday afternoon with the boyfriend and our 6 month old Akita Yuki, there were tons and tons of people here of course with their dogs or exercising. The walk up and the view of Lake Merced was wonderful and all the views after this are also just as wonderful. The view of the beach and the ocean is just breath taking, especially on a sunny day. 

There are doggy bowls, thank goodness because our dog will drink water any chance she gets. Everyone who comes here are pleasant to be around and friendly, you and your dog will have fun! Whether it's watching the ocean or watching your dog playing with other dogs. This will be my new place to come when it's a nice sunny day.
author: Heather C.

description:
The word windswept comes to mind when describing this place.  There are lots of spots to see hang-gliders if anyone is up.  I haven't seen anyone on my visits here yet.   

Unfortunately there aren't any visitor facilities.  There are also a ton of dog walkers here.  I guess it's cool that people's four legged friends can enjoy the park as well, but they do tend to dominate the park.

It is a pretty cool place though and I highly recommend checking it out if you find yourself on Skyline Blvd.
author: Brian L.

description:
Amazing, fun park. This is a great place to take your dog (please be responsible and clean up after your pet - the park is beautiful, let's keep it that way). There's a lot of hiking to be had. In fact, I wouldn't recommend it if you can't hike around. I have back and knee problems and it was at times very difficult for me. 

The whole place is pretty much sand, so be prepared clothes-wise. Getting down to the beach, at least the way we went, involved going down a large, steep, sandy hill. It was worth it, however. Our dog loved running around through the succulents and playing on the beach. Lots of places for him to play. 

The scenery is breath-taking. The bluffs and the ocean-line are amazing. Lots of good photography to be had here.

There's a main entrance as well where you can go hang-gliding, if that's your thing. 

The not-so-greats: parking is a nightmare. Unless you're lucky enough to get a spot (which there are so few of) you have to park along the highway. Not ideal for trying to get in and out of the park. There is a bus that'll take you to the SF Zoo which is nearby. 

There are also no facilities here, that we ran into at least. There are no bathrooms. We only saw one water fountain, and although it had a dog spout, irresponsible owners were letting their larger dogs drink out of the people spout.
author: Jenny J.

description:
Okay I just love this place. I have many great memories of walking here over the years...meeting other cool dog owners...seeing all types and breeds of dogs...
One of my little guys can't quite make the walk anymore but I know he's there in spirit.
I'm glad to see that lots of other dogs and their owners are finding this magical place too!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Great place for friendly dogs in San Francisco. One word of caution - fleas! Make sure your dog's flea meds are current. I have left a few times with some bites. 
Oh, and not that the dogs care, but it can get really cold and windy - wear layers!
author: A G.

description: My husband and I took our little Scraggles here for an afternoon of fun at the beach! There are trails, cliffs, and a big stretch of beach with a wide sandbar. This is doggy heaven!! There were so many dogs here off leash just having the time of their lives. It was so much fun strolling along and seeing all these dogs. There are also hang gliders here. Lots going on here!
author: Michelle T.

description:
This place is dog Heaven! Every single dog is off leash and you can even walk down to the beach. It is such a gorgeous view as well, especially at sunset.

Take your pooch, he/she will love you forever!
author: Danielle C.

description:
FORT FUNSTON = DOGGY HEAVEN. 

In case you hadn't heard or read from the hundreds of reviews... This is as good as it gets in doggy land..  I make it a point to bring my Layla here at least once a month.  If you love your dog this place is a must!
author: Natasha V.

description:
Let me start by saying the parking lot can only be accessed from one side of the road, (the road closest to the beach), which you can easily miss if you're driving too fast. 

Fort Funston is my new "Go-to" place to relax.  The high cliffs overlooking the ocean are breathtaking, and as you continue along the trails, the wide open space allow your mind to drift away from all the stresses that city life can build up. Bear in mind there are 100s of dogs everywhere, some leashed & most not, allowing this place to be doggy heaven as well. Personally I'm not much of a dog person but I do have to say that ALL the dogs I've encounter during my visits seem to be very familiar with the area & just go about their business or stop by to say a polite hello, which I find to be a sweet thing to do on a day I really need to de-stress.

Fort funston also has a beach access for those that don't mind a steep grade downhill and allows for a good workout getting back up, which is definitely worth doing on a beautiful day.

Overall I recommend this place if you: 
1) Have a dog. Your pup will be exhausted well into the next day.
2) Need a day to reflect. Go during sunset. Beautiful.
3) Enjoy a leisurely walk. The Ocean view is to die for.
author: Riz B.

description: What an amazing walking area! I can't wait until I have a dog because this walking trail is doggy heaven! There are so many dogs, and lots of places for them to run around, smelling and sniffing to their hearts' content. There is no leash requirement on these trails, so you have to stay on your guard because dogs frequently run past you chasing a ball, or another dog, or just for the fun of it! This trail is also paved, so it is perfect for wheelchairs, strollers, or a child's tricycle. I did not see any cyclists, so I would look online to find out if that is an option.
author: Maddy L.

description:
Came here last two weekend with my labrador puppy and I cannot even think anything negative about this place (okay, may be only negative is that the drive to the place is too foggy) and I am certain that I will come here at least couple of times each month, even though I have more than an hour drive from south bay.

People who come here are excellent. They all love dogs and this is only place in bay area that I can be comfortable with my pup being off leash and not to worry about an aggressive dog getting on him !

Views from this place are absolutely stunning !

I like to hike, but it's not much of a hike here. I would just call it as a beach walk.

If your dog likes water and likes to fetch, this place is a heaven. As someone else mentioned, if there is a place called Disneyland for dogs, this is it !

Bottom line is, if you love dogs (even if you don't have one) come here any day and you will not regret. If you do have a dog, this place will help develop/strengthen your bond with him/her.
author: Nilesh D.

description: Beautiful view at the top of the cliffs, Little bit of a work out to get to the beach though.
author: Brian K.

description: What a great open park on the beach to take a dog or two. There is some really beautiful scenery here. There is fresh drinking water to accommodate your dog near the main parking lot. I have run across some really friendly people here. The one con.... Some of the paths are in need of maintenance, but not in such a way that you shouldn't come. Bring your dog and let him/her roam free and over indulge those senses!
author: Robert H.

description:
Forget Disneyland, Fort Funston really is the happiest place on Earth. Where else are you going to get breathtakingly-spectacular ocean views, refreshing sea air & dozens of pooches smiling & wagging so hard they look like they're going to combust from sheer happiness?

Fort Funston is one of those places that makes me SO HAPPY to live in San Francisco. It's a regular weekend stop for us, not just because it makes our pup, Smokey, beyond happy, but we love it, too. 

Things to know: from the parking lot, be prepared for a steep walk down the stairs (near the hang glider runway) or you can use one of the many dog walker trails to the left of the stairs. They're a little more vertical, but less crowded & a quicker route to the ocean. As soon as you get down to the beach, the wind will be much calmer & you have a few miles to stretch your legs & let your pooch romp to his heart's content. We always have a great time meeting the other dogs (and their parents!) & have been lucky enough to run into a few dog meet-ups. Our favorite being the Great Dane meet-up where we got to watch a few dozen Danes having the time of their life.

The walk back up is always brutal & you'll be asking yourself: wait, was it REALLY that steep? But you can always take a moment to admire the view (aka catch your breath ;) & may even spot dolphins, in addition to the doggies, frolicking about in the waves!
author: Chantelle D.

description: This is dog and human heaven! It's as good for your dog than for you! Sometimes I even wonder if I'm going there to walk my dog or for myself ! There's miles of beaches and hikes, up and down, breathtaking views and tones of dogs of course. Most of the dogs are chill there and off-leash, from the little to the big ones. One thing to check out is parking. It's sometimes hard to find parking on really nice days. Also watch out not to park in an illegal area, you will definitely get a ticket. The rangers always drop by during the weekend...
author: David L.

description: This place is great to bring the dogs! Lots of dogs off leash here so if your dog is not well trained it may not be the best place to take him. Early mornings are my favorite times to come!
author: Mallory R.

description:
Review of Fort Funston by BARNEY, the POMERANIAN:  

Fort Funston!  Fort Funston!  No leash!  Yes!  Fort Funston!  Open the door!  Open the door!

It's a wonderful day, another windy afternoon and the perfect simulation of sticking my head out of a car.  This is paradise.   

Barney sense tingling!  -EARS UP-

Bird!  The chase begins!  Ugh...got away again.  I'm going to get you bird, my nemesis.  When I catch you, I'll, I'll...actually I don't know what I'll do.  That's beside the point.  Mark my words, the day of your reckoning inches closer!  -MARKING TERRITORY-      

Why do these humans jump off the ledge on these flying contraptions they call hang gliders?  They're fun to watch, yet mimicry of the enemy, the bird, is pure evil and an injustice.  Exception is made to the purple glider...because it is purple...duh!    

Hey, it's Cassandra, my pug friend!  HI!! -SNIFF BUTT, SNIFF BUTT, SNIFF FACE, SNIFF BUTT, SNIFF FACE, ONE MORE BUTT SNIFF TO GO...and DONE- She looks like she's been upping the cardio.  Unfortunately, she'll always be a butter-face.    

Oh, my favorite sandy ditch!  Why does my owner's brother, Arnold, keep yelling "Stop Barney!"?  I love rolling around in sand and messing my fur up.  Interruption should be deemed illegal with a sign so these humans can understand the joy this brings.  Maybe they should try it themselves.

Hey, I see the car again.  F@&K!  I'm sad inside, but my perpetual smile says otherwise.  

What's that curious smell emanating from the liquid by the big box the humans mark their territory in?  Arnold is yelling for me to stop smelling that area.  Why?  I'm trying to figure out this peculiar scent.  He keeps yelling the letter "p" for some reason.  I will never fully understand humans.  -MARKING TERRITORY- 

These splendid walks around Fort Funston are never long enough.  Back to the car I go.  I love my owner.  She brings me to the best places.
author: Arnold T.

description:
So you have a dog in the city...


COME HERE. It is amazing. I was worried about crowding and there are tons of dogs here but it's so big and open, there is no stress. I've been to parks where all of the dogs are on edge because they are in such a small enclosed space and there was not a hint of that here. I didn't see a single dog fight or scuffle, just a lot of happy people and dogs. We got a big lost trying to find the beach access but made it eventually. It's pretty sandy so dress appropriately. You do have to go down a slightly steep hill of sand to get down to the beach which isn't the most fun to walk up, but it's still worth it to get down to the ocean. My dog had just as much fun running around on the paths as down by the ocean, so you don't even have to climb down there to have a good time.

In summary, like everyone says, this place is amazing. If you have a dog, it's a crime to not take them here. I can't wait to drag my roommates and their puppies here soon.
author: Christine H.

description:
If you like to creep on other people's dog's because you live in a tiny SF apartment and can't have one of your own, this is the place for you.

My biological clock is telling me it's time for a dog but due to aforementioned apartment situation I can't get one.  SO I come here and hike and sit by the 180 degree view of the ocean and pet the dozens off-leash dogs that come up to me.  

If this place had a tree that grew Chilean empanadas, then it would truly be my heaven.  It's seemingly sunny all the time (but deceptively breezy so bring layers).  People are friendly.  The colors with the trees, flowers, sand and crashing waves, are insane.  Bring a picnic, sunglasses and sunscreen, your dog (if you have one you lucky bitch) and prepare to laze the day away.

My absolute favorite Bay Area park.
author: Meg M.

description: Such a great place for the dog! Everyone we run into is so friendly and lots of other pups for ours to play with. All the dogs seem really well behaved and just tons of space to play and hike on and off the beach. They even have water stations with bowls for the dogs. Not to mention breathtaking ocean views and hang gliders overhead.
author: Kristin K.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the city. Doggie heaven. 

I love taking my dogs here, such a great escape. It can get too windy to the point where you will get whipped by sand....trust me it was NOT pleasant. 

A lot of people take their dogs out here, off leash playtime.
author: Jenn T.

description: I took a bus from BART and walked up into the recreational area. The scenery was breathtaking and it was dog friendly. It was a bit windy the day I was there. I would give a word of caution that one trail I climbed up abruptly ended in a steep, high cliff, drop-off so it is good to pay attention to where you are walking there. I thought it was a beautiful place to walk my dog and see the ocean. Some dogs were off leash and others, like mine, were on leash.
author: Karen W.

description:
ATTENTION- if you do not like dogs or wish to not encounter them then do not come here. This is a dog park and a great one at that.

There are other dog parks but they do not compare to how amazing and beautiful this place is. There are tons of paths to travel on and just so much to see. It is really a great place to take your dog. Despite the fact that there are tons of dogs here- there is more than enough space to have your own private walk.
author: Nina M.

description: Fort Funston is one of my favorite place in the world and my dog also absolutely love it to death. My 90+ Lab will jump into the wave and we would play catch for 2 hours until he'd used all his energy up. Over the years, I have been bringing people to this place and it's an absolute hook that they would always come back on their own. It also have live crabs too!
author: Wayne H.

description:
This is the most scenic part of Ocean Beach I have ever seen! 

I happened to visit Forst Funston while the weather was unusually hot, during the heat wave. I, living in Santa Clara, thought I would escape the heat by checking out Forst Funston with my dog. Boy was I wrong, it was about 90 degrees at 11 in the morning! And for the first time ever I was sweating at the beach! IT was eerie. 

Although the walk felt more like a hike, possibly do to my shoes and the weather , I enjoyed every minute of our Funston visit. From the Golden Gate views in the unpredictable clear skies, to the very friendly dogs frolicking in the ocean.

My dog actually got in the water! He usually runs from waves but this time he dove right in and paddled to get his ball and even chased other dogs in. 

I was pleased to find a very pet friendly path to the beach. Doggies were happily running around all over the place and would run up to greet us. My dog was on excellent behavior off leash, but if you worry about your dog snapping or running off I would keep him on leash when walking the path to the ocean.

There was a water station half way their surrounded by silver doggy water bowls and about three fountains attached to a wooden post. 
I think they should install more though, it was not enough for all the dogs there that day. I also wish they would build a restroom instead of having a porta potty, for obvious reasons. 

Once arriving at the shore, our hot ,what seemed like a long, walk, was worth it. The beach was very clean and the waves were perfect for dog paddling. Not very strong or frequent, just a steady, smooth, and cool rhythm. It was so hot that I got in the water myself, along with my relieved pup. 

The people were friendly and were pretty vigilant as far as watching their dogs. This really is doggy  heaven and I am for sure going to be taking my dog back.

The walk back was really nice too, I could see Lake Merced, this brought back tons of memories from when I lived right across the street from the runners paradise lake. 

I had no problem with parking because it was a weekday,although it was pretty busy. I recommend parking near the port a potties because there is a nice little overlook where you can get a great view of the ocean crashing in to the cliffs.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I may be one of the few Yelpers to write a review about Fort Funston who never took a dog here.  Oh well, I guess I always gotta be different (but then, that goes with being a Christian in the Bay Area, eh?).

Not that I didn't have the chance;  when I got married, I also inherited my wife's Australian Shepherd.  This dog *hated* other dogs, though, and would go into attack mode when she saw other dogs.  She would have died of a heart attack here, there are so many dogs here.

Obviously, I didn't come here for the canines.  Instead, it's a nice coastal park that's part of the GGNRA.  Nice view of the beach and ocean, when the fog isn't there.  Coastal vegetation that's probably unique to this part of the California coast.  Gliders.  Old bunkers and batteries from the war days.  And it spreads north a long way.

Cons:  Typical weather for this part of the coast, windy and cold.  Remote corner of San Francisco;  no problem with a car, but you can't walk there from your apartment in only a few minutes.  Can get lots of use on the weekends.

Basically, it may or may not be worth the trip out here for you.  It's not for me, living in the East Bay like I do, but I still like it.  Good place to relax in The City, or jog, or explore history, or enjoy the view.  Or have fun with your dog.
author: Ron L.

description: This place is awesome! I can't praise this place any differently then fellow Yelpers: off-leash, doggie Heaven, lots of space to roam free. BUT, and a huge BUT- the greenery is riddled with poison oak! We found ourselves standing on a huge patch of it (about 10 ft long!). Just stay on the sand trails and you'll be fine.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
OK first and foremost on sheer natural beauty and scale this place deserves 28 stars on a scale of 1-5 but alas as the saying goes the people usually make or break a place and in this case it is the dog people that really wreck it. I am by all means an animal lover but just because I love animals does not mean that I want intimate knowledge of some stranger's "Rover" or do I want to have Rover  slobber all over me. I go to Fort Funston to hike and take in the scenery and not to scrape dog drool off my hands or dog crap off my shoe. Strange dogs and their strange dog poop,  much like strange kids are appreciated AT A DISTANCE and should not be allowed to slobber on people, scratch people ( some woman's unruly dog scraped the crap out of my leg once) or gnaw on people's ankles. Fort Funston is NOT exclusively for dog owners it is a recreation area for many different types of folks from hang gliders and para-sailers to equestrians and yet it seems that the dog people think it belongs to them.  The dog owners are militant there and from what I understand from several conversations I am not the only one irked by their canine anarchist collective. 

Just last week I did get a good laugh from some signs that say "There is no Poop Fairy, pick up after your dog". Apparently there are others equally as irked by the doggie mines left behind by owners who think for some reason that they own the place

Gorgeous views and lovely beach but watch out for the canine terrorist cult..
author: Aud S.

description: The name says it all--FUNston! I took my dog and my friend's dog here today and we had a blast! The views are breathtaking and it is such a peaceful place. All of the dogs were happy and the people were all smiling, too. It was refreshing to be in such a positive environment. I can't wait to go back.
author: Carly H.

description: My dog loves this place! And so do I as it's such a treat to see so many happy/friendly dogs in one place. Didn't expect my dog to be so behaved without a leash with other dogs around (on a leash, she tugs and barks at everything!) so it was a wonderful surprise to see this other side of her. We'll be back, Fort Funston!
author: Melinda V.

description: Great place to take your dog for a hike or just take a hike yourself, it's gigantic and there are routes that lead down to the beach. It can be chilly since its by the coast. Lots of parking!
author: Queena T.

description:
I've been coming here for years with my two dogs, but time after time, I can't believe my eyes. As you walk along the path, you will see anything and everything your eyes desire. Cliffs, beaches, grass, hills, ocean, and even a forest-like canopy cover this multi terrain park. 

People take their human children to Disneyland as a sign of the greatest affection available to man, and Fort Funston is the equivalent for your furry children. Okay. Eff Disneyland. This is doggy heaven. 

I once saw a woman that was pushing a Golden Retriever in a dog stroller with a lab walking alongside them. When I asked her why her goldie couldn't walk, she replied, "He could walk DOWN the path here (his favorite place), but he can't walk up because he's too old. He's given me the best years of his life, so this is the least I could do." This, ladies and gentlemen... is the type of people you find at Fort Funston.

Come here once and you will be a fan forever.
author: Jeani L.

description: What a great dog park.  We brought our 3 chi-mix pups out for a Sunday hike and some play time. I was struck by how clean and well maintained the trails are.  And by how most of the dog owners are friendly and responsible. I say most, because there were the typical few with their pit bull, not paying much attention to it. At one point, we had to scoop up all of our dogs to avoid a charging pit.  I don't really blame the dog, it's the owner's responsibility to keep a more aggressive breed on-leash at all times.  We did have a great time - we will be back again very soon.
author: Rachel H.

description: What's not to love here? It has great views, fresh ocean air, free-roaming dogs of all breeds, dog-loving people, nice hiking trails, fun sand dunes for people and dogs, and of course, the great tumultuous ocean to frolick in with your pup. I've been coming here for the past 15 years, and I'll have to say, this is my happy place. Just gotta watch out if you have little kids. They can get rammed by dogs going at top speed.
author: Mei W.

description:
I want to call this the "Point Isabel of SF" - but it might be even better... mostly because the drama of the landscape. CLIFF! OCEAN! FORT! CLIFF!

I may also be biased because my dog's favorite thing is sand.

Immediately after visiting FF for the first time I was planning our next visit... for the same week.
author: tess e.

description: My dog Sadie had a blast!! Great trails, beautiful scenery, and not too crowded. We live in Santa Clara, but making the drive up a few times a month is definitely work it. Awesome experience for everyone.
author: Mahea N.

description:
I have been coming to Fort Funston with my dogs for over 10 years now.  This is a great dog friendly off leash area for your pups to run around and have a great time.  If you walk all they way down, you can take them to the beach.  

It can get very busy on the weekends but the week days are not bad.
author: Henry S.

description:
This is like DOG HEAVEN. it's an open range off leash beach for dogs. So many dogs here, from big to small. Between the mist and the fresh ocean breeze, I absolutely love this place. When i need to clear my mind, taking little Rosco here while he stops at every stump to claim his territory is such a stress reliever for me and him.

There are all sorts of paths, the concrete path, the walkway to the beach area, the kite flying area, the mini sand dunes.

Highly suggested for your dog to go and spend its day running freely and burn all its energy.   

Remember, to pick up after your dog, there are a few post that contain bags for pick-up too.
author: Tam T.

description:
I loved this place as a first time dog owner. I was really nervous about how my dog would behave off leash, but this place was the perfect place for training, both for him and me! 

My favorite experience was running on the beach with my baby. It was a great opportunity to teach him "Drop it!" as there were so many crabs on the beach! Watching the sunset here was absolutely breathtaking. 

As a 20-something yo female walking with my dog by myself, I only had one uncomfortable situation come up when a 40-something yo guy started to hit on me and was quite lewd. There's enough foot traffic that I still felt safe, but I would definitely stay on the main trails if I were to come here by myself. Besides, there is so much beauty here, it would be a shame not to share the experience with others.
author: Mia S.

description:
Yes sir, this is the 350th reivew of Fort Funston. No, sir, nobody was asking for my opinion. But here it is anyway:

Wow! I love this place. It's especially fun with my part-time pooch, Roxy the Wonder Dog, but I've been known to come here and just dog stalk. It's like Westminster in the Wild. 

It's especially nice when the tide is low enough that a beach walk isn't risky, and it's interesting and fun when the hang gliders are active, but for those of us who never plan ahead, it's really rather fabulous no matter when you go. 

Never mind the dogs, physically, it's a beautiful place. It was the perfect place to be today, January 13, at 4:31pm, when Roxy and I were "working from home". It was sunny and warm and I feel super glad to live on the west side of San Francisco, California, USA!

The useful: webcam action: http://www.flyfunston.org/
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I love going here and bring my dogs. My boyfriend and I love going for walks and brings our 5 month ago boston terrier puppies here. 

Our puppies love how they met other dogs and get run around without there leashes and how they get to go on the beach.
Its so fun and wonderful seeing our puppies enjoy being there.
author: Christine L.

description:
If you own a dog, and can access Fort Funston reasonably, you need to go to Fort Funston.  It's doggy Disneyland.  The average dog visiting Fort Funston has a better time than its owner.

As a standalone beach destination you're essentially visiting a hilly version of Ocean Beach.  It'll be cold and windy.  The access to the beach is steep and muddy in places.  Just prepare for that and you'll have a fun time.
author: Bill H.

description: This is a very happy place for friendly dogs to meet.  Beautiful views and lots of dogs to see.  If only people were more responsible there would be more places where dogs can be off-leash.  One of my dogs got nipped today by a fluffy black and white dog.  The woman with the dog saw it happen but did not apologize or put the dog on a leash.  There are no bad dogs, only irresponsible people.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Absolutely gorgeous views! I wish I had known about this earlier. We took our picnic basket and spent a lazy Sunday afternoon away. There were many dogs here, which I loved since I'm a huge dog lover, but may be a problem for others. 

Blue sky, peaceful ocean, gentle breeze, with wine, I couldn't ask for anything else. Just kidding, if only my dog was well behaved enough to come here :(
author: Alice W.

description:
Gorgeous views of the coast. I especially like all the iceplant scattered among the cliffs and sand. 

Tons of dogs.
author: Chrystina Z.

description: Love, love, love coming here with my lab. I do a loop going down to the beach and back up the stairs where the hang gliders launch off.  The beach is shallow and flat, perfect for my dog to fetch and swim in the water.  I always found that even though the weather is nasty, the huge cliffs next to the beach area gets shielded by the winds.  Truly is Disneyland for dogs!
author: Krystle L.

description:
This is doggie paradise without having to leave the city. 
You start off by walking up a pretty steep hill that generally leaves my pooch princess a little out of breath (but that's because she's lazy.) Plus once you get up the hill the excitement is like a shot of espresso for her. Dogs are running, jumping, fetching, barking, doing what they do best: living carefree. 
Most of the dogs are off leash and once you get down to the beach, pretty much all of the dogs are off leash. The beach area is vast and dogs have the run of it. 
This is the perfect place to bring your pooch! 
Warning: If it's a windy day, walking down the hill to get to the beach can be painful due to sand whipping your face. If it's windy and you really want to go down there; run for it. The wind generally dies down once you get down there. Trust me, it's worth it! Your doggie pal will agree! 
Parking can be a little scarce.
author: Ashley S.

description:
As if I couldn't love San Francisco enough! San Francisco, you spoil me with all your breathtaking views! 

I took my puppy out here one day and he loved it! There's a lot of happy dogs roaming around. My puppy made lots of friends and perhaps, potential girlfriends! Lots of trails to get lost in. I love watching my dog approach other dogs and their owners here. It's just a friendly, happy place. 

This is a dog's version of Disneyland! "Hey look , it's a cliff! ohh the beach! ahhh the water's cold!! oh another doggie! run run run dig dig dig run! weeee!"  

Just the BEST dog place ever. 

Bring a jacket! It gets cold. Typical San Francisco..
author: Paul P.

description:
Awesome dog park!

QUESTION: Does anyone know what's up with the cave down by the beach? Where'd it come from, where does it go, and how safe is it? ...I must know!
author: Zach B.

description:
My doggies LOVE coming here and I love coming here! It's a no-brainer!

Been coming here for over 6 years and it's the best place for bringing my two big dogs since they can run around off-leash. It seems though that there's a possibility the leash rules might be changing so I guess time will tell.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Dog Heaven. Nothing can beat it. If you don't like dogs, stay away. This is not a place to set up a huge beach setup and expect to be left alone by four-legged friends. This is a place to bring your furry best friend and run around with both of your tongues hanging out. 

There are two beach entrances - one near the parking lot with a daunting grade and limited steps, and another one further North down the walking path that uses switchbacks that is more friendly for people with issues going down a 10-20% or more grade. 

Once you get on the beach, you may be tempted to go over the seawall to see what is on the other side. Let me save you the trouble and the sprained ankle I got and tell you the answer: nothing exciting. You can see it here: http://maps.google.com/maps?q=fort+funston&hl=en&ll=37.714925,-122.504335&spn=0.000836,0.000589&sll=37.614514,-122.27983&sspn=0.605919,0.602875&t=h&hq=fort+funston&z=20

Basically, that wall splits the beach in half. You may be tempted to go over or around it but trust me it ain't worth it... Just stick to the side you are on.
author: Cyrus A.

description:
Just wanted to add a WARNING in addition to all the great reviews.

Please keep your dogs away from the cliff areas (especially if they chase birds)! This past Saturday we were there and a dog fell over 30 feet. The fire department/park ranger showed up and I heard the dog got rescued yay! 

Also on the SAME day, two people had to be rescued from a cliff nearby. Don't know the details on that one but 3 rescues in one day is a good enough warning to me to stay away from the edges!

Oh last one...on the way in (look to your left side)...  I've seen 2 cars get stuck as they tried to park half on the grass ditch and half on the cement. Watch out as your tailpipe will get stuck lol
author: E T.

description: Doggie heaven.  Tons of wide open space to let the furriest of your friends run around to his or hers heart's content. The  view from the cliffs is breathtaking.  Only issue is the horse shizz that is everywhere because my dog for some reason thinks horse shizz is like natures butter and I have to run around chasing him away from it.  If you don't like dogs don't bother coming here because you'll be running around scared the whole time.
author: Duyhien N.

description: A veritable Doggie Disneyland.  Your dog never had so much fun.  Acres of open space, hills, trails, bluffs and beach all for your doggy's delight.  Great views for humans, too!
author: Isaac W.

description: This place is so awesome its something that i wouldve never found out about if my uncle didnt take us here.. i Guess its known for people bringing their dogs to play and others bring actual hangliders you get to see...the coolest thing was that it was a foggy day so you drive in to a dirt lot parking and you see alot of people with cars and hangliders and you cant really see anything..you follow this trail where everyone goes and you dont even realize youre at the top of a cliff you follow the trail down the cliff and its like a private beach where everyone is playing with their dogs and alot of the dogs arent on leashes and they seem so happy.. so many varieties of different breeds and im a dog lover so it was an awesome experience.. now there is also another part where you can watch from the area on top of the cliff and theres some history that was told where they used to store guns in these big metal BOXES that were supposedly there for years...more of a local spot but what an awesome place
author: Tommy D.

description: Dog friendly area in San Francisco, near the Daly City limits. The trail is nice and there are lots of dogs, but it is usually foggy and cold so bring a jacket.
author: Lisa H.

description: Amazing views of the ocean with plenty of succulant foliage to add to the atmosphere. There's a little bit of trails to see the ocean from the cliff and also lead you down to the beach. There's a lot of open space. There are many dogs there so it is definitely dog friendly. The only downside is the amount of trash on the beach. Hopefully it'll get cleaner in years to come to restore its full beauty.
author: Jason H.

description: This is a lovely walk. There are paved and dirt paths that go along the coast & through the dunes with various viewpoint opportunities. I was able to take my jogging stroller through the paved path, but not the through the whole thing. The path is not swept, and while I was able to push through some sandy dips, at one point the path is completely covered in deep sand. We had to turn around and head back before we were ready, but the walk we did have was nice. Everyone on the trail had a dog, the views were beautiful, and bonus- we ended up coming at the same time as a hand gliding club. Note: this place can get really windy so mind the weather before coming. Or be ready to walk around Lake Merced across the way if you can't stand the sand blowing in your face at Fort Funston. On a good weather day, though, this place is great.
author: Rocio G.

description: Great place for dogs. Good workout climbing down.. and then back up from the beach! Plenty of room for my crazy dogs to run around and meet new friends. I have been here many times, it's a staple for our family.
author: Silvie P.

description: This is like Disneyland for dogs. Off leash, miles of trails, sand dunes and hills galore, and a long stretch of beach and tons and tons of dogs and dog lovers -- this place is so amazing and I totally recommend it for you and your furry friends.  Will def bring my pups again!
author: Mel C.

description: Went the other day, took some pictures.  Awesome place to watch hang-gliders and to walk your dog.  Great for walking and exploring.  Awesome place, family-friendly, bring a hoodie, check it out.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I agree with one of the reviews here -- it is truly Dog's heaven :)
Huge open area with grass, sands, dunes, hills, tunnels and a beach ! 
I just took my 2 y.o Labrador retriever here and we both loved it and will definitely come back. Almost all dogs are off leash!  They are just happy. Happy dog = happy people.

There are some areas with broken bottle glass mixed with sands - so just be aware with surrounding.

Otherwise, wonderful place to go take the pooch.
author: Hendry C.

description: Definitely going to keep the 5 star average rating rolling!!! By far the best dog park I've ever been too.. On a Saturday or a Sunday you're looking at a huge, huge doggie party, probably over 100 dogs or so. If you get bored of a paved trail, you can go on off road terrain hikes and of course, walk down to the beach. At the beach, I witnessed 1 of the most touching memories I've ever experienced with my boy. After a year and a half of being completely fearful of water, my boy finally broke his phobia. He made a great friend who wanted to play a little tag and lead my boy right into that beautiful Pacific Ocean. They both continued to run around, drenched with the biggest smiles of all time. I will never forget that. Thank you Fort Funston!
author: Patrick O.

description: I drove 120 miles roundtrip to visit with my dog because she had never visited the ocean. The walk on the beach started out nice, but about 10 minutes into it a group on horses came by. The horses pooped and the riders didn't stop to clean it up. I had to leash my dog because she then wasn't interested in anything but eating horse manure. What's up with this -- we have to clean up after our dogs but people don't have to clean up after their horses?? Outrageous and very selfish.
author: Laura S.

description: Great dog park. Great place to walk, enjoy the beach, water, and hiking. But definitely a great place for a dog!
author: Siv L.
