description: I loved it here. So many positive vibes. I always take my dog to different places to explore. And I have returned here. Love the different views.
author: Yasuko R.

description: This is our favorite place to bring our pups on the weekend. There's cliffs to walk them up top, but we head straight down to the beach for a good run. This is a very popular place, so you'll see lots of families and furry friends roaming the area. It's truly a dog's paradise!
author: Jericka B.

description: Dog lovers' heaven! Great view, good trails and beautiful landscape. Very enjoyable place for a short stroll even if you are not a dog owner.
author: Mona W.

description:
Everyone's ratings speaks for itself.

Great place to go with friends and not to mention your dogs. Friendly people, wide space and heaven for dogs.

It is really close to the beach and my dog enjoyed it very much and I did too!
author: Herbert R.

description: Wow...just wow. Such an amazing place to journey through. I definitely would have a kick back/picnic here all the time if i had the time! This is a must see!
author: Chris C.

description:
Worth coming to SF regularly for for big dogs, especially water-loving big dogs, but not the best place for a brachycephalic small dog on a hot day.  Little ol' Brimley was panting up the sunny climbs today and we had to take a few rests in the shade.  Got him to wade in the water with some of the bigger dogs, but he (wisely) didn't want to go in too far - the surf was strong and the aforementioned short-nosedness doesn't make a Brussels the best swimmer.

The abundance of professional dog walkers walking huge dog packs is a little off-putting too, during the week.  Contrast this to, say, Point Isobel in Richmond, and it's an interesting demographic indicator.  Lots of rich San Franciscans with little time and space to spend with their own animals hire dog walkers.  (also, big dogs in smaller spaces need walkers)  At Pt. Isobel, sure, there are dog walkers, but most people are just out for a walk with their own pups, even midday on a weekday.  More space, more time, less money to spend on dog walkers in the East Bay.

I mention this in part because a condo-living dog owner walking a small dog in Emeryville stoppped me the other morning and asked me how often I walk my dog.  They didn't have a back yard, were afraid to walk their dog at night, and it was an older dog who probably had bladder issues.  I said "about 3 times a day - morning, at lunch, and at night, and oh, he gets let out into the backyard late at night".  The dog also got taken to doggy day care.  It truly helps to have space and time for a dog, although our little guy could use a little more socialization.

Go to Funston by all means whenever you get a chance with your little pup, just keep some water handy for the small short-nosed toy breeds, they need it!
author: Joe B.

description:
Fort Funston is evidently NO SECRET to dog owners, come on a nice day and this place is swarming. It's nice to see so many happy dogs running around off leash, and there never seems to be a problem.

Trails abound, there's beach access, a water fountain, doggy bags and a decent amount of parking. The views are gorgeous from the cliffs, and you can see a good portion of San Francisco from the other side. Basically this place is awesome and your dog will love it.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Fun and free, this place makes me want to move to the area just to let my dog go nuts!  I can only imagine him taking a dip in the ocean and then running around like a mad dog through the dunes and battery.  What a beautiful place to go even without an animal.  WOW!
author: Jenn C.

description:
It's like Disneyland for dogs.  I love it here.
I have a small yorkie, who isn't very social.  But for some reason, when she's here she's on her best behavior.  I love watching her approach other dogs and running along the trails.  

It's a large area with several trails and a great beach section.  There are plenty of water stops and tons of open space.  Everyone we encountered was incredibly friendly.  

Makes me want to get more dogs!
author: Maryrose S.

description:
Dogs galore!!

The walk to the beach was a bit confusing for us but once we found it, it was fun to watch our pups play in the water.

The trek down & up from the beach is definitely a work out. We went on a foggy day so maybe it wasnt 5-star amazing to me. We wished it was enclosed so we could let our huskies run off leash.

There are lots of dogs off leash here. & tip, bring a towel for your furry friend cause they will need it.

& lastly, clean up after your pet.
author: Sarrah F.

description:
This place is awesome My wolf hybrid loves it here because I can actually let him off leash and he no where to disappear to! 

Its either cliff or water for a great distance. I can't believe anyone would drop a 4 star review because its sandy. Its a beach you f'n idiots. 

Pretty good people come out and I've yet to any problems like you encounter at your local dog park with uptight people. Dogs come here to play, so let your dog play... THEYRE DOGS!!
author: Kevin Z.

description:
A took me here yesterday on an awesomey awesome superdy duper warm Indian summer day (also a bye week for the 49ers, so I got him all to myself!)  Having been born and raised in San Francisco, I, somehow, never found myself at Fort Funston.  Visiting for the first time with A made it all the better.

It has a huge parking lot, but on beautiful Sundays, definitely try to get there early because it really does fill up.  We got there a little after noon and were lucky to find a spot.  When we left around 2:00pm, there was nary a spot to be found and everyone was parking in spots that don't even exist.  They'd probably be parking along the freeway later on in the day at the rate the spots were going.

It was really cool seeing the old WWII batteries and imagining the soldiers stuck in there searching for enemy warships.

We also walked along the beach and sat for awhile.  I think the amount of dogs outnumbered the amount of people that were there, so if you're not a dog lover, be forewarned.  

The stairs getting to/from the beach are KILLER.  I suck at stairs.  Seriously.  It's a good thing A took my hand and practically dragged me up last part of the stairs and up the little wood chip covered incline to the parking lot or I'd probably still be stuck on the steps whining about how my legs couldn't go another step.

Beautiful views, stairs are great exercise, lots of dogs.
author: Kris L.

description: Good place to walk dog or just walk a mile if doctor telling you to get more exercise. Lots of dogs with mandatory litter pickup; however look where you are stepping anyhow. Horses have been using trails as well. Parking available at base by Lake Merced or further south parking lot where they hang glide.
author: Clifford W.

description:
I've driven down Skyline Blvd many a time, especially since moving to South San Francisco a few years ago.  I've always noticed Fort Funston and the amount of cars flowing into it, but never really ventured into there.  One day my dog owning friend asked me to hang out and walk his lil pups over there.  Since a dog is one charming ass animal and I haven't seen my buddy in a while, I decided to roll with him to this lil jewel.

I guess I don't understand how lucky I am to live in such a beautiful area since Fort Funston was awesome.  A lot of dog owners bring their dogs here unleashed.  There's plenty of room to roam around for dogs and they seem to have a blast playing and interacting with each others.  It's also a great place to get a little walking exercise and checking out the beautiful views of the water.  My and my friend walked around talking shit while his dogs enjoyed walking down the little trails.  

I haven't been back to Fort Funston since then but it being so close, I don't have any excuse. I'll definitely get around to it again.  Just remember to bring your jacket (any self respecting San Franciscan would know to bring a damn jacket) cause it does get windy over here.  Some trail parts aren't exactly the most level, so for those who have tough time walking or who are older, beware.  Note to self, enjoy more of what the city offers.  I guess I'm just lame hahaha.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Fort Funston is one of those magical places where people and dogs experience nature at its very best.

There isn't a more a more superb, pristine, or peaceful place for our four-legged friends (or us perhaps) in all of San Francisco, with its mix of surf, sand, forest, and cliffside.

We are so lucky to have this most amazing natural treasure so close to us.
author: Brendan S.

description:
Dogs dogs dogs galore! Honestly, its doggie heaven. I've never seen so many dogs in my life, and them running around like a bunch of crazy maniacs is not a bad sight. My only issue is that if you park near John Muir and Skyline, the route to the beach is down a pretty steep sandy hill. My dog is pretty old, so at some points I had to carry him up.

But besides that, a wonderful place. If you dont mind the sand of course.
author: Jessica H.

description: If you like dogs this is the place for you as its filled with dogs as it is an ideal place to walk your dog. This is also a mini hiking trail area. This place consists of several small trials walk able with less difficulty compared to other longer and more rugged terrain. This place is very close to my house so that is a big plus.
author: Robert Y.

description:
I'm new to the city and have yet to find a fully-enclosed park where I can let my two dogs run off-leash without worrying about one of them running into the busy streets. They're both well-behaved dogs but very curious...and just small enough for me to lose track of them if they go behind a bush. For this reason, I've pretty much kept them indoors except to go out to do their business and I feel terrible about it.

Last weekend, at the recommendation of a friend of a friend, my roommate and I decided to take our dogs here since none of our dogs have ever been to the beach. As soon as we parked, we saw nothing but happy dogs and happy owners, and that continued for the entire hour we were here.

I had imagined this to be like a human beach (long, flat strip of sand next to the water), just dog-friendly, but that is not the case at all. This beach is full of hills, sand dunes, plants, and partially paved paths for you and your furkids to discover. Only a small area accessed water so you don't have to worry about dirty, wet paws or drowning puppies. All the dogs were well-behaved (mostly unleashed) and all the owners were friendly and happy to introduce their furbabies to yours. There certainly were people there without pets but they were in the vast minority. As a matter of fact, if you come here without pets, you'll feel pretty left out.

Long story short, this is like doggie heaven! Big dogs and small dogs alike roam free, socialize with each other cordially, and magically know to stay just within sight of their owners despite the beautiful scenery and countless new smells to explore. I can't wait to come back!
author: Amaryllia L.

description: Dog Mecca! Best dog place hands down. Off leash. All dogs are well behaved. Beautiful and goes on for miles. My dogs were actually smiling and slept like babies after! Can't wait to go back.
author: Ashlee L.

description: Great walk/hike for the pooch and owner!
author: Ashley M.

description:
Can all dogs go to heaven? Yes. It is called Fort Funston, and it is pretty rockin' for two legged creature too, did I mention hang-gliding? Just wow. Everyone must visit this park, swing by Trader Joes on the way to get some snacks (on John Daly) and spend w few hours just kicking to the beat of birds and barks. 

People bring their kids, but there are dogs, so if you are cool with a doggie coming by to say hi, or running by if you will, then it is a great place for kids too.
author: Mary J.

description: You have to go! If you have a dog, you REALLY have to go. It's off-leash :) We went a little late and got there after dark, but still had lots of fun. I'm giving it 5 stars and am willing to bet that it's even better during the day.
author: Crystal W.

description:
Went this past weekend, had a great time! 

My boyfriend and I took our beagle mix, Max, here for a day in the sand. He is a little skiddish, and the for the most part all the other dog parks/beaches we have been too don't have too many dogs. But this place had almost too many dogs and my dog was scared. That is the only reason I gave it a four and not five. We still ended up spending the day there.
author: Roqui P.

description:
I am kicking myself for not having come here earlier...the fog of the area is rather off-putting at times.  I don't own a dog so I doggysit others'.  If i ever needed a dog fix, however, I would come here.  

The walk along the beach is awesome - you can go on for miles and miles (just don't forget that you have to turn around eventually & that there are no trashcans for poo bags anywhere).  My adopted dogs and I also climbed up the rocks and walked along the bluff - also amazingly gorgeous.  Careful though because I made the mistake of trying to go down to the beach via several sandy, steep hills...not the best idea. 

There are horses so if you see one coming, please try and lease or hold your dog.  

This place is reason #39492 why I need a dog.
author: Helen F.

description:
If you are looking to get your dog more dirty than they have ever been--look no further.  This is the place.  My golden loves to roll around in every patch of dirt on the property and then spend spend some time chasing the ball on the beach/in the water and then repeat.  Suffice to say, she's a muddy, cakey mess by the time we leave and head straight for our favorite, neighborhood self-service bath facility...

It's all worth it though.  When Callie is about due for a bath, we head to Fort Funston and kill two birds with one stone....or something like that.

Like all great things, I have to use this place in moderation......I imagine doggie heaven is something like this place, but my car cringes every time I punch in skyline boulevard into the navigation (still getting a hang of the directions).
author: Gary M.

description:
Doggie theme park?  Yup, I think so!

Fort Funston has a great cliff overlooking the ocean, hiking trails, and the ultimate freedom for any unleashed dog to enjoy the beach!  I wish there were more trash receptacles to dispose of ya-know-what, and the beach access can be a little steep (but you'll work that butt!), nevertheless, this is a great place, if not the best place, for dogs to party.  Parking is free, I suggest you come equipped with a light jacket, and no, you shouldn't swim, you might drown.

Ultimately, this park is great for anyone, but you must love dogs.  It is also NOT gated, which is something to consider if your pet is too young to know or too reckless to care!  But whether leashed-up or footloose & fancy-free, let 'em have a ball!
author: Diane N.

description: Beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean, and a chill respite compared to other parks in San Francisco.  As a lot of the reviews here say though, the ratio of dogs to people is about 2:1, so this is definitely the main SF dog park.  So, this may/may not be as tranquil as possible due to that, but the scenery just can't be beat.  That amazing Pacific Ocean air.  Fantastic.
author: Mel G.

description:
Saturday morning and the pup needs to exercise. We drove out here and he had a blast

Very scenic area although it gets more fog and wind than other areas nearby

Plus that dogs are allowed off leash but do keep an eye out as the bluffs are steep

Nice stroll and friendly attendees (human and 4 paws)
author: Ashley P.

description:
tap...tap...tap.tap.tap.tap. as it proceeds to get faster the closer I get. The excitement in Safari's eyes as I make that right turn into the parking lot. Sit! Stay! as she waits patiently before charging into the open space what we call "dog heaven". 

All I can say this place is beautiful and is a great place for you and your pup to stroll.
author: John B.

description: This place is amazing I love bringing my basset hound here it is so beautiful and it's right on the water you don't even have to have your dog on a leash! My dog loves going to the dog parts to make friends and everybody loves him this is by far the best dog park in California
author: Dustin C.

description: Amazing view, my dog loved it. Slept like a baby when he got back. I wish I lived closer, I would come everyday!
author: Lisa P.

description:
I never knew this place existed until my fiance told me about it.. Came by here on Labor Day, and my dog loved it!! There were soo many cute pups just running around! It was like doggy heaven for him! 
Since it was our first time we didn't know where to go, so we just started following a trail of people and dogs down the path which ended up to the dog beach, I like how the path is huge and your not crammed to one side. 

Note to self: walk down the staircases to the beach, and back up the other side. I had to stop a few times to catch my breathe until i made it back up, but it was well worth it.
author: Alida L.

description:
Awesome! 

Great place to take the dogs! It feels like cheating when you go without one! No leashes needed anywhere in the park, which is great if you have a good dog who listens! 

The walk down to the beach can be brutal, but it's worth it! And if you just wanna stop for a few minutes and not head down the the beach, there's a great area up by the parking lot with lots of area for the dogs to roam. Theres also great trails. It's absolutely beautiful! Seriously an amazing gem in San Francisco! 

The only thing we have to say is, if you bring your dog, pick up their poo! 

Other than great, it's the best place in the city to bring your dog, hands down! Love it! Love it! Love it!
author: Rebecca L.

description:
This is doggie heaven on Earth.  OMG - dogs LOVE this place.  There are sand dunes to wrestle on, trees to run through and the ocean to fetch the B A L L.  I've only visited a handful of times and there haven't been any problems.  

Ample parking, sufficiently secluded and on a mild day this is the best way to get your dog exercised.

The trek down to the beach is probably about an easy-medium or maybe medium level hike in the sand.  Not too bad going down, slightly challenging coming back up.  If you suffer any kinds of walking issues this might not be the place to consider taking your dog to the beach.  The rest of the hike is 95-99% flat. 
If you do make it down to the beach there's supposed to be an alternate way up that's more challenging than the "normal" way (you'll know which one is the normal one when you're there - it's obvious).  So, for those looking for a little push in your day's adventure, look for that alternate way up.  

The only other "complaint" is that as far as I know there is only one place to get water, though I've heard that there's a second.... 

Thank you Golden Gate Parks for having this available for dogs to run free and off-leash.  They're so happy when they're there.
author: Maria H.

description: Fantastic, expansive park. A great place to watch the sunset and of course, bring dogs. There's plenty to see and the dogs have lots of space to run around. But because the dogs can roam freely, it can be difficult to call them back. The parking lot is big; there are lots of parking spots, but it can get busy.
author: Andrew L.

description:
The coastal views are stunning, so as a scenic spot, I give Fort Funston five stars. It's definitely worth a trip, in particular, if you have out-of-town visitors, hang glide, or have a dog. 

As a place to go running, however, I'd give Fort Funston three stars. I know other reviewers say there are great trails, but for the life of me, I can't figure out a way to go for a more-than-three mile run here without crossing the very busy Skyline Boulevard over to Lake Merced. Or heading straight down (and then worse, back up) a dramatic decline.

It's best to come here on a sunny day. Back in WWII, my grandfather, after returning from Guadalcanal, was stationed in Vallejo and spent a week at Fort Funston as Executive Officer of an AA Battery. They were supposed to engage in target practice, but the fog never lifted, so they were finally sent away. Sixty-plus years later, his granddaughter moved out here and ended up living five miles from Fort Funston. The battery is still there. And yup, it's still foggy.
author: Susan S.

description: Great place for my dog! Definitely worth a drive from Vallejo to spend a few hours with my dog, the outdoors and nature. All dogs run wild and free here. Huge open area, trails and of course the beach! So glad they have something for dogs.
author: Mary A.

description: LOVELOVELOVE Fort Funston!  Not only is it dog heaven it's gorgeous!  The views, the greenery, the cliffs are beautiful.  It's a testament to the dog walkers of the cleanliness of the area who take care to pick up after their charges.  The dogs are happy to be in the fresh, brisk air and so are their peeps.  Great place to spend a couple of hours even if you don't have dogs.
author: A P.

description:
Fort Fun! My dog's favorite place on earth.
We had great adventures in the tunnels when I was a kid. Unfortunately, they're all sealed off now.
author: Patrick S.

description: It is surreal how  beautiful this place is.  The trails are in wide open spaces, surrounded by lush succulents, and you get an amazing view of the ocean and beach on top.  When you're on the beach, you're right by tall sandy cliffs and cute dogs walking all around you.  There's also some ruins with some cool graffiti.  I really can't describe how beautiful and majestic this place is.  Just go!!
author: Lily N.

description: Crazy great dog place! The beach, trails, view all super. Our furry guy had the best time. Even our non furry kids had a terrific time. According to them, this is the BEST DOG WALKING SPOT EVER! Kids loved climbing Battery Davis and all the funky forts around. Actually came on a Sunday and found it to be pretty busy, but since the place is so vast, it didn't seem crowded at all. Our doggy found plenty of friends to chase and play with. Parking lot was pretty full, but we found a spot pretty easily. Love that it's off leash. Wouldn't hurt to have a few more trash cans around. Makes life easier on the poop scene. Other than that, it's all good!
author: Cindy F.

description: Yep, we've lived in SF for almost 25 years and today was our first visit to Fort Funston.  We will be back.  This place is an incredible place for ocean vistas, butt work-outs and dog lovers.
author: Esther R.

description:
Had ourselves a good good timeee. I've been searching for a dog friendly off leash beach, and I had actually had my heart set on Capitola but I was too lazy for the drive so I settled for Fort Funston. Fort Funston was pretty fun, you have to walk down this steep hill of sand to get down to the actual beach area which makes you feel extra safe to let your dog run around. Oh, and before you actually get to the actual beach area you have to walk quite a ways from the parking lot but I liked that about Fort Funston. 

The only negative thing about this beach is that it's really dirty! I was expecting nice clean sand like Capitola so I wore flip flops and that was a big mistake! I was getting stabbed left and right by sticks and whatever miscellaneous things in the sand.  Andddd... most of the sand is black!? What's that about? 

I'd definitely come back here again but I'll know to wear some shoes!

++I found some whole sanddollars!
author: Vicky C.

description: This place will make your doggy run around like they're on crack! They have a huuuuuge area to romp their grounds. My pug was so tired near the end I had to carry her.
author: Sam T.

description:
I have a lab. A lab that loves water even more than food (if that is possible). She loves nothing more than a trip to Fort Funston. It is one of the only places in the bay area where your dog can be a dog. (so for those of you complaining that you or your baby was scared by all the big dogs running around... go to one of the other 1 million places where humans rule and let our big dogs have at least ONE place to play). 

On a sunny day when the tide is low you can walk along the dunes down to the beach then kick off your shoes and wade in and out of the freezing water with your enthusiastic pet. After about a half mile walk down the beach you climb back up the dunes and if you have done it correctly, your dog should be worn out for at least a few days! 

warning: if it is cold and foggy in SF it is even COLDER and FOGGIER at Funston. It doesn't stop us from bundling up and enjoying it anyway. 

We usually immediately follow a trip to Funston with a trip to the "doggy car wash" at pet food express.
author: Meagan C.

description: Dog owners read up!  This is one of, if not the best places around San Fran to take your dog.  Literally a mile of un-leash run anywhere beaches, including acres of huge sand dunes, trailways that are just fun for both dog and owners! Beach itself is very windy, but if you walk around above before heading down the dunes to the beach, you can find all kinds of places to have a picnic and just relax.  It's a popular hanglider and para-sail spot, so heads up!  Parking is fine, theres enough around. Go now!
author: Michael C.

description: Very natural and exploratory environment for dogs and humans.  A true, off-leash, laid back park where you and your dog can enjoy a lengthy walk on the beach, the dunes, and the trail getting there.  I only went for a short time since my dog was recovering from recent surgery, but will go back for a longer walk when she's better.  I highly recommend this park for active dogs.  My only caution is that the dogs can get a little wild in this great atmosphere, and as a result require more guidance from their humans.  I saw 2 dog 'conflicts' forming, and fortunately they did not escalate.  So, +5 for the dogs, +5 for the nature, and some caution (sorry only a 4) for the humans.  Just keep an eye on your dog and keep him/her out of conflict and you will have a great time.
author: Kim A.

description:
Yogi the chihuahua was invited to ft. "fun"ston today for his girlfriend Roxie the Doxie's birthday/adoption day, and i don't know who had more fun - him or me.  

first of all, it was a GORGEOUS day, beautiful clouds, a few rain drops but not enough to soak us, just enough to make us appreciate the sunshine that followed, lots of people and dogs, hang gliders, and huge waves that made me feel as small as the chihuahua running next to me.

i've only let yogi off leash in an unsecured area a few times because his foster mom had said he was a little houdini, but his lady friend stays close to mom and dad, and i was hoping he'd stay close to his lady so i let him go.  first thing he did was run out in to the parking lot and i frantically chased him around cars and other dogs, heart pounding (i think he thought me chasing him was a game), but then he ran out from under a car and i grabbed him and gave him a little tug on his neck and he seemed to listen to me after that - and we had a great great day. 

i have never seen Yogi so happy, side by side w/ his Roxie, chasing birds, getting chased in turn by seafoam, avoiding the lapping waves (he doesn't like water too much), running like the freakin' wind!  i tried to keep up with him but i couldn't.  and one time i turned around, and yogi was IN THE WATER!  WOOHOO!  i finally have my beach dog!  we ran along the beach for what seemed like miles and miles of beautful coastline, and stayed until the sun started to go down.  we hiked up in the trails around the ice plants and dunes, and as we neared the parking lot, got buzzed by a hang glider (i almost dropped down on my belly, it freaked me out).  we stood at the top of the hill to catch our breaths and enjoy the views, the beautiful sun between the clouds and the hang glider soaring through the sun's rays.  

breathtaking.  simply breathtaking.

i used to come down here in high school to drink beers and have bonfires with my buddies, but it has such a different meaning to me now - it's one of the places that makes me so happy that i was born in this beautiful city, and that i came back here to stay. it's a place where you can drive only a few miles and feel like you're far far away from city life, where you can catch your breath, and let your dog enjoy being a dog.

a true amusement park for dogs and people alike.
author: Suzanne A.

description:
I love bringing my little Lhasa-Poo out here.  Its a diverse crowd of people and dogs.  

I used to go here in High School with my Cross Country team because of the many sand hills.  Whenever anyone mentioned Fort Funston back then, I always associated it with painful hill drills.   I didn't know that if I just went uphill about 0.25 miles more, there would be an off leash haven for dogs!  

Now I go here at least once every two weeks to get a good jog in with my dog.  I try to spend about 30-45 min here.  He loves it!  You can walk a paved path, or be a little adventurous and take the Horse Trails.

Make sure to bring a good jacket with you.  Even if it looks nice and sunny, the wind coming off of the ocean is almost always cold.
author: Rosalyn D.

description:
This park is simply amazing!

Besides being a dog's paradise (I can picture my dog dreaming about going to Fort Funston again), the park has breathtaking views, nice trails, beach access and everything else you need to enjoy a nice outdoors day with your dog. 

Don't have a dog? No problem at all, you can still enjoy all the trails and views - and you will have the chance to play with other people dogs.

The park is clean, the trails are well maintained, they have doggy bags, a water fountain and a lot of parking spaces.

Almost all dogs here are off leash and as weird as this may sound, things work good and everybody (including owners) behave, so be ready for a lot of dog/people interaction.
author: Gisele M.

description: This is a super place to take your dog off-leash and it was truly enjoyable for me too. Only small negative is it can feel a bit crowded at times. Fun on the dunes, fun on the paths, fun on the beach. Don't miss the beach if you go...
author: Julie W.

description: Happy hounds abound at this great dog beach!  We love visiting here as much as our  greyhound Cleo does.
author: Cary G.

description:
AMAZING!!!

Fort Funston offers sandy walks along the ocean, as well as trails on the cliffs above. This old military lookout provides an amazing view of the San Francisco and San Mateo coastlines. Hang gliders are drawn here for both the strong winds and the thrilling descent over the Pacific. You can also expect to see scores of pooches romping along the beach--it's a haven for dog walkers!
author: Marie L.

description: Such a fun place to walk around! Dogs are OK off-leash and there are lots of trails to explore. You can cut through the trees to the cliffs above the ocean or walk down to the beach and watch the gliders take off. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit here!
author: Amanda M.

description: When the hang gliders are flying along the cliff face, this place is pretty awesome the first time you see it. After a few visits, it's still cool, but it becomes more of a place to take a nice walk.
author: Michael S.

description: Great area for photography and hikes. The trail is a great exercise and the old cement bunkers are a treat to photographers. Photographers will see the potential for photos throughout the whole trail. While hiking do not just keep your head down watching your step but try to look up at your surroundings or you might miss a moment to snap your next profile shot. Do be careful climbing or entering any of the bunkers, they are solid but also falling on cement structures in general is terrible. Enjoy the trail.
author: Kelvin M.

description:
It puts the FUN in Funston!

Ok, really, really unoriginal bad jokes aside, this place is awesome. I walked here, in my KATE SPADES, and had sand in them the whole time. But you know what? WHO CARES! Molly (the doggie!) had fun, and I was stopping every 5 fucking seconds going "awwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww look at that dooooggggggggggiiiiiiiieeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee"

And yes, it was just as annoying to hear as it is to read.

I hadn't walked along the beach in such a long time! I got to cut open a dead jellyfish (weird, isn't it? It was AWESOME), and a dog came barrelling at me full speed ahead and damn near knocked me over. Kinda like in those movies where you're like "get. out. of. the. WAY. YOU. IDIOT." Oh yeah, I totally saw it coming. Did I move? Nah. Why? Because I'm an idiot.

I can't wait to come back!! :D I'd bring my cat if she wasn't such a baby.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Fort Funston is why I could never leave the Bay area, without feeling like my heart was being squeezed into a pair of too tight designer "no really we're a size 29" pair of  jeans.

Fort Funston will make you cry it's so remarkably close, open, free,  and poignantly breathaking

Your dog will thank you with wet salty kisses all the way home if you take them to this leashless city diamond. 

With a plethora of dogs to play with, big and luckily fast birds to chase, miles of soft thick bland sand, countless sandy mountain trails, and never-ending Pacific froth to frolick in - Fort Funston is the Cedar Point of San Francisco for dogs. 

One visit here will make you a better person.

Promise.
author: Jessica T.

description: This place made me want to immediately pack up my things in Brooklyn and head for California. Gorgeous sunsets, trails, and plenty of adorable dogs to look at (or walk your own!) I was here alone just before dark and felt completely safe.
author: Betta L.

description:
This is the greatest place to walk a dog in SF and the GGNRA is proposing to strip away our rights to walk off-leash @ Fort Funston. 

PLEASE LOOK AT THE ARTICLE LINKED BELOW AND COMMENT ON THE PLAN OR ATTEND A PUBLIC HEARING. If we don't make our opposition heard, this will go into effect soon!

http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/01/13/MNKG1H7EMU.DTL

Ways to respond to the proposed plan:
Public hearings on plan

See the plan or comment beginning Friday at parkplanning.nps.gov/dogplan.

Sound off

March 2: 4 to 8 p.m., Tamalpais High Student Center, 700 Miller Ave., Mill Valley.

March 5: 11 a.m. to 4 p.m., San Francisco State University, Seven Hills Conference Center, State Drive, S.F.

March 7: 4 to 8 p.m., Fort Mason Center, Building A, Marina Boulevard at Buchanan Street, S.F.

March 9: 4 to 8 p.m. at Cabrillo School, 601 Crespi Drive, Pacifica.


Read more: http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/01/12/MNKG1H7EMU.DTL&ao=2#ixzz1AvjBoJlQ
author: Anya S.

description:
I'm not going to be the 500th person to write a novel on how great this is. Just know that it is, especially if you're a dog owner. some quick tips:

1) get here before 11 or good luck on parking
2) Dress for super windy/cold conditions, i.e. pants or thick sweats
3) wear shoes that will get super dirty
4) control your dog - running around and playing - good, running around running into strangers - not good. 
5) theres a beach access to the north of the main parking lot by the hang gliders, and one right next to it south of the launching area. 

Otherwise, you'll figure it all out - enjoy!
author: Nick W.

description:
Little Maddie loves the beach. So many new things to sniff and explore!! So obviously Ft Funston is one of her favorite places for an afternoon romp!!

Little Maddie gives it 5 paws so why not more than 2 stars from me? 

Apparently the secret is out (has been out? never was a secret?) with every dogwalker and their crew bringing their group of dogs here. I've seen numerous dogs do the #2 from these groups and the walker is either oblivious trying to keep track of their group or maybe just doesn't care? Just because it's not on the main path doesn't mean it's OK.

I always pick up after my dog, have come to several beach cleanups here, and have spare bags to pick up after the other lazy walker and owners who don't. Still, this is the only place where I've gotten yelled at (on numerous occasions) as Maddie does her thing "YOU AREN"T THINKING OF LEAVING THAT THERE ARE YOU?!?" 

Why don't you STFU and wait for my dog to finish and see what I do before raising your voice at me?!? Sigh. Yelled at by the militant hang-gliders again and again.

I think I know now why I haven't taken up hang-gliding. A prerequisite seems to be that you have to be an @ss! I apologize now to any dog friendly hang-gliders out there!! Maybe you can hang with me at Ft Funston?!?  :)  OK, truth be told, they are probably used to seeing a high percentage of PnRs (Poop-n-Runs), but still, can't I get the benefit of the doubt? You don't have to be that proactive, do you?

So there it is. -3 stars to keep my therapy bills down!!

Location: 20 Stars
Dog walkers/owners who don't pick up after their dogs: -10 Stars (you give all dog owners a bad name).
Hang gliders with sh*tty attitude: -20 Stars (don't yell at people until you have reason to)

Oh, and Maddie says don't forget a towel, when you bring your dog to the beach. Your car will thank you when Fido has finished his romping in the sand and surf.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Damn dogs! If I didn't have two I wouldn't have to waste half my life taking care of them and the other half clarifying to people that I'm not gay while having two Malteses under each arm. Now there's nothing wrong with being gay but sometimes I think I should have just gotten a rottweiler. 

So I headed to Fort Funston for the first time for DYB. I drove straight there from working all night. The first great thing I noticed was plenty of parking. If I had to look for parking I swear I'd probably fall asleep at the wheel.

The park is well kept and they offer pick up bags in case you forgot yours. Definitely a nice touch. LG (my dog) and I climbed down the stairs to the beach. There was a lot of stairs but all 3lbs of LG was able to navigate down. http://images.yelp.com/photo?id=xlfrhrT8NzaQUkCBzskYFQ&s=l That was good because it wore him out. Then we got to the beach and it was so freaking beautiful. It's a huge park so if you need your space you'll going to find it. 

After DYB was over I needed to get some Zzzzzs so I made a sand pillow and laid down by the cliff. LG became my heater as he laid on my chest and we spent a few hours sleeping to the sound of the waves. It was a bit cold but I needed to get some sleep and I wasn't about to walk the 300 steps up the cliff in my crappy condition.

I expected at least one dog to come up and accost LG and I from out nap but it never happened. The dog owners that come out here seem to be responsible and though other reviews have mentioned dog crap everywhere but I found it  pretty clean. 

There are cliffs, stairs and waves so you might want to keep an eye out on your dog if they like to dart off to places. And it's a beach so your puppy is probably going to need a bath afterwards. 

But it's a beautiful, there's hangliders and it's clean. What else can you ask for? 
_______________________________________________

Who the hell am I joking? 5 stars for all the hot girls that were out there!!!!! That's what else you can ask for!
author: Dan T.

description:
This place has such beautiful views! I loved looking out from the cliffs. The hang gliders were in full-force. My dog seemed to have a lot of fun, though if your pooch is shy, be warned that dogs are allowed off their leash here. My dog does not get aggressive at all but too many dogs got right up in her face with their humans nowhere in sight, and she was definitely getting overwhelmed. She is very friendly but also a bit timid, which we are working on. It was also difficult for her to be comfortable at the designated water stations/water bowls, because more confident (and some very big) doggies run up off-leash an lap away at the water, all at the same time, sharing the bowl. So if your dog is shy or you are still working on their socialization, it is a good idea to bring some backup water and a bowl in case they are too overwhelmed to share. My dog kept backing up to let everyone else rehydrate. 
  I'd like to see some owners have a little more of an eye on their dogs. Tons of owners do, but this is dog central, and many don't. I get that it's a real treat to have your pet run around and be free but there were some so far away from their owners, you had no idea who they belonged to and their owners would take quite a while to reach them. It's important to be within reach of your dog for their own safety and everyone else's. I personally was not comfortable letting my dog off-leash (12 lb terrier) until we were in a secluded area a ways away from the cliff edges. I usually let her off-leash when on a flat beach, but the beach here is more of a mud beach, not sand you can lay your blanket out on. Kind of a bummer, but there is plenty of sand up on the cliffs for you to pick your own little spot to hang out at. I don't know what other ways there are down to the beach, but we went down the sandy hill... fun going down, strenuous going up (I'm a little outta shape!) So next time, I am sticking to the hill tops. I enjoyed the views more from there anyhow. All-in-all a fun place, just have to familiarize myself with the trails more.
author: Manda S.

description:
I've tried to come here before but always managed to miss the sign and ended up at Lake Merced.  Now that I know where it is, I hope to bring the dogs whenever the weather permits.  

We took the hill down onto the beach and the dogs went nuts.  Neither are water lovers, which is good since I don't think they could've fought the current, but they loved running up and down the beach.   There were a lot more big dogs than small ones but the little guys did great off leash.

The walk back up the hill was slower than coming down but we had some happy and tired out (middle aged) puppies.  Always the best kind.
author: Seong P.

description:
Awesome, not only if you have a dog, but if you like to walk! Of course there are dogs there, but the area originally wasn't meant for them. I remember going out there when I was a kid, running through the "batteries" while my aunts were enjoying something or other, lol.

Most of the people seem to know each other out there. If your dog is friendly, it's a great place to walk them off leash. Unfortunately there are some people that don't have etiquette and don't seem to know how to walk their dog, let alone command their dog. 

Mornings M-F are best, even in the fog! I actually prefer when it's foggy b/c the dog doesn't get tired out as easily. Weekends I stay clear of this area b/c it does get crowded with the weekend trendy dog owners.

Great place to get some exercise and get your dog some exercise too. Bring your Chuck-it and toss the ball into some sand dunes. Lots of water bowls in the 2 designated "water fountains". Bathrooms up at the end of the parking lot. Be sure to bring your own plastic bags, there are a few now and then in case you forget.
author: Dina V.

description:
This place has a lot of breath taking views and an interesting climate for a location so far away from all the attractions.

LA and downtown SF are nice places, but what I hate about them are that they aint the happiest places on Earth at all when you could come over to this place. There is absolute peace here. A place where homeless and wealthy could get along without some government jackass telling me shit about them.

Hell you could even take your dog out here and let him wreak havoc on the place if you wanted too.

Get some beers and we're all made.
author: Jacen W.

description:
Yeah!  After a few years of begging my husband to take us to Fort Funston, today was the day!

We actually started playing in the field right next to the parking lot.  But look yonder, and you see ocean and trails.... and dogs, everywhere!

There is a very cool dog bowl/water area... you see interesting dog breeds congregate to sniff each other's asses and slurp up some water.  Wouldn't it be funny if humans did that upon meeting?  OKAY, maybe not funny.

It's a leashed park, but not too many people observe it.  There were so many interesting and friendly people to chit chat with.  I met so many dogs and hippies today.  

The place is a haven for dogs.  If you take a stroll down to the beach, make sure you can make it back up hill.   My dog waited for us at the top of the hill and watched me sweat.  If he could talk it would have sounded like this:

'Come on, MOM.... there are so many more things for me to smell!  HURRY UP MOM!  I.... CAN'T..... WAIT!'
author: Emily S.

description: Best place to let you doggies frolic and socialize with their fellow canines. The walk to the end of the park is a beautiful one. It's kept clean and is the perfect off leash place!
author: Linnea H.

description:
This place can cheer me up in minutes. My 2 boys love it as much as I do. It is a dog lovers dream and a great way to spend a few hours. It is so much fun to look at all the various beautiful dog breeds and chat with owners.
Why pay to go to a small indoors puppy social. Free fun! 
Highly Reccomended
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I love coming down here and watching all the hang gliders, people with their remote controlled planes and people walking around the beach. 

It is a 5 minute drive for me to get here but it seems like I am a lot farther away. Away from all the craziness of work and the world, just sitting on the sands and watching the waves crash in the sands with the occasional freight container going by.
author: M C.

description:
uhm, can you say DOG HEAVEN?!

First time I came here was on Christmas day, and it seemed like everyoneee who has a dog was there! This is the only place I would not complain about so many people being at! Everyone's dogs are off leash and they get to run and chase each other like crazy! It's definitely a great place to take your dog to release lots of energy and get social skills in. 

When you walk down the trail you see the amazing view of the beach down below and on the other side you see the view of the city and you can even spot the bridge. It's beautiful to walk down the beach during sunset. I would come here just to walk even without a dog!
author: Annissa H.

description:
Good place to do a little trail running with awesome views.  They also have a trail going down to the beach, but don't forget you'll eventually have to walk back up!

I only wish I had a dog!!! or maybe 3... =*(
author: Jina R.

description: We took my goddog Olive here this weekend. She has been a lot and totally loves it. She's a puppy and adores other dogs. I found some of the areas sort of gross, and the beach is a little gross, but I guess that's why dogs love it? I'd like to come back here when it's not as foggy, if that ever happens.
author: Julia D.

description:
FORT FUNSTON IS THE BEST!! Such a glorious place to be :) I love it just as much as (maybe more) than all the pups do. I look forward to coming here each weekend.

Such a vast and gorgeous park near the ocean. Dogs frolic about and are able to just be dogs. Dog lovers everywhere. You can take hikes, walk the trails, explore wherever you want! Walking down to the beach takes some time, but it is heaven!

Love this place :)
author: Joanna M.

description:
This is the best place on earth if you have a dog that needs to socialize or get socialized.  Lots of open area to roam, lots of dogs, birds, cliffs, hills, trails, sand, and the beach.  You must clean up after your pet and while you're down there it's nice to help somebody else for forgot to pick up theirs.   

It is a public area so it's best to keep an eye on your pets at all times.  There are a lot of friendly people that regular the area, but watch out for the first timers with their dogs in chains of steel, spikes or three forms of shock collars.  Anything that needs to be controlled with hardware as serious as that needs to find another place to exercise their pets, but nobody can really stop them except us.  The local wacko's are pretty harmless and it's fun to catch a short conversation or story to pass the time.  

Take the log stairs to the left of the hang gliders for a crazy fun work out.  You're also welcome to find the hidden trails on the sides of the cliffs for a change of scenery.  The Horse Trail is nice, but watch out for the road below and leash your dog if they have selective hearing.

Whatever you do, please keep the place clean and don't cause problems.  They are trying to shut this place down for years and it's the last free place for dogs to be dogs.
author: Grenache G.

description:
Bring field glasses to watching hang gliders and hawks.
Bring the dog to enjoy an off-leash romp.
Bring a jacket because it's often windy.
author: Ken B.

description:
Late at night when I am dreaming and twitching my paws and letting out little woofs and yips-- I am fantasizing about my one and only day I had visiting fort funston.   I got to frolic along side friendly pups, chase the ball out  into the ocean over and over, greet nice people and roll around on the warm sand.  A labrador's dream.
If there is a doggie heaven it would be just like this place.
 Too bad L.A. has nothing to even compare it to.
The owners said they had fun there, too.  
Someone else said they should have a snack bar here... I also love snack bars.  Maybe by the time I get around to visiting again, there will be one.
author: Roach D.

description: I don't know how I had lived in SF so long and never been to Fort Funston!  Now that I have a dog, many other dog owners recommended it.  We checked it out last weekend, and I don't think I've ever seen our dog so happy!  So many well-behaved dogs frolicking in the waves, all for him to chase!  Plus, they do a beautiful job maintaining the trails and the dunes with native plants.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
What a beautiful place! When you look for it on the map, you'll see that it's not at all far from "civilization," but when you are there, it's like you are in a whole separate world. Aside from this, the best part about coming here is watching the hang gliders. I don't think I'd ever have the courage to take off over a cliff, but watching the pros do it so effortlessly makes me feel like I could. 

For those of you with dogs, this is a great place to run your dog. Why go to some dried up city park, when you can come here and enjoy the ocean scenery, poke around the pre-WWII battery, and watch the gliders. Just don't forget to dress in layers with a sturdy windbreaker on top--the wind out here can be quite ferocious.
author: Katie I.

description: Definitely the best dog park in San Francisco. Just be prepared to leave with a dirty dog.
author: David I.

description: DOG PARK!!!  dogs, dogs, dogs.  and if you want to go to the beach its a nice little hike!
author: Patrick W.

description:
simply beautiful....
the views, the landscape, and the site of hang gliders soaring past and above the observation. If you are a dog lover then this is the place for you....lovely
author: Patrick K.

description:
If you haven't figured it out yet, this is an awesome place for you and your dog.  Here are a few pointers I have found out to make you enjoy the park/beach more.  
First, you will be covered in sand- in places you wouldn't think you could get sand in.  Bring any necessary things (towels, etc.) to make getting home easy and clean.
Second, this is the sunset/daly city area so you won't see the sun much (I spent a year in the outer sunset- ah, the year I missed summer!).  So bring a wide arrange of clothes to accommodate.
Third, a nice tip if you want your dog to go into the water you might want to wear swim trunks and get in their with him/her.  I have seen a few guys doing this and I wish I would have thought of it. 
Forth, besides at the top, there aren't any places to get water for your dog so bring some.  I have made this mistake and it won't be repeated (either for her or for me).  

Have Fun!
author: Scott J.

description:
Fort Funston is one of the few off leash dog parks in San Francisco.  This is Turbo & my favorite hangout on a nice and sunny day.  We love visiting the area because dogs and people are allowed to be carefree and close to nature. Thanks to all the volunteers that participate in frequent group clean-ups, this national park is very well-kept and provides its visitors with a sense of ease and relaxation.  For the most part, visitors with pets are very considerate and do pick up after their dogs. Plastic bags are provided along the path in case dog owners forget to bring their own bags.  

It's also great that there's something for everyone at Fort Funston... whether it's hiking along the trails... walking along the paved paths... or romping on the beach... everyone that visits Fort Funston seems to have a great time.  It's a very family-oriented place and one of the few places where there's an absolute breath-taking view of both the ocean and the city of SF.
author: Vindy C.

description: A beautiful place to hang out with your dog and watch the world go by. It's not only for dogs and I recommend it for people who want a great view of the Pacific ocean and the city.
author: Sheila T.

description: expedia .com has lost its lack lust, they were reponsible  for sending me to a hell holecall town hotel no parking no heating i had an asthma attqack i am goin g yo sue the he ll out of town hotel and exxpedia the new
author: Donovan M.

description:
This beach area is large, expansive and great for walks and runs. The stairs leading down to the beach is quite a trek and it can be very windy so bring a jacket. All dogs are off leash and the area seems pretty clean with owners picking up their dog's waste. They also offer hang gliding here so that indicates just how windy this area can get. 

Only downside was lack of easily accessible restrooms. Also since it is an "off leash" area with many dogs frequenting, there is always a risk that dogs are not behaved or are aggressive. 

We experienced just that when a dog, completely unprovoked by my dog was attacked with 2 puncture wounds requiring emergency vet treatment. The owner still has not accepted responsibility and as all dogs are off leash, the county or animal control cannot do much given the leash law is not being followed. And since the stairs leading off the beach are pretty steep, it was an ordeal to get my injured pet up the stairs and to the ER. 

Other than that horrible experience, the dog beach is a great escape and excercise adventure so close to the area.
author: Stella C.

description:
Fort Dog Fun!

Hang gliders, doggies, and views oh my!

To get to the beach is a bit of trek but its never crowded and always relaxing. This is a great place to people watch, dog watch, bird watch, and dolphin watch. Critters everywhere!

The parking lot can be a madhouse.
author: Jordan P.

description:
If you love Fort Funston as much as I do, please know that the GGNRA (Golden Gate National Recreation Area) is looking to limit off leash dogs here and ithroughout the GGNRA. Please see the following FaceBook page for more information:

https://www.facebook.com/saveoffleash?sk=wall

make your official comment here:

http://www.parkplanning.nps.gov/projectHome.cfm?projectId=11759

Thanks!
author: Amy L.

description: Go watch the hang gliders, off leash dogs, and find the cool caves and watch a sunset.  It's Fort Fun to the dog lovers.
author: Heather M.

description:
Wow! I found this place on Yelp and explored it today with my German shepherd, and we loved it! It's a true paradise for dogs of all sizes and breeds, and their owners. Just imagine an enormous scenic area with trails, woods and the ocean beach where you can walk your dog unleashed everywhere. 

There were hundreds of dogs there today, running, and playing, and enjoying freedom, from toy terrier to Great Dane. But the whole area seemed pretty clean, probably because the park was equipped with waste bags and cans, and also water fountains and bowls for our four-paws friends.

Few tips: 

- Don't forget to take your warm jacket cause this place is rather windy. 
- There are paved trails in the park but there is still lots of sand around. Prepare to shake it out of your shoes.
- Your dog will need a good bath after walk, to wash out the unusual black sand from the beach.
author: Marina O.

description:
In my next life, I want to come back as spoiled doggie with parents that will travel near and far so that I can romp, play, and sniff other doggie butts (I mean, make the acquaintance of other pooches). And, I want them to bring me here! 
This place pretty much has it all:
Sandy beach
Sandy trails
Sandy stairways to heaven (great work out for the quads)
LOTS of sand, so attire your feet properly - or, don't (but beware, there are LOT of turd-mines)
And hang gliding! 

I love this place, and our rabid doggie did too. Woof!
author: Kara B.

description:
Love Fort Funston.  Have been coming here with my dog/s for over 10 years.  Beautiful scenery, lots of nice people, 2 water holes for the dogs to quench their thirst, lots of room for the dogs to run around, access to the beach... My only complaint is all the dog walkers that bring WAY TOO many dogs at a time!  This has become increasingly worse in recent years. It's not only irresponsible, but unfair to the rest of the people that share the park.  They're way less likely to be able to pick up after a dozen dogs, less likely to be able to manage their dogs if something should happen, and are much more likely to lose one of the dogs (as I've seen all of these incidents more than enough times).  
BUT, it's still pretty much the best doggie park I've been to.
author: A T.

description:
Dogs everywhere--It was great!
We joined the yelp group there this morning for our first fort funston experience and we loved it! The best part is that it's the perfect beach to let your dog off leash. I was nervous about letting "Lucy" roam free since she's only 5 months old and hasn't quite mastered "come" yet, but I had no need to worry. It's not technically enclosed, but there's nowhere for them to go unless they plan to swim west. The beach is at the end of a long, sorta steep, sandy stairway. Once you get to the bottom, the cove area is sheltered by the cliffs and the pups can run and play to their hearts' content.
author: nicole c.

description: This is my favorite spot for a dog's day out!  The views are amazing, the weather is nice, and the beach is awesome!  There is a ton of parking so even on the busiest days, there is room for you and your four legged family members.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Best...Place...Evarrrrr!  Take my dogs down here at least two times a month as a treat.  Plenty of beach to run at low tide and also a great place for owners to explore local flora y fauna
author: Maiyah M.

description: What's not to like about a giant park for dogs? My dog, Waggly, loves this place. He can poop and pee anywhere he likes without a leash. He loves to run with all the big dogs at the beach and pretend he's one of them (he's a terrier mix, 21lbs), even though he's always in last place. This place is great!
author: Laura L.

description:
What a great, scenic walk with your dogs! Its really a one of a kind spot that I have never seen before and I've lived in the bay area all my life!

The dogs love running on the beach and its a great place to take a hike.

This is going to be my go-to beach for dogs now. I wish I had discovered this place sooner.
author: Elisa C.

description:
One of my new favorite places... I can run and be freeeeeee!!!!   Easy drive up to  SF downtown for some good eats.  
Great friendly dogs and owners:  very happy place!
The sand is really dark and there is a sewer pipe that drains out into the bay :-(  
Kinda gross so I have to get a bath when I get home from mucky icky sand.
author: Leila A.

description: Stunning, dog-friendly beach with amazing views of the Pacific and the Nor Cal shoreline.  It's a pretty good hike with some rolling hills and wet sandy beaches, so wear shoes that you don't mind getting sandy/muddy.  There's a large (free!) parking lot adjacent to the top of the beach.  Our little dog had a great time as did we.
author: Tara C.

description: Fantastic, huge, leash free sand dune and beach dog park with hang gliders and the most beautiful scenery. Doggie Disney World, but better. Best dog park I've ever seen.
author: Nate P.

description: Hi everyone! We would like to share you all how happy I was when my husband discovered this wonderful place at Fort Funston in SF yesterday, with my brother in- law John and my kids. It was a marvelous experience  for us to explore this location . We were able  to  spend quality time together  especially with my brother-in-law. He doesn't go out that much and but we were happy that we were able to bring him along. We also brought our dog Aris, to Fort Funston as well. The ocean, the scent of the air, and watching hang gliders soar was amazing. There are also numerous hiking routes, scenery, historic, & bunkers. All kind of places explore. It's a perfect place for a hike and quality time with friends, & family,  better yet--- with your dogs !!! It's a dog heaven for sure.  It's a great  place to bring your dog to play and socialize. I am going to attach the pictures for you to see the photos. I hope someday we will be able to go to this place.
author: N T.

description: Went here just yesterday and had a doggie date.  My dog is tiny and was kind of scared at first seeing all the big dogs around but she kind of gotten into it later but would be close to my side when she felt threatened.  It's her own insecurity but in reality all the dogs and owners here are very friendly and it's basically dog heaven.  It's super clean as well and some of the trails give you an amazing view of the beach. Definitely a very cute fun place for everyone.
author: Kim D.

description:
Where else can a terrier-mutt run buck wild and come home, run straight to bed, and fall asleep for hours?  I'm talking wild!  Beautiful walk along the beach for the human companions too.

As a side note, horses walk here too, so don't forget to leash up or be ready to control your little guys when you see them coming.
author: Melissa M.

description:
393 reviewers, solid 5 stars, this truly is DOGGY HEAVEN! 

I'm so glad we were able to find this place through Yelp, and even more glad to experience it on such an awesome, warm, holiday weekend. 

We went here on Labor Day Sunday around noon. You park on the side of the road, where you see other cars parked, and you start walking up the trail. The hike is a tiny bit strenuous; mostly because my husband hurt his back the week before, and I wasn't very useful at helping to carry anything. At one point, you have to climb down a muddy cliff to get to the beach. 

Tips: 
1. Bring a beach chair/umbrella 
2. Pack LIGHT. Expect wet dogs to jump all over your blankets if you have them out. 
3. Bring a light lunch/drinks. 
4. Again, lots of wet dogs...don't wear your nicest clothes out here. 
5. Your doggy will come home a sandy, wet, slobbery mess. Prep the car for sand, and get a doggy shower ready right when you get home. 

Hamlet the little love pug had the time of his life there. First time seeing sand, water, rocks. Everyone there is a dog lover, so it's OK to have your dog off leashed, even during the hike. 

There were NO aggressive dogs out there. Not even one. I hope it stays that way. 

Hubby is the overbearing, hovering doggy owner, so he had a hard time at first having Hamlet off-leash. But once he gained trust by always coming back, hubby was able to relax and drink his heini's in peace. 

-1 star for no people bathrooms that I could find. :(
author: Vi Y.

description:
Fort Funston is a perfect place for doggies!! i love bringing my dog to here because he can socialize with other dogs and plus he can run around thru the sand. what a perfect place! 

If you dont have a dog Fort Funston is a great place to hike and exercise too. Plus you get an incredible view of the city. 

SF is love
author: Carol Y.

description:
My buddy loves this dog park.  I think my dog can smell this place as I drive up. There's plenty of on and off trails to roam here.  You can access the beach from either end of Fort Funston or you can walk from Cliff House area down to here.  He's here to freely snag a pat on the head or hug from friendly dog lovers.  Dog owners tend to pickup after their dog so that's a good thing.  There is a doggie watering hole with stainless steel bowls to refill water to and from the trail to the beach.  My dog will even carry his own Frisbee.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/-fqw8aDcx1Sgjs-4u__Aiw?select=HZO83CyYfK4nTyI0sSAASQ

http://youtube.com/watch?v=OXWm1k7KvRE

You can watch surfers, listen to the oceans roar, watch the waves, people watch, watch doggies at play,  watch hang-gliders, smell the ocean air, hike up and down the beach, picnic and just have a good time.  

There's plenty of parking in the main lot.
author: Nanette L.

description: So fun, so beautiful, so great for dogs.  I've never had a bad experience here and I've gone a lot.  The beach is great, but the views are more spectacular on the walking path.  It's not to be missed for humans or dogs.
author: Ryan S.

description:
There are few beaches in the area that are so breathtaking and so dog friendly at the same time.  Even less beaches that allow you and your furry family member to walk and not have to be bothered with a leash.  

It's a great park to go to with the family and meet all sorts of dogs, so many different breeds and so many nice people.  

If you love it here please take time out to comment on the proposal to make certain if not all areas leashed areas.  Please don't let them ruin one of the last places left in the Bay like this.  

http://parkplanning.nps.gov/document.cfm?parkID=303&projectID=11759&documentID=38106
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Who would have thought a dog park/ dog beach area would get 5 stars from a non dog owner however going to this place with my friend with a hyperactive dog made me buy into the hype of this place. 

I've never been at a walking area and dog beach with so many well behaved dogs and with that said well behaved dog owners. Striking up conversations was very easy, lots of advice, chit chat, and lots of play space for even the most hyper dog. My friends dog loved every minute of this place meeting and sniffing everything and everyone I think she felt like Scarface during the most famous scene in the movie, except what she was sniffing was more natural. You could almost see her smiling at the end of her visit. I only saw really only one minor flare up with dogs out of maybe 70 - 90 dogs we saw so that's an amazing ratio. The walk to the beach is scenic and a easy walk, well until you get to the beach which could be tiresome walking back up but you can just keep walking the path and its just as nice.

Overall, if you have a dog who has been socialized I recommend this place immediately! Are dogs unpredictable.. yes however this place is scenic and a great way to meet other dog owners in the area and get your best buddy tired since lets face it a happy dog is a tired dog.
author: Mike D.

description:
Fort Funston is Absolutely Beautiful!  The BEST Dog Park I have ever been to!  We took our 2 Boxers to Funston last Saturday and they had the time of their lives! 

Quite a bit of parking is available and there are porta-potty's and picninc tables along with a few water fountains and bowls available to get a drink!

There are plenty of on and off road trails for you and your dog, hiking paths & amazing scenery make up a few of the wonderful things about this park.  The ocean is right there with a glimpse of the city to your back and the GG bridge even peeks out on a clear day!
There's a trail that leads you right onto the beach or you can take the sand steps up/down.

The actual beach/sand isn't overly impressive, but I do not think many people go here to lay out! People go here to let their dogs go just absolutely insane and have the best time ever!
We had as much fun watching our dogs run in the ocean and play with other dogs as I think they did themselves!
Enjoy this Beautiful park and please pick up after your pets to help keep it clean!
author: Matt E.

description:
Well what can I say my Dog just loves Fort Funston It's a great place for a dog to walk there human.. You can walk down to the beach and your dog can excercise for hours

Then you can get your workout on as well walking back up those stairs or up the hill either way it's a good workout

The weather is not always the best(THis is SF) but sometimes it is just beautiful,the area is pretty safe and it's so good for your dog to run and make friends
author: Kim R.

description: Great off leash park (one of the very few) to take your dog.  Excellent people and dog watching, nice trails, hang gliders everywhere.  There are water stations for the dogs.
author: Julia C.

description:
Wonderful beach for heavenly dog fun. Our "aquaphobic" shiba inu overcame her own fear and ran into the water just so she could play with other pups!

Since bathrooms are unavailable, remember to pee before you go.
author: Alex W.

description: Hands down the best National Park to bring your dogs to! As dog owners know too well that a good park to take our fur babies are few and far between and often comes with limitations. So when I decided to take my dogs on my NorCal visit I did some research. This place had raving reviews and I can see why. Dogs are allowed off leash, they can run freely along the beach. So many locals bring their dogs here, I only wish I lived close enough to this amazing national park.  This is a great way for your dogs to play and for you to get some exercise all the while in the beautiful coast. We went on a Saturday in the morning and the park was already pretty busy. Parking was fairly easy, although I think towards noon it can get filled up. It can be pretty windy, but depending on the temperature you may or may not need a light jacket. There was so many other dogs on the hike and beach that if you wanted to give your dog a chance to socialize this place would be perfect. I saw a water fountain near the beginning of the trail, there is no fountain on the beach so make sure to bring water for your dog or fill up at the fountain before entering the beach.   My dogs had a blast here, I would definitely bring them back here again on our next NorCal visit!
author: Kristy H.

description:
Welcome to Fantasy Island!! ...for dogs. A great place to unleash your furry friend and let 'em be free. There are some neat hill trails up high, or you can venture down the beach. 

...The area has some pretty neat WWII era historic landmarks which are pretty fun to explore.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Someone once told me that Fort Funston was a dog mecca and it really is. At first the tall cliffs and sand dunes made me worry that my doggy would wander off and never be seen again, but she just ended up having a wonderful time. Not only did the puppy run around and get tired (draining her energy and making her sleep through the night), but we got some exercise too walking on the trails. Definitely come prepared with a jacket and a hat or something because it gets windy. 

Doggie bags on site, but I'm just giving a 4 because sand everywhere and there's no cafe/puppy grooming shop like Point Isabel in the East Bay:(
author: Angela L.

description:
Fort Funston is my favorite dog park on the planet.  It's quite a distance from Sunnyvale, but it's worth the drive once a month or so.

You have so many walk options, all good.  My dog doesn't have a preference so it's all up to me.  Assuming you are parked at the lot near the Ranger Station and not on Skyline, here are the main walk choices in general level of difficulty.
- take an easy walk along the flat-ish paved path 
- walk among the sand and ice plant paths on top of the hill.  On either side of the glider take off area
- walk down the hill to the bottom of the V and come back up
- walk down the hill to the end, make a right and return through the eucalyptus trees, parallel to Skyline boulevard
- walk up and down the dunes and in and out  of the woods to your heart's delight
- walk down to the beach.  Lots of ways to get down to the water, try them all. OK going down.  Steep, sandy climb coming back up after you're tired from walking along the beach and/or throwing the ball.

Since there are no standard paths, so you can mix it up and have a totally different experience every time.

The weather is very variable.  It doesn't matter how it is anywhere else in the bay area, Fort Funston seems to be it's own microclimate.  Could be sunny and calm when you turn off 280 but drizzly and gusty at the fort.

To be prepared for anything, recommend having a minimum of sunglasses, hat, gloves and two layerable jackets.  As you get warm from walking you can peel things off.
author: Debra E.

description: Skye, our Siberian Husky puppy loves to run and is a regular at Fort Funston. While I do 3 miles, I'm pretty sure with all her circles she's getting at least 10 miles.
author: Sara D.

description:
I don't have a dog,but I love this part of San Francisco. It is nice and if you have a dog even nicer. Luckily I would get tired chasing the little rascal around. Even thought the times I have been here I have had dogs running,I would say charging at me because they are excited.
 I understand,but clearly this area has good ground for a nice walk with your're puppy.

What else I thought was nice was someone was flying some sort of object(it was something ok). Also, there is a deck located in the area and you can walk out and see the nice clear,sky and water. Watching the water was nice because of the waves and the dogs would get all excited..when the waves came closer.

Really nice place even if you don't have a dog.

I think it is a nice place to sit for a bit and relax. The sunset can be nice too.
author: Dani D.

description: Heaven on Earth for dogs! Best of both worlds hiking and beach. Large parking lot but gets packed on the weekends.  During the week there are a lot of dog walkers.  Everyone is really friendly and the dogs are well behaved too! If you want to go to the beach and don't like dogs then this isn't the place for you. But if you are a dog owner then this is the best place in the whole bay area to bring your dog!
author: Maverick W.

description: Love this place!  Been coming here since I was in elementary school, we actually went camping & stayed overnight.  The view is awesome and the Sunsets is incredible
author: Anthony J G.

description:
What a great place for an afternoon with your dog!  There are plenty of trails, beach, and water for your little friend to sniff and explore.  Your dog does need to be able to follow you on the trail and respond to your call but if our stubborn Shiba can do it, yours can too!  

Be prepared to do a little hiking back up from the shore.  There's a long way back or the short way, which involves climbing a long set of sandy steps.  

This place is also great for watching hang gliders.
author: Nina L.

description:
Doggie heaven!!!!  My dog looooves the beach (takes after her mom), and she is in pure heaven when I took her to Fort Funston.  There's plenty of space for her to roam free without me worrying about her getting herself into trouble (although I think a crow tried to kidnap her yesterday).  You will see happy dogs of all shapes and sizes here.  Despite all of the dogs, I did not see an ounce of dog poop anywhere.

Aside from how good Fort Funston is for dogs, it's also great for people.  The sights are beautiful, especially on a sunny dat---yet another reminder of why I live here.
author: Danielle B.

description: Love love love fort funston! Beautiful views, beach access and dogs are allowed off leash everywhere! This is the best dog park ever! My pups always return from funston tired and happy. They can't get enough of it and I love it because it's a great hike and a nice place to watch the sunset. Just awesome.
author: Maria V.

description:
Beenie (my 5 yr. old pug) went CRAZZZY!  Crazy with fun that is.   Running up and down the slopes and all over the beach.

I used to go to a dog park in Albany called Pt. Isabel and I thought that was nice but this one is 10 times better.  It's pretty clean for a dog park too.  The scenery is beautiful too.   Check it out, and see for yourself.
author: Louise G.

description: Love this place! It's not the most pristine of sandy beaches but the walk down the cliff side is like something out of the Shire, add hang gliders and dogs frolicking in the surf and you get the makings of a great afternoon.
author: Cec D.

description:
I've been coming to Fort Funston with my dog(s) for years!  They LOVE this place and in turn I LOVE this place!  Great for the dogs to get their energy out and great exercise for me as I hike the park.  

Remember to pick up after your dog and do keep an eye on your dog as not all dog owners understand their dog and behaviors.

A great place to socialize your dog.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I cant believe that it has taken sooo long to write this review!

This is honestly the mecca of dog heaven, there are always hundreds of dogs here, rarely will you ever find less then 20 on a non rainy day (sometimes even in the rain)!

Its fantastic, you can also walk all the way down to the beach and your dog, can swim in the ocean or hop the waves (watch out for dead sea life however, we once ran into a dead sea lion my doggie couldn't stop looking at)!

The watering bowl is also a popular place to hang out around if you dont want to walk all the way down to the bottom!!

And plenty of parking always!
author: Noelle L.

description: This is a beautiful place. I love to come here to walk my dog. Unfortunately, I live on the East Bay so it is a bit of a drive for me, but i will come whenever i have time.
author: Angelina N.

description:
wow! im very happy this place has a 5 full star rating.  I use to bring my dog here all the time..and I call it the "Dog Park" because of all the dogs running around.  

I think this place is amazing.  The trails are fun to walk and there are so many dogs, there are also water fountains for dogs with bowls included.  Everytime I come here, I see a different breed of dog.

The Beach here is also very good because you are allowed to let your dog off the leash.

The only problem I have is my own dog.  I don't know if its because he's not very social or if its because he doesn't go out often, but he always barks too much at other dogs whenever we go here.  He also chases the larger dogs.  

Other than that, I really this place.
author: Emi K.

description:
I think they should rename this place to Fort Tons of Fun.  Dog always looks sooooooo incredibly happy here.  

He did fall off the cliff once and and ended up on the beach unharmed.  We used to make fun of those warning signs of people and dogs falling, but never again.  It was a scary experience and worse for my husband who ran as fast he could down the long steep decline to the beach to fetch him.
