author: Maria L.

description:
Sandy, great place to walk your dog, fun to walk with your partner and watch the dogs play. 
They should have a dog wash station tho'.
author: Jim H.

description:
Awesome place if you're a dog person (like me!). TONS of pooch everywhere! And there're plenty of activities you can do. Hiking, exploring, playing catch, watching dogs play, taking romantic walks, making out, having se-... Uh.. what was I talking about?

This place is also great for getting a little exercise. Especially on the path to the beach and back. That dreadful log stairs are good exercise for your thighs.
author: Ari C.

description:
The dog loves it here.  I think he was a little confused at first (lack of a fence or leash).  It got dark soon though.  Good thing for his lit collar or I'll never find him.

Will definitely come back, earlier next time.
author: Winnie C.

description: I fond the perfect place for mutt and master....Parking was great...the view was amazing and you could not ask for a better place to spend the day with your best friend.
author: B J.

description: Killer steps. Great spot to view hang gliders.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Delightful place to take your dog off lease in the Bay Area..people here are friendly, and the views are outstanding..just note - it can be chilly here - so dress accordingly.

Nice to walk down to one of the two beach areas - fun to take the kids as well.  I highly recommend this place!
author: Marie C.

description:
Breathtakingly beautiful place to watch dogs and their owners and also the hanggliders.

Place can get a little crowded on the weekend, but worth the effort to come by and watch the scenery.
author: James W.

description:
This place beats any dog park my mini Aussie and I have been to. Here's why:

  *Almost everyone walks their dogs here off leash. It's like a big doggie party out there!
  *There are 2 water fountains on opposite sides of the park and there are several dog bowls out for all the thirsty pooches.
  *Beach access for everyone and all dogs!
  *The trail has many amazing ocean views

There is a sign at the beginning of the trail that indicates that dogs must be on leash or be voice-controlled. Please make your dog responds to your commands before going off-leash. :)
author: Jane H.

description:
5 woof's from doggie Jackson.

This is a great place to take your fur babies to do some human-dog training.  Excellent place to work on voice commands and keeping attention.
author: Kari C.

description: Fort Funston is my favorite park in the city, hands down. It has gorgeous views of the coast and I love taking my dog on the trail. It's usually packed on the weekends with tons of other dog owners, so if your dog is friendly like mine, it will have a blast. The trail (unnamed) alongside the coast is about 2 miles long each way (starting near the hangglider take-off point). The only bad thing I noticed is that if you keep walking on the trail it ends abruptly around the 2 mile mark on a narrow edge. That wasn't fun but now I know ;). Nature at it's finest.
author: Dominique T.

description:
yay Ginormous off lease dog park with grass,  sand, dogs, beach, trees, sewer tubes (dry, of course), and trais!

too bad it's so far away from me - been here twice and the best part is that dogs are allowed to roam free pretty much everywhere in the dog area with no fences.  

Be prepared to get very sandy though.  and to return with a sandy pet.

also, since it's in the city, weather can be a bit hit or miss, but having Kody run around exploring nooks and crannies and meeting all sorts of other doggies...well that is worth it.
author: Shinny L.

description:
I have a VERY good sense of smell (not to mention I can SEE) and I can tell you that it does not smell of shit here   AND I do not SEE a bunch of un- picked up poop.  It smells like the ocean.  

The dogs are always sweet because they are happy.  The people pick up the crap, too.  Too many other people watching not to.

This is the best place for a free, unfettered happy romp!
author: Jorah N.

description:
I decided to put 5 stars cuz it's ridiculous people are giving low ratings for the weather. 

This is SF/Ocean Beach. What do you think the weather is gonna be like ._. 

There's really no cons to this place other than the funny smell depending on which way the wind blows. I've walked my dog here everyday for the past 2 months (the corgi that just follows other packs of dogs} and he's having the time of his life. 

Socialize your fricken dogs people.
author: Christopher L.

description:
My first review of 2010 and I choose Fort Funston. Why? Because this is where the fiance proposed in Oct 2009!

When we adopted our puppy two years ago, we discovered Fort Funston. Ever since then, its become our weekend "family" time to take the doggie here and let him be the king of the world. The sun, the sand, the grass, the companionship of each other + the happy dog =  we wouldn't change that time for anything.

So on an extremely windy Saturday morning during our weekend walk with the dog, the bf picked a bench that sits atop a cliff overlooking the ocean, got down on one knee, and popped the question. We looked at the proposal photos afterwards and realized we weren't the only ones who were happy that day. Turns out our dog was humping my bf's leg the entire time he was on his knees, yet the bf was too nervous to notice! Those photos and that moment was priceless.
author: Nancie T.

description:
Wow-- this place is like heaven for dogs-- all dogs seem to get along, and the owners are great dog loving people.  It is beautiful here as well.  Groove and Greyley know this to be "Ft. Fun."  My samoyed knows when we are on our way in the car and starts squeaking with excitement!  They love this place, and the fact there are watering holes along the way...

yay!!!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Fort Funston should be renamed dog poo park.....The smell of dog poo is pervasive, and if you are uncomfortable with random dogs galloping towards you at breakneck speed don't come here. I'm not afraid of dogs and in fact I LOVE the little/big critters but really, people show some manners, having a Great Dane charging at you is a little discerning. I didn't know if it was being aggressive or playful?? Not a good time to learn. Turned out to be just a dog with a sick sense of humor. Yes, they do have senses of humor, this place proves it! I think they get a kick out of scaring random strangers while their owners are obliviously sipping their Starbucks coffee having their social hour. 

Have all dog owners here lost their sense of smell because ewwwww!! How did you manage to take a gorgeous state beach and turn it into a stinky dog poo mess? It's an insult to my nose whenever I try to hike here, shallow breaths are a necessity in order to avoid the gag reflex....Gene A suggested that you remember your plastic poop bags because they are not readily available...ah duh! It's obvious by the smell how many people have no bother to bring poop bags or hike into the scrubs to retrieve the big stinky poo that their dogs have left behind. Gross, gross and gross! 

Don't worry dog lovers I'm not trying to insult you I'm talking about some dog lovers with a terrible lack of etiquette. In the meantime all you with a well developed sense of smell avoid this beach at all costs, despite the awesome hang gliders, beautiful beach the smell is just too overwhelming.....
author: Teisha F.

description:
One of my favorite parks in SF. This is perhaps the best place to take your dog if you have one - or just enjoy being around dogs if you love em and can't own one. Dogs of all shapes and sizes run along the trails here, and seem to act like this is the happiest place on earth.  If you head north of the parking lot there are some old war ... remnants (bunkers? I dunno) that you can walk around and through. 

If the weather's right you'll see hang gliders here off the cliffs. Just head towards the ocean from the parking lot to a lookout platform. If you veer slightly south from the parking lot (but not very far south, just south of the lookout) you'll hit a loooong staircase down to the beach below. I dunno - it seems like 200-250 steps - so make sure you can get back up if you head down. But the beach is simply marvelous, much nicer (less garbage) and less crowded than Ocean beach just north of here. Walk south along the beach if you venture down. 

Oh yeah, and top notch sunset views from here.
author: Jen D.

description:
After our long car trip our doggie was like a kid in a candy store when we brought him here.  It's the best place for doggies I think I have ever been to!

The view is amazing and the nice walk and hike was such a great break from the city.  

We went on Saturday afternoon around 3pm and there were about 100 doggies there with their parents....just walking around and hanging out all over the place. 

I think if would have let him our doggie would have moved there!!

I would take him back there in a heartbeat!!
author: Amiee L.

description:
Gorgeous Place. Very pleasing to the eye.

Warning: Please make sure your dog is reliable off leash, there is no gates/barriers. 

-Keep away from the edges/cliffs
-It is often windy cause of the beach, so bring extra layers
-ALWAYS keep an eye on your dog in case your dog gets into a disagreement with another dog

I come to this place often. Very nice place, and a lot of people come to Fort Funston because of the nice view, and beach area. Although once in a while you'll get your amateur who is new at this. Dog walkers come here often, and from my experience they ALWAYS have good control over their dog. I personally came here with 5 of my dogs and were quickly given a look of disgust, Why? I would only assume because they think a little girl like me can't handle 5 dogs.

Best way to enjoy the park? Ignore everybody else and enjoy it with your dog.
author: Mary L.

description:
This is a doggie paradise.
I took my roommate's doggie here and she loved it.
She was smiling the whole time! No really, she was. 
Lilo does this snarly face thing where she has this wide grin and shows her teeth. I think she was so happy to be out of the house. Aww, poor thing.
We did not conquer all the trails but there are plenty to keep you busy.
We went down to the beach and it's like a private getaway, since you gotta walk down a sandy/rocky semi-steep path. But, I was able to walk down it and if I can, anyway can!
author: Grace P.

description:
Fort Funston 
Fortress 
Of Flight
500 feet above the waves
Gliders catch the fresh lift
To take them far away.
The guitarist told me
once has soared
Past 20,000 feet
But none in their
Gliding Gange
Refuses to fly over 1k.
Soaring over California
They do at Fort Funston 
Where was once to protect
Now it is open for the rest. 
Dunes destroyed 
By a cold war fear
As missiles pointed 
Towards the air
We have came a long way
To understand
To not fight against man
Our goal now 
Is to restore 
As those gliders soar
And as the Fun Funston 
Party goes
We shall uplift 
The San Franciscican soar.
author: Jon-o G.

description: A+ for gopher diggin dogs like mine. I always feel refreshed after a walk here and usually see peeps from espirit dog park
author: Kelly K.

description:
Who woulda thunk Fort Funston was a place for the dogs?  I had no idea!  I must have been the only local resident to not have known that.  But where else was I supposed to go to show visiting friend the ocean, when I had missed both parking entrances for Ocean Beach along the Great Highway?  Fort Funston seemed like the next logical choice.

As soon as you get out of your car, the smell of dog doo doo fills the air.  And it pretty much stays that way for much of the early part of the trail.  It got better, though.  And there's a nice spot to wave-watch near the parking lot, but secluded from the dogs.

If I were a dog, I'm sure I'd love it.
author: T. O.

description:
What an awesome place to bring your dog! No leash is the best for Riley, he runs as much as a senior citizen of the dog world can run. He loves the water and smelling the asses of other dogs. Since he's older and doesn't run a lot with the younger dogs we came with, he decided to check out the girls. He tried to mount a few, but they returned his gesture with nasty snarls. 

The weather on President's Day wasn't perfect but it was still great. I highly recommend this park for all dogs! Everyone is super nice and the dogs go to town for sure. We were in a big group so didn't walk too far away from each other. But I'm definitely going back to the beach and walking along the water with Riley close by my side or on top of an unassuming female dog.
author: Michael D.

description: I heard great things about this place from a GF. I agree it's totally dog heaven. Many trails to take. There are a lot of dog walkers with 10+ dogs. I think there was easily 100+ dogs at the park. But there was plenty of space for all the dogs to play. My pup and I usually take the trail down to the secluded beach. One time she almost got attacked by a Pitt. Ever since that incident it got me thinking...if she did get attacked it was a longs way to get help. Sadly I will not be coming back here because of that.
author: Jo S.

description: One of the only places that you can bring a dog off leash! I hope it never changes, great for trail and beach running with your k-9. Most people are good with their dogs, a few are a little less responsible! But still a great spot
author: Jimmy A.

description:
I finally made it here after hearing all of the hype. It seriously sounded like nirvana for dogs. After paying a visit, I would have to agree that it's a unique place in the bay area. It sort of seems like the dogs are in charge and the owners are along for the ride. My dog definitely had fun here.

The main reasons I didn't give it 5 stars are because it was really crowded when I went, which was a Sunday, and I noticed a few owners who were not practicing good dog etiquette. For example, I ended up having to play fetch with a couple of random dogs until I eventually tracked down their owners and let them know that unless they paid me, I wasn't going to play with their dogs. I hate when owners neglect their dogs!
author: amanda m.

description: Love to see the hand gliders crowd on a weekend.
author: Tyler Y.

description:
The other day I was on my way here, and as soon as we pulled up next to the ocean, my dog started sniffing the air and got excited.  She knows when she's getting close to the beach!

Lola is a Golden Retriever, so naturally she loves chasing the tennis ball into the water and bringing it back to shore!  

This place is great to bring your dog, let them run off leash.  Almost everyone here has a dog.  Better to come at low tide for more room for you and your four-legged friend to play.
author: Brian M.

description:
This place is amazing.

Free parking for a state beach!

Even if you don't have a dog, but you love dogs, go here and revel in the masses of dogs.  

If you do have a dog, take him/her here and have them go buckwild!  They'll have fun if they're sociable, guaranteed.  Both you and your loved pet will get a workout.  

Make sure you have your plastic poop bags ready because they're not readily available.
author: Gene A.

description:
Checkers my dog is the one who is telling me to write this review.

This place is so big and wonderful, if I did not have my hubby and Checkers with me I would get lost. No you say? Yes I  say. I get lost in doctors offices, I can never find my way out to get back to the waiting room unless exit is on the door!!

This place is so amazing it is like doggy heaven to all the dogs. 

Where else can you go and see a 55 lb dog ( Checkers) playing catch me if you can with 2 beagles who are howling with ears flopping around like propellers. Quite a site! Then when Checkers gets tired of running he will find a place in the sand and try to hide. So I guess the game then turns to hide and seek. Doggies just look for the mound of sand that has a panting tongue sticking out of it!!!

For the most part all of the owners and dog walkers are the nicest people you ever hope to meet.

Checkers gives Fort Funston 4 paws and a wagging tail up!!!
author: Corina W.

description: I come here to walk my dog and exercise. My chihuahua/terrier mix, Doobie is always getting picked on by other big dogs. It's a sad sight, but what can I do :( She really enjoys playing with the other small dogs that come in big groups. I suggest coming here on a sunny day so you could really enjoy the beach!
author: Sara L.

description:
This place is the BEST!!!!  We drove up from Fremont on a Friday morning and got there by 1030am. It was crowded with hundreds of people and dogs, of all sizes! The only thing that sucks is there's no bathrooms, only porta potties. You'd think if this place was so popular they might install some decent bathrooms. But they were clean for the most part. 

It was a very nice sunny day and we walked (leashed) down towards the beach. I love that it's so far away from the parking lot, for safety reasons for new puppies and dogs who are in training!). The dogs are off leash and running around in sand and water and chasing toys. 

I don't recommend this place for little kids though, it can get a bit risky with so many dogs. I was walking bare foot on the beach and a few times I had to watch my toes as huge dogs ran right in front of me, a few times they actually crashed into my friend! I don't think any smart parent would bring their kid though with so many unleashed dogs even though they are friendly. Fort Funston was made for dogs :) 

High tide came around 2pm today so we stayed for 1.5 hours, plenty of time to tire the pooches out. I think they should have more water fountains though, it gets extremely crowded since they are exercising a lot and need water. We will definitely be coming back here frequently :)
author: Kermy K.

description: Ponyo's favorite playground is the beach @ Fort Funston.  I can see that she is soooo happy here, I can see her actually smiling.
author: Wakako U.

description: I have had a dog for almost...15 years now? Been coming here since I was a child, and I still remember when it stopped being off-leash. It's now back to being off-leash, which I am very thankful for, because dogs cannot run freer anywhere else than here! I've owned nothing but larger breed dogs so this is invaluable. Lots of different trails and dogs to see, and an added bonus is the impressive ocean and city views you can take in as you walk your pup. This is seriously doggie paradise on Earth and a San Francisco gem!!
author: Caralisa L.

description: Doggie heaven!  There aren't very many places in NorCal you can let your dog roam free, so I'm glad to have found this place. Dogs are allowed off-leash pretty much the moment you step out of your car. It's nice meeting dogs of all sorts and their owners on the trail to the beach.  I also went on a day when it was a little chilly and overcast, so I'm looking forward to taking my pooch back on a much sunnier day.
author: Angeline K.

description: I had such a great time walking on the beach with my friend while dog sitting a chocolate lab. I have two tiny chihuahua's and the big dog was bored trying to play with them in my backyard so my friend and I took him to Fort Funston. The hike down was a bit scary (back up was exhausting and equally as scary). There were so many dogs and the no leash policy is great. We played catch and Walter (the dog) ran in and out of the water, splashed and played with new friends for hours. The views are spectacular and I loved seeing the hang gliders being put together.
author: Kellie N.

description:
Fort Funston is simply the best dog park in the Bay Area. My dog loves the place (off-leash with awesome places to run across), plenty of other dogs to socialize with, I too love the walk (the hills, sand, beaches and views), most of the dog owners are nice.

I guess there is dog poop left by some of the less responsible owners & (rarely) an aggressive dog & (more often) a dog owner with an attitude.

But they do not significantly detract from the experience. I love the place!
author: T S.

description:
Doggie's Paradise!

I didn't head to the water/ocean area; only ventured near the upland areas.  

Need to revisit the ocean front but otherwise a great place for dogs and close to home!
author: Jboogie L.

description:
This place is great!  For anyone who has a dog or is a dog-lover and is in a hiking mood, this is the place to go.  Since my b/f and I had 2 dogs this Saturday, we decided to visit this spot.  We got there a little uncertain of letting the dogs go off-leash at first.  So we walked them over to the beach access and let them go. 

What we soon figured out was they loved the freedom!  We had no problems with other dogs and ours stayed in watching distance the whole time.  I was also pleased that the other dogs were well-behaved and played rather than got mean with them.  Couple things to remember: wear tennis shoes, take water, and take a jacket.  there are a bunch of snd dunes with really fine sand but the majority of the area is rocky.  The hikes are really great but long; you will get thirsty.  And even though it was in the 90's in SJ, it was about 58 degrees in the area we were in.

But I fully recommend it and am excited to take the mutts back!
author: Jessica H.

description:
I recently moved up from San Diego where we had a plethora of leash free dog options, including the first Dog Beach in America. My shepherd mix and IG put in some serious time at both the beach and our favorite dirt pit,  Fiesta Island.  I have to admit when we put the pooches in the car to start our trek to nor-cal, I was not sure what the future would hold for their beach going lifestyles. I was worrying for nothing....

Fort Funston is like Dog Beach on crack. Great trails, expansive beaches and even some great art. This place is everything I have found to be good about the bay area - laid back, thoughtful people who hold pets in high regard and clean up the "footprint" all dogs inevitably leave behind, quiet beaches, wildlife filled surf and hiking galore mixed in with colorful history. 

Despite the recent security set backs (some wacko brought a knife to the beach), and the somewhat predictably unstable cliffs,  it's a relatively safe and welcome refuge from the daily grind. 

I can't believe this place exists.
author: Layla M.

description: This is a great place to take your dog for an off leash walk by the beach.  I've been here quite a few times and have never had a problem with other dogs (being aggressive).  It's more of a dog party than anything else.
author: Christina D.

description: The park is big and has a nice view.  It's a great place for hiking.  We took Max there on a week day and there were so many dogs off leash there.  It is a great place for dogs to run around but I will be a little bit cautious for the small dogs.  It is easy for them to get lost because the place is so big.  The place was foggy and cold but still nice, make sure to bring a thick jacket.
author: Lan D.

description:
A dog owners paradise!  This park is beautiful - overlooking the Pacific Ocean, with nice trails, and plenty of dunes for your canine friend to run around. Everyone is friendly and I've never encountered an aggressive dog.  This is my dog's favorite place to go for a weekend walk.

And the views continue at the north end of the park where all the surfers are!  Hehe.
author: Vicente G.

description: This is the ultimate in dog parks and the training ground for my trainer Dan Perlata. We have a good time here and get a lot of work done. One word of caution: not all dog owners are responsible and you will come across aggressive dogs. It's not the dogs fault for being what it is, it's the owners lack of experience and knowledge, just another reason to plug Dan-the-dog-traning-man.
author: Steve S.

description:
I went to Fort Funston a few months ago, which is a giant off-leash dog park and beach area and part of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area and Parks Conservancy. Fort Funston was formally a military outpost and two-gun battery in the mid-20th Century and you can actually see the remains of the battery up close. That was more of an interest to the bf than me or my shiba, Kika, but hey, history is cool :) There were great rolling sand dunes, cliffs, beach access and hiking trails for bikers, hikers and dog owners alike.

I've been wanting to take my dog to another large off-leash dog area since moving up to the Bay Area and Fort Funston was it! There were off-leash dogs everywhere and you could just feel their energy and freedom. The number of dogs almost outnumbered the people there, but I didn't see any dog confrontations at all. They were all too busy sniffing and exploring and running around to bother other dogs, which is great for a dominant dog like our shiba. Kika stayed on-leash for the most part because the bf's overly cautious, but we did let her off leash when we were down on the doggy beach. It was flanked by the cliffs and far away from the roads and parking lot, so Kika was safe to roam off-leash in what we felt was a protected area. She was so happy trotting up and down the beach, and we let her get away with her selective hearing skills. ;) At the end of the day, her face was covered in sand and drool, which I think means a day well spent in her book!  

It's pretty hard finding off-leash dog parks where I feel confident enough to let my dog wander off-leash too, in terms of the surrounding area and cars or the dispositions of the other dogs.  Fort Funston was very spacious and far away from the highway, and I definitely felt secure letting Kika run around.  The park was big enough to give each dog their own space if they wanted it but enough dogs around if they're looking for doggy company and playmates.  There was also a good amount of trash cans and watering stations to keep doggies hydrated and for poop bags.  Unlike other dog beaches and dog parks, there were very few poop land mines around.  Overall, I thought the dog owners were pretty respectful when it comes to picking up their own dog's doodoo.

Fort Funston had with tons of rolling hills, trees, hiking trails and great coastal views to keep dog owners and dogs plenty busy and happy.  I will definitely come back  when the weather's a little nicer.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I am from SAC. I met up with my friend there for a play date with our dogs. My dog she had a field trip there! I lost her twice in this massive land of sand and trees. The scene is breathtaking. It is so nice to feel sand in your feet!! 

I would come back again and have my dog on leash all way to beach so I won't have to look for her or call on her. Ha! This is something for dog owners to keep in mind if their dog become too excited and get themselves lost in this beautiful paradise!
author: kristeena t.

description:
disclaimer - i was here on a warm, sunny day (which does not happen THAT often).

beautiful views, nice and easy trails, with just enough uphill.  and all the doggies that run around - they make the walk so much more fun!

on the weekends, it's also a great spot to watch the hang gliders take to the sky and loop around the area.  they seem so agile - it's amazing to watch. 

one note - we parked right off Skyline, just before the big parking lot. (There's usually a row of cars parked there.)  and the truck parked next to us (and mind you, this is 1 pm on a Sunday) was conducting a "transaction" - the kind without clothes.  so watch where you step.
author: Yayu L.

description:
uuuummm....  what can I say about Fort Funston that 389 people HAVEN'T already commented here?!  

uuumm.. it's FANTASTIC!  Tito (mini long hair dachshund) and I LOVE LOVE LOVE Fort Funston.  We live in Downtown San Jose, so it's hard to get out here often, but we try as much as we can.  Although the drive is about an hour each way and the drive back home is (NOT FUN) especially after the HUGE climb back up the hill/stairs on the way back to the car, it's such a great feeling to be on the beach in warm OR foggy weather so that He can run free!! 

We have many options to choose from in the long list of Dog Parks in San Jose, but we all know that the small dog section is always JUST THAT small.  So to come to the Dog Beach and watch him run freely is the best thing that makes it ALL worth it! 

As many ppl know, Dachshunds are a bit protective of their owners and thus a little aggressive, but I do my best to train him away from this behavior as much as I can.  For this reason, I was afraid to let him run off leash, but he did GREAT! 

Another great thing about the trip is that I stop in Daly City on the way home for some yummy Filipino Food and Desserts.  If you get the opportunity, you NEED to try House of Silvanas - YUM! 

For those that haven't tried Fort Funston and reading this review among the 389 reviews - GO TRY IT!  You'll be SUPER pleased! See you out there!
author: Suzy L.

description: I don't visit this place nearly as much as I should. The walk is beautiful, the parking is plentiful and you'll get plenty of exercise getting up and back from the beach to the top of the dune. I always enter from the back of Lake Merced and bring my own doggie bags. There are no garbage cans on the beach or public water fountains, so pack in and pack out everything you need. Have fun!
author: Alyss D.

description: I was at ocean beach and asked someone who was walking there dog what the off leash policy was. She told me and then recommended I go to a place named fort funston. I drove here and got out of the car and fell in love. This is the most beautiful place in all of the Bay Area. I can't wait to come back with my german shepherd. I love love love this place. The only thing that was hard for me was walking back up the step stars holding a 2 year old. This almost killed me, but so worth it.
author: Paul R.

description:
I love Fort Funston.  My dog loves Fort Funston.  I'm sure horses and riders also love Fort Funston.  But for the record...

Dear Horseback Riders:  

I don't think shrill screaming and abject panic when my excited dog approaches is the best way to defuse a potentially dangerous situation.  And these people seem to agree with me:  http://sites.google.com/site/fortfunston/horse-dog-faqs.  

I'll work on my dog's recall if you work on your crazy.

K, thanks!
author: Stephanie S.

description: After living in San Jose for a year, I finally decided to take my dog for a fun afternoon to Fort Funston. My dog had an absolute blast running around on the trails and beach  and the views are amazing!!
author: G T.

description:
If Toby were to rate this park...he'd probably give it a 5. 

However to YOU owners out there who have nippy dogs...put a muzzle on your b*tch! The last time I brought Toby here this dog went straight for him with his big chompers.... I had to kick the dog in the face...sorry but don't mess with my baby!
author: Michelle Y.

description: Fort Funston is beautiful and spacious. Lots of parking. Really cool to watch the hang-gliders while your dog plays in the ocean. Be prepared to hike both up and down a giant hill, though.
author: Aaron H.

description:
I own the kind of dog who has dreams about this park nightly. The kind of dog who, as soon as he smells other dogs, he jumps from the front seat to the back seat like he's being slung. The second we get out of the car, it's a mad frantic "WHAT TO SEE FIRST!" dash through the park. Tons of dogs everywhere, and plenty of places to hike and look around. It's truly a great place. 
My ONLY problem - I have a dog who doesn't give a shit where I am as soon as I let him off his leash and basically makes a mad dash for the beach. I wish there was a little fenced off area for people who have spaz dogs that cannot be released.
author: Jena D.

description: I want to give 10 stars.  This is arguably the best off leash dog park in the world, not just the US.  This isn't just a great place for your dog to run, swim, fetch, etc.  It's a great place for kids and to get some exercise for yourself as well.  The views are amazing.  My dog goes bizerk when the car approaches the park because he just knows that he's in for an awesome afternoon, and he loves me for it.  You need to go now!
author: Simon B.

description:
Awesome place for both people and dogs. 

Fort Funston is heaven for the puppies, they get to run and run, and they get to see other pooches and sniff, chase, get chased and play play play. 

Five dogs are around the man on the beach with a tennis ball thrower, four can hardly wait until the next throw, and the fifth wonders what all the excitement is about. The throw happens, and four rockets are off after the ball, the fifth dog takes off a second later to chase the chasers. 

You will always leave Fort Funston with a smile.
author: Kopa J.

description:
This is the best off leash place!!!  Dogs are everywhere.  I love to go during the week when it's pretty much all dogs and/or professional dog walkers.  

Pros (there are many) -
Off Leash for miles
Dogs who love other dogs will be in heaven
Dogs who love water will be in heaven
People who like to walk dogs on the beach will be in heaven
People on the beach are friendly and warn of dog hazards (such as live or dead sea lions)
Great to escape the East Bay heat of summer
$4 bridge toll plus gas $ for a 1/2 day of fun
Parking is free!

Cons -
Be careful if your dog likes to roll in smelly stuff.  There are often dead sea lions / seals and fish on the beach.  
There are no garbage cans on the beach - bring your own plastic bags to scoop poop and carry it out.  
Porta Pots only in the parking lot (sometimes no TP)
Dogs who don't like other dogs should go elsewhere.  At times there are 50 - 100 off leash dogs on the beach.  If your dog can't handle this you probably won't have fun.

Notes:

There is a fairly steep hike to the beach but you can stay on the trails above the beach if you have bad knees etc.  

Low Tide is the best time but it's pretty awesome any time!
author: S J.

description:
This is the place that's to be and be seen for doggies. It's a beautiful getaway for yourself and your dogs (more like Heaven for them)! There's plenty of parking but bring a coat because it gets chilly here. Make sure your dog is on a leash, but if you get the feeling that the other people are cool, you can take the leash off. I, unfortunately, can't because my dogs get way too excited and every time I try to let them off, they'll run after other dogs. Truly, the death of me... There are hidden grass areas away from the trails that you can let your dog run loose though. 

Anyway, so much room, fresh, crisp air, and great paths for everyone! You can hike along the grass, but my fav is climbing down to the beach where you can see people hang gliding in the sky or in full body suits and boots standing in the ocean and fishing! It's a great way to exercise without even thinking you're exercising. And OMG Phoebe (my dog) has a freakin field day every time she comes here and when we get home, she is passed out for the rest of the day. Hallelujah! Everyone wins!
author: Lucky N.

description:
Great place to take your furry friend for a day of free-roaming fun on the "beach". Our puppy played so much that she could barely follow us back to the car after we were done ---she kept sitting down and staring at us every couple of feet. 

Almost all the owners are cool and the dogs are well-behaved and sociable. Of course, there will always be the 'bad parent' and 'obnoxious kid', but you get those anywhere. We're thinking of visiting this place more regularly now.

One of the previous comments complained about bad smell from people not picking up their dog's waste, but we didn't notice any such thing. Our guess is that he/she must've caught a whiff of the horses down the road and mistook them for dogs.
author: Aaron N.

description: I can't believe I waited so long to take my dog here.  It's a beautiful dog friendly park.  All dogs are able to go off leash and walk around the trails and the beach area.  The pathways are beautiful and clean.  There are a lot of water spots for your dog.  Just know sand it everywhere so you and your dog could get a little dirty.
author: R C.

description:
This is a great place to take your dog... 

Nice view!!

Huge space!!!
author: Jay C.

description:
Yes, it's all true, FUNston rocks!  I love running on the cliffs, the trails and the beach, with new and old friends alike.  My parents used to bring me and my brother here all the time when we lived in the Mission.  It was one of the few places that they trusted us off leash, you know, the whole Sight Hound "recall" issue, whatever....  They (the 'rents) always talk about the view and how romantic, blah, blah, blah...  But I'm down for all the running and sniffing!

Unfortunately, we live on The Hill now, (not the Nob, not the Russian, nothing swanky, the other one) so they say that it's farther to go, but I don't think so and my parents also feel like there are always tooooo many dogs now, even in the off hours.  I mean does any one work anymore??  And I am an Afghan, so I am a little weird, some might say neurotic, when it comes to lots of strange dogs rushing up on me, trying to get all up in my business, I mean, come on... I know I'm cute, but I've just laid eyes on you, have a little respect, jeez.

No Love on this one, just

LuLu
author: Kimberly K.

description:
AWESOME, AWESOME, AWESOME!!!

Ft. Funston is one of my favorite places to go in San Francisco.  It is definitely my favorite place to go with my dog Ziggy.

Ziggy starts freaking out when I even say the words Ft. Funston.  It's a different story when we pull into the parking lot.  He goes nuts and can't wait for me to open the door.

Here's the routine...

Park the car and open the door. Ziggy flies across my lap and starts running into the park.  The place is HUGE and you can easily walk around for hours.

It's the best dog park that I've ever been to and it's a lot of fun especially when your there with your four legged friend!

If you have a dog and you live in San Francisco, Ft. Funston is a must!
author: Benjamin F.

description: I still remember way back when I was little and not long after my parents and I came to the US from Hong Kong, my dad would drive here just to watch the people riding the gliders.  That's still a highlight here after all these years.  Also, after growing up, I learn to enjoy the great ocean view from here (assuming it's not completely covered by fog) and the variety of trails you can take here for some hiking exercise.
author: H K.

description: This is a great dog park! So much wide open spaces for dogs to run around and a variety of different terrains. Plus, the view is amazing - there are mountains, rocks, and you can see great views of SF as well. This is a dog's dream location and a great place for their owners to get lots of exercise as well! If I had a dog and lived closer, I would go all the time! Warning: when it's windy, make sure your body is well-protected. Getting pelted with sand is quite painful!
author: Kristen S.

description: Our baby Lucy LOVES Funston!  Great dog park with great dog watching.  Only problem the number of dead birds that I've seen lately.  Why so many?!  Biggest problem is that Lucy loves to roll around on dead birds.  So gross, but awesome dog park.
author: Jennifer N.

description: If you have a dog,don"t mind corporate dog walkers,dog poop,or just being chased,pawed,smelled or hassled by dogs.Please go to Ft. Funston.If not avoid at all cost until the GGRA can reclaim this lost area for ALL users.Do NOT TOUCH THE SAND IN THIS AREA,it has been tested recently and the fecal count is off the chartss
author: patty d.

description: This place is pretty amazing. Being brand new to SF from the midwest, this dog park took my breath away! I couldn't stop taking pictures. My dog was so happy here too.
author: Kathryn M.

description: Great place for dogs to roam free. Comparable to Pt Isabelle in east bay.
author: Katie L.

description: I love bringing my German shepherd here! Great for off leash walking! Only complaint is that some dog walkers let the dogs walk them if you know what I mean. Doesn't affect how I feel about fort Funston or bringing my dog there :)
author: Yolanda L.

description: The best place in the world for dogs and dog lovers. My ten month old german shepard had a blast here and was utterly exhausted after 3 hours of wrestling,running up sand hills and butt sniffing. Cant wait to go back!
author: Joshua D.

description: Do NOT take your kids! Every minute there is a dog off leash running up to kids and barking and intimidating kids! The owners just say "he won't hurt you!" as the dog is barking aggressively at their face....
author: Nic M.

description:
My dog had the greatest time here.  This place is great for dogs, and the majority of owners here are seriously responsible.  I only saw one unscooped poo.  That is incredible. This place is vast and your dog will never get more open space for being within city limits.

Anyway, there were hang gliders galore and you can get to the beach by a path in the backside.  I wandered around for an hour "the opposite way" and found ledges.  Then went around for another hour and found the TO BEACH sign!  It was kinda steep... and after two hours I was pretty tired.  It took about a half hour to get back to the car and my pup was pooped by then.

It gets pretty cold and windy here so I would suggest bringing a jacket, but if you walk around for as long as I did you'll be pretty warm.  I would definitely like to come back and walk the beach.  I would also suggest wearing shoes you don't mind getting sand in and please be careful if you have a small dog and they're going into the water.
author: Wilson K.

description: Wow... this has got to be the best place for dogs ever! We had a great time walking along the various trails, hiking down to the beach, and watching our dog enjoy a long stretch of time off leash in a pup wonderland!
author: Madeline W.

description: Can't give any less than 5 stars to Fort Funston.  I brought the pooch there to satisfy item #3 on my SF Bucket List.  It's a secluded beach with sweet views and TONS of hounds.  Like dog Times Square.  Had a great time.  Parking can be scarce at busy times but it's worth the hike.
author: Eric S.

description:
All dogs probably don't go to heaven.. but they can go to Fort Funston! Which is seriously the next best thing. 

I come here often to walk the pup. She absolutely loves this place. It's a great place to help your friendly companions socialize and exercise. This place is as good as it gets! - - off leash madness, popular concrete trails, many off road secret sandy trails, history (it wass an old fort!), the beach, a fantastic view, andd great doggy cohort company! All compact for your connivence :) Annnnd it doesn't smell like dog poop to boot! 

Only tip is to bring plastic bags (to upkeep this place!) and to wear good shoes for walking; the roads are old and have uneven pavement so be careful!
author: Jessica W.

description: Critter and Bird loved it! So happy to find a great beach for the dogs, especially since I got lost on the way there. Tip - Set your GPS for the SF Zoo then make your way to/stay on Sloat Blvd to get to the parking lot. Enjoy!!
author: Anne G.

description:
Doggy heaven, as everyone knows...

But it's also a heavenly places for humans!  Be ready to climb those stairs, but the trails around Fort Funston offer gorgeous scenery replete with the Pacific Ocean, Lake Merced, cliffs, and cute pups galore.  

My dog gets helllaaa HYPHY here.  I get only semi-hyphy.

P.S. My dog doesn't have the best recall (in fact, he often ignores me completely when I call his name) and so there aren't many places I can take him off leash.  Fort Funston is perfect b/c you head down a trail towards the beach, and you dog has nowhere to run off to.
author: Sid D.

description:
One of the nicest, prettiest dog parks I have ever been to! The beach is clean, the paths are cleans, people always clean up after their dogs, and there is tons of greenery! I would definitely bring my dog back.  Most of the dogs run free. Lots of people bring tennis balls/frisbees for their dogs to fetch, and the walk down to the beach isn't bad at all.  bring your dog here!! its a good socialization experience for your pooch. 

Lots of parking, a drinking fountain for dogs, paved paths, and tons of different trails.
author: Ashley M.

description:
This spot is the shiiiiittttt!!!! I love bringing my dogs here, they absolutely love it here!! It's not only beautiful but spacious!! I would bring everyone here that had dogs; just to show you how awesome it is! Its not only a great place to go for hikes with your little buddy but a great place to meditate and think....i love the beach they have as well. This spot is so relaxing and most of the owners and there buddy are well mannered. They have a little area for water breaks for your pooch if they get thirsty. 

COME CHECK IT OUT! ITS WELL WORTH THE DRIVE AND TIME!! AND YOUR DOGGY WILL LOVE YOU FOR IT =)
author: april j.

description:
Should I be playing with the words like everyone else?

FORT FUNSTON- tons of fun, funstown, foot snot, nut snort, no fun...not!!!   

OR

Should I write this review as if I were Doobie or Jessie my two dumb dogs?    

"Uncle David takes us here when we've been good" (I aint ready to be Daddy David!!)
"Uncle David why does Doobie hump me when his nuts were already chopped off?"  Because Jessie he is displaying dominance.
"Uncle David why am I so skinny and Jessie so fat?"  Because Doobie she eats your food when you arent looking.  

Davids bottom line-  a great place to take your dogs for some socializing.  Bring stuff to cover your car seats with.  Dogs get extremely dirty running around on the beach.
author: David L.

description:
While the concept of Fort Funston seems like heaven for dogs because of two uneducated dog owners who let their dog run off leash,  my sweet six month old Bernese Mountain Dog puppy  (who was leashed) was attacked without provocation.  

The Pit Bull's owners stood there dumbfounded while their dog viciously attacked my pup and had no clue about how to get any control over their animal whatsoever. Fortunately for me and my pup, my husband was there and was able to wrestle the Pit Bull away from my pup and my husband escaped unscathed.  My poor puppy didn't fare as well and had lots of bleeding.

I am NOT anti-Pit Bull whatsoever having had three of them in the last 15 years.  However, if you are going to own an aggressive breed at least take the time out to learn how to be a proper owner for this type of animal.  It's simple math:  Aggressive breed + uneducated owner = trouble.

Bottom line:  people who have no control over their animal should stay the hell out of Fort Funston!  Take your dog to an obedience class rather than let them terrorize other animals.
author: Ang D.

description: This is the best doggy beach/park I've been to! It's nice, clean, and huge space for my dogs to run around in! It has amazing views of the city - and I especially love coming here during foggy days because it makes me feel like I'm in Jurassic Park!  Great variety of dog breeds --- though most of the smaller doggies come during around noon.   For the most part, everyone picks up their dog's poo and everyone is just very friendly ( both people and dogs).
author: Emy D.

description:
I've died and gone to doggy heaven. (that is what my pugsley would say if he was alive and real)

I came here to meet with some yelpers and their pets. Unfortunately I miss everyone. Prior to the day, I had a terrible evening. I had planned to come here for several weeks, I've never been but always wanted to. I've continually adore the ocean, the sound and movement of the waves, the salty breeze, and for the love of nature and its natural habitat.

As I walk around, it seems like an adventure had taken place. Imagining what canine friend I would come across next. At the end of the tunnel, there he is.... PUGSLEY, walking in stride and in aww, "my owner really loves me". While his new found friend is on the leash, Pugsley looks happy. 

This place is great for dogs, kite flying, and for hang gliding. Sometimes in solitude and sometimes with friends.

FYI:
Be sure to bring a camera and NEVER leave the memory card behind.

Today is my first year YELP Anniversary.
author: Stanley K.

description:
Me, my two little ones, and my hubby LOVE this ginormous dog/people park :).

It's so huge and great for walking and exercise for you and the little mutt in your life.  I'd really have to say that my critters had such a great time here.  They were able to run and play as much as they pleased.  It's not just a gated off little plot of land... it's like dog heaven!
author: Kay R.

description:
I came here on field trips as a kid. It was fun, as indicated by the name. I hear Gen. Funston's refugee camps were the place to be.

I learned that certain plants are edible. I later learned that lettuce is a plant. Not so cool anymore, though it was a pleasant experience brewing tea in the fields with freshly picked Chrysanthemum flowers. Thank you, Ft. Funston, for turning all us 6-year old boys into metrosexuals.
author: Keane L.

description:
I only came upon this listing because I keyed in the word "Poop" to see what would come up and this happens to be the first listing. 

I don't know if being known as the number one Poop destination in San Francisco is going to generate much interest, but hey, who am I to say?
author: Brandon B.

description:
dog friendly my ass!
This place was getting expensive in the way of vet bills.  On two consecutive weekends, my dog chased some little dog into the brush and wound up puncturing an eye (yeah, one each week)

Then it was the urinary tract infections from rolling around in the sand with the other dogs,

then it was the fungal infection on the nose when he went sniffing around who knows what.

it's been two years since I brought him to Fort Funston and...what a surprise! two years without emergency vet bills!

this place is a disease waiting to happen.  The communal slobber troughs are enough to make anyone who's heard of Parvo shudder!

take 'em for a nice walk in GGP instead.
author: Lisa B.

description:
It is often said, you don't have to go far to get a world away.  There is no other place were this rings truer than Ft. Funston.  If I were to say "Funtown" aloud right now the dull thudding of thwapping tails would drown out all other noise in my home.

Tucked in the south western most corner of the 7 x 7, it is a puppy paradise, a hang glider launching point, a native plant restoration center, a piece of military yore.  With or without a dog it is a quick and thorough escape from all that is urban.  

On one visit a man walking with a toddling boy explained this place as, "Doggie Disneyland." The boy let out an, "Ooh" of recognition.

Back in our Outer Sunset livin days we would take the dogs here every morning.  Now that we live on the far eastern edge of the city we all have to settle for weekend trips.  I'd reckon we have been there well over five hundred times and it will never get old.

Things to look for:

The chartreuse hang glider  where the pilot's feet are facing forward, that thing is fast.

"The Historian" as the wifey and I call him is a older white haired vagabond if you will, who walks through Funston everyday constantly jawing about events in San Francisco's past.

Climb to the top of the Battery for and even more spectacular view than from ground level.

The stand of cypress in the center of the, "Loop Road" an enchanted grove if even there was one.

Dog or not this place is a must visit.
author: Erin W.

description:
Brody, have you ever seen the ocean?  Have you ever played in the sand?  Have you?  I wish I could ask these questions.   I wish that Brody could answer, but he cant, cuz he is a dog, so I decided to find out for myself.  

Fort Funston is littered with doggies all there to play, hike and frolic on the beach.  It was a beautiful day, so Cadmium, Willie and Brody all came to join in the doggie fun.  I let him off leash, and the second Brody stepped on the sand, I knew my answer to the questions I  was wondering about.  He stepped onto the sand with hesitation, looked totally goofy and it was pretty entertaining watching him attempt to walk.  There are paths paved that he was cool on, but the sand was pure comedy.  Until we got down to the packed wet sand...where his first glimpse of the ocean was a moment to soak in.  He went straight to the water, chasing butts as he loves to do, ready to have the best adventure he has had yet.  I mean he was rescued from Sacramento.  How much fun could that have been?  

So much to explore.  So many areas still left untouched by Brody....and me.  This was my first time too. :)
author: Lauren F.

description:
The Doggy Beach is my new favorite place to spend a sunny sunday afternoon. I don't have a dog yet and get a big yen for one every time I'm there. I fall in love with several dogs on each visit and the owners are usually more than happy to tell us everything we want to know about the breed in general and their fabulous pooch in particular. Last time I was torn between a gorgeous golden Viesla and an adorable Great Dane puppy. One of these days I'll make a decision. In the meantime, doggy-shopping at FF is the best.

Oh, and the hang gliding is glorious. Go up on the observation platform and you will hear this amazing "swooooosh" sound as they fly right over your head... it's like Lord of the Rings when their shadows pass over you, only less scary...
author: Cathie C.

description:
It might as well be Disneyland if my doggie was a 7 yr old human.  It's her favorite dog park and we've taken her to quite a few.  There's always a lot of other dogs around for socialization and they are all free to roam off-leash.  

My secret confession? I think I love this park just as much as my dog.  The views are amazing and I always feel happier after a visit.  It's very relaxing, even if you're just taking a stroll without making it down to the beach.  The beach is amazing...just be prepared for a steep hike on your way back.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Dog disneyland.

Probably the best dog park in the entire country.

Expect thousands of dogs on a good weekend day....

I have never seen a serious doggy fight here..cuz of the dogs dont like each other they can just move on to the next dog. Dog after dog after dog.

The only negative is there are so many dogs in such a huge space, your dog probably wont recognize many friends.

Great place if you want to get exercise along with your dog.
author: Eric H.

description:
Disneyland for Dogs is what we typically call this place. Soooo much fun for the pooches (and their people). You can work your way down to the beach and get a hardcore swim (they can) or if you want to keep the car semi-clean after wards,  you can have a land-based hike. 

Couple of cautionary tales, when my oldest was a puppy he jumped off a washed-out cliff. He was (miraculously) OK after the fact but it was a breathless moment or two. Also, as a few folks mention (and as anyone who has ever done anything outdoors in SF well knows) layers are usually needed. Hot, cold, windy, sunny, foggy, all can hit you at various times in the same hike. If you have a super-sheepish dog know that sometimes the cops are firing at their shooting-range and that can be heard in the distance.

One of the other things that's really great about this place is (for whatever variety of reasons) there never seems to be any conflict between the dogs. (It's a hard place for any animal not to have a blast). Best dog park EVAH!
author: James F.

description:
I love, love, love Fort Funston and so does my Lola.  From the scenic views, the easy beach access and the variety of dogs makes this spot a for sure treat for myself and my dog.  

The enormity of the park is breathtaking.  Leaving so much room for the hundreds of dogs that visit their daily.  Parking is rarely an issue and those who come to Fort Funston are always so nice and friendly.
author: Alena R.

description: Fort Funston is doggie heaven, especially accompanied by fellow Yelpers Carol, Jay and Carla and their adorable dogs.  Love the multiple water bowls and garbage cans to help take care of Fido's every last need.  It does get cold so bring a jacket!
author: phil h.

description:
The greatest reward you can give your puppy is taking them to Fort Funston on a sunny day.  

Feel the doggy love.
author: Kat R.

description:
I forgot how beautiful Fort Funston can be. I used to come here in my teens, along with my cousin, my uncle and his pack of pit bulls. Or when the weather was nice enough to sit and look out at the best view in the bay. But since moving to the East Bay I've forgotten about Fort Funston. (please forgive me!) 

I decided to test my dog's car ride threshold and take her from Oakland to Daly City. She made it without getting sick, which meant my day was off to a good start. I took her to Fort Funston for her FIRST off leash walk. I was a bit nervous at first, but I realized once she was off leash, she was actually very well behaved. There were tons of people here due to the nice weather and dogs running around everywhere. The dog owners were all pretty chill and so were their dogs. The views here are awesome (weather permitted) and you barely notice how far you end up walking because it's so nice.

As for cleanliness, most everybody is responsible enough to pick up after their dogs, but there are some people who are just plain lazy. I saw someone leave a dog baggy full of poop on the ground. Like really, you picked it up but you can't throw it away. SMH. I hope someone lets their dog poop on your doorstep and you walk into it barefoot. I'm just saying....

Now that I know my dog can handle an off leash excursion with tons of other dogs around, I will be hitting up Point Isabel in Richmond. Review for that coming soon...
author: Joshua C.

description:
I am always amazed at how clean and safe this place is, considering the number of dogs that come here every day of the week.  There is nothing quite like watching hundreds of pups of every size and shape romp around, meet & greet, swim if they so choose, and generally get the most out of life.  Our dog comes here every day and I don't think her life would be the same without it.

Brief update: apparently there was a recent rash of car break-ins at Fort Funston, mostly on weekdays.  I know at least two people who had stuff stolen out of their vehicles.  However, thanks to our friendly district supervisor Elsbernd, the SFPD was alerted and has been patroling the area.  If your car was or is broken into, please contact the police (non-emergency, of course).  We'd like to keep Fort Fundog a safe and carefree place for dogs and owners alike.
author: Gene G.

description:
This place deserves an Eleven. More stars please!

I am a long-time Funstonite and never tire of the sight of our dogs running free, eyes gleaming and tongues lolling. It's a veritable parade of dog breeds in a beautiful setting. The paths and views are so spectacular that the dogs' companions get a special treat -- it's more than just taking the pooch for a walk. Breathe the fresh air and know that this is one of the spots that makes San Francisco extraordinary.

Moreover, dog owners are conscientious about clean-up and take care to remove dog messes. Funston dog walkers hold monthly clean-up "parties" to take care of any overlooked landmines. I have never participated in one of these (I believe they take place usually on Tuesday mornings or something?), but have heard rumors of donuts? Something about scooping poop along with eating donuts seems wrong, but I reckon I won't knock it till I try it!
author: Liza T.

description:
This place is the best place EVER for dogs. Even better than Roy M. Butcher Dog Park. It is HUGE and a great place for dogs and people alike. If I could, I'd easily give it 10 stars. There is no place in Southern California that could beat it either.

There are long hiking trails that you could start on that lead to the beach. SO many dogs off leash, so wonderful to see. I didn't take one of my two dogs off leash during the trail part just because I wasn't sure how she would react since she is still young. But once we got to the path that leads to the beach, both dogs ran free and there was no where they could get lost or run away to. There's a mountain that blocks the beach from streets and such. I totally felt confident that my dogs would be safe in this area. 

Dog owners were responsible and friendly. The weather was just right. There are a bunch of hang gliders, neat to watch. Trash cans are readily available and so were water fountains. Great place to take pictures too.

It was just so relaxing to take them there. Even though there were tons of other dogs running around, it did not feel cramped or crowded. I know that the dogs absolutely loved it. We'll be taking them there more often from now on.
author: Pamela B.

description:
When i lived in L.A. I had the hardest time finding a good dog park/beach.  I would have to drive all the way to Laguna Beach just to have at least a good mile to explore with my beautiful companion (my Dog).  Now that I've moved up here... wow, i wish i was able to show this to my Dog (Her name is Ein in case you were wondering), this is a Dogs wet dream, or the same kind of excitement when i traded my old stupid cell phone to a RAZR a few years back.  
It has all kinds of terrain.  Sand, Dirt, Cement, as well as a Beach in which Dogs can freely soak themselves in order to seek revenge for all the times you failed to pick up their poops.
I love this place, lots of things going on, and even if you dont have a dog, enjoy the solitude and calming sounds of the ocean crashing on the rocky/sandy shores.
author: Riko H.

description: I looooove how this place is soo dog friendly.  The owners are also so super friendly and also responsible with their dogs.  I have a long hair chihuahua and although he's not tiny I still worry once in a while he might get stepped on by a big dog.  If my little guy had a Yelp account he would give Fort Funston 5 stars too!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
This is by far the best park to take a dog. It's sometimes crowded, depending on the time of day, but there's so much space that it rarely seems like it. There are beautiful trails winding through the coastal dunes and forests, with amazing views of the city and ocean - or, sometimes, amazing views of the fog over the city and ocean.
There's a nice stretch of beach to explore, and you can also climb around on the old ruins if you're all adventurous like that.
People come to hanglide all the time, here, too, which is wonderful to watch.
Our dog Mali loves the place, and people are generally all dog-people who know to ask before reaching toward a dog and don't get too agro when she acts like a bee-ach towards them. (We're training her, I swear!)
author: Owen L.

description: The best beach to take you dog to in the city, there is tons of room for them to run around, all the dogs are pretty well behaved although we did run into a couple of wanna be thugs who claimed that if my dog got too close to their pit he would attack....he seemed friendly though, felt sorry for it. Anyways if you are going down to the beach area there is an easier way to access it from the north, the walk down from the hang glider section isn't hard but the walk up is a lot longer up than the northern access.
author: Bruce W.

description:
When dogs dream of heaven, it is Fort Funston.  It is my favorite dog park in the city, and my finicky, silly French bulldog loves it too.  Take her to Stern Grove, and she looks at me like, "Are you serious? You got me off the couch for this?"  Take her to Fort Funston, and she gets into her doggie groove, going up to perfect strangers for a pat, digging around in the ice plants, and marking, marking, marking.  Good God, she must keep a stash of Gatorade in the car where I can't see it, otherwise she'd surely pass out from dehydration.

The reasons we love it so much are:

Lucy:
1/ Off leash = freedom
2/ Lots of different environments: sand, woods, cement, ocean
3/ Nice watering hole at the halfway point

Me:
1/ Off leash = freedom
2/ Beautiful view of the ocean
3/ Nice, nice people who all love their dogs & clean up after them :)
author: Liz S.

description:
I love this place!

My owners take me every weekend. I feel the anticipation as we drive down skyline...smelling the fresh ocean air. The anticipation builds as we park and then all of sudden the back of the SUV opens and he we are!!

I run over and take a squirt and then lead my owners down the long steps to the beach. Sniff, Sniff, Sniff.

Ahhhh. I finally reach the bottom and do a mad n crazy run in a circle, before being called back. 

Need I go on.....miles of beach, delicious horse poop, tons of other dogs to chase, wrestle and sniff and water. That elusive water with those crashing waves (Shudder)....I think I will stick to land. 

Is it Saturday morning yet? Sighhhhhhhh

woo-woo
author: Koa t.

description:
Undoubtedly one of the best dog places in the world. Stop taking your dog to a tiny gated dirt-filled area - drag your ass over to Fort Funston. It's pretty much on the edge of town, but you won't be disappointed.

Only things that are bad are when it's windy, it's like death. The loose sand is crazy, just like Spider-man 3. When the tide is high, you can't go down to the beach or when you do it's crazy-crampt.

When it's pleasant weather, it's great. The place is absolutely huge and tons of terrain for your dogs to run around in (just hope they don't get lost, like my dogs have many times). Not only can you hike on the top terrain (beware of the side woods, there's sometimes a hobo there... awkward!), but you can go down to the beach and sun around. Unlike other dog parks, not only does your dog get a workout, but you can too. Definitely a good way to pretend like you're being healthy and active so you won't feel bad about your Twinkie binges.
author: Kris Q.

description: We take our dog here at least once a month, but definitely as often as we can. THIS IS DOG PARADISE! So much land for them to run around, play in the ocean, and run up the dunes to wear them out. My recommendation to dog owners is to bundle up, it gets cold there. Also, wear shoes you don't mind ruining because the hill to get down to the beach is steep and muddy. My dog loves this place, and if you own a dog, you owe it to them to take them there.
author: Sam S.

description: Un-freaking-real how beautiful it is here.  I can't believe it took me like 4 years living right by it before I ever went.  Now I go at least once a week to run up and down the gigantic sand dunes.  Dogs are always chasing me.
author: Roy G.

description: Love, love, love, absolutely loveeeeeee this park.  Fort Funston is my favorite off leash dog park. I come here about 5 times a week with my puppy. There are so many dogs at all times of the day.  The view is gorgeous. You can seriously walk here for hours without being bored. I have never faced a problem here. The only thing you need to care for is checking the weather beforehand because it gets pretty windy.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Ear to ear doggie smiles here we come!

I've taken my two small social phobic dogs to this park, and they love it.  The trails are wide enough for dogs to have their space (even with tons of other dogs around.)  

The pups could mingle without feeling overwhelmed, and in turn they are blossoming into social butterflies.

Also,  the kids (grabby gremlins to my dogs) who usually try and pounce on my dogs ('cause they're so cute) didn't manage to faze my pups.  Instead, the pooches winked at those little tots and kept on prancing through this slice of doggie heaven.
author: Kara D.

description:
This place is, simply, dog heaven. Miles of trails, acres of beach, and hundreds of canines everywhere, in all shapes and sizes. 

Dog getting thirsty? There's a fountain with dog bowls, just ahead. Want to toss a tennis ball for your dog but forgot to bring one? Just grab one of the communal ones. Need a "poop bag"? You'll find bag stations which volunteers keep stocked and available. 

The weather is often beautiful (this is SF, after all, so you never know), the crowd is always friendly, and leashes are not required. You never need to be self-conscious about your dog, because EVERYONE here is a dog lover, and 99% of the dogs are happy and well-behaved. 

Our favorite walk is from the parking lot north, along the trail through the old bunkers, then down to the beach. Turn South along the beach (let your dog swim, chase tennis balls, etc), and then you'll get to a set of steep sand-step switchbacks which will bring you back up to the parking lot. The last bit is steep enough that it's a good workout for man and beast, and there's a drinking fountain for both at the top of the hill.

Fort Funston must be seen to be believed. I cannot imagine a place closer to dog heaven.
author: Bret W.

description: Okay, I've heard about this place so many times but actually never came until recently. Couple of months ago, I got a pitbull puppy and I've been dying to bring him out but haven't been able to because of his shots. Now that hes about 4 months, with his shots we were able to bring him to the park. HE LOVED IT! Everyone here was really friendly, and this was like DOG HEAVEN for him. I got something out of it too, which was being able to see my pup socialize with other dogs (made me really happy) and also the fact that I got some exercise too! Its really hard bringing my dog out because a lot of people see pits as "scary or vicious animals", but I really liked the fact that everyone was accepting here. Definetly going to come here at least 2 x's a week!
author: Colette P.

description:
This is THE most awesome dog park/beach SF has! It has 3 different trails to get to the beach and is so amazingly beautiful with the ocean beside it.
Every time I take Spencer (my basset doodle) there, he is in heaven! Lots of space to run, chase and be chased! I can't stress the fact how awesome this place can be if you have a dog! Plus you can get some nature/ocean/walking time on the beach. Even if you don't have a dog, I suggest going there for the beauty this place has to offer and you get to see so many kinds of dogs(that is if you are interested in getting one or like petting others dogs :) 
NOTE: Wear proper shoes and bring extra towels to wipe all that sand off!
author: sandhya ..

description:
The coolset bestest funnest place ever. Granted, it's kinda strange it being an old army fort and certain WWII ghots definitely linger their anti-japanese anti-axis of evil, errr, i mean just the "axis" presence there....but the puppies, the dogs, the happy happy dogs purify this place of any evil. 

and the beach, nice-a$$ beach, was so wonderful that i thought sampson, tito, and i were all dreaming the same dream. serrriously, yo.
 i consider this place the best dog park ever!
author: Sprout S.

description:
If you don't have a dog this place is sure to make you want one!

And, if you live in SF and own a dog and have yet to bring your pooch here you are a horrible doggie parent!
author: Jeff P.

description: The best place for dogs! We were on a drive with our dog and 2yo son, looking for a park to play in, and randomly found Fort Funston. The first thing we noticed was that nearly EVERYONE had their dogs with them. It was doggy paradise! The trail is great with lots of open space, and it's cliffside, so you get a beautiful ocean view. There are also tons of hang gliders in the area which is neat to see. Even with hundreds of dogs and people, it is quite relaxing. The trail leads to a pathway down to  a beautiful beach area where we let our pup loose and played fetch and socialized with other dogs. Our 2yo son also had a blast with all the running space and dogs. We live in the South Bay, but would definitely take a drive back here.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
That I love this place doesn't matter. What matters is that my dawg, Milo, loves it. 

SO much to do there, to sniff, to chase (not the nesting birds of course!) and most of all, which he's doing that, I get to talk to some of the really cool dog owners. I love taking Milo to the local dog park but sometimes, the local dog owners -- yeah, not so much. My dawg's a mutt, a lovable, loyal and super sweet tempered mutt. But a mutt nevertheless. Dog owners in my hood can sometimes not like the mutt. They like pedigree papers and a dog who doesn't look like Tramp  in Lady in the Tramp (and is 75 lbs at 7 months!).

But dear Fort Funston with all the cool sand and other owners. You've won my and most importantly, my dawg's, heart.

Woot! - Me
Woof! - The Dawg.
author: joann p.

description:
It's absolutely gorgeous on sunny days. There are so many trails and so many lovely doggies to watch frolicking with other lovely doggies! It's a dog lover heaven!

The wooden step ladder that leads to the beach is a wonderful beginning and/or end to your beach run/hike! It's an amazing workout. Lastly, if you are interested in a particular breed and see it, the owners are actually very willing to talk about their dog and give you tips, suggestions and information! A definite must for anyone who loves nature and leads the ultimate active life.

Oh, last thing...hang gliders! Check it - http://www.flyfunston.org
author: Dorothy S.

description:
I haven't been here for a while, but I used to LOVE going here. We used to take our dog out to play and get REAL dirty before a nice mango scented bath. 

Yes, dogs are everywhere but most of them are so kind and gentle!!! Dog walkers & Pet Owners unite!!! 

I was a bit bumbed when the blocked off the clift side section with orange tape the last time - maybe it's because someone attempted to jump off?!? 

Just a tip, be careful of WHERE you step. . Let's just say my first experience wasn't the best. . . it was all nice fresh and mushy. . and smelly.
author: Michelle B.

description: My dog and I absolutely love this beach! I've come here a few times with a beagle meetup group I'm apart of and it has always been super fun. We are always finding new trails away from the beach and then go for a stroll along the water.
author: Madison A.

description:
Fort Funston is great for dogs of all sizes.  From a Great Dane to a little Maltese mix like my pup.  They have paved paths or sandy dunes and wooded areas that make for very interesting sniffing.  There's even a trail down to the beach.  Most of the dogs are well behaved and I haven't run into any problems yet.  The park is well maintained and people pick up after their dogs!  I don't go during foxtail season or when it's too windy(you'll get a mouth full of sand and you'll wish you had goggles).  

If your thinking of adopting a dog(please adopt rather than buy from breeders) you should come here and do some homework.  You can ask the dog people questions they're really nice and friendly and probably love talking about their dogs.  You can find a dog walker and find out about the type of dog you want and their temperament.  

Fort Funston is like Cheers everyone knows your dog's name(but probably not yours).
author: Joni S.

description: Best dog park ever! But it does get really crowded on nice days. DRIVERS SLOW DOWN! there are dogs every where!!! But other then that, My first and probably only choice when a nice walk with the doggies are in order.
author: Nghi Thu H.

description:
I love the fact that Dogs are so accepted here in San Francisco compared to many other places I've been. Fort Funston is probably what it is like in Dog Heaven. My dogs love it here no matter what the weather is like.
I would definitely give it 5 stars with the exception of all the people (usually the dog walkers with 6+ dogs) who don't have control over the dogs they have with them. I wonder if the people who are paying to have their dogs walked know how many dogs are in each group? Witnessing this only makes me never want to hire anyone else to walk my dogs knowing how greedy the dog walkers can be. They appear to be way more concerned about the money they can rake in for each trip than the well being of the beloved pets they are suppose to be watching over. The only thing they have going for them is that dogs are a very smart species. So pretty much what I see is the dogs walking a bunch of avaricious wayfarers.
The # 1 problem with this is when the dogs veer too far off the trails they disrupt the Bank Swallows which are a threatened species. Fort Funston is one of only two nesting sites for this diminishing species which makes this a crucial matter that I see overlooked on a regular basis. Not to mention all of the countless other types of plants and animals that live here. Don't they realize that eventually this can lead to strict regulations on where you can and cannot have your dog just like there is everywhere else?
If you are going to use (more like abuse) a place to run your business out of free of charge you could at least be aware and respectful of your surroundings. Just sort of seems like a lack of common sense to me, considering all of the neglected signs that are posted around the area.
author: Paulette B.

description:
Thousands of dogs can't be wrong...two paws up!

Our dog Sato loves loves loves loves Fort FUNston.  Everywhere you look, dogs having fun, dogs playing and dog mommy and daddys smiling.  

Everyone is courteous and cleans up after their furry kids, making the park a great place for everyone.  There are the occasional grumpy hikers sans dogs that get miffed when a happy go lucky dog runs into them, but they are the minority here. 

Don't go if you don't like dogs because the dogs will sense this and bum rush you!  Do go for awesome views of the ocean, a wonderful place to let your furry kids run free and a chance to see happy dogs frolicking like they were meant to do.
author: Christy L.

description: DOGS! Dogs dogs dogs. My chubby beardog loves coming here to dig and run and troll for treats. I love coming here to watch all the dog walkers with their packs, and to pet every dog that comes up to say hi. It is absolutely impossible to leave this place in a bad mood. It is also impossible to leave without being covered in sand and hair. High fives all around, dogs! You're pretty great.
author: Corinna K.

description:
This is Buster's favorite place EVAR!!! So this review is really for him.
He is a beach dog and loves nothing more than running along the shore, bonus if there is a horse to run after. You can totally let your dog run crazy on the beach, which is great for you and your dog.
Ft. Funston is super, duper dog friendly and the perfect place to take your pooch or just go dog watching. It's also one of the few places that we get to see other Basset Hounds. Also one day I counted EIGHT Beagles. Damn!!
author: Catty C.

description:
