Beautiful.  The most fun a dog can have and great views and walking for us.  Just be careful - tonight I witnessed a violent dog whose owner should never have brought him to the beach.  However, this the first time I've ever seen this - and hopefully most owners are more responsible.

All in all a lot of fun.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
It's a great place to walk your dog-  that's for sure! Most of the people are very friendly and so are their dogs. The views are also amazing =) 
But it can get pretty windy up there. If it looks like a nice day and you want to go here for a walk, always be prepared for the wind. 

I've been going here with my dad to walk our dogs since I was little. I love coming here. My dogs always have a great time here. There's so much to sniff, see, and they can play with other dogs.
author: Paula G.

description:
This is Doggie Disneyland!!!  Fort Funston is by far the BEST Park to take a dog to.  This is a place where a dog can be a DaWg!  It  also offers excellent views of the pacific ocean, and to the east beautiful views of Lake Merced.  The people are always friendly and social; and if you compliment them on their beloved pet, they gloat.  

I can say however, as fantastic as this place is, I have encountered a few grumpy curmudgeons with the small snappy off-leash dogs; and AGAIN I say... DON'T let your Dog off leash if it's NOT FRIENDLY.

***UPDATE***

If you are lucky enough to have a weekday off and looking for some doggy action, this place is.  It's overloaded with dogs.  I was amazed (but not surprised) at how many dog walkers/sitters converge and form little doggie aliances.  More amazingly, there was NOT ONE dog offleash who had issues...  All dogs, big and small, played with one another and there was no yappity snap dogs around.

Ahhh the Joy.
author: Cris B.

description:
The biggest dog playground in the city! (yes, it's techinically still in SF)

I live in the middle of the city in NOPA but trek it all the way to FF on the weekends so Sasha can romp around freely with all the pups.  As soon as we hit the great highway from Fulton, she starts barking out of control as she catches wiffs of the ocean air.  We usually walk down the sandy trail to the beach where she plays catch in the ocean waves until she gets the runs from accidentally drinking too much salt water =0....but even then, she's still the happiest dog in the world!

Great place to socialize your dog!  Watch out for the dogs that go around humping all the other dogs but other than that it's just a perfect place to take your dog away from your apartment and to treat yourself to some breathtaking views!
author: Susan P.

description:
I don't own a dog...
but this place is still AMAZING.

I got off work early to enjoy the 2nd day of spring and a couple hours of sun before the rains rolled in again.

The wooden ramp leads to wonderful views of the coastline with great benches to take your time and enjoy the ocean breeze.

Hang-gliders taking off was entertaining to watch, too. 

Afterward I took the asphalt path to see where it led to... which were MORE great views of the city, a cool look at the great highway, and an overall different perspective on the city.

All the dogs, though not on leashes, were all friendly and for the most part well behaved and playful. The owners were responsible and I didn't see any problem with dog poop along the paths.

I'll be back soon!
author: Angel L.

description: Best off-leash dog park in the city... Must visit if you are a dog lover!
author: Jose S.

description:
We loved this place.. We miss this place.. When we lived in SF, Fort Funston was our favorite place to be with our Gordon Setter, Kona. Of course, she loved that place & fun for humans too - Usually, dog park is not human friendly. BEAUTIFUL scenery! You must go to this place if you have a dog or if you live near by. 

Sadly, we live too far from there now...
author: Sunny K.

description:
This past weekend, I ventured back out to Fort Funston after a far-too-long-hiatus, with a couple of friends in tow (plus Pants). Decidedly more adventurous, we took a different trail down to the beach and then trekked our way back up along the shoreline. 

It was deceptively cold and windy and there was a serious lack of facilities (we found port-a-potties close to the hang glider takeoff point up at the top but only noticed as we were headed back to the car). 

Eh hem, so as we walked further along the beach we came to some sort of structure with bars, tons of graffiti, and eventually a drop off some 50' into this tunnel. All very exciting and a teensy bit creepy. Our steep hike up the side of the hill was tough for some but I left the Fort renewed, calm and content.
author: Angela N.

description: We took the dogs for a fun afternoon at Fort Funston. Three dogs total. They were in doggy heaven. They got to run around and enjoy the water. It gets a little sandy as you can imagine but the dogs don't mind. They needed baths anyway which by the way is a total must after this outing. The beauty of it all is they got to run and run and run. Great workout against a beautiful background.
author: Heather J.

description:
Fort Funston is an AMAZING place to take your dogs off leash! I've never seen so many four legged friends in one place. If you are not a dog lover, then I suggest that you find another space to visit. Dogs reign Fort Funston.

We took our two Westies there yesterday to meet up with the SF Westie group. There were about 9 Westies ruling the beach yesterday. 

There are so many trails and hills to climb, shells to collect and friends to meet! We even saw people riding horses on the beach and hang gliders in the air.

One word of suggestion: keep an eye on your dogs if they are off leash around the cliffs. Some moron lost track of one of his three dogs. The poor dog ended up on a ledge below the cliffs. My boyfriend and one of the hang gliders had to lower some rope to rescue the little guy. Be aware people!
author: Mona L.

description:
This place is in my neighborhood, and I am soooo sad to admit I didn't know that what I had been calling "doggy hill" is actually Fort Funston. But no matter. This place is famous for being a great place to run down your dog's batteries. It's also a great place to run down your KIDS batteries!!! This is assuming that your kids are not afraid of dogs. My kids love dogs and we go around trying to name all of the different breeds and enjoy watching them frolic in the ocean breeze.  

The view from the deck where the hand gliders take off is amazing. Peaceful and beautiful....we even saw some dolphins frolicking amongst the waves.

There's a sandy path down to the beach that's actually on quite an incline. Going down is ok; try going back up. That's going to add a nice calorie burner to your walk. Also, the walk along that stretch of the beach is so refreshing with relatively few people and clean.

The paths are smooth and wide with plenty of room for dogs and humans. Watching the dogs and enjoying the view is such a great distraction that you could have yourself a good walk and not even know it...that's the best kind of exercise!
author: Virg Y.

description: A gorgeous beach to let your doggies run free. Love the gorgeous views and my dogs love the wide open beach to run around on and the plethora of other pups to play with.
author: Katie B.

description:
Wow, what a great place. High up on the bluffs, you see nothing but miles of ocean - with trails to walk on. Nice to get some air and let your dog run off leash. Lots of dogs there so they all socialized - or not if you want to. There was both dog and human drinking fountain for water. Today we saw hang glider in the sky and come in for landing. It was a pretty good day. Will be back again to get exercise with dog. I saw an official park sign that showed logo of dog and human icons falling off the edge... yeah don't get to close. The edge of the bluffs look quite unstable. Have fun, be safe.

Note: we saw portable potty, so pee before you come.
author: Lola L.

description:
this place is absolutely beautiful!!!!!! its a friday and my friend wanted to go to the beach, but i really wanted to take my dog out to get some air. 

we headed out here around noon, its nice and sunny with only a lil wind. already you can see dogs running everywhere! my baby isn't really friendly with other dogs so i was scared to see how he would react. he was barking in the beginning but after seeing so many dogs, he would just dart around and looked so scared. SIGH =[ 

but i could tell he was enjoying the outdoors and fresh air, he was soo energetic and crazy. All the dogs were extremely friendly and I wished i coulda let my dog run free. Maybe next time. We only ventured on the upper areas since I didn't listen to yelpers and wore flip-flops. The beach water area was indeed muddy so we didn't go down. Still a very lovely place to go! 

and yes becareful where u step! X___X
author: Christine M.

description:
A must for all dogs and their person. This is the mecca of dog parks. This is closest it gets to doggie heaven. Every pooch deserves to roam free in the sand, smell the sea breeze, and meet other dogs. Most people understand dog park etiquette. 

I only ran into one mean lady who was overly protective with her chihuahua. She almost kicked my dogs when they went up to greet her dog. Come ready for your dog to be greeted by other dogs, or don't come at all.
author: N G.

description:
Doggie Holiday! Best described as a hill to hike where dogs are a-runnin freely. You can take your pick of a couple of trails to walk down and we even made our way to this cove overlooking the ocean. Dogs literally have their pick of the litter (my friend's dog kept sniffin the other dogs' bums =P). There's tons to explore: shubbery, sandy walk ways, the beach itself and even grassy fields to be lazy in. It was loads of fun to spend a sunny saturday afternoon with my friends and their dog here and it's so close to my apartment too! 

When I finally have enough time to care for a pooch of my own, I'm taking it to fort funston.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Won't you take me to... Fort Funzy Town? Won't you take me to....Fort Funzy-taown!  that's the song I sing to my dogs when we're on our way to Fort Funston. But they can already smell the beach from Sloat. 

The dogs love it there and I love it too. The place is amazing.  
First off, yeah-- I'll say it... parking!!! There's a huge parking lot there. Always a spot. Me like. 
Second, there are so many different trails to choose from. You can stick to the pavers and cruise around the bluffs, go off-road in the sand and iceplant or head straight down to the beach.
Third, off-leash heaven-- all of it. My dogs get to sniff all the booty they want and get the chance to socialize and run, run, run.
Finally, amazing views of the Pacific and the GG Bridge. Love it.

My favorite part of the park is the beach, but in order to really enjoy the beach section, check the tide schedule. We went early today, and couldn't walk down. Last time we went, we were able to walk well into Daly City territory.  Bring water. There's no fresh water for you or your dog on the beach. Bring a bag or 2. Save 1 for your dog, and use the other to help clean up the tidal garbage on the beach--  not only is it good karma, you feel pretty great helping the environment.

I do have some minor complaints- But think of them as room for awesome-ness.
1. horse poop on beach - we have to pick up ours- why not your big dumper?
2. more trash cans especially by the beach heads
3. you can overhear the shooting range by Lake Merced. Me no like. Not your fault.
4. more water stations and a real bathroom facility.
5. evil sand steps. evil. I'm a softie. not your fault.
author: Pea H.

description:
I love dogs, but I HATE irresponsible pet owners.

Since this isn't technically a dog park, and there are kids running around all over, it would be great if you could keep your dog THAT BITES on a leash.  Thanks!  

Bad apples aside, it's a 5 star park.  Lots of cute dogs, amazing views, and an awesome beach.
author: Ezra C.

description: Wow- is all i can say. My doggie had so much fun. We took the hike down to the beach, and hung out there for a bit, saw a whole lot of dogs going up and down the road. My doggie a leash aggressor was off leash and doing this thing. He sniffed big dogs, small dogs, friendly dogs, happy dogs.. la la. All in all, my little guy is superb happy and now he is tired. He is happy, therefore, I am even happier! whooooooot! 5 star for this place
author: Monika T.

description: Love, LOVE, LOVEeee this dogbeach park! Came here for the first time a month ago and my little pug loved it!! Even if you're not a dog owner, the hike/walk is a challange. Especially the flight of sandy stairs that gets you to and from the beach. Had to stop and catch my breath a couple of times before finally reaching to the top. This is a great off-leach park for your little furry friends and the drive to Fort Funston is totally worth it. I'll be coming back again and again!
author: Esther M.

description:
I come here almost everyday in the afternoon to get some exercise for me and my two dogs! This place is great and has many interesting trails. 

- Most of the times this place has more wind than others..so bring your jacket+hat =)
- Your dogs will get dirty as they play and run.
- Bring extra plastic bags to pick up after your dogs

Just enjoy the fresh air (although on the sandy area near the parking lot is a lil bit smelly due to a lot of dogs' pee and unpicked poop)!!
author: Nany K.

description: I'd kick the damned dogs into the ocean if I could, but instead I go to watch humans hang glide off the cliff.
author: Faffy L.

description:
Dogs, dogs and more dogs!  People here are really good with picking up the litter as well.  I've never seen so many happy people hiking around having the time of their lives swinging little plastic baggies of poop at their side as they jog around and play fetch with their four-legged pals.

Here's one for the useful button:  Be sure and bring shades on a windy day, because you'll miss half of the scenery squinting to keep the sand out of your eyes.

Also, at the historical gun battery on one end, powerless aircraft (hangliders) can take off and can often be seen from the Great Highway.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
came here to hangglide and discovered a little gem. 

dog lovers, come here. 

people just looking for a place to sit, stare and clear you head... bring a jacket. it's frickin' cold!
author: Milly S.

description:
COOL and GORGEOUS!

This place makes you feel like an old school explorer/adventurer!  

"Alas!  I found it!"

Hiking here is fun.  Uh, there are tons of dogs though.  I do love dogs, and would definitely bring my dog here if I had one.  The dogs can give you doggie phobia at times.  BIG DOGS with NO LEASHes, just walking around enjoying the day.  I'd like to use the trail more...if it wasn't such a "dog's world".  I have been butt sniffed and leg humped on more than one occassion.  

Overall, it's still a beautiful place for a hike and I do recommend it!
author: Ladi Da A.

description: Funston is another reminder of why I do not live in a landlocked state. Along with the picturesque NorCal coastal scenery, the ability to take my dog off leash along the Pacific is practically priceless. Just watch out for sporadic mounds of horse crap on the beach. If the weather was consistently warm and sunny (like in Berkeley or Palo Alto), then Fort Funston would be a definite 6-star.
author: Be N.

description:
Jango's review:

I miss this place.  Nothing else will ever compare (Pt. Isabel is close).  

My old dog walker used to take me here everyday, plus this was mommy's favorite place to take me.  I knew every nook and sea plant in the entire park. I once got in trouble with my pack for eating the fresh horse dung on the trail - oh, good times!  Don't worry dog owners, horse dung is very rare.

I even learned how to behave here.  Mommy & Daddy took me here for dog training class.  Those were not always the best memories, but I had a lot of fun chasing other dogs around the trees after class.

Here's our routine: we pull up to the parking lot, and I get very excited. Daddy would calm me down by always doing training exercises with me for a few minutes before getting off-leash.  As soon as that was over, mommy would throw the ball far and I would run to fetch it. Then we would walk down the wood chip area to the doggie-bar and get some water before walking all the way down to the BEACH!  I love the smell of the water at the beach, and I'm still not sure why it tastes weird.  I'm always thirsty after drinking it.

I hope I can go back soon.

Woof!
author: eileen r.

description: Dog paradise! My dog absolutely loves this place.. its her favorite spot. (she told me so today!) Really nice to go at sunset also..
author: Sarah W.

description:
So my boyfriend took me here last week when I came up to visit him. I must say, the view here is one of the most amazing beach views I've seen. It such a nice place to just chill, relax, talk & smoke a cigarette. Not to mention take your pooch. I saw so many dogs just running everywhere. =) 

This place is one of my favorite spots in SF now.
author: Joelle L.

description: beautiful scenery. friendly dogs & people with lots of room to run
author: Sarah D.

description:
This is the place for dog and dogs lovers.  Whenever we get within about 5 minutes of this place our dog goes bonkers!  Its amazing how they know.  There is a ton of parking and bathrooms for humans.

There is a sandy open space up by the parking lot where lots of dogs hang out.  If you follow this path down north from the parking lot, you will get to a beach access spot.  ALong the way there is a water stop for your dog just in case he gets thirsty.  You walk down a mild grade sandy patch.  I would recommend that you check the tides before you go, because its much better at low tide.  

At low tide you can walk out about 20 yards or so.  You can head either North or South on the beach...if you head North then you will eventually hit Ocean Beach.  We typically head south and circle back toward the parking lot.  The only bad part is there is a huge stair case that you need to go up.  It makes it hard because the stairs are really sandy so walking up these is extra hard.

The beach itself is really cool....You can find lots of whole sand dollars and some really cool ocean rocks.
author: Chris A.

description:
The most beautiful views of the ocean - who knew it was a doggy nirvana too?

Dogs, dogs and MORE dogs!   The best part is that my little rat-chihuahua  becomes a toy for all those huge labs.  Poor Bruno...but its funny to see him run like a jack rabbit and chased by 12 hungry hungry hippos.

Oh and the people (dog owners) are fairly friendly...
author: J J.

description: Best dog park, almost as nice as the Point Isabel in the East Bay. My daughter loves to see those hand glider taking off from the cliff. It's pretty exciting to me too. It's a very easy and relaxing walk. Get to see the great ocean view. Sometimes can be pretty windy tho. Off leash dog park is huge for my Jack.
author: Don L.

description: I haven't ventured the beach part of Fort Funston, but walking the trails with the dogs is super relaxing. I love that there are always so many other doggies to run into when walking these trails. I'm from San Diego, and all of the other dog parks I've been to pretty much suck. Fort Funston gives ample amount of walking/running space and the greenery provides for a real nice backdrop. The view of the beach is beauts and every once in a while you can catch the hang glider's take off from the cliffs. Real, real nice. I miss this place!!
author: Felicia G.

description:
I do not have a dog but I am friends to the dogs.
I like going to Fort Funston and saying hello to the various types of dogs. This is their Club Med.
author: Marcus R.

description: Totally great!  This place is dog Mecca and though we did not have a dog with us we had a great time watching all of them.  The paths are nicely laid out and the views are beautiful.  Want to go again.
author: Caroline K.

description: I loved this place so much the first time I visited that I wanted to get married here. Unfortunately, the weather sucked on the day so we had to change venue rather quickly. However, it's still one of my favorite places to go for a walk weather permitting. Yes, and lots and lots of dogs everywhere!!!!
author: Anita L.

description:
1 Star for the gorgeous view
1 Star for letting my dog go crazy chasing the tide
1 Star for the endless hours I could spend watching the hang gliders.
1 Star for providing a zero cost romantic spot for the hubby and myself over the years.
1 Star for just being a big part of why I love living in the Bay Area.
author: Jasmine D.

description:
Klausy gives this place two paws up.

It was a doggy haven.  But damn was it windy.  I don't know if it is always this windy, but I had sand in my hair, eyes, and mouth.  

Klausy loved the beach, romped around with other dogs and frolicked in the shallow waves.  He isn't a swimmer, but I was surprised that he did splash around as much as he did.  

There are tons of dogs to interact with here.  It is a great place to take your furry friend.
author: jen n.

description: It's like Disneyland for dogs... and cool to see the hang-gliders too! I love this place!
author: Angela E.

description:
I'd be lost without Fort FUNston.

We first took our dog Clyde to Fort Funston after finding it on a tip from our vet.  Immediately we were in love and in heaven.  I could have never imagnined such a place.  It is fun for the dogs, it is fun for the people.  Dogs are free to play in the dunes or in the ocean, and they have water, poop bags and trash cans for convenience.  I even find that Fort Funston is almost as good for me as it is for the dogs, very theraputic.  My only advice is to bring layers, it can get pretty cold and windy...
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
Three hundred and fifty years in to the future in a solar system far far away a group of explorers lands on the planet Soror.  Despite the resemblance to earth these humans soon find that the planet is ruled by dogs.  Ulysse, the leader of the humans becomes a research subject and by proving his intelligence he ultimately gets adopted....

Walking around Fort Funston is like being in an alternate universe.  Beware humans.  This place is run by the dogs.  Don't be surprised to find hundreds of dogs running free, enjoying life, and being exceptionally well behaved.  

Our six month old, Captain, had a great time here.  He loved running on the beach, meeting every dog in site, and concluded the day by wiping his mouth on an unsuspecting German tourist in white pants.  (Sorry! But really who wears white pants to dog land?)  

You can bet we'll be back here as often as possible.  Fort Funston is one of a kind.
author: Garrett D.

description: We brought my daughter here this past weekend because she loves dogs and ofcourse the birdy-men (aka hang gliders).  The views are amazing especially the lookout area.  Next time I'll bring a snack and sit and enjoy the view.  Practically all of the dogs are leashless so it's not the best place for a baby but we had a nice walk and more importantly a nice nap when we got home!
author: anne m.

description: Without a doubt THE choice for running your dog off-leash. Hooray for the open space, hooray for beautiful views, hooray, hooray, hooray!  Places like this make me happy I have a dog to keep me going and going and going.
author: Christine V.

description:
Here I am going to wax a bit poetic, as Fort Funston is deserving of no less.

A year before I moved to San Francisco, I flew out from Boston for a five-day visit that would prove to sell my heart on where I should be living. When I got here, I looked up an old roommate from college, whom I hadn't seen in years but with whom I had shaped some very fond memories of around-about-town adventures as we got to know the city in which we lived for four years. Despite the long pause in our friendship, she tucked me into her car with a grin and took me to Fort Funston, telling me it was her favorite outdoor place in the city. Upon arriving there, it immediately became mine.

Where else can you park your car, walk directly to the edge of land, and find yourself beaming like a small child with a new toy as you watch happy, brave people run off the cliff and lift into the air? The first thing you encounter at Fort Funston, if you go on a windy day, is a sky full of hang-gliders swooping gracefully above you. For me they are a half-hour distraction at minimum. Once I finally move myself onward, I love the left(south)-most walk down to the beach--the long path down the cliffside, the heat of the sand as you climb down the stairs, the ice plant covering the dunes around you, the still, flat part at the bottom where there is no wind, and for a moment you think it can actually be a warm day in San Francisco, and then the slide out of the dunes and onto the beach. 

The sand here is much prettier than at Ocean Beach just a mile or two up the road--it's whiter, loser, easier to sink into as you walk. Peppered amidst stones and doggy-trampled bits of sand dollar you might find some whole ones or, if you have sharp eyes, even some fossilized ones (I have a large collection of them at this point). If you walk even ten minutes down the beach you might find yourself alone, and you might find a rock to sit on while you read a book. If you are there in the late afternoon, you might see dolphins. And if you are not an idiot or an east coaster, like the writer of this review, you might realize sooner than 20 visits in that any old day you want you can watch the sun set over the ocean there, as unlike the Atlantic this ocean faces the right direction for that treat. 

Fort Funston is no Half Moon Bay, but as far as beaches in the city go, and in terms of beauty and peacefulness, it's league and leagues above Ocean Beach.
author: Lara F.

description:
Off leash madness!

Fort Funston holds all things dogs love - the beach, a forested area, cliffs for running and chasing balls up, and hells off leash dog ass to sniff at their will. My dog Truman loves to trot around and yell at other dogs and then run away. Awesome.
author: Serene L.

description: Awesome spot to take your dog for off leash play/exploring! Its a nice hike down to the beach,which is clean and beautiful. People are friendly and all the dogs I encountered were too. There are spots for kite flying enthusiasts and benches to rest on up on the upper level of beach. This is heaven for dogs with so much to smell and explore. Parking is free and the location was easy to find. There are porta potties and a drinking fountain with several bowls near it for the dogs. Even if you don't have a dog this place is great for walking,checking out the beautiful views and relaxing. But if you don't like dogs this is not the spot for you. Be sure to bring walking shoes and a towel if your pup takes a dip in the ocean. Also dress in layers as it can be cool here. Overall Highly recommend. If you have a dog you must experience Funston at least once!
author: Jo M.

description:
i've been taking the little Nugget here to get her to mingle and socialize.. and so far so good. she loves it here. 

i like it here too.  the views are amazing. it gets chilly here, but it's still amazing. there's also a spot where hang-gliders can jump off of, and i thought that was cool, except, i've never been able to witness someone doing that. 

the bad part of it all (which is totally my bad anyway) was that i wore flip flops here. there's the beach if you walk it downwards, so of course there's sand. but there's also the dogs and considering that this is a dog park, everywhere is their toilet. yikes!
author: Summer R.

description:
This place is doggy heaven.  I don't have a dog of my own, but I've spoiled friends' dogs by bringing them here for long afternoons playing around with some new friends.  

The ocean and coastal views are truly spectacular, and sometimes you can even see migrating whales while viewing from the top. 

Graceful hang gliders, trotting horses, buzzing radio-controlled airplanes, glistening waves, elated herds of dogs, and happy people make this one of the most enjoyable parks to visit.  

You don't have to have a dog to love it here.  There are plenty of trails to stroll along, treacherous hills to make your ass burn, and benches on which to rest your contemplative self.   It's like nature's grestest playground for man and beast (and I don't mean "beast" in a derogatory way).
author: Jenny K.

description:
Ft. Funston is dog and human heaven. What better way to spend quality time then listening to the waves crash against the rocks, watch hang gliders sail across the sky, and let your dog smell and run till they pass out with happiness in the back of your car?

I'm impressed by the overall quality of dog owners and general good behavior of dogs and people here. Everyone is very conscientious and friendly. Plus you can hike and hike and hike!
author: Mariangela S.

description:
A great place to take the doggies!

It was REALLY windy the day we went, and being unfamiliar with the trails and paths we went down a little "canyon" of sorts and experienced what I imagine to be gale force winds. When we finally got to the bottom, there were dogs a plenty, most running around off leash and in and out of the water. 

If it's your fist time going and get confused, don't park on the side of the road right after the stop light.  If you go up the hill towards the country club, there will be a big sign and plenty of paved parking in the Fort Funston parking lot!
author: christine l.

description:
Doggie heaven for sure...

Wait I take it back. In doggie heaven EVERYONE's poop is picked up and disposed of properly.

I don't get it. I see bags of poop on the trails. If ya picked it up, why can't ya walk it over to the trash?

Back to the heaven part...

I've been to other dog parks in the city. Most a nice, but some are clickish. I like to take my doggies out to different parks so they don't get bored.. as if a dog is ever bored when he's not at home... but I digress...

Fort fun is the best because there are tons of trails so I don't get bored. Walk on the hills, hike down to the beach, sit on a bench and watch the dogs socialize and play. I can walk a mile, or eight. 

I can be alone with my dogs, or I too can socilaize with other dogs lovers...

And somebody tell me this---

why is it is much easier to remember a dogs name than the hansome owner of said dog?
author: Anita R.

description:
This place is pure doggy Heaven!!! When i take my dog to explore the beauty of the valleys and the beach, I take her here, and I swear to god, she is absolutely free and happy! I've never seen her happier anywhere else, than the holy paw palace that is fort Funston! Pure Puppy JOY!

It's great for humans too, to enjoy the view, many natural beautiful places to walk around, and the beach with all the dogs running happily off leash is just lovely! You can't help but be in a great mood when you come to Fort Funston. It's really peaceful, beautiful, and free. :)

I wish I could come here every weekend!
author: Jessie W.

description: I bring my dog here on nice days he seems to love it here. I love the view of the sunset and the random hiking-ish paths I run into.
author: Judy Z.

description: I love it here!  There are families, joggers, hippies, yuppies, such a mixed group of people.  There is always someone friendly with a story to tell.  I love taking my two doggies here on Sundays.  They are usually the smallest dogs their so I have to watch and make sure no other dogs use them as chew toys.  This place can be enjoyed almost any time of the year.  With the beach access its so beautiful in Summer.  I'm actually headed there right now...
author: Krystal D.

description:
BB says, "WOOF WOOF!"

Translation:  "BEST FREAKING DOG PARK OF ALL TIME!"

additon:  BB says, "Fog is scary."
author: Dietrich H.

description:
Fort Funston is like MY FAVORITE PLACE IN THE WHOLE WIDE MAGICAL LAND OF.. um... 

anyway.

You get my point.

I love going there, the dog loves going there, and the bf gets annoyed because I jump up and down in the car seat yelling, FORT FUNSTON we're going to have TONS O FUN! Funstonfunstonfunston.

Then he yells at me to shut up.

One of the cool things I really like though is the board where people who frequent the park will often post notices. Like, park clean up day, a dog is ill =(, or even put up keys that they found. It's really nice and has a great community feel to it. Plus we always run into people we know or just start chatting with random strangers. 

Sometimes they even give us candy. ;p
author: Terra T.

description:
I LOVE this place.  I've been here with the Great Dane Meet Up group a few times which was fun and recently I've started taking my Dane there.

It is so amazingly beautiful.  Most of the people are SO nice.  Dogs get to run around and have a blast.  Most dogs are under good voice control or just don't get into trouble.

Might be a good idea to pay attention to the tides.  When we went last Sunday there wasn't much beach but we ventured down and through the archway and met the nicest couple and their dogs.  Their dogs were more than happy to play and wrestle with our Dane.  Fun was had by all.

I can't get enough of this place and it's easy to get to and there's tons of parking.

If, however, you do not like dogs - this is NOT the place for you.  Most owners watch their dogs carefully but there are dogs EVERYWHERE.
author: Kristin G.

description:
Mommy takes me to Fort Funstons every week and it's my favorite place in thw world. I love running around and playing with the other dogs. Mommy walks me down to the beach where we sit and enjoy watching the waves :)
Saturday's are our favorite, cause that's when Daddy joins us. Love, Daisy May
author: H B.

description:
Doggie Heaven.  Our dog loves this place and we love taking her there.  Its better than an off lease dog park because the humans get their exercise as well.  There is also a great hike (and I hate to hike) down to the beach and its full of dogs and families.

Be sure to watch your step and try not to kill the thousands of beautiful tiny jelly fish that get washed up on the shore (they look like clear rocks).
author: Steph D.

description:
DOGGIES! Come here, you! *chases random dog around* 

Beautiful place to take a walk and one of the reasons why I love where I live.
author: Nathalie L.

description: This place is AMAZING. Where else can you go where hundreds of dogs are running around off leash enjoying the wonderful SF sun and yet there are hardly ever any fights, few steaming piles of dog poo, and most everyone is friendly and responsible? I love this place because even on a SUPER busy day I can find trails to take my dog on where we are the only ones around. Probably one of my favorite places in SF.
author: Melissa L.

description:
What a great lace to take your little pooch. WOW WOW WOW!

My doggie loves it here. SO many other dogs to smell and play with. Over labor day weekend, I came here 2 times and each time, 100+ dogs having fun. 

If you have a dog, come here and let them be FREE!

I love running and chasing "Oreo," in the sand dunes. He is one fast MO FO!
author: David L.

description:
I love this place! my husbands takes our two American bulldogs M-F in afternoon and I am there in morning hours Sat and Sunday. We have a dog group that we meet up with on the weekends and our dogs have BFF's they see. 

One thing I hate are the dog owners who bring there dogs who are not trained, and the ones who are not regulars and assume that my dogs are aggressive, and then freak out. If you are not used to being around a lot of different kind of dogs do not go here and freak out, chances are you will scare the dog. 

I love seeing my dogs happy when they get to the beach, Vinny my bigger American bulldog seems to have a lot of people who know him, sometimes the walks are longer because he is out saying hi to new people, and I have to wait until he finishes saying hi.
author: madi b.

description: Simply put they should drop the ston from the name. No place on earth was created with the idea of dogs and their owners in mind. From the hike down to the massive beach to the waves, to the sand the dogs love it and you will too. There is no greater escape from the humdrum of concrete madness for the four legged or two legged paws than this place. You can watch the tails wag with joy as they run in and out of the ocean as you gaze around and see the occasional dolphin jump into the air or the hand gliders who take off from the cliff. Bring a blanket, perhaps wine and cheese, go at low tide and be prepared for your sandy furry best friend to sleep post-funston for 24 hours straight!
author: Gurpreet T.

description:
I love this place! Though it's an off-leashed park, I don't trust my 3 dogs w/o leashes. This park is not fenced so be careful of them running down the hills off the street. It's dangerous because these people are going 40-50mph. 

Bring your dogs here if you want them to socialize. And this got to be the most populous park that I've been to. Highly recommended.
author: MT D.

description:
While I have yet to actually bring my dog here (I rarely go to the city with the dog in tow as I am usually there for work reasons or some sick relative and take BART).

I have been here with others who live in the city with their dogs and have had a great time! Great place to meet dogs and their owners and plenty of open space and places nearby that allow you to eat with your dog.
___

Update finally brought my dog here and she had a GREAT time judging by the wagging tail. The stairs up & down can be better made and they could use more water fountains but other than that it was barfick!
author: Valerie F.

description:
Who knew Fort Funston was both dog and nude-friendly...

So as you all know, this week was hoTT.  I decided it would be a great idea to hit up the beach three days in the row.  [ We usually park on the left-hand side where only the adventurous go] Going this way gives you a chance to walk through the colorful dunes and see San Francisco as it once was - a peninsula of dunes!

*Wednesday was medium hot. My boyfriend and I kept our clothes on but the shoes and socks were off and the legs were in the water.

*Thursday was out of control hot so I ran out of my house and took my dog to the beach around 11 a.m.  We walked far south to the end of the beach where it's no-mans-land and I immediately took my clothes off.  I swear I didn't see a soul for almost an hour or so....ahhh

....But when I finally did see someone, I bashfully put my bottoms on and stayed top-less. It was chill - there weren't any dirty looks or weirdo lurkers.   Apparently that was the que everyone needed because each person, and couple that walked by me slowly began shedding their clothing and all of a sudden it went from a dog park to a nude dog-owner beach haven.  

*Friday rolled around and although I wasn't nude, I once again brought plenty of water and laid peacefully on the beach for hours....

5-stars, Fort Funston!!!
author: Mennlay A.

description:
By far, one of the best dog parks in SF. With the numerous trails - with 3 different ways to the beach - it's always an adventure at Fort Funston.

It's also a nice place to go if you're thinking about getting a dog as I've seen almost every kind of breed there.

My dog, Lucie, always excited to arrive and always leaves a happy & tired pup.
author: Kelly R.

description: Great place to go with a warm drink in hand and beautiful scenery. Not mention all the fun places a dog's nose can get in to.
author: Sharlene M.

description:
My dog loves Fort Funston. We don't live as close as we used to, so don't go all that often anymore, but we used to go every Saturday. There's all kinds of dogs there - large, small, pure bread, mutts, etc, but the best is that all the owners seem really laid back. 

At some dog parks in the city, owners with their designer dogs don't want your dog to slobber on their dog. But, duh, that's what dogs do. And, these owners just make all the dogs nervous and upset the balance. If you're one of these people, don't come to Ft Funston -- your dog will not only get slobbered on, it will probably roll in sand and then get it all over the seats of your BMW.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Yep, Funston is Tons of Fun (hah) for dogs.  They get to run off leash in wide open areas, in trees, on sand dunes, on the beach, in the water, you name it.  On the weekends, there must be hundreds of dogs here.

The downside is that if Esther (our dog) goes wading into the ocean, she comes back smelling like dried shrimp... oh well, I guess it's bath time.


[NOTE: Watch out for the washed up dead sea lions on the beach... dogs just love that sort of nastiness but it can be dangerous for them.]
author: David S.

description:
A beautiful, dog friendly beach. 

Fort Funston is on the edge of the city -- right across from the Olympic Club Country Club. When you arrive, you will find plenty of parking. Even on an unseasonably warm day. 

It is dog (and owner) paradise as it includes trails, beach and beautiful views.
author: lindsey l.

description: This is officially my favorite dog park in the city!! Not only is the scenery breathtaking and surreal, it's also a great place to bring your dogs with you. If you're not a dog person, I don't suggest you coming here because this whole park is filled with dogs of all sizes. Majority of the dogs are off-leashed, which is allowed here, and I haven't encountered any misbehaved dogs. Although, I do recommend to only let your dogs off leash if you're comfortable with it, since they could run over the hills and into the beach. Owners pick up after their dogs and there's posts with bags in case you forgot to bring some. It's easy to find parking since they have a smaller parking area near Lake Merced and as you go a little further down Skyline Blvd, there'll be a bigger parking lot. Be sure to dress warm because it can get a bit windy. What do you expect? It's San Francisco and right next to the beach! I can't wait to bring my dogs back here again, I really recommend it if you haven't been here before. Once you come here, you'll never go to any other dog parks again because it just doesn't compare!
author: Athena W.

description: I remember the first time I came here was for a camping trip in elementary school. There was a daily hiking and fossil hunting and shell collecting. Years later it's still as beautiful as I remembered it but with ALOT more dogs. Wide open areas for you and your canine. I would let my dog off the leash, but he's a runner and I'm no track star. There's lots of trails on top, getting to the beach is a little tricky. It's a slope with lose sands that's kinda steep. I've seen people tumble down. Once you get to the beach it's a nice stroll, there's hundred of dogs, people collecting shells and starfishes, flying kites, hang gliders above and sometimes people fishing. It's a nice place to take your dog for some quality time, but I still prefer Crissy Fields.
author: Katrina C.

description:
If it's Saturday morning and the weather is decent this is where you'll find us. Louie the Swissy thinks he died and went to Heaven when we arrive. Lots of nice people and nicer dogs.

After the obligatory romp on the beach, then perhaps some trails, it's back to the house for Louie's long afternoon nap. There is nothing better than a burned out puppy and Fort Funston delivers every time!
author: Teri M.

description: I have finally found the ABSOLUTE BEST DOG BEACH.  Miles of trails and terrain accessible to dogs.  Mr. Pickles (our English Bulldog) had a fantastic day at Fort Funston, despite the treacherous walk up those stairs.  Pickles loves the beach and we love letting him roam freely as my husband and I go for a romantic walk on the beach.  We love this place so much, we plan to take Mr. Pickles here every time we pass through San Francisco.
author: Alex B.

description: This place is AWESOME! Hang-gliders, cliffs, and hundreds of dogs running wild -- throw in a picnic and you've got my very favorite way to spend a Sunday afternoon.
author: Tasha D.

description:
This is doggie heaven! Anyone who has a social canine companion must go to Fort Funston. Your dog has all the space s/he needs to run and meet friends. There are plenty of trails and beach access. There's always parking in the parking lot.

Fort Funston is the best place to bring your dog!
author: Gina P.

description:
Yes, this is a great park. Even though our dog had a good time, we like Point Isabel (in Berkeley/Richmond) better. Pros: everything you read in all the other reviews. Cons: 1) location from our home 2) when we went, there were a few families walking around with small children and no dogs...hard to know if they were comfortable around dogs so i put the leash back on when we were around these families just in case (i.e. defeating the purpose of an off-leash park) 

We went to Ocean Beach immediately after for a picnic at the beach, and our dog had just as much off-leash fun. We had a better time there...
author: V. C.

description:
Despite the wind and cold, it is always an enjoyable day with Keema here. Plus, come on, it's really only "California cold"!

Added bonus is you can meet all sorts of cool breeds of dogs.
author: Theda E.

description:
I like dogs. 

This is the place to go with/for dogs. They'll have more fun here than anywhere else in the world. Truely is a doggie heaven. No where else will you be able to go out with your dog and be told so many times exactly how old your dog is instead of being asked. This is the dog place for all the dog people in the area (and out of it.) 
It really is amazing how well kept (non-poopie all over the path) the place is seeing that there are about a million dogs that pass through there daily. 
Lets go again this weekend?
author: Bee C.

description:
As a future a dog parent, I've done some of my best research for a breed during walks at Fort Funstion. Here I've met some of the most socialized and well behaved dogs with the nicest owners (trainers and walkers too) that will tell you everything and anything about their dog.

But if you want some seclusion, you can find it there too. Be warned - it can get very windy on those cliffs!
author: Judy L.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said?
Hanggliders and mass amounts of happy puppies on the beach.
It doesn't get any better than this!

Word to the wise: prepare guests for the hike back up.
author: Claire S.

description:
I love bringing my dogs here! A lot of pups go here too and it's a good place for dogs to play with other dogs and socialize! This place was totally meant for both dogs and humans alike!

Just don't go here when it's windy. Sand flies everywhere and gets in your eyes. =[ But other than that, this place is awesome!
author: Michelle B.

description:
Simply the best place for my doggies I've found in SF.  My disbelief is only now wearing off after my first trip there yesterday.  
Tons of trails to trek? Check.  Beautiful views of the ocean, lake merced and the city? Check. A ridiculously long beach with immense cliffs that keep my pups from running after critters or back to the road?  Check.  Super nice fellow dog owners that calmly let my pups say hello and don't get all freaked if they're off leash? Check.  
I have found my new favorite dog spot!
The only things to be warned of are the massive stair/hike to get to and from the beach and the packs of dog walk groups that can get a little over excited.
author: Tamsen S.

description: This is a beautiful beach preserve and the dogs love it. Doggy went absolutely nuts with happiness here, jumping and running through the damp sand and the low hilly dunes. She started playing hide and seek behind the dunes and it was so cute. It was comfortably cool but sunny on the day we went. There are lots of really nice pretty trails heading from the cliffs to the beach. You can walk along the beach for miles. The huge scope of the place and the salty ocean smells give the dog (and you) a sense of freedom. The hike down to the beach is quite easy although sandy and the views are gorgeous. There are little turn offs along the way where there are spots of woods and fields. I was surprised how dirty my dog got, it was like she had been wading in wet sand up to her chest. Next time I will bring a towel. FYI there are water fountains at the parking lot but no water to be had along the trails. And perhaps the trail is very mildly strenuous when coming back up to the parking lot. Overall, this is a wonderful place to walk, rest, hike, hang out, enjoy with your doggy.
author: p v.

description:
Fort Funston is one of the many reasons why I love San Francisco.  Better than just a day at the beach, and I've never met an unhappy person or doggie there.   The air seems easier to breathe and you don't even realize that you're exercising.  This place always gives me the sense of how big the world is (not to mention the universe).

Porter, of course, loves it.
author: Angela C.

description:
Devin (my dog) starts to get so exited once i turn into the parking lot. I love this place for so many reasons. Lets me pet and play with all sorts of dogs, I get to breath some fresh air and get to spend quality time with my pups. He gets to explore, run and smell to his hearts content.

Ive never seen a dog fight take place. everyones dog seems so well behaved.
author: Alfredo N.

description:
One day, when dpz and I get a dog, this is where we'll take him/her.

:)

We'll pack up a picnic basket, socialize with the other doggies & humans, and enjoy the view.
author: jen a.

description:
Love the Fort.  I've had countless memories of hanging out at the wooden deck to just relax, contemplate the meaning of life, watch the hang gliders almost crash into each other, and viewing the sunset.  Unlike Ocean Beach and the Cliffhouse, the area is a bit secluded in that it's not super adjacent to any road/freeway.  Thus, this place totally epitomizes peace and quiet.  

It's also a great place to take your dog out or to just have a good bike ride along the Fort's trails. I will always cherish those memories if taking out our family Shih Tzu, Taiko, to take a nice walk, only to be almost eaten on a few of those occasions by bigger dogs, but nonetheless we both enjoyed our time there.  Dog lovers, you'll love the plastic bags and trash receptacles made available in the area just in case your dog has to do duties.
author: Joe V.

description:
Doggies get down dirrty! Check the weather forecast because a sunny day at the beach is better than a foggy day. 

We came here for one of the pups birthday paw-ty and it was a success. The dogs ran for a couple of hours with sand in their nose, eyes, ears, and mouth!

Great off-leash park, that is, if your pup has good recall ; )
author: Oanh N.

description:
My dog Katie was in heaven yesterday. The park is absolutely huge and leaves a lot to see. As we walked through the park, we weren't sure which way to turn and walk. It's a magnificent park where my old dog actually will run and can meet other dogs without feeling pressured to play.
A must-go!!!
author: Liz L.

description:
Not only is this one of the best off-leash dog beaches I've ever been to... but it's freaking GORGEOUS!  Tons of running and ocean fun for the pooch, and lots of amazing views and hiking for the people. 

This is a dog, and a dog-lovers paradise.  There are so many places I CAN'T go with my dog, thank goodness for this gem where we are welcome!  

Mattie the Border Collie gives it two PAWS UP!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
This is where I go to get my fix of other people's dogs.  

Me: {Squeal}  Oh my god, your 8 dogs are so cute!!!!!

And the owners are cool and don't freak out when they see me coming.  The dogs here are well adjusted too -- you would be too if your owner (or paid dogwalker) took you here regularly.

Oh, there's a gorgeous ocean view and perfect walking/jogging loop atop the cliff and on the beach, too.  Yay!
author: Leo C.

description: The best dog park in San Francisco. The only total leash free dog park in the area. The dogs that go there are very well behaved and I wish people were as good as the dogs. There are handgliders on windy days and a guy with 3 colorful parrot walking his birds off leash as well. The only downside is that you need to bring a jacket even during the summer because the temperature is about 10+ degrees lower on an average from lower grounds.
author: Alex V.

description:
This was one of my all time favorite places in the city even before I got a dog.  I would love to go out there and walk along the oceanside cliffs and look out across the city and the bay.  Incredible views and atmosphere and don't let me forget about the hangliders.  

When the conditions are right (I do not know what the "right" conditions are) there can be many folks flying on the breeze.  Leaping off the edge of the world with giant multi-colored wings and soaring up to the sky.  All this in the SF city limits (albeit on the far edges of the city)

And now I am one of the lucky dog owners that also gets to take advantage of this amazing place.  I do not think there is a happier place on earth for my puppy.  Running around the dunes, jumping off into sandy landings and tons of other dogs to play with.  An hour here and she is done for days, snoozing and dreaming of the next time she gets to go back.
author: David R.

description: I really can't any anything new that hasn't been said. This place is AMAZING. It is a bit far of a drive, but the reaction from my pup is worth it all!
author: Karen V.

description:
Just took my two dogs today for the very first time and loved it! Weather was perfect and my kids had a blast!  It was a nice hike towards the beach, people are nice, lots of dogs& the beach was even clean! 

If you haven't gone, its a must.
author: Sarah C.

description: Besides being a beautiful and expansive dog friendly public beach with trails in the cliffs above and views of local hang-gliders, this place is especially great for our dogs who tend to make a break for it as soon as they come off the leash. The cliffs provide a natural barrier that ensures they can't go far but can still run and play freely.
author: Emily C.

description:
My dog starts whining when we are about half way to Fort Funston because she is so excited to go crazy and play her litle heart out.

This is great place to run your dog off leash. There is the option to stay on the path and run on the green hills or trek down the hill to the beach where the real fun begins. 

Parking is easy with access from 2 lots and free. This offers a great workout for both pet and owner. Myself and my pooch have never met a dog here we didn't like, and there are several poop bags along the way in case you forgot.

All play is safe and secluded, my pooch tends to forget she is trained when she gets in such wide open spaces. Here I feel completely comfortable letting her run.

WARNING: The poochies get very dirty running on the beach, especially is they have long hair. 

TIP: Our key to this is taking her to beach first and the continuing down the path to let most of the sand fall off.
author: Aubrey W.

description:
Your dog will love this place and be eternally grateful to you for letting him run around on the sandy beaches. Perfect for dogs who love to jump in the water to retrieve balls. It's worth it to see the smile on their faces.

Great for you as well. You get exercise that you know you need.

Just remember to bring a couple of towels when you go here. 

The last thing you want is a dirty backseat full of sand courtesy of your wet, smelly, dirty dog. That just sucks.
author: Mark G.

description:
This is Kyoko's favorite place to run leash-less.  Actually, it's the only place I can trust her to run around freely.  The parking lot/main road is a little high up for her from the beach area.  Shibas are known to run off, so I'm always afraid of her running away, but since there are usually several other dogs on the beach to keep her attention, she doesn't think of running off.  

I never stay after 3:30pm as the fogs begins to roll in fast around that time.  It gets really cold and windy...so take caution, and remember to bring something to keep you warm.
author: Michelle N.

description: San Francisco is a beautiful city.  Fort Funston is one of its many jewels.  The great panoramic views and trails makes this a fun spot for jogging, waking the dog(s) or just catching a sunset.  Bring a jacket because it can get pretty chilly and windy no matter the time of year.
author: Javier O.

description: Fort Funston definitely delivers on its promise of good times! Even if you don't have a dog this is a fabulous place to visit with gorgeous views of the ocean from sandy cliffs. Great place for an light hike too, you can walk along the bluffs, down along the beach, and back up the other side. On a beautiful day like today it is the perfect spot for an oceanside picnic.
author: Will A.

description:
FUN...FUN...FUN!!!

Your pooch will love you forever if you bring him/her here. It's doggie heaven!

We brought our four legged friend Miso here and it was her first time at the beach and her first time off leash in such a big area. She was great, and had the best time running up and down beach and although she wasn't sure about the water she did manage to brave small shallow pools of it here and there. 

Definitely a place you can get addicted to, especially on a gorgeous warm day. But be warned... it's a quite a hike!

Totally worth it though!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
This park is great- It has everything-

Amazing Ocean Views- Check
Cool City Views- Check
Golden Gate Bridge Views- Check
DOGS EVERYWHERE- Check*
Old Marine Battery's to climb on- Check Check
Trails to walk and jog- Check

*I can get my not  having a dog sadness out of my system here because all of the dogs just run around off leash and are so excited to be there they are happy to let whoever (me) pet them and tell them how cute they are.
author: Ashly M.

description: This place already has hundreds of 5 star average review, so not much more to add.  Best off-leash dog park.  Please be respectful of nature if you go.  There is a proposal to limit the off-leash dogs due to a few bad owners letting their dogs into protected areas.
author: Dennis H.

description: This is a great place to wear out your dog and get them some exercise. Parking is free and plentiful, dogs can run around off the leash and there is a drinking fountain for the dogs. There are some paved walking paths, but some paths turn into dirt or sand. You can walk down a steep sandy hill to get to the beach. Prepare to get your shoes all messy and sandy, and prepare to get sweaty. Wear a sweater or jacket because the beach is always cold. Also, bring a towel for the back seat of your car so your dog doesn't get the car too dirty on the way home.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Fort Funston is truly doggie paradise! we take our 3 Boston's down there for exercise, socialization (there are always a ton of other dogs there) and fun times.
the dogs love the little hike and chance to play with other dogs. one of SF's best dog play areas for sure.
author: Ax L.

description:
all the other yelpers have done a fine job of describing FF, so i ain't even gonna try.

FF is awesomely beautiful and beautifully awesome. 

for those who've never experienced it, i urge you to go. 
for the denizens of san francisco who haven't gone, you have no excuse.

and lastly, for doglovers who have yet to bask in the joys of this glorious destination, what are you waiting for?
author: jennifer y.

description:
To sum it up: Fort Funston is the place dogs and dog owners dream about.  I know many people already said it, but I have feel the need to drive the point that this is dog heaven.  Your dog can run anywhere off leash and explore all it wants without being told by the Ranger to "put them on a leash" and owners can enjoy the gorgeous views, ocean air, and of course the joy of having a very happy dog.

There is plenty of parking and all the space your dog/s can dream of for running, sniffing, swimming, and playing with other dogs.  There is plenty of open space up on the fields, trails and on the beach so if you want some personal time with your dog, there is no problem finding some quiet space.

If you plan on staying down at the beach for a while, bring some water because there is no water available for your dogs until you get back up near the parking lot.

There is a cliff line and it's possible to have your dogs run away from you and fall off; however, that is highly unlikely if you stick to the trail and have just moderate voice command of your dog.

The hills off the beach are a bit steep and may be challenging for some.  Also, recommend taking sunglasses and a windbreaker; it gets windy.
author: Arturo A.

description:
Have you heard that statistic about how dogs outnumber children in San Francisco? Ft. Funston is the proof.

Ft. Funston is also like a Disneyworld for those dogs. Lots of different terrain, a very pet-friendly/off-leash environment, and so so so many other dogs to play with, this might be the world's ultimate dog park.
author: Derek R.

description:
Most definitely doggie heaven.

Nothing beats strolling on open land with happy dogs running around, a comfortable breeze, and a gorgeous view of of sun and sea.
author: Linda C.

description: The location is great, wonderful walk, amazing views....BUT this beautiful place has turned into one big doggy potty.  People...please pick up your dog's poop!  The last time I was there a couple of weeks ago, every where I turned (or stepped) there was a mound of poop.  My beagle loves it, but I don't.....
author: suzanne l.

description:
I have the best job in the world:  I walk, train, and board dogs for a living.  And I get to spend my days romping and playing with a bunch of my canine friends.  We go to Fort Funston as often as possible -- at least several days a week, rain or shine.

Fort Funston is dog heaven, as so many other yelpers have said.  Be responsible, pick up after your dog, watch their behavior, and you will have an amazing time at this beautiful and one-of-a-kind spot. (I have hundreds of photos of Fort Funston on my website (see my profile); just go to the photo page, and find the album labeled Fort Funston (--albums aren't in alphabetical order).   This is not a plug for my business, just a desire to share more photos than I can put up here.  :-)

Couple of things worth noting:  
1. If you have a dog that freaks out at sounds like firecrackers or whatever, just be aware that on some days, the sounds from the nearby shooting range (somewhere over by Lake Merced, I think), can be heard from the area around the water fountain.  It's not loud, and it doesn't seem to bother most dogs, but I have seen 2 or 3 dogs bolt at the sound.

2. The first time I ever went to Fort Funston, I got to see a rescue operation in progress for a dog stuck about a third of the way down the cliffs.  It was a lab that had been chasing a ball or something.  He was eventually saved, after hours spent by helicopters and hard-working rescuers, all paid for by the taxpayers.  Moral of the story?  Don't let your dog run near the cliff edges, not even a little bit close.  'Nuff said.
author: Eden H.

description:
MY SPOT. it's been my place since early high school days.  Lotta memories with special people.  If i've been there wit you, then u know u mean something to me.  

A great spot for talking and catching up, a place to be by yourself and reflect, a place to propose to someone, a place to break up with someone hahaha (not so good), a place to watch the most beautiful sunset ever!!!!!

hope this helps.. go on a sunny day.  You won't be able to see anything when it's foggy.
author: Reina A.

description:
This is the best place for your dogs to be in heaven.
OFF LEASE, TONS OF DOGS, breathtaking ocean views, PARKING, various trails leading down to the beach...beaches are clean, not too crowded. Dont need to bring much..there are shitbags, waterfordadogs..
OW..you may wanna bring a friend, and your running shoes..to take off on a little journey of your own (if you like to run)..with or without the dogs..
Anyway-this is my fav. place to go with my dogs in this city..regardless of weather..
author: CadoBaby P.

description: My new favorite place within the SF city limits.  Beautiful, natural, a real find!
author: Bette K.

description:
I can not say enough good things about this place. Not your run-of-the-mill dog park, Fort FUNston is more like Disneyland for dogs. Perfect for all types of dogs, from the playful, energetic puppies to the older, sensitive types, every dog has its day at FF! Worth the drive! 
Seriously one of the best (if not the best) place in the Bay Area to take your four-legged friend(s)! So many beautiful, well-mannered dogs with their equally friendly humans in tow. Breathtaking views abound! Do you and your dog(s) a favor! 

P.S. Bring a jacket!
author: Rachel N.

description:
60 degrees... no wind..... and clear skies....  this is a paradise for dogs.... We had so much fun I wanted to stay here and feed on dog food so maybe one day I can turn into one.... and not in the way my ex looks at me... 

the views are breathtaking... I could see the Golden Gate Bridge northeast of the parking lot.... and the beaches are a great area for the dogs to play.... lots and lots of us.... the only thing missing are the women in bikinis....
author: John R.

description:
Great dog park, but keep an eye on your pooch...

Huge sandy field and trails for dogs to play on, and you can walk down to the beach on 2 steep trails for additional playtime in the water.  

Keep an eye on your dog though - there is a 100 ft cliff along one side of the park (down to the beach), the surf can get pretty rough a few days a year, and there is always one idiot with dogs they can't control....
author: Ron W.

description:
Dog nirvana!

There are not a lot of garbage cans throughout the park so train your pup to poop near the parking lot otherwise you will be carrying a bag o' poop for your entire walk.
author: christine c.

description:
This place is the shit.  I just read someones mediocre  review of F.F. and it really sounds like  she should go to G.G. park and sit there with her dog.  Its fenced in, safe from pits and foxtails, free range, and acres.
 Come on.  Do we even need to have our government monitor our dog walks.  What next.  Screw the hangliders.  Punch them if you need to.
  I give it a one star off because of the shit weather.  Nothing the park could do about that.  BUT, I am not going to F.F. for me its for the bitch.  AND she could care less about the weather.  A matter of fact if you think the weather is cold take about five steps in the water.  Then look over and see how much fun your mutt is having.
Get it!
author: Tony B.

description: This place is pretty great with or without your dog, although I would suggest bringing them.  Lots of open space for your dog to run and play, plenty of trails, and a great view.  This place is no hidden gem.  It can be fairly busy on a Sunday morning, but there's more than enough space for everyone to enjoy.  Watch out for the hang gliders as you approach the beach, especially if you fear decapitation.
author: Garrett F.

description:
This park is great for off-leash dog walking.  
Lots of trails there, so explore beyond the paved area, the cliff side, the middle dune, shady tree trail, and the beach.  Try the path near the street.  It's shady with lots of trees and you won't have too much sand on your face when it's windy.   Walk on the middle path and your dog will love playing hide and seek with you.   If you're going down to the beach, bring water with you because there isn't any water fountain on the beach.
author: Mari L.

description:
This place is five stars on a warm sunny day and one star in the fog.  It totally depends on the weather.  The water sparkles as far as you can see and the coastline is amazing.  Hard to believe it is SF.  

The beach is great if you have a dog.  Dont go near it if you dont like dogs running all over the place.  It is also a BIG hike down a ladder in the sand to get to the beach, so be ready.
author: John A.

description: I called it "an undiscovered beach" because I lived in the Bay Area for 7 years (2 years by the Lake Merced) but never came across to this place until accidentally driving by just very recently.  It has the great views from up and below on the beach.  A great place for dogs and kids also.  You only need to be careful of not going too close to the edge of the cliffs.  It says that people and dogs felt and injured themselves there before because the sand cliffs are not stable.  I also had lots of fun watching the hang gliders which the Fort Funston is full of.
author: Ellie M.

description: Good times had by all! This is the holy land for doggies!
author: Kelle K.

description: Fort Funston is amazing! From the second you arrive you will notice the vast area full of vegetation, cliffs, and dogs. Battery Davis is also located within the area, which is nice to visit and read about. It's usually really windy and chilly, but if you don't mind it then it's a great place to walk, run, or do just about anything else. Everyone must visit Fort Funston and absorb its tremendous beauty!
author: Sade R.

description:
This place is HEAVEN for dogs, lots and lots of dogs. Off-leash all the way.
All my friends loves to come here as well, I see Buck Jones, Prada, Sebastian, Tasia, Marble, Mavericks, simply too many friends to name them all . This place got fresh water and lots of people with treats, and of course lots of balls and rocks to play, 4 Paws-Up!
author: Merlin O.

description:
I just came back from taking my dog for the first time today. It was all the good things that everyone has said about it, honestly. There is so much to do and see... we were there an hour and it just flew by. The scenery is gorgeous and there's a ton of room for your dog to run around and explore. 

What I like best is that this park is really great for a kind of shy dog like mine. She likes to see/greet other dogs, but can get overwhelmed at Golden Gate when a pack of like, 8 dogs come up to try to play with her. Here at Funston, she can greet and move on.

This is my new favorite dog area in SF, and I'm sure I'll be back soon!
author: Angie B.

description:
Our Muscles loves Fort Funston!  Who would not, sand, sun (most days), awesome views and lots of open space to explore!

This place is a definite weekend spot to hit up with our pouch.  If you have not been (dog or sans dog) you must make the trip to the outskirts of SF and explore Fort Funston!
author: J R.

description:
Woof! As good as it gets!

This IS the best park for pooch in the city, state, country & world. In a country where our local, state, and national parks are most often off limits to off leash dogs (not to mention restaurants), Fort Fun is like heaven on earth. Not only can your dog poop with a view of the Pacific as God intended but there are tennis balls for the hunting and sticks to fetch and bushes to pee on and most of all other well adjusted dogs to chase and play with. Most owners are well adjusted themselves - but sometimes on the weekend's there are some wieners (not just the dog kind).
author: Jack K.

description:
My dog (and his owner) loves it here!  Alas, he's still too young and too excited to go off-leash on the paths yet.  But he loves going down to the beach access and play off-leash in the sand and water with the other doggies.  If you go during a week day, you will find a TON of dogwalkers and their packs.  Weekends are more for individuals and families.  I went tonight around 6:00pm--it was cold, but nice because there weren't a ton of dogs there.  Of course my pup had to say hi to everyone he passed by sniffing their butt!

If you haven't gone here before, make sure you walk down the path and take that beach access instead of the one to the left of the hang-glider area--that part is STEEP!

Definitely THE place to take your dog in the Bay Area!!
author: Jen N.

description: Doggie Heaven on Earth to be sure.  I never have a bad day when part of my day is spent here with my dog.  Millions of dogs running and playing off leash...what could be better?  Oh and the people and dogs that go there are a true reflection of San Francisco's many eclectic people.  One of my top 5 fav things about this city.
author: Sara F.

description:
My dogs and I LOVE Ft. Funston!!! It's such a perfect beach for dogs! It's really closed off so they can't run near a road. I recommend checking the SF tide table before going though. If the tide is high there is hardly anywhere for you dog to run and the high tide can be dangerous. When the tide is out, there is TONS of room for you dogs to run! Often times, we have a whole 1/4 mile section of beach all to ourselves and it's beautiful! 
You have to walk down a bunch of sandy steps or a big hill to get down to the beach but it's a safe walk... just a little long. 
We've never had a problem with any of the dogs or owners there, everyone seems pretty responsible and nice. There are often horses walking the beach so FYI if your dogs like chasing horses like mine do! 
There's drinking fountains and dog water bowls up in the huge parking lot which is handy and often extra poop bags if you forgot yours. There are porta potties also. The lot can get crowed on a nice weekend but we've always found parking pretty quickly.
This is my favorite place to bring the dogs in the area (without travling over an hour)!
author: Little O.

description:
Even on a foggy day, Fort Funston is the best place for your pooch.  Today, my trouble maker rolled on a dead sea bird, which made him really happy.  I mean seriously, where else can you let your dog roll on a dead sea bird?  :-)  

We love this place and he needs a bath.
author: Evan D.

description: brought my little guy here today with a few friends and their dogs as well and everyone had an awesome time! the dogs loved being off leash and running wild and the people enjoyed a little exercise too lol the place was clean, no poop piles on the trails and there were water fountains with bowls for the dogs. love it here and will definitely be coming back soon [=
author: Jenn D.

description: We're new to the area, so one Sunday we felt like exploring and driving to find a cool beach where we could walk our dog. The fates collided and we ended up in doggy paradise! I've never seen so many dogs in one place! Plus there were various trails to walk on, hang-gliders to watch, and my dog's personal favorite: BEACH! Beachbeachbeach. She pranced around joyfully and frolicked with other dogs, literally with a big goofy dog smile of happiness. She then came home and took the most contented-looking nap ever. There was no doubt that my dog would give it 5 stars if she could yelp, and we'll continue to take her here. However, I'd have to deduct a star for humans because it's a bit too overcrowded and trash-littered for my park preferences.
author: Kat L.

description: This is my favorite place to bring my dogs. It's huge, open, and far from the road so the dogs can all run around and play. It truly is doggie heaven, and I love seeing them run and look so happy here. There's a trail to the beach if you want to go down and let your pup swim, and there are doggie drinking fountains too. On sunny days it's one of my favorite places to view the city. For those of you who think, "But it's far...." from where you live in the city, it's SO worth the distance. Plus, you should change your mindset from being limited to only IN sf anyways!
author: Emy s.

description: Yes...a good place for dogs. It's one of my chihuahua Wyatt's favorite spots. But what people usually overlook are the trails. I can spend hours just walking and exploring all the trails. Also, if you wander off the beaten path, you'll find this massive sand hill/dune. Try running it a couple times...makes for an awesome workout. Poor Wyatt just sits under a tree, and laughs: "Grace is one crazy biatch, but that's why I love her."
author: Grace L.

description: One of my personal favorite public treasures. There are lots of dogs on the trails, breathtaking views of the ocean from a bunker-turned-ob-deck, and where else in San Francisco can you be perched on a cliff's edge and suddenly see a hang-glider launch less than ten feet from where you're standing?
author: Gregor G.

description: This is one of my favorite places on the planet. The best people visit this breathtaking park with their dogs. I used to bring my Min Pin Tyler here back in 1999-2000 he would run on the beach with the HORSES...fearless Ty, I miss him everyday. It's bittersweet for me to visit THE FORT, but I do love it here. Some of the most amazing sunsets and great meditations are memories that I continue to create on a regular basis. Fort Funston reminds me of why I call San Francisco my home.  I love you Fort Funston!!!!
author: Sherie R.

description: I took my foster dog here on Sunday, and met a few Yelpers and their dogs too!  Great place with lots of friendly dogs and butt sniffing all around!
author: Starla D.

description: Our outing here is making me re-think the 5 stars I gave Point Isabelle. I caught Fort Funston on a bright, sunny day. It was phenomenal! FF should be the park to get all of the stars. There are tons of different paths; some winding, some flat, some hilly, some hardtop and some sandy. And the ocean views are SPECTACULAR! Don't walk, RUN! It's so fun!!! Oh, and my dog loved it too.
author: REN S.

description:
A whole bunch of people turning a beautiful park into a dog run and a toilet for their dog. If that were not enough, heaven forbid if I try to walk or jog unmolested along the path. No leashes, no control--they just plain do not give a dam about anyone or anything. There is not a single square inch of path a person can travel without facing off with a dog off leash and/or the feces and urine they leave behind.  How about this you supposed dog lovers, treat the rest of us using the park and the park itself like you expect us to treat you and your property. You know, how about I go piss on the hood of your car while it is parked at the Fort. Like that? No, either would I. Sound like non-sense, yes it does--now hold that thought. 
         I assume you agree that a national park deserves at least as much respect as a hunk of metal. Maybe you say yes, but your deeds say no. 
       What kind of self-serving illogic lets you reek havoc on this park and other non-dog owning users? How about I dump a bag of garbage on your doorstep everyday? How about I run my mountain bike down the Fort Funston paths--you would be hysterical because I might run over Fifi, but if Fifi cuts me off while I jog--that is ok?  How about when you let your dog off leash you at least keep him in your line of sight and when you see a jogger coming, heel him.
