As opposed to chatting away on your cell phone while Fido is wreaking havoc behind you. Such conduct is really not nice, demonstrates a poor upbringing and marks you for the selfish fools you are. 
        Really people, honest,  the paths are NOT DOG RUNS, they are SHARED walkways used by people without dogs who cannot use them when, well, when dogs act like dogs zig zagging all over the place.  We need to share this park, and turning the pathways into dog runs means that the rest of us cannot safely use this park.  (sorry to repeat myself, but I am at a loss how to communicate with people who watch their off-leash dog cut-off a jogger, and then still do not put the leash on. For lack of a better plan I am talking/typing slowly, using small words and repeating myself) 
       I have owned dogs most of my life and would never think of letting one run off leash in this area, not to mention let him join hundreds of others pissing and shitting all over this once beautiful place. Shame on you.  
            NEWS FLASH--If you have convinced yourself that owning a dog entitles you to wreak havoc on a national park and prevent others from enjoying that park (warning--you might want to sit for the words which follow)--then maybe you should NOT OWN A DOG. (Dog owner suddenly feels dizzy and short of breath)  WOW. WHAT!!--"You mean, if I live in a crowded urban setting and I do not have a yard large enough for my dog to get enough exercise in that yard, so that I must use public parks as my dogs toilet,  then I should think twice about supporting the puppy mills and maybe NOT OWN A DOG." (Dog owner either faints or reacts with uncontrolled rage). "But that would mean thinking about the impact of my actions on others....." (blank look on face, pause, dimly lit bulb briefly flickers to life, but quickly darkens for good)  Wew--"that was close", she said as she stopped to watch her dog lift its leg on the bushes in front of her neighborhood school.  

         Ok. Recognizing the futility of expecting you folks to engage your brains or to demonstrate even the slightest modicum of common sense or common courtesy, I will henceforth resort to Plan B while visiting Fort Funston. And it is an oldie but a good one---"Do unto others as they would....." or, if I might be so bold as to delve in to those poop addled brains of yours and put it like you would put it--- "I will treat the place like a garbage dump and anyone in the dump like the garbage they are because everyone else does." Translated---I will run and ride my mountain bike with abandon (with boom box strapped to the back and blaring away), stop and piss in the bushes, sing profane Marine Corps running songs, expel large wads of saliva in plain sight as often as my salivary glands allow and empty all the garbage from my car in to the parking lot before I leave--oh, hell, might as well save some money--- I will cancel my garbage service and make a weekly dump of ALL MY TRASH  right there next to the largest pile of dog shit I can find.  

        In fact, and I am rolling now, I hereby declare Fort Funston the FREEDOM ZONE.  The place where we can each pick a law or two, or maybe just a few well founded rules of common courtesy or common sense, and IGNORE them.  So go at it--garbage, loud music, yelling, minature pigs, flatulence, profanity--let er rip. So screw you and everyone else, we are Americans and we are free.

         And no whining from you dog owners upon witnessing all this, because, after all, this will be your world according to your rules. Welcome and everyone for themselves. How pleasant and thank you neighbor.
author: b g.

description: We went here again - and since it was a warmer day, we went to the beach area and it was great! Hailie was scared of the waves at first, but now she is bolder about going into the water. It's a lot of fun watching the dogs play around on the beach. I could stay here all day! The climb up from the beach area is strenuous!! I need to get more in shape. :(
author: Orie M.

description:
i am wicked allergic to dogs.  don't tell me your dog has human hair, don't tell me you shampoo it with a special potion, don't tell me it's hypo-allergenic.  i'm freakin allergic to every dog on the face of the earth.  my mom even bought a hairless (chinese crested) dog to try to justify creating an environment that could kill me.  and i'm wicked allergic to that ugly ass hairless dog.

the old man is a dog person (as well as a cat person).  everywhere we go he points out dogs.  i mean every god damned dog he sees, he points it out.  so today when we went to fort funston, he freaked out at the first big dog gang we saw.  then we saw another.  then another.  after we had seen 65 dogs, an amazing thing happened.  he stopped pointing them out.  for the first time in our marriage, he had his dog fix.  we were able to enjoy the rest of the walk without stopping every 5 minutes to oogle over a stupid dog.

but on the way home, there was a guy walking his dog and he slowed down to 5 mph and yelled "ohhhh, look at that one!".  so i guess the fix was short lived.
author: Katie H.

description: absolutely BEAUTIFUL! this place is amazing-from the spectacular views, friendly dogs/people, and great trails. If only I lived closer. My poodle chihuahua mix had a great time running around free from her leash. I was a bit worried at first (it was her first time off leash anywhere large besides the dog park) but she did amazing and the other dogs there were absolutely friendly and those who weren't the owners were smart enough to have on a leash or have muzzled. I cant find anything wrong with this place. A treasure for four legged and two legged friends!
author: anna o.

description: I love Fort Funston, and my doggies love it more.  As far as the most amazing playground for pooches... definitely five stars all the way.  The views are breathtaking, and the trails are SO fun to explore.  The reason I take away one star... people who are inconsiderate (or should I say plain stupid) that bring their AGGRESSIVE dogs there and let them run wild.  Listen, if you have a dog that DOES NOT LIKE OTHER DOGS, please PLEASE do not let it run wild here!!  Use a leash, muzzle, whatever you may need to keep him away from the innocent, well behaved and socialized dogs that come here with their families.  My dog has been attacked by the same aggressive dog twice on two occasions and the idiot owner doesn't seem to give a crap!!  Ughhhhhhhhhh  Now I go VERY early in the morning to avoid people like him.
author: Samantha M.

description: Forget the dogs that are scampering around here shitting in the ice plant and stinking up the place -- throw them off the cliffs if you must in order to enjoy an unobstructed view of the magnificent Pacific Ocean and North Bay. Or better yet, tie the small chichi dogs to one of the "Powerless Remote Controlled Flying Vehicles" -- aka "gliders" -- that operate on the "Powerless Remote Controlled Flying Vehicle Launch Deck" (yes, this park has a special platform just for operators of remote controlled gliders!)  -- seriously, the only thing cooler than a sky full of completely silent, remote-controlled gliders would be a sky full of completely silent, remote-controlled gliders carrying yelping toy poodles making kamikaze runs on old, clumsy St. Bernards.
author: Ben P.

description:
Disneyland for dogs!

A couple of things though:

1. PICK UP AFTER YOUR DOG - this is one of the last leash free havens around, don't screw it up for the rest of us.
2. IF YOU DON'T LIKE DOGS, DON'T COME HERE - seriously, are you kidding me???
3. SOCIALIZE YOUR DOG - see point #1 ...
author: Fi G.

description: Beautiful walk, and perfect for the dog. A bit windier & colder than we expected so dress warm! It's pretty crowded on the weekends, but we've never had trouble parking. We love this park!
author: R F.

description: Love this park!  I took my mini dachshund here and she just walked next to me the whole time off leash and ignoring all the big dogs coming to sniff her.  All the dogs were nice and well behaved.  I was surprise how big the park is and it's pretty clean considering how many dogs are there coming and going all the time.  When I was there, I did not see any poop anywhere.  When I did see dogs poop, the owners quickly cleaned it up.  And if you see a dog pooping and the owner doesn't see it, let him/her know, I'm sure they would be happy that you told them.  Do bring plastic bag to clean up after your dog so everyone can enjoy the park to it's fullest.  Again, I love this park because I enjoyed it just as much as my baby girl did.
author: N V.

description: This is Disneyland for dogs! I wished I would have brought a camera because there were so many great views. It kind of reminded me of Torrey Pines in San Diego except there were Cypress trees. There are lots of great trails and the best part is that it all leads to a gorgeous spans of beach. It's all off leash so it is a wonderland for dogs. The only draw back I found was when we were heading back to the truck, I felt like we were running the gauntlet through wave after wave of professional dog walkers each walking at least eight dogs.
author: Stephani S.

description: Whenever I want to just mellow out and hang, I drive to Fort Funston.  It's beautiful here, with a great dog walk and plenty of cool, friendly people.  Dogs and humans alike love this beach, and for good reason.  A great place to sit and watch the hang gliders and de-stress.
author: Honey L.

description: I was quite surprised to see that we had such impressive coastal bluffs right here in the city.  The cliffs make this far and away the most scenic stretch of Ocean Beach.  Anyone looking for a good walk should definitely come here and take the trail down to the beach, which you can then follow all the way into Daly City if you like.  And for dog owners, this place is apparently heaven.  Personally, I could stay here all day just to watch all the hang gliders, and on weekends there are a *lot* of them.  Also, you can take a nice little stroll to the fort itself, which is basically just the remains of some gun installations.  Great for history buffs though.
author: Wes M.

description: Hang gliders!  Doggies!  Beautiful views!  Smiling happy people!
author: Bleep S.

description: Doggy utopia.  Need I say more?  This place is simply a blast.  Take your dog here and go hiking on a nice day.  You will not regret it!!!
author: Robert P.

description:
Bring your dog here NOW! This place is covered with trails, sand, and, well, other DOGS! On one side of the park is an undisturbed view of the Pacific Ocean, and (if you look closely) you can see whales in the distance.  On the other side is a view of San Francisco's Sunset, Lakeshore, Richmond, and Parkside districts along with the Golden Gate Bridge itself!

This place has beach access. Enough said. Having a black Labrador, I take advantage of this opportunity every time that I can. 

5 Stars. Been walking my dog here since the vet told me that he can socialize with other dogs.
author: Danny D.

description: I must not have gone to the same place as the other reviewers.  Fort Funston just seems like a dirty, poop ridden place to me, but I have to admit that I don't like dogs.  The beach in that part of town is grungy though.  I gave it two stars because it does have parking and can get very windy.  I much prefer Land's End.
author: Lolia S.

description:
I love this magical place.  There is nothing like watching a San Francisco dog walker manage 8-10 mutts of all sizes, shapes and colors to brighten one's day.  

If ever I am in a bad mood, Fort Funston is the place to go to cheer up.   I have even been known to come here without my dog.  Shhhh . . .don't tell him.  

The only thing to be careful of is very large dogs that are roaming off leash.  My dog once got trampled by a great dane named "Jack" who was almost as tall as me.
author: Brenna C.

description: When the sun decides to come out and turn the heat up, instead of suffocating at the gym I run outside. Park on the side of the road and run up the "stairs" it's actually logs laid on top of sand and running up these give your booty a nice workout. It tends to packed with dog walkers day in and day out. Oh yea be careful not to walk on dog poop since there's still people who don't pickup after their pooches. There's paved and unpaved trails that lead you to beautiful views of ocean beach. Bring a jacket as this is where the fog tends to settle.
author: Lola L.

description: Oh how Cogswell loves Fort Funston!  He's in Corgi heaven, trotting down the path to the beach, shaking his furry butt as he slogs through the sand.  And once on the beach, rain or shine, calm or windy, high or low tide, he'll run and play and do his best to achieve a maximum soaking, sandiness, and smelliness until he can barely move.  If there's a happier dog place on the planet, it's got to be very far away, because Cogswell and I have never found a better spot in all our travels.
author: Hugh B.

description: Dog heaven, enough said. My dog is the happiest when i bring her here. A dog beach, freedom, and friendly people. Loves it!
author: Shay W.

description: Everytime we go we have to prepare for the sand that will get in the car later.  If your dog loves the beach, or hasn't been Fort Funston is a must.  It us a great afternoon in the sun walking down the beach with your dog.
author: Alex H.

description: I miss this being my backyard & my ultimate angst reliever.  Perfect remedy for the blues OR the mean reds: super cute dogs & people, gorgeous dunes, & amazing views of the city & the ocean.
author: Sierra S.

description: Pretty place so I took my dog here for the first time yesterday (a Tuesday). He loves other dogs and to run, but he's a rescue dog and still skittish. Lots of pet walkers with large groups of dogs and not all well behaved. Saw several with muzzles. One came up to my dog when we were first there and was snipping and growling at him. A little later the same dog attacked him and his friends joined in. It was total mayhem. The dog walker was not able to contain the dogs. My dog was bit several times and I was bit twice (neither of us suffered blood or puncturing of the skin). Beware of unruly dogs and their pet walkers that can't control them!!!
author: Helen R.

description: Fort Funston is not just a fun hidden gem for doggies, but humans too!
author: Chris R.

description: What a cool place!  It's perfect for a nice walk along the beach and the terrain is challenging enough to give you a real workout.  What a great view of the ocean and the sunset.  It's a must see.
author: Corey V.

description: This is a beautiful place, and great for the dogs.
author: JIll H.

description: Absolutely perfect place to bring a dog.  Beautiful scenery, dogs everywhere, fun for all.
author: Sean A.

description: Doggy heaven. Poor Murphy couldn't run off leash, tho. Probably lose her. But it's beautiful here. Massive doggy heaven.
author: Howard T.

description: Took my puppy here for the first time yesterday and it was AMAZING!!!!!!! This place is like dog-heaven! Miles of walking along the beach. My dog had a blast--he ran around with other dogs, he climbed the sand walls, and we just walked around for hours. He came home and slept for the rest of the day! This is the best place to walk your dog in the entire bay area. It was beautiful, refreshing, and unlike some reviews...the place did not have any doggie stench! I was a little nervous to take my puppy off leash because he isn't great with other dogs (too playful), but everyone was patient and all the other dogs are really well behaved. After he got used to it, he was just like all the other dogs and just ran around and enjoyed the breach. This is the most amazing place to take your dog!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Sarah V.

description: By far the best dog park around. Huge beach (when the tide is low) no leash and tons of dogs. If I could imagine what a dog heaven would look like it would be similar to fort funston.
author: Alan W.

description: This beach area and the surrounding cliffs are quite beautiful and it's surprising that it is so close to the city. On most weekdays the beach is nearly deserted but on week ends there are quite a few people. The downside, (and the only reason I give it four stars rather than five), is the fact that this is area where dogs off leash are permitted). I've had some instances with aggressive dogs and owners who could care less whether their dog is being a nuisance. There are too many dogs and the dog walkers are using this public beach to ply their trade. I have nothing against people trying to make a living but walking ten or more unruly dogs at once? Many owners don't follow the rules and don't pick up doggie's little deposits so the beach can get nasty. I wish the authorities could clamp down. It's not the dog's fault, there are just too many irresponsible owners and too many people who seem to think they have to have a critter to soil the environment.
author: Everett E.

description: I WISH I HAD MY OWN DOG!!! Lucky for me, I know a few people with dogs to take out and play. Seriously this place is amazing! There are various landscapes for dogs to play. You get to start on top of the hill playing on the grass under the trees or out in the open only to continue walking down toward the beach. Being from Southern California originally, I love the beach. This beach is solely for dogs to roam around and have fun. And believe me, I am jealous just how much fun dogs have playing in this giant park. In my book, it definitely lives up to its name of Fort Funston.
author: Misty G.

description: My dog loves it here, and so do I.  Great views and a nice walk for me, and an awesome tongue-hanging-out good time for my dog and his friends (new and old).   The only con is that it can get pretty windy at times.
author: Joy B.

description: Is there really a place where you can go and let your dog run everywhere off-leash?  My dog is pretty retarded so when it comes to dog parks I hardly ever go.  But lately my dog has been showing slight signs of a functioning brain so this is our new favorite.  I wish I had the power of the pack?!?!
author: Tito C.

description: They don't call this place "Fort Fun" for nothing!!...hehe....beware of dogs off-leash...ouch....
author: Peter S.

description: Fort Funston get a full 5 stars.  The 1 star rating is for the cheap incompetent dog walkers that is making Fort Funston an unpleasant place to visit.  Most dog walkers do not pick up after the dogs that are put into their care.  Which is making Fort Funston smell like a dirty toilet.  Then there are the dog walkers that have no knowledge of how to handle a dog.  I'm surprised there are people who would put their dogs in the care of these incompetent people who call themselves a Dog Walker.  They must be charging a very attractive low price for their service.  One so call Dog Walker is Brian Bageant of Out + About Dog Walking.  Every time I see him at Fort Funston, he's with too many dogs for him to handle.  The dogs that are put in his care are running wild with him constantly yelling for them.  Today one of the dogs he was "walking" bit my dog.  Again Brian Bageant had no control of the dogs.  My dog was running with two of dogs when an American Bulldog named Guido that Brian Bageant was walking ran over to try to hump my dog.  I tried to separate the bulldog from my dog, but the bulldog got a hold of my dog's ear.  The bulldog did not let go until Brian Bageant pried his mouth open, and got bitten by the bulldog when he finally let go of my dog's ear.  Not only is Brian Bageant an incompetent dog walker, he is even dishonest.  He tried to claim that it was my dog that bit his hand.  My wife saw everything clearly from 3 feet away.  It was the Bulldog that bit his hand when Brian Bageant pried his mouth open.  Wish I can contact the dog owners that are paying for the services of Brian Bageant, to let them know of the danger they are putting their dogs in.
author: S Y.

description: I LOVE Fort Funston.  I love the beach.  I love the steps down to the beach.  I love the trails above the beach.  I love all the dogs having such a good time.  I love the hangliders.  I just love everything about it.
author: Kerry L.

description:
My puppahs LOVED this dog park.  It is just another slice of paradise that I found on our first road trip with the puppahs.  It is so beautiful, has incredible views of the city, the ocean, and sooo many happy friendly HAPPY dogs.  Our first time here, we started up the trail, not really knowing what to expect.  We didn't know if we could legally let the dogs off the leash so close to Skyline Drive, but we see a few dogs and their people walking around without their leashes on, so we figure, why not.  We make the climb up the sandy stairs and find ourselves in a grouping of dogs and their people.  Everyone is friendly and so are their puppahs.  We start walking one way and realize that we're going the opposite direction of the beach, so we head the other way and meander down to the beach.  We travelled off the paved walkway thinking we could find our own way to the beach, but it ended up meeting up with the paved walkway anyway.  Haha.  So much for our adventure.  Hahaha.  We then proceed down this really steep sandy slope towards the great big gray (I would say blue, but if you've ever really looked at the ocean, it is not a great big blue).  My dogs bolted towards the group of weary travelers coming up the slope to say hi and then proceeded down to the water.  When I finally made my way down to the beach, the dogs were in the water (only their second time in the ocean and seriously loving it this time, the first time they were a little bit timid and afraid).  They ran around like they'd been beach dogs their whole life.  They played, they chased, they splashed, and omg, they had a grand ol' time.  I couldn't stop clicking the camera, they were so adorable!

We are coming back again and next time, I am going to remember the towels!  :)
author: Agatha M.

description: This is pretty close to doggie nirvana.  HUGE area to walk around and get lost.  Off leash dogs, if you have a problem with them here... TOO BAD! Lots of great dogs and great owners.  Some not so much.  Be wary though of walking over large patches of foilage or non-pathways... theres usually alot of doggie dung lying around.
author: Eric W.

description: Great place to walk a dog or cruise them if you don't have one. I love taking out-of-towners here as part of my atypical SF tour and showing them the hang gliders. Great views, rugged mountain, steep descent down to the beach, but you can also stay up top and walk the trails in doggy heaven.
author: lisa g.

description:
heaven on earth for dogs and their people. 

the views! the sand ladder! the socializing for both dogs and people! all just perfect. 

it's my favorite place to walk on earth, as my dog went there for 10 years either with me or the dog walker. 5 stars all the way for reals.
author: Kenna T.

description: This place is truly doggie heaven where the canines rule and humans are pets. Can you ask for a better dog park? I don't think so. I suggest walking along the top of the sand dunes parallel to the beach when the tide is too high. My dog loves the feel of sand beneath her paws and turn crazy. When you are here, you realize just how good some dogs have it in the bay area.
author: Mike A.

description: This park truly is doggie heaven.  I would give it 10 stars.  On any given day there can be 200 dogs there at once!  Pretty silly.  It has cliffs and you can hike down to the beach.  Your dog will make 20 friends reguardless of his/her attitude.  There are just so many friendly dogs there that they have to be friends.  I have never seen a fight there once.  I think the dogs just realize how cool it is to be there and soak it up. Not to mention how cool it is to watch the waves roll in on the beach, or the paragliders flying right over your head.  I made the mistake of going there once with a Vietnamese sandwich in my pocket and was almost tackled by 2 great danes 3 labs 2 german sheppards, a bulldog ,a rottweiler, and a family of Vishla's....I escaped though!
author: Daniel Q.

description: This is a great place for a walk. I love to take Roxy here and let her explore. There are always lot's of dog here and  there is plenty of shade to stay cool!! The views are also amazing.
author: Lisa A.

description:
happy days for django!

he loves the ride up there.  i have a seat belt for him and he puts his paws out to steady himself along the windy roads.  remember to bring a towel unless you want a wet doggie in the car.

my dog loves to play fetch and bites at the waves as his ears flop around.  the dog owners i saw were really responsible and kept a watchful eye as their dogs did the meet and greet.  most of the dogs i saw were socialized and were well behaved -  no shamed faced owners tugging at a barking dog.

it gets pretty crowded on the weekend but it's still so awesome to watch my dog have so much fun.
author: Anh V.

description: a nice little stroll next to the sea not too mention, barely anyone around to bother you for a smoke. I don't smoke though man.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description:
Well known off leash dog paradise, kept pretty clean, weekends in summer can get hot and crowd.  The main parking lot you can usually see some hanggliders.  
There is a main paved trail, but some side dirt trails that you can see the actual fort part is neat if you follow the sand trail near the top of the cliff by the oceanside.
To the left of the hanggliding area, you can take some challenging beach steps down to the water (people with bad knees take the other way down), or follow the paved trail for about 5min until you get to a more gradual sandy hill going down to the water.
At low tide, if you are brave you can explore the underground tunnel that looks like a jail, bring a flash light it's pretty dark, but some creative graffiti.
Sometimes you can see horseback riders from the near by stables along the shore.
You can collect a lot of sand dollars, sometimes there are jelly fish during summer/fall.
during warm summers, lots of kids playing in the water.
For the doggie water fountain follow the dirt trail on the right to the main paved trail you can't miss it.  There are a few nasty portapotties to use near the main parking lot, sometimes they run out of TP, so bring your own tissue just in case you have to #2 or are female and have to wipe the coochie.
Fun place for kids, bring a pail, shovel, and sunscreen.  Be careful not to go out too far into the water, the undertow is pretty strong, there have been a few shark sightings, but no closings.  Bring bottled water, you will thank me after the walk up and down to the ocean.
author: David K.

description: This little walk along the cliff and beach is just so gorgeous... such a nice way to feel like you got out of the city.  Seeing the big grin on my dog's face when we pull into the parking lot says it all.
author: Shannon W.

description: Awesome place to walk dogs -- mostly all of the owners are responsible god (ummm...dog!) owners who have good command of their off-leash mongrels.  The dogs always have a fabulous time, and, I've found that sand is much better to deal with and clean up than mud.  A real winner -- ditto for Crissy Field, too.
author: L H.

description: The great Pacific. As if I needed yet another reason to justify why I moved to San Francisco.
author: Michael E.

description: like he says, "it's a club for dogs." our pooches love this place, so much room to run, play, and meet new friends. there are paths around that you can follow, trek along in the sand and into the 'forest', head down to the beach (!) and you must try what we call the 'sand ladder' great work out for you and them. a water fountain and doggie bags/ trash cans through out the park. plus you need to show visitors the you can see the ggbridge and so many more views from atop. Only downside, on a really windy day, your screwed. Have fun!
author: Abigail W.

description:
this is one of the best places to go to meet your dog hair quota when you live in a no animals allowed apartment.  it is so much fun to watch all the dogs running around.  amazingly the area is not covered in poo. although i still watch my step.

don't miss the native plant nursery at fort funston.  it is among that small group of buildings to the left of the parking lot.  they have a green team volunteer program on saturday mornings.  you can just drop in and they will be happy to put you to work transplanting, putting soil into planters, etc.  ask for sharon she is the person in charge.

bonus, you can get there by muni.  the 18 will drop you off at the "corner" of john muir drive and the skyline blvd.  cross the street, climb the stairs, and you are in dog paradise.  dogs can ride muni as long as they are muzzled.  i have seen plenty of unmuzzled dogs on muni too.
author: Amy M.

description: One of the nicest, largest dog parks I have ever been to. Also a great workout for the owners who have to walk back up from the beach. Great views from the walk up to parking lot.
author: Lisa S.

description:
beautiful coastline preserve.
large parking lot with a nice trail to the beach.

not as many dogs as I was led to believe 
and not quite the NIrvana that I was expecting...
I was thinking poop all over cool.

Most Owners kept to themselves and so did the dogs.
In general the Dogs were large breeds/hyper types that needed the huge space of a beach.

social interaction was lacking...
just thought there would be more interaction...
guess I have been away from the City too long.
author: Cee G.

description: This is the best dog park in the bay area. My girl friend and I take our dog here every Sunday for a long walk. There is a lot of dogs off leash here and everyone is friendly. Come as long as your dog will listen to you and is not aggressive. There are many trails, some are sand and others are asphalt.
author: Don and Regina S.

description: This is my favorite, favorite, favorite place to go with my dogs. There is a ton of great space (high and low) and lots of good dogs to play with. On the weekends you can often catch the hang gliders and the horse riders, so be sure to leash your dog as they pass if they show interest in either. There's a few poop bag stations and a fountain on the way down to the beach from the parking lot. Parking can sometimes be a challenge, but I've always been able to find a spot.
author: Bridget W.

description: This was Maggie's first visit to a dog park, and she LOVED Fort Funston!!!!  I was a little apprehensive about letting her off leash, and she did great!  All the doggies were so well behaved and having so much fun.  The views of the ocean were so beautiful.  We both can't wait to come back!!!!
author: Kim C.

description: Best time your dog will ever have!  I take my baby (a.k.a. English Pointer) here whenever I can, but especially on special occasions like her birthday and if she's been especially good or had a big Vet visit.  There are beautiful trails and views here, so it ain't a bad trip for the humans either.  Dogs can safely run off leash and can explore trails, the beach, little woodsy areas and of course, other dogs!  This place is a must for any dog owner in the city.
author: Jorie p.

description: My dog and I love this place :) love the trails, the beach, the view and the breeze. However, there are so many big huge dogs.... it can be kind of intimidating when they're coming at you in packs!! AhhHhh!! So I have to keep my baby on his leash before he gets super nervous.  I'm sure those professional dog walkers know what they're doing .... sure. Half the time they're not even looking!! Ohwell, we'll be back anyway! Off leash fun at the beach I hope!! :)
author: Allyson L.

description: Excellent, excellent, excellent! Great view, dog friendly park, and best of all, it is in Daly City, who said all we have here is Target!
author: Kelvin Y.

description: I live across the street, so the location is ACE!  And the view of the ocean from up top are amazing.  I love watching the hang gliders land and take off here.  It's clean, well maintained, and just a total joy to go to.  Especially in the super heavy rain- that was the most fun.
author: Darian H.

description:
If I was in the slogan writing business I would say:  Fort Funston, Where a Dog can be a Dog.  Thats pretty lame.  Maybe thats why I could not make it in the glamorous world of slogan writing  
Being that I live with a large hairy two testicled beast, it is great to have a place where he can let loose and find other like minded creatures to lift a leg and sniff an ass with.  There are usually many many dogs goofing around.  And whatever the reason, they always seem to get along famously at FF.  Maybe it is the lack of fences or the clean ocean air.  It seems like my dog is the only one picking fights out there.  He has a pretty mean left hook.  His jab needs work.    
I have not seen another place as perfect for large dogs on this planet.  I take that back, I am sure there are better places, but the sheer numbers of dogs, the ability to swim in the ocean, run through fields, have drinking water, poop sachels make it tops in my book.
I gotta go, Escobar just told me he has to go to FF and kick some ass and drop a duece or two.
author: Chris A.

description: I love, love, love this place! Oh, my dog does, too, which is great! The dog park has lots of different trails and doggy bubblers and there are usually lots of playmates.  If you can handle walking up the hill to get to the dog park I suggest parking in the small lot on Skyline, otherwise you can drive to the main entrance and park there. It's also fun to venture down to the beach but the walk up can be a struggle so make sure you have lots of energy saved up! Dogs love this place, though, lots of smells and plenty of space for them to be off leash!
author: Kristin D.

description: I LOVE this place. I don't have a dog, but when I doggie sit Lucy Lu, I love to bring her here. So much to discover for dogs and humans alike. Great views. Nice work out. Hang gliders. And tons of friends. A must go!
author: Carey L.

description: Gorgeous beach, lots of dogs.  Lots af trails too.  My family used to take our dog to Fort Funston on Christmas day to kill some time, as we're Jewish and had nothing to do all day.  Luckily Fort Funston is always open.  It's even worth the trek from the east bay, where I live now.
author: Sara M.

description: i can never get enuff of fort funston! it's always fun in the sun and plenty of sand!
author: Teen F.

description: Best dog park, ever, hands down!! When my beau & I were pet sitting for our favorite (high-energy!) Australian Shepherd, we brought her here twice in a few days. It was incredible! It makes me want to get a puppy...just to go hang out at Fort Funston! Alas, it can be enjoyed by non-dog owners too...it's just not quite the same. Anyways! Love this park!
author: Anne A.

description: if you have a dog and haven't been here your dog may never forgive you. Acres and acres of dog park on the coast with beach access. Canine heaven. Watch for daredevil hang-gliders too.
author: Carlos C.

description: The best place to take your doggies and let them run free, just please please remember to pick up the dog poo, for some reason I always seem to find it and step in it:(
author: Cassie L.

description:
What was my life like before this???

Three words: WE LOVE IT! And our doggy loves it too :) Heaven on earth!
author: Becki K.

description: This place is amazing!  Sooooo much fun.   I took the puppy I'm babysitting there this morning.  I barely left the parking lot, and she was snoring.  Thank you, Fort Funston!  Sleep, puppy, sleep!!  :)
author: Stitchy M.

description: Doggie heaven.  IF you have a dog, and a car, it's a must.  Not many places anywhere in the country will you find something like this.  Please believe me and go.  TODAY.
author: Sarah F.

description: If it weren't for the fact that it gets so cold there so often and you have to compete with the toy plane fliers (got nailed by one), this would be a slam dunk recommendation. All the same, the beach is great, it is a fun hike up and down to the beach, plenty of level ground areas (more or less) to walk on near the parking yard, and the views are spectacular.
author: Eric P.

description:
rocky, my rotti, absolutely loves this place. so does his "cousin", bruiser, my brother's malti-poo. 

i'm not afraid to let them off the leash here however they don't like the horses too much. so after an incident where a horseback rider tried to attack my dog with his rope, i tend to avoid the part where the horseback riders frequent. other than that... everything else is wonderful.

we take them on a different trail every time we go there. they get to mingle and make new doggie friends.

and the water bowls are such a great idea.

personal fave for dogs: other doggies
personal fave for myself: the great hikes and amazing views
author: Mei N.

description: It doesn't get much better than this for the puppies. All of the other dogs we've run in to have been very social and sweet. The hang gliders and scenery are pretty cool too.
author: Megan S.

description: Scooter's all exhausted - Great beach haven for your furry friend.  Enough room for your dogs to chase, your dogs to be chased and for you to chase after yours.  May I recommend bringing a hose and towel to rinse all the sand off - otherwise, your dog will take part of the beach with you & into your car!
author: Kerri L.

description: Beautiful park and lookout point to see the hand-gliders! Must-see for out-of-towners. Bring friends and family here....ideal leisurely hike around the park and stop at the lookout point to ponder at the gliders that take-off and land....
author: Yan M.

description: Did the beach loop yesterday..not only worked out the human legs on the stairs, the pooch got quite a work out.  Where else in the world can you get such a gorgeous view and spend some time off-leash time with so many fun dogs??!!
author: Brye L.

description: Love it! Best dog park on the entire peninsula.  The ocean can be quite strong so keep an eye on the doggers when they are in the water.  Also, you can stay up high or go down to the ocean, lots of choices.  Your dog will get dirty either way so bring extra towels.  There are hoses to wash them off after they are done running around loving life.
author: Jen W.

description: 5 stars because my dogs told me to. I'm not much of a beach person. But both my dogs apparently loved this place. They got to run around free with no leashes! they got pretty dirty but nothing a quick shower can't fix. By the end of the day they had their fun. But the climb back up the stairs they weren't too crazy about it.
author: Terry S.

description: My dog, Monte, loves this place.  He's quite the botanist, as he has more interest in the surrounding foliage and flora than in the other dogs or frequent attention he gets from other dog owners.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
well then...

i don't even know why i BOTHER writing a review...it's obviously fantastic!!

bring your furry friends.  both animal and human, you won't regret it!



but i never even knew about this place, and it honestly TOOK MY BREATH AWAY.  I was brought here right at sunset, on a clear and crisp evening.  Take the little path to the lookout, which features lots of wooden seating, and an incredible view of the Pacific and surrounding cliffs.  I haven't experienced something that beautiful in a long time.

So bring your dog.

Bring that significant other.

Pack that picnic and a blanket to snuggle with....and soak it all in.
author: Vince S.

description: What else can I say that other people haven't said? This place ROCKS for humans and they're furry friends. I just wish it was closer to the East Bay. But, it's a great weekend trip and always well worth it. I've never encountered a mean dog or an annoying dog owner. Everyone just seems to be so happy to be here that any confrontations you might encounter at other dog parks aren't an issue here. I would give it 10 stars if that was an option.
author: Tanya M.

description: One more great review for fort funston, a.k.a. Doggie Disneyland. Also a great place to hang out with your significant other. FF is a short drive from anywhere in the city, yet a million miles away and oh so beautiful. Make sure you bring a warm jacket to soak in the scenery.
author: Ashley W.

description: Love love love this place for dog walks!!  It's the best place in the city by far.  Large open area above the beach for dogs to run around and a long stretch of beautiful beach with a loop that's a great distance for dogs and humans. One of the only off-leash dog areas which is perfect for my two huge dogs (Malamute and Golden) who love to run around through the waves.  Dog owners here also don't try to tell you what to do and don't mind big guys either. Only bummer is that there are often horses trotting along the beach and a lot of dogs (including mine) tend to chase and bark at horses.  Beautiful views, beautiful dogs and hang gliders galore! Doesn't get much better than this!
author: Angie K.

description: Such an awesome place. "Pogi" my retriever puppy had a great time here. It was his first outing and he had a blast witht he other dogs. Down side is he wore himself out in like 20 minutes. Must go back soon.
author: Louie C.

description: My pups get excited as soon as we turn into the parking lot...great exercise for humans too.  I have been coming here for about 5 years and have never witnessed a dog fight or any misbehaved dogs.  I think  the fact that people need to drive out there eliminates jerks with bad pets...those folks tend to stay close to whatever park is near their home.
author: Marina F.

description: Since I live in new york now, I have craved nature.  I went with my friends and their dog, clyde to fort funston, and I must say that it is pretty much the best dog park on earth! There are tons of trails and the dogs can run around without their leashes on all they want.  There is also quite a large stretch of beach in the park, which is great for the dogs and the people alike! Go!!
author: Carley B.

description: 5 stars from my dog, Beeba.   Trails, beach, ocean ...a great place to see and be seen, according to Beebs.
author: Mei B.

description: This is the best place EVER to take your dog. Ours is still kind of a puppy (11 mos.) so she has a ridiculous amount of energy and needs to run around a lot. She also loves playing with other dogs, so it's her favorite place to go in the whole world. Also, if you're a dog lover, it's really fun to see all of the different cool dogs people bring to the park. The scenery is fabulous, especially on a clear day. The only concern is the steep cliffs. A friend of mine who works for the parks department said there have been numerous incidents involving doggies falling off the cliffs and needing to be rescued. So made sure you supervise your pup if you let him/her off the leash!
author: Jenny R.

description: Dogtacular!  We brought my 2 dogs to Fort Funston Thanksgiving weekend and had a blast!  Awesome views, plenty of hiking, great trails and lots of happy dogs!!  We kept our dogs on leash about 50% of the time, since we weren't sure if they'd run off the side of a cliff, but after the dogs calmed down a bit, we let them loose and they had a ball!!  Would highly recommend bringing your well behaved pet here!
author: Cheryl M.

description: born and raised in sf, and I've never come to fort funston! this place is great for dogs to run around freely.. and it makes me happy to see so many happy dogs! we stumbled on this area because we were looking for the launching pad for the hang gliders. it's right near the beach and you get a great view of the city... great way to spend the day relaxing or with your significant other :D
author: Nancy F.

description: It is spectacular there today. Nice dogs, beautiful flowers, clean crisp airs - and when you want to rest, someone has built you a comfy chair out of driftwood with the best views of the Pacific for miles.
author: liz d.

description:
The picture of my kids running with our dog, my daughter's hair flying, the dog's tail spinning, is to me, a sight of extreme beauty, exhilaration and joy.
It's a picture of happy childhood days. I seek out these off leash places to recapture this picture. Every time, I feel immense gratitude that this is still possible, in a world where children are getting increasingly nature deprived.
We got our dog, my first, a couple of years ago from a shelter. It was immediately apparent that 'walking the dog' is a terribly inapt expression. Anyone who has seen a dog sprint, scamper, play and run for balls and twigs, realizes this in a split second. Dogs were made to run. Children were made to run. 
After discovering Fort Funston, we've called it 'Disneyland for dogs'. It is worth a special trip. As we approach our dog will whimper with excitement. There are always tons of dogs of all different breeds and sizes. On sunny weekends it is packed.  An enormous amount of JOY, in people and dogs alike, is generated at Fort Funston. It would be a sad day if that JOY was killed by restrictions.

Please write: http://parkplanning.nps.gov/document.cfm?parkID=303&projectID=11759&documentID=38106
author: Birgitta B.

description: I've seen some of my favorite sunsets here. Most owners pick up their dog poop, but there are a few bad apples. It's really nice to see people come and do that flying thing... whatever it's called. It's pretty just about anywhere, but if you really want to enjoy it, take the man made trails, not those stupid designated ones. Sometimes ferociously rabid dogs try to pounce you, but for the most part people's dogs are pretty sweet, cute, and lovable. It's really great to come an hour before sunset to see the cliffs illuminated, and then an hour after sunset to see the city illuminated. It's a fantastic park and the batteries do not smell like urine most of the time.
author: Israel C.

description: Hands down this is the best dog park! My Bianca loves the freedom and the trails. We usually go down to the beach and just walk for hours. She runs into the ocean and than all wet and scared charges back to share her wetness. My favorite times and best memories are connected with this magical place!
author: Masha C.

description: Absolute dog heaven with gorgeous views. Maximus is at his happiest at Fort Funston!
author: Jo Ann A.

description: Love it.  Love it.  Love it.  Plenty of walking, running, playing space with amazing views and p;lenty of dogs for mine to play with.  It also has a paved walking trail so is stroller friendly.  This is a new favorite place. But, I say that about every place I go lately.
author: Leah M.

description: Beautiful.  I have never seen so many dogs in one place....and so happy!  This is the largest "dog park" that I have ever been to.  The views are amazing.  A pretty easy walk, except for a steep sandy set of stairs that takes you back to the parking lot.  Bring some towels to wipe your pup off before getting back into the car.
author: Shana Y.

description: Absolutely perfect spot for dog owners to bring their dogs (and for dog watchers like myself who don't own dogs but just like to Oooh and Ahhh at the cute ones).  There's plenty of parking in the lot but do get filled up fast on sunny days.  I like to take a trail toward the beach on the right side of the parking lot, walk down to the beach, go left on the beach and walk for about 20 mins, and right when you past major graffiti work on pipes and forts, look for a place to climb UP the sandy rocks.  It'll take you to a massive flight of stairs called "Sand Ladder Trail" which will take you back to the parking lot.  The whole hike takes approximately 1 hour.
author: Jessica N.

description: My husband and I laughingly call this Dog Poo Park!   We are not from California but when passing thru, we love to take our dog to this park.  Our dog loves it too.  I would like to see the area where the hang gliders fly, and the fields behind the hang gliding area closed to dogs.  We saw lots of dog walkers and the doggy poo was not always picked up. Hopefully this park will remain open to off leash dogs.  They need some place to run and roam free.  Please pick up your doggies poooooo!
author: Trish F.

description: I bring my dogs here once in a while and they LOVE it! They get to run around and play with all sorts of dogs off leash which is great :)
author: Wanda L.

description: This has to be the best dog park in the world. There are acres and acres of open space for dogs to run off-leash. The park has beach access, so you can take your water-inclined dogs down to the beach, or, for the water averse (like my Kisha) stick to the top and run through the sand dunes and trees.  Despite what must be a hundred dogs or more on the great-weather weekends, the park is very clean and very spacious. A true San Francisco treasure for the canine inclined.
author: Micki S.

description: This is probably the best dog park in the city. I haven't seen one syringe yet! At any given time, you can find 50+ dogs running around and well...acting like dogs. There are even bowls of fresh water at the top where you can let your pooche hydrate themselves. You can walk down to the beach and let your dog run for miles. There are plenty of drift wood sticks to be found for a game of fetch if forgot a ball at home.
author: Sal B.

description: It is just such a lovely place and if you do not take your dog here then you really need to reevaluate yourself.  Bella and friends spent all day there and it was so nice, just a feel good beach, you gotta go and check it out, it is quite the experience...
author: Tamara M.

description: Dogs, dogs and more dogs. This really is doggie nirvana, at least if you ask Miss Maggie. Beautiful views for the humans, and several nice trails and stairways for variety.
author: Michelle C.

description: Anybody remember me?...the Jack R. that likes to play with rocks...FF is the greatest...Hi Max and Christine!
author: Doug E.

description: One day I will have an extremely expensive dog and take it here. In the meantime, I will go solo and have the best hike/walk after work ever. Beautiful sunsets, amazing views. Relaxing way to end the day!!
author: Mama C.

description: I've only been here once and am meaning to return very soon.  Shortly after that first trip, Baron got neutered so he'll be indoors for a few weeks. While he was there, he had an absolute ball.  He's a whore when he gets to the dog park and has to give every dog he sees kisses. On my way down to the beach, I ran into a few nice people that I got to talk with.  Once on the beach, Baron went full speed towards the water.The night before, I just gave him a bath so I shut my eyes, cringed and prayed that he'd stay out of the ocean.  After a few seconds, I remembered he was a lab and knew there was no stopping him so any attempts would just be futile.  He played with a bunch of other dogs in the water and had a blast.  We walked towards the other end of the beach and after an hour or so, it was time to go. I was exhausted as was Baron.   Nothing but the comfortable seat in my car was on my mind until I saw that someone has brought the Half Dome to Fort Funston and to get back up, the pooch and I had to scale the faces of death of hand-made stairs constructed of mostly sand. I ran out of water and for a quick second, thought my only hopes of making it up top was to call the Coast Guard for a rescue.  Okay, it  wasn't that bad, but after running on the beach, it wasn't a pretty site as an elderly lady said "excuse me, sonny" and passed me right up.  Anyways, its the best place I've taken my dog yet and I can't wait to take him back there.
author: Milton W.

description:
i L0VE F0RT FUNST0N!!!  SHAD0W THE BLACK P0MERANiAN L0VES F0RT FUNST0N T00!! :D

my booboo and i take our dogs here whenever it`s nice out.  on a sunny day, it`s so gorgeous here - warm golden sunshine, blue cloudless sky, blue-green water :]  the trails are really fun.  you get a great workout, especially when you take the trail down to the beach.  sometimes, you can find tons of sanddollars on the beach.  

i love the fact that you can walk your dog off-leash here.  it`s hard to find open spaces like that in the city where you can walk your dog off-leash without having psycho drivers trying to flatten your dog with their ugly hybrid priuses!!  LoLx

my little, 8 pound baby has a split personality [should i say doggyality?].  half of him is a spoiled mama`s boy with a $5OO Coach carrier that loves to wear clothes [seriously!  he loves it when i put close on him, and he never lets me take them off!] and be carried around in my arms.  the other half is a huge dog trapped in a small dog`s body with a love for wide open spaces to roam, trees to pee on, and other dogs to play with.  

here at fort funston, my dog shadow roams the wide open spaces, pees on trees to his little heart`s content, and has tons of playmates [dogmates? hehe], big and small, to play rough with.  

fort funston is shadow approved! =^..^=
author: Dee W.

description: Like everyone says- great place for the dogs.  Check to tidal chart before going- at low tide you can easily make the loop from the beach back to the parking lot.
author: Joe O.

description: My daughter and I had a great time here with our dog-my daughter didn't want to leave!  It's beautiful, people are nice, happy doggies-watch out for the cliffs, though!  We saw a dog that went over the side and his owner that scooted down after him.  Everyone turned out fine, luckily.  One thing-please pick up after your dogs properly!  To the guy who decided to scoop up his dog's poop and throw it in the surf a few feet from where my daughter happily played in the water-that was not cool!  Otherwise, we had a great time-and days later my legs were sore from the climb back up to the parking lot (yes, I am out of shape).
author: Sadie F.

description: Awesome! Being the owner of a very large (150 pounds) Rot  - Germean Shepard mongrel named "Elvis" who to some looks like a vicious attack dog and to others (people who know dogs) see him for what he really is, a big goofy ass teddy bear who would rather lick your face then bite you. Anyway I was very stoked at how he and I were received at Fort Funston. A very good and friendly dog loving community and the beach is huge and cool place to hang out the the pooch or friends or both and the hang gliders are cool to watch and really add to the scenery. I highly recommend spending a day there with your fury buddy and see for yourself.
author: Scott W.

description: I love this place. My dog loves this place too. It's a shame that my dog isn't more well behaved, then he can go off leash and play with the other dogs. But my maniac of a dog chases after everything in sight so I sadly have to keep him leashed up every time. Despite that minor inconvenience, he still loves Fort Funston. Even if you don't own a pup, you should definitely give this place a try. The paths are gorgeous! If you go on a sunny day, it makes our other 355 days of fog worthwhile.
author: Diana L.

description:
WARNING #2 (from another reviewer)!
  
Today, our car was also broken into (8 or 9pm) and  our window shattered.  I wish I had read Alicia's review earlier.  To prevent future victims,   please be careful and do not leave anything people may think worth stealing visible in the car!
author: Kik O.

description: This is definitely one of the most beautiful places to walk your dog off leash (next to Point Isabel in the East Bay), or even hang glide if that's your thing.  The views are incredible, from the ocean to the tops of the Golden Gate bridge, even across to Lake Merced.  It's breath-taking.  Of course I could do without the crowds of people, especially the ones that bring their infants and let them run around, they spook my pooch!  But it's a free country, at least for the time being.  I've been coming here for years, it was better before it was discovered a few years ago.
author: LA T.

description: My boyfriend and I took our dog here yesterday for the first time. We've been trying to find a good place to take our dog to get his exercise and fun time and  we found the perfect place here at Fort Funston! We are so into dogs and this place was like dog heaven. There are dogs running around everywhere and all of them were so friendly! I've never seen so many dogs in one place! Our dog Max seem to like it. He was sniffing around everywhere and dragging us all over the place! By the time we left, he was so tired but we could tell he had a good time! And so did we! The view there is awesome! Its a big place to explore. I cant wait to take Max back there!
author: Bobbi Gail F.

description:
Another place I take all out-of-town visitors.  What is not to love?  Beach, waves, handgliders, cute doggies and defined paths.  OK, so the fog is a downer occasionally.

I dig it.
author: iii i.

description: OK, so this is kind of a "duh" review, but I was just thinking about how I miss Funston.  It's been chiily and damp in the avenues, and we haven't been out there in a few months.  It is simply dog heaven, with gorgeous views and respectful people that keep it clean.  My greyhound Mary loves this place.  I'll have to take her tomorrow.
author: erika s.

description: After a long day of lying around Dirty Trix Saloon, our dog Mulligan loves the freedom of running around with no leash and sniffing at the "cocktail" of scents that is other dog's butts! Great place to get some negative ions from the ocean, while enjoying the view and the plethora of dog types. If you have a dog, you should go! If you can't have a dog, but love them you should go! If you have a small child who toddles around with a stuffed animal in their hand, you should rethink where you want to go!
author: Lee P.

description: fantastic beach heaven for dogs and their people.  if you have a dog and have not been here, you are a fool.  a damn fool.  the only thing this place is missing is a snack bar.  snack bars are great.
author: Laura B.

description: my dog loves this place. this is like doggie whoring central.
author: Euge L.

description: what the hell? review page for fort funston?! w-what?
author: Amalia D.

description: Great little park right on the beach has spectacular views when the sun is out.  Worth a visit for a nice stroll or jog.
author: Nick L.

description: i must say this park is one of the best park i've been to so far. i've came here since i was very young, 3rd grade? i went camping with my fellow classmates. they used to have a little center (i don't know if it's still there.) they had staffs there help our class out, setting up tents, and basically have a fantastic time there! camping was so good and i learned a lot. this place have a lot of dogs and theres good view too. i will definitely bring my little boy here one day!
author: Valerie N.

description: doggie disnelyland/heaven/anything&everything positive to describe a place. bring your dog here, you won't regret it!
author: Margaret Y.

description: if i'm very good, when i die, i will go to the big fort funston in the sky, and all my dogs will be there. and we'll run on the beach, bbq lotsa meat, dig in the sand, roll around, and poop on the cats and the republicans stuck below us in the mini mall of hell.
author: eliza w.

description: i used to take my dog here at least 3-4 times a week and desperately miss it now that i moved from sf! nothing else like it anywhere. you can walk forever with ocean views and rollings hills. sometimes you can hear a lone sax player above one of the bunkers while your walking. lots of dogs, most are off leash (i hear they give tickets but i never got one) and surprisingly the dogs are all well behaved. its gorgeous in good weather or bad, i actually enjoyed light rainy day walks. if your up for a work out then take a side path and venture down to the sand, walk along until you get to stairs by where the parachutes take off...trust me your legs will feel it after your done climbing them back up.
author: Kerry B.

description: This is objectively the best place in san francisco.  I brought my puppy here today and he went bananas.
author: Mark S.

description: it is a great place for hiking, and walk the dog. it is really a dog's heaven. u will see dogs everywhere.....big parking lot. nice beach. very easy to walk, no hills. very relaxing.
author: B B.

description: heh, I remember pulling ice plant as an elementary kid here to give the native plants room to grow. That was pretty fun XD. I've actually had wonderful memories here, learning about the environment/terrain of San Francisco and the history of the fort. I remember sitting with my classmates, looking over the beautiful Pacific from the cliffs and getting surprised when I discovered that the trees I was standing next to were actually tea leaf trees....*Reminiscients on the past...* Would be nice to visit Fort Funston again...
author: Cindy W.

description: Lived here for 12 years and this was the first time I ever went to Fort Funston... Why I went there was so random... I was at the library today, and the person sitting across from me at the computer lab said she had to go pick up the dog so she can "bring 'em to Fort Funston ...off the leash! ....it's close by!"  I was intrigued... so I closed up my laptop, went home and grabbed my two dogs....   I'm an idiot so I had to use my GPS to find the place...   how many times did I pass this place in the past 12 years??? HUNDREDS! THOUSANDS!  The place is HUGE... my one dog, a 8 lb chihuahua terrier aka  chihuahua terrorist who I thought was fearless was actually a scaredy cat when other dogs approached her.  My other dog, a 2 lb yorkie, 15 years old... well, she walked really slooooow.. dogs approached her, smelled her butt, and she was not mauled....  There was one BIG dog and he had a muzzle on..very responsible of the owner...It was soo coool... soooo  many dogs and the people seemed cool, too.  I didn't see much poop laying around, everybody was responsible.  We are going back again TOMORROW to do more exploring!
author: Lita T.

description: I'm a Dog Walker and owner of FogCityPaws.com. I have give this place a five star rating because I was a fan even before I was a dog walker.  My dog Tito loves this place and so does all my doggie clients.  They can not wait to see all their friends in the park and make new friends on the way.  The hike is refreshing change from the city streets.  The dogs love it and the proof is apparent when you see their spirit lift, their tail waggin, and ears perked up with anticipation.  Not to mention the quiet satisfaction and long nap they take at home.  It is a win win for all.  The trails in Fort Funston are welcoming and diverse.  There are many different types of trails here.  You can take the steep hike down to the beach or you can take the paved roads.  There are sandy and grassy areas and you can even take a more sheltered route where the trees provide shade from harsh sun or wind.  There are plenty of baggie boxes for those who forgets to bring some and water fountain for human and dogs alike.  It is a great place to take a scenery stroll or social hangout for your dog.  It is a bit windy here so a jacket is recommended for humans.  It is a great place to socialize your dog and a great place to bond with your dog.  The space is open and the air is fresh.  Plenty of parking spaces for you car and lots of room to play fetch.  There are 2 entry points to the beach and the beaches are wide with plenty of space for a run.  My favorite spot for a walk and my dog's favorite place to play. I believe exercise for dogs is not complete with just a walk around the block or a mile run with you.  They need mental stimulation and play time with other dogs to keep a healthy body and mind. This is the perfect place for that.
author: lisa s.

description: i just got a new puppy and he absolutely loves fort FUNston. we come here every evening at 6ish and hike down to the beach and watch the sunset. the hike down is beautiful (beware loads of steps). its just has a great atmosphere about it. there are dogs off leashes (not mine though too  young). if your a dog owner i recommend coming here and if your not i recommend coming here. dogs and people will have a blast!
author: bridge A.

description: greatest place in the world to take your dog.  just be sure to bring a coat.
author: boner time j.

description: a great short trail for dogs and their owners to see a great picturesque view of ocean beach.
author: Jen P.

description: this is the best dog park.  dogs get to run around off leash and socialize with other dogs.  hate those dog litter nazis though--if your dog leaves a small pile deep in the ice plants and you can't find it, you'll get crucified.
author: allen h.

description: as far as dog parks go, this place is 5 stars! the best part is that every 3rd saturday of the month they have bulldog meetup. however, if you're not into bullies, you can always take a stroll around the trails here. what a great park!
author: Simon L.

description: gorgeous views of the ocean!!! since today was a sunny breezy day, I decided to bring my bf up here to show him the beautiful view of the ocean from the wooden steps. perfect for a date or even by yourself if you ever want to come alone and sit and think.we had alot of fun in the parking lot too by having a jumping contest to see who can jump the furthest=)
author: christy w.

description: pit bulls love this place...my pooch loves this place. people love this place and to watch this centuries' operational flying DaVincis.
author: miriam b.

description: Puppies everywhere!  There's sand, trails, beach, water...what else do you need!
author: Niel H.

description: IMO - best place in SF to take your dogs!  Dogs can go off-leash with absolutely no worries about cars, roads, etc.  The people who go here are responsible with their dogs (read minimal nasty piles of doggie bombs), and I've never seen a dog fight yet.  Perfect place to get the kinks out - for both you and your dogs!
author: Kristin S.

description: fort funston is one the best walks in the entire city.  its absolutely beautiful, and has some of the best coastal views around.  the combination of rolling sand dunes covered with red and green ice plants, windswept cypress, and great-smelling eucalyptus is amazing.  and oh yeah, if you have a dog, you will feel like the best dog owner ever, because every dog there (including yours) is having so much fun its guaranteed they will love you even more for taking them there.  dogs undeniably have a great time here!
author: Erin C.

description: great place for an easy hike, or to watch the hang gliding
author: steve t.

description: This was a special place for me and my dogs when I lived in SF. I would take my two Rhodesian Ridgeback here at least 3 times a week. Watching them run about the sand dunes and play with their friends were happy times. I no longer have my babies (died) but I still remember those days when I would turn the corner in my car  into the parking lot and they knew they were close. Their excitement was pure joy.
author: D a.

description: a  fabulous off leash dog area. My dog loves it and most of the  dog owners and walkers are really really responsible. the reason for 4 stars and not 5 is the stupidity of parents. they let there small children run and play w/ toys... stuffed animals, balls and all the toys that dogs also own. even the best trained dogs are confused by the ownership issues. The parents get really uptight and there are 21 miles of parks and beaches that they could take their leashed dogs and kids with toys to instead of the only unleashed fun park for dogs.  the parents are so unaware of how it affects other dogs fun and makes the other dog owners uptight. this mainly happens on Saturdays and Sundays when the professionals are not there. I don't have the least interest in banning kids. kids and dogs are fun it is just allowing the kids to bring the same toys that dogs have. It is a wonderful community that gets a long really well that doesn't need the thoughtlessness.
author: mary r.
